verses.latin: Haec sunt verba, quae locutus est Moyses ad omnem Israël trans Jordanem in solitudine, campestri atque contra Mare rubrum, inter Pharan et Thophel et Laban et Haseroth et Dizahab.
verses.english: These are the words that Moses spoke to all the people of Israel who were on the other side of the Jordan River. They were in the wilderness, on the plain across from the Red Sea, between Paran and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, and Dizahab.

verses.latin: Undecim dies de Horeb in via montis Seir usque Cadesbarne.
verses.english: It was an eleven-day journey from Mount Horeb, by way of Mount Seir, to Kadesh-barnea.

verses.latin: Quadragesimo anno, undecimo mense, prima die mensis, locutus est Moyses ad filios Israël omnia quæ præceperat illi Dominus, ut diceret illis.
verses.english: In the fortieth year after they left Egypt, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses spoke to the children of Israel everything that the Lord had commanded him to tell them.

verses.latin: Postquam percussit Sehon regem Amorrhæorum, qui habitavit in Hesebon, et Og regem Basan, qui mansit in Astaroth, et in Edrai.
verses.english: This was after Moses had defeated Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and Og, the king of Bashan, who lived in Astaroth and Edrei.

verses.latin: Trans Jordanem in terra Moab, cœpit Moyses explanare legem, dicens:
verses.english: On the other side of the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses began to explain the Law, saying:

verses.latin: Dominus Deus noster locutus est ad nos in Horeb, dicens: Sufficit vobis quod in hoc monte mansistis:
verses.english: “The Lord our God spoke to us at Mount Horeb, saying, ‘You have stayed on this mountain for long enough.

verses.latin: Revertimini, et proficiscimini in montem Amorrhæorum, et ad ceteros vicinos ejus, campos et montosa atque campestria et ad meridiem, quæ versum sunt litus maris mediterranei, terram Chananæorum, et Libani usque ad flumen magnum Euphraten.
verses.english: Turn around now, and set out for the mountain country of the Amorites, and for all their neighboring lands—the plains, the highlands, the lowlands, the Negev, and the seacoast—all the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great River Euphrates.

verses.latin: En, inquit, tradidi vobis terram: ingredimini et possidete eam, super qua juravit Dominus patribus vestris Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob, ut daret illam eis, et semini eorum post eos.
verses.english: See, I have given this land to you. Go in now and take possession of it, the land that the Lord swore to your fathers—Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—that He would give to them and to their descendants after them.’

verses.latin: Dixique vobis in tempore illo: Non possum solus sustinere vos:
verses.english: “At that time, I spoke to you and said, ‘I cannot bear the burden of leading you by myself.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus vester multiplicavit vos, et estis hodie sicut stellæ cæli plurimæ.
verses.english: The Lord your God has multiplied your numbers, and today you are as many as the stars in the sky.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum addat ad hunc numerum mille vicibus, et benedicat vobis, sicut locutus est.
verses.english: May the Lord God of your fathers increase your numbers a thousand times more, and bless you, just as He has promised you.

verses.latin: Non valeo solus vestra negotia sustinere, et pondus ac jurgia.
verses.english: I alone am not able to bear the burden of your affairs, your heavy load, and your disputes.

verses.latin: Date ex vobis viros sapientes et gnaros, et quorum conversatio sit probata in tribubus vestris, ut ponam eos principes vobis.
verses.english: Choose wise, discerning, and experienced men from each of your tribes, and I will appoint them as your leaders.’

verses.latin: Tunc respondistis mihi: Bona res est, quam vis facere.
verses.english: You answered me then, ‘What you propose to do is good.’

verses.latin: Tulique de tribubus vestris viros sapientes et nobiles, et constitui eos principes, tribunos, et centuriones, et quinquagenarios, et decanos, qui docerent omnia.
verses.english: So I took the wise and prominent men from your tribes and appointed them as leaders over you: commanders of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, and also officers for your tribes, to instruct you in all matters.

verses.latin: Præcepique eis, dicens: Audite illos, et quod justum est judicate: sive civis sit ille, sive peregrinus.
verses.english: I then commanded your judges, saying, ‘Hear the cases between your people, and judge fairly between a man and his brother, or between a man and a foreigner.

verses.latin: Nulla erit distantia personarum: ita parvum audietis ut magnum, nec accipietis cujusquam personam, quia Dei judicium est. Quod si difficile vobis aliquid visum fuerit, referte ad me, et ego audiam.
verses.english: You shall not show favoritism in judgment; you must hear both the small and the great equally, and you must not fear any man, for the judgment belongs to God. If any case is too difficult for you, you are to bring it to me, and I will hear it.’

verses.latin: Omniaque quæ facere deberetis, præcepi vobis in tempore illo.
verses.english: I commanded you at that time concerning all the things you were to do.

verses.latin: Profecti ergo de Horeb, transivimus per eremum terribilem et maximam, quam vidistis, per viam montis Amorrhæi, sicut præceperat Dominus Deus noster nobis. Cumque venissemus in Cadesbarne,
verses.english: So, after we left Horeb, we traveled through that vast and terrifying wilderness you yourselves saw, following the road to the mountain region of the Amorites, just as the Lord our God commanded us. When we reached Kadesh-barnea,

verses.latin: Dixi vobis: Venistis ad montem Amorrhæi, quem Dominus Deus noster daturus est nobis.
verses.english: I said to you, ‘You have now arrived at the mountain region of the Amorites, which the Lord our God is giving to us.

verses.latin: Vide terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dat tibi: ascende et posside eam, sicut locutus est Dominus Deus noster patribus tuis: noli timere, nec quidquam paveas.
verses.english: Look, the Lord your God has given you this land. Go up and take possession of it, just as the Lord God of your fathers has told you. Do not be afraid or discouraged by anything.’

verses.latin: Et accessistis ad me omnes, atque dixistis: Mittamus viros qui considerent terram, et renuntient nobis per quod iter ascendere debeamus, et quas civitates ingredi.
verses.english: But all of you came near me and said, ‘Let us send men ahead to scout the land for us and bring back a report about the route we should take and the cities we will encounter.’

verses.latin: Cumque mihi placuisset sermo, misi ex vobis duodecim viros, singulos de tribubus suis.
verses.english: This idea seemed good to me, so I selected twelve men from among you, one from each tribe.

verses.latin: Qui cum perrexissent, ascenderunt in montana: et venere usque ad Torrentem Botri, et lustrata terra.
verses.english: They went up into the hill country and came to the Valley of Eshcol, where they explored the land.

verses.latin: Sumptaque de fructibus ejus, ut ostenderent ubertatem, attulerunt ad nos, et dixerunt: Bona terra est, quam Dominus Deus noster daturus est nobis.
verses.english: They gathered some of the land’s fruit as proof of its richness and brought it back to us, saying, ‘The land the Lord our God is giving us is indeed good.’

verses.latin: Et noluistis ascendere, sed contemnentes sermonem Domini Dei nostri,
verses.english: But you refused to go up, and instead you rebelled against the command of the Lord our God.

verses.latin: Murmurati estis in tabernaculis vestris, atque dixistis: Odit nos Dominus, et idcirco eduxit de terra Ægypti, ut traderet in manu Amorrhæi, atque deleret.
verses.english: You complained in your tents, saying, ‘The Lord must hate us! That is why He brought us out of the land of Egypt—to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites to destroy us.

verses.latin: Quo ascendemus? Fratres nostri terruerunt cor nostrum, dicentes: Maxima multitudo est, et celsior nobis: urbes magnæ, et ad cælum usque muratæ: porro et filios Enacim vidimus ibi.
verses.english: Where are we supposed to go? Our fellow Israelites have filled our hearts with fear by saying, “The people there are stronger and taller than we are; the cities are large, with walls reaching to the sky! And we even saw the Anakim, the giants, there!”’

verses.latin: Et dixi vobis: Nolite metuere, nec timeatis eos:
verses.english: Then I said to you, ‘Do not be terrified or afraid of them.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus vester, qui ductor est vester, ipse pugnabit pro vobis, sicut fecit in Ægypto videntibus cunctis.
verses.english: The Lord your God, who goes before you, will Himself fight for you, just as you saw Him do for you in Egypt.

verses.latin: Et in solitudine (ipse vidisti) portavit te Dominus Deus tuus, sicut solet homo portare filiolum suum, in omni via per quam ambulastis, donec veniretis ad locum istum.
verses.english: And in the wilderness—where you yourselves saw—the Lord your God carried you, just as a father carries his son, all along the path you traveled until you reached this place.

verses.latin: Et nec sic quidem credidistis Domino Deo vestro,
verses.english: Yet, despite all this, you still did not believe in the Lord your God,

verses.latin: Qui præcessit vos in via, et metatus est locum in quo tentoria figere deberetis, nocte ostendens vobis iter per ignem, et die per columnam nubis.
verses.english: who went ahead of you on your journey to find you a place to camp. He showed you the way to go by fire at night and by a pillar of cloud by day.

verses.latin: Cumque audisset Dominus vocem sermonum vestrorum, iratus juravit, et ait:
verses.english: When the Lord heard the sound of your complaints, He became angry and swore an oath, saying:

verses.latin: Non videbit quispiam de viris generationis hujus pessimæ terram bonam, quam sub juramento pollicitus sum patribus vestris,
verses.english: ‘Not one of the men of this evil generation shall see the good land that I swore to give to your fathers,

verses.latin: Præter Caleb filium Jephonæ: ipse enim videbit eam, et ipsi dabo terram, quam calcavit, et filiis ejus, quia secutus est Dominum.
verses.english: except for Caleb, the son of Jephunneh. He alone shall see it, and I will give him and his descendants the land on which he has walked, because he has fully followed the Lord.’

verses.latin: Nec mirum, contra me quoque iratus est Dominus propter vos, dicens: Nec tu intrabis illuc.
verses.english: Because of you, the Lord also became angry with me and said, ‘Even you, Moses, shall not enter there.

verses.latin: Sed Josue filius Nun minister tuus, ipse intrabit pro te: hunc exhortare, et robora, quia ipse terram et populum Israël sortietur.
verses.english: But Joshua, the son of Nun, your assistant, he will enter there in your place. Encourage him and strengthen him, for he is the one who will lead the people of Israel to inherit the land.

verses.latin: Parvuli quoque vestri, de quibus dixistis quod captivi ducerentur, et filii qui hodie boni ac mali ignorant distinctionem, ipsi intrabunt: et ipsis dabo terram, et possidebunt eam.
verses.english: Also your little children, about whom you said they would become captives, and your children who today do not know the difference between good and evil—they are the ones who will enter the land. I will give the land to them, and they shall possess it.

verses.latin: Vos autem revertimini, et proficiscimini in solitudinem per viam maris Rubri.
verses.english: But as for you, turn back now and travel into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.’

verses.latin: Et reversi, tetendimus in solitudinem, viam quae ducit ad Mare Rubrum, sicut locutus est Dominus mihi: et circuivimus montem Seir diebus multis.
verses.english: And we turned back, journeying into the wilderness by the way that leads to the Red Sea, as the Lord had commanded me. And we circled around Mount Seir for many days.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Sufficit vobis circuire montem istum:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to me: "You have circled this mountain long enough.

verses.latin: ite contra aquilonem:
verses.english: Now turn and go northward.

verses.latin: et praecipe populo, dicens: Transibitis per terminos fratrum vestrorum filiorum Esau, qui habitant in Seir, et timebunt vos. Videte diligenter,
verses.english: And give this command to the people, saying: 'You will be passing through the territory of your brothers, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, and they will be afraid of you. Be very careful,

verses.latin: ne moveamini contra eos: neque enim dabo vobis de terra eorum, nec pedis unius portionem, quia montem Seir filiis Esau in possessionem dedi.
verses.english: do not provoke them to battle. For I will not give you any of their land, not even a foot of ground, because I have given Mount Seir as a possession to the descendants of Esau.

verses.latin: Escas emetis ab eis pecunia, et comedetis: aquam quoque emptam haurietis.
verses.english: You must buy food from them with money to eat. And you must also buy water from them with money to drink.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus tuus benedixit tibi in omni opere manuum tuarum, scivit iter tuum, quo perrexisti per solitudinem hanc magnam, per quadraginta annos: non defuit tibi aliquid.
verses.english: For the Lord your God has blessed you in all the work of your hands. He has known your journey, how you have traveled through this great wilderness for forty years, and you have lacked nothing.'

verses.latin: Cumque transissemus de fratribus nostris filiis Esau, qui habitabant in Seir, per viam campestrem de Elath et de Asiongaber, venimus ad desertum Moab.
verses.english: So when we had passed through the territory of our brothers, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, by way of the Arabah road from Elath and Ezion-geber, we then arrived at the wilderness of Moab.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Non hostiliter agas contra Moabitas, neque committas adversum eos certamen: non enim dabo tibi de terra eorum in possessionem, quia filiis Loth dedi Ar in possessionem.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: "Do not treat the Moabites as enemies, nor provoke them to battle. For I will not give you any of their land as a possession, because I have given Ar as a possession to the descendants of Lot."

verses.latin: (Emim primi fuerunt habitatores ejus, populus magnus, et robustus, et tam procerus ut Enacim.
verses.english: (The Emim were the first inhabitants there, a great, powerful, and tall people, just like the Anakim.

verses.latin: Sicut Enacim reputati sunt Refaim, et Moabitae vocaverunt eos Emim.
verses.english: Like the Anakim, they were also considered Rephaim, and the Moabites called them Emim.

verses.latin: In Seir autem habitaverunt prius Horraei: quos interfectos atque deletos, filii Esau possederunt, habitantes pro illis, sicut fecerat Israël in terra possessionis suae, quam dederat illis Dominus.)
verses.english: The Horites used to live in Seir, but the descendants of Esau drove them out, destroying them, and then settled in their place. This was just as Israel would do in the land of their own possession, which the Lord had given to them.)

verses.latin: Nunc ergo surgite, et transite torrentem Zared.
verses.english: Now then, get up and cross the Wadi Zered.

verses.latin: Dies autem quibus ambulavimus de Cadesbarne usque ad transitum torrentis Zared, triginta octo anni fuerunt: donec consumeretur omnis generatio virorum bellatorum de castris, sicut juravit Dominus.
verses.english: The time from when we departed Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the Wadi Zered was thirty-eight years. This was the time until the entire generation of fighting men had perished from the camp, just as the Lord had sworn they would.

verses.latin: Nam et manus Domini erat super eos, ut interirent de medio castrorum.
verses.english: Indeed, the hand of the Lord was against them to eliminate them from the camp.

verses.latin: Postquam ergo universi bellatores consumpti sunt, morientes de medio populi:
verses.english: So after all the fighting men had perished, dying out from among the people,

verses.latin: locutus est Dominus ad me, dicens:
verses.english: the Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Tu transibis hodie terminos Moab, urbem nomine Ar:
verses.english: "Today you are to cross the boundary of Moab, near the city named Ar.

verses.latin: et juxta filios Ammon venies: quos non concutias, nec movearis contra eos: quia non dabo tibi de terra filiorum Ammon possessionem: eo quod filiis Loth dederim eam in possessionem.
verses.english: And you will approach the Ammonites. Do not harass them nor provoke them to battle, for I will not give you any of the land of the Ammonites as a possession, because I have given it as a possession to the descendants of Lot.

verses.latin: (Terra gigantum reputata est: et in ea prisco tempore habitaverunt gigantes, quos Ammonitae vocaverunt Zomzommim,
verses.english: (That land was also considered a land of giants. In ancient times, giants lived there, whom the Ammonites called Zamzummim,

verses.latin: populus magnus, et robustus, et procerus, sicut Enacim: quos delevit Dominus a facie eorum: et posuerunt filii Ammon habitatores pro eis:
verses.english: a great, powerful, and tall people, like the Anakim. The Lord destroyed them before the Ammonites, and the Ammonites settled in their place.

verses.latin: sicut fecerat filiis Esau, qui habitabant in Seir, delens Horraeos, et possidentibus eos: usque ad praesentem diem.
verses.english: This was just as He had done for the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, when He destroyed the Horites before them and they took possession. This remains true to this very day.

verses.latin: Hevaeos quoque qui habitabant in Haserim usque ad Gazam, Caphtorim, qui egressi sunt de Caphtor, deleverunt, et habitaverunt pro eis.)
verses.english: As for the Avvim who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came out from Caphtor, destroyed them and settled in their place.)

verses.latin: Surgite, et transite torrentem Arnon: ecce tradidi in manu tua Sehon regem Hesebon, Amorrhaeum, et terram ejus: incipe possidere, et committe bellum contra eum.
verses.english: Get up now and cross the Wadi Arnon. Look, I have delivered Sihon, king of Heshbon, the Amorite, and his land into your hand. Begin to take possession, and engage in battle against him.

verses.latin: Hac die incipe mittere terrorem atque formidinem tuam in populos, qui habitant sub omni caelo: ut audito nomine tuo, paveant, et mirentur, et quasi parturientium dolores perferant.
verses.english: This very day, I will begin to put the dread and terror of you upon all the peoples who live under the sky. So that when they hear your name, they will tremble and be astonished, and feel anguish like a woman in labor.

verses.latin: Misi ergo nuntios de solitudine Cademoth ad Sehon regem Hesebon verbis pacificis, dicens:
verses.english: So I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon, king of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying:

verses.latin: Transibo per terram tuam: publica gradiar via, non declinabo nec ad dextram, nec ad sinistram.
verses.english: 'Let me pass through your land. I will keep to the main road, not turning off to the right or to the left.

verses.latin: Escas vende nobis pecunia, ut comedamus: aquam da pro pecunia, et sic bibemus.
verses.english: Sell us food for money, so we may eat. And give us water for money, so we may drink.

verses.latin: Tantum est ut nobis concedas transitum, sicut fecerunt filii Esau, qui habitant in Seir, et Moabitae, qui morantur in Ar:
verses.english: Only let us pass through, just as the descendants of Esau who live in Seir, and the Moabites who live in Ar, did for us,

verses.latin: donec veniamus ad Jordanem, et transeamus ad terram, quam Dominus Deus noster daturus est nobis.
verses.english: until we cross the Jordan River and enter the land that the Lord our God is about to give us.'

verses.latin: Noluitque Sehon rex Hesebon dare nobis transitum: quia induraverat Dominus Deus tuus spiritum ejus, et obfirmaverat cor illius, ut traderetur in manus tuas, sicut nunc vides.
verses.english: But Sihon, king of Heshbon, refused to let us pass through. For the Lord your God had hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate, so that he might be delivered into your hands, just as you see today.

verses.latin: Et occurrit Sehon contra nos, ipse et omnis populus ejus, ad proeliandum in Jasa.
verses.english: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

verses.latin: Et tradidit Dominus Deus noster eum nobis: percussimusque cum filiis ejus, et omni populo illius.
verses.english: And the Lord our God delivered him to us, and we struck him down, along with his sons and all his people.

verses.latin: Cunctasque urbes in tempore illo cepimus, et interfecimus omnes habitatores earum, viros ac mulieres et parvulos: non reliquimus in eis quicquam.
verses.english: At that time, we captured all his cities, and we utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of those cities—men, women, and children. We left no survivors.

verses.latin: Absque solis jumentis, quae in praedam venere, et spoliis urbium, quas cepimus.
verses.english: Only the livestock we took as plunder, and the spoils from the cities we captured, were spared.

verses.latin: Ab Aroer, quae est super ripam torrentis Arnon, et oppido, quod in valle situm est, usque Galaad, non fuit vicus, et civitas, quae nos latere posset:
verses.english: From Aroer, which is on the edge of the Wadi Arnon, and from the town that is in the valley, as far as Gilead, there was not a single village or city that could escape us.

verses.latin: omnia tradidit Dominus Deus noster nobis. Absque terra filiorum Ammon, ad quam non accessimus: et omni parte torrentis Jaboc, et urbibus montanis, et cunctis locis, quae prohibuit Dominus Deus noster.
verses.english: The Lord our God delivered everything to us, except for the land of the Ammonites, which we did not approach. And all along the Wadi Jabbok, as well as the cities in the hill country, and all the places that the Lord our God had forbidden us to touch.

verses.latin: Deinde reversi, profecti sumus in solitudinem, viam quæ ducit ad Mare Rubrum, sicut locutus est Dominus nobis: et circuivimus montem Seir diebus multis.
verses.english: Then we turned back, and set out into the wilderness by the way that leads to the Red Sea, just as the Lord had told us. And we circled Mount Seir for many days.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Sufficit vobis circuire montem istum: ite contra aquilonem.
verses.english: You have circled this mountain long enough. Now turn and go towards the north.

verses.latin: Et populo præcipe, dicens: Transibitis per terminos fratrum vestrorum filiorum Esau, qui habitant in Seir: et timebunt vos.
verses.english: And command the people, saying: 'You are about to pass through the territory of your brothers, the sons of Esau, who live in Seir. They will be afraid of you.'

verses.latin: Cavete sollicite, ne quid eis faciatis: non enim dabo vobis de terra eorum, ne pedis quidem portionem, quia in possessionem Esau dedi montem Seir.
verses.english: Be very careful not to provoke them. For I will not give you any of their land, not even a single foot of ground, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau as his possession.

verses.latin: Cibos emptos dabitis eis pro pecunia, et comedetis: aquam quoque emptam haurietis, et bibetis.
verses.english: You shall buy food from them with money and eat it. You shall also buy water from them with money and drink it.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus tuus benedixit tibi in omni opere manuum tuarum: novit iter tuum, quomodo transieris solitudinem hanc magnam, per quadraginta annos: non defuit tibi aliquid.
verses.english: The Lord your God has blessed you in all the work of your hands. He knows your journey, how you have traveled through this great wilderness for forty years. You have lacked nothing.

verses.latin: Cumque transissemus de fratribus nostris filiis Esau, qui habitabant in Seir, per viam campestrem de Elath et de Asiongaber, venimus ad deserta Moab.
verses.english: So we passed by our brothers, the sons of Esau, who lived in Seir, by way of the Arabah road from Elath and Ezion-geber. Then we came to the wilderness of Moab.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad me: Non pugnes contra Moabitas, neque ineas cum eis certamen: non enim dabo tibi de terra eorum in possessionem, quia filiis Lot dedi Ar in possessionem.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: 'Do not fight against the Moabites, nor engage in battle with them. For I will not give you any of their land as a possession, because I have given Ar to the sons of Lot as their possession.'

verses.latin: Emim quondam habitaverunt in ea, populus magnus, et robustus, et tam excelsus ut Enacim.
verses.english: The Emim once lived there, a people great and strong, and as tall as the Anakim.

verses.latin: Sicut Enacim, ipsi reputabantur gigantes: quos Moabitarum vocabulis vocant Emim.
verses.english: Like the Anakim, they were also considered giants. The Moabites called them Emim.

verses.latin: In Seir autem prius habitaverunt Horæi: quos possessos atque deletos, filii Esau habitaverunt, sicut fecit Israël terræ possessionis suæ, quam dedit illis Dominus.
verses.english: The Horites previously lived in Seir. The sons of Esau drove them out and destroyed them, and lived in their place, just as Israel did in the land of their possession, which the Lord gave to them.

verses.latin: Surgite, et transite torrentem Zared. Et transivimus torrentem Zared.
verses.english: 'Now rise up and cross over the Zered Brook.' So we crossed over the Zered Brook.

verses.latin: Tempus autem, quo ambulavimus de Cadesbarne usque ad transitum torrentis Zared, triginta octo annorum fuit: donec consumeretur omnis generatio virorum bellatorum de castris, sicut juravit Dominus.
verses.english: The time that we traveled from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the Zered Brook was thirty-eight years. This was until the entire generation of fighting men from the camp had perished, just as the Lord had sworn.

verses.latin: Nam et manus Domini erat super eos, ut interirent de medio castrorum.
verses.english: Indeed, the hand of the Lord was against them, to destroy them from among the camp.

verses.latin: Postquam ergo universi bellatores consumpti sunt, morientes in castris,
verses.english: So after all the fighting men had perished, dying in the camp,

verses.latin: locutus est Dominus ad me, dicens:
verses.english: the Lord spoke to me, saying:

verses.latin: Tu transibis hodie terminos Moab, civitatem nomine Ar:
verses.english: 'Today you are to pass through the territory of Moab, that is, the city named Ar.

verses.latin: et juxta filios Ammon venies: quos non concupisces, nec tentes certamine: non enim dabo tibi de terra filiorum Ammon quicquam in possessionem, quia filiis Lot dedi eam.
verses.english: And when you come near the Ammonites—the sons of Ammon—do not provoke them, nor engage in battle with them. For I will not give you any of the land of the Ammonites as a possession, because I have given it to the sons of Lot as their possession.'

verses.latin: Terra gigantum reputata est: et in ea quondam habitaverunt gigantes, quos Ammonitæ vocant Zamzummim,
verses.english: That land was also considered a land of giants. Giants once lived there, whom the Ammonites called Zamzummim,

verses.latin: populus magnus, et robustus, et tam excelsus ut Enacim: quos delevit Dominus a facie eorum, et posuit illos pro his, qui habitaverunt in loco.
verses.english: a people great and strong, and as tall as the Anakim. The Lord destroyed them before the Ammonites, and the Ammonites took their place and settled in their land.

verses.latin: Sicut fecerat filiis Esau, qui habitant in Seir, delens Horræos, et terram eorum illis tradens: quam possederunt usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: Just as He had done for the sons of Esau, who live in Seir, when He destroyed the Horites before them and gave their land to them, which they have possessed to this very day.

verses.latin: Eveos quoque qui habitabant in Haserim usque ad Gazam, Caphtorim de Caphtor egressi deleverunt, et habitaverunt pro his.
verses.english: The Avvim also, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, were destroyed by the Caphtorim, who came out from Caphtor, and settled in their place.

verses.latin: Surgite, et transite torrentem Arnon: ecce tradidi in manu tua Sehon regem Hesebon, Amorrhæum, et terram ejus incipe possidere, atque committere bellum contra eum.
verses.english: 'Rise up, and cross over the Arnon River. Behold, I have delivered Sihon, the Amorite king of Heshbon, and his land into your hand—meaning, I have given you victory over him. Begin to take possession and wage war against him.'

verses.latin: Hodie incipiam mittere terrorem atque formidinem tuam in populos qui habitant sub omni cælo: ut audito nomine tuo, contremiscant, et quasi parturientium dolores ineas.
verses.english: 'Today I will begin to put the dread and fear of you upon all the peoples who live under the entire sky. So that when they hear of your name, they will tremble and be in anguish like a woman in labor.'

verses.latin: Misi ergo nuntios de solitudine Cademoth ad Sehon regem Hesebon, verbis pacificis, dicens:
verses.english: So I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon, the king of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying:

verses.latin: Transibo per terram tuam, publica gradiar via: non declinabo nec ad dextram, nec ad sinistram.
verses.english: 'Let me pass through your land. I will travel only along the main road. I will not turn aside to the right or to the left.'

verses.latin: Cibos vende nobis pecunia, ut vescamur: aquam vende pro pecunia, et sic bibemus.
verses.english: 'Sell us food for money, so we may eat. Sell us water for money, and so we will drink.'

verses.latin: Tantum est ut nobis concedas transitum, sicut fecerunt filii Esau, qui habitant in Seir, et Moabite, qui morantur in Ar: donec veniamus ad Jordanem, et transeamus ad terram, quam Dominus Deus noster daturus est nobis.
verses.english: 'Only allow us passage through your land, just as the sons of Esau who live in Seir and the Moabites who live in Ar did for us, until we cross the Jordan River and enter the land that the Lord our God is giving to us.'

verses.latin: Noluitque Sehon rex Hesebon dare nobis transitum: quia induraverat Dominus Deus tuus spiritum ejus, et obfirmaverat cor illius, ut traderetur in manus tuas, sicut nunc cernis.
verses.english: But Sihon, the king of Heshbon, would not allow us passage. Because the Lord your God had made his spirit stubborn and hardened his heart—so that he would resist us—so that he might be delivered into your hand, as you see today.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad me: Ecce cepi tradere tibi Sehon, et terram ejus: incipe possidere.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me: 'Behold, I have begun to deliver Sihon and his land to you. Begin to take possession.'

verses.latin: Egressusque est Sehon obviam nobis, cum omni populo suo ad pugnam in Jasa.
verses.english: Then Sihon came out against us with all his people for battle at Jahaz.

verses.latin: Et tradidit Dominus Deus noster illum nobis: percussimusque eum cum filiis suis et omni populo.
verses.english: And the Lord our God delivered him to us. And we defeated him, his sons, and all his people.

verses.latin: Cunctasque urbes in tempore cepimus, prosternentes omnem civitatem, viros, et uxores, et parvulos: non reliquimus in eis quemquam.
verses.english: We captured all his cities at that time, utterly destroying every city—men, women, and children. We left no survivors in them.

verses.latin: Absque præda quam cepimus, et pecoribus, nullius rei ex spoliis urbium quas cepimus, quidquam nostri fuit.
verses.english: Except for the plunder we took and the livestock, we kept nothing from the spoils of the cities we captured for ourselves.

verses.latin: Ab Aroer, quæ est super ripam torrentis Arnon, et oppido quod est in valle, usque Galaad, non fuit vicus, et civitas, quæ nos latere posset: omnes tradidit Dominus Deus noster nobis.
verses.english: From Aroer, which is on the bank of the Arnon River, and from the city that is in the valley, as far as Gilead, there was no village or city that could escape us. The Lord our God delivered them all to us.

verses.latin: Absque terra filiorum Ammon, ad quam non accessimus: et omni confinio torrentis Jeboc, et urbibus montanis, universisque locis, quæ Dominus Deus noster prohibuit.
verses.english: Except for the land of the Ammonites, which we did not approach—that is, all along the Jabbok River, and the cities in the mountains, and all the places that the Lord our God had forbidden us to touch.

verses.latin: Et conversi adscendimus per viam Basan: egressusque est Og rex Basan in occursum nobis, ipse et omnis populus ejus, ad pugnam in Edrai.
verses.english: So we turned and went up the road towards Bashan. Og, the King of Bashan, came out to meet us, with all his army prepared for battle; they stood ready to fight at Edrei.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad me: Ne timeas eum: quia in manu tua tradidi ipsum, et omnem populum ejus, et terram illius: faciesque illi sicut fecisti Sehon regi Amorrhaeorum, qui habitavit in Hesebon.
verses.english: The Lord God then spoke to me, saying, 'Do not be afraid of him, for I have already delivered him, along with all his people and his entire land, into your hands. You will do to him exactly what you did to Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who ruled from Heshbon.'

verses.latin: Igitur tradidit Dominus Deus noster in manus nostras etiam Og regem Basan, et universum exercitum ejus: percussimusque eum usque ad internecionem.
verses.english: So the Lord our God truly delivered Og, the king of Bashan, and his entire army into our hands. We utterly defeated him until no one was left alive.

verses.latin: Urbesque illius omnes cepimus illo tempore: sexaginta civitates, omnem regionem Argob regni Og in Basan.
verses.english: At that specific time, we conquered all his cities. These were sixty walled cities, encompassing the whole region of Argob, which was part of Og's kingdom in Bashan.

verses.latin: Omnes urbes muratae, altissimis muris, et portis, et vectibus, absque oppidis innumeris, quae absque muris erant per circuitum.
verses.english: All these cities were fortified, protected by very high walls, strong gates, and reinforcing bars, in addition to many, countless unwalled towns surrounding them.

verses.latin: Et delevimus eos, sicut fecimus Sehon regi Hesebon, vastantes omnem civitatem, virosque, ac mulieres, et parvulos interficientes.
verses.english: And we completely wiped them out, just as we had done to Sihon, the king of Heshbon. We utterly destroyed every city, killing every man, woman, and child.

verses.latin: Omnes autem pecora, et spolia urbium diripuimus.
verses.english: However, we took all the livestock and the spoils from the cities for ourselves.

verses.latin: Tulimusque illo tempore terram de manu duobus regibus Amorrhaeorum, qui erant trans Jordanem: a torrente Arnon usque ad montem Hermon,
verses.english: So, at that time, we took the land from the two Amorite kings who were east of the Jordan River. This territory stretched from the Arnon Stream all the way to Mount Hermon,

verses.latin: quem Sidonii Sarion vocant, et Amorrhaei Sanir:
verses.english: Mount Hermon is called Sirion by the Sidonians and Senir by the Amorites.

verses.latin: universas civitates campestres, et omnem terram Galaad, et Basan usque Salcha et Edrai, civitates regni Og in Basan.
verses.english: We took all the cities of the plain, and the entire regions of Gilead and Bashan, extending to Salcah and Edrei, which were royal cities in Og's kingdom of Bashan.

verses.latin: Solus quippe Og rex Basan restiterat de reliquiis gigantum. Monstrabatur torus ejus ferreus, qui est in Rabbath filiorum Ammon, novem cubitos habens longitudinis, et quatuor latitudinis ad mensuram cubiti virilis manus.
verses.english: Truly, only Og, the king of Bashan, remained from the last of the giant races. His enormous iron bed was on display in Rabbath of the Ammonites. It measured nine cubits long and four cubits wide, according to the common measure of a man's cubit. (This means it was about 13.5 feet long and 6 feet wide, indicating his immense stature.)

verses.latin: Occupavimusque terram in tempore illo ab Aroer, quae est super torrentem Arnon, media parte montis Galaad, et civitates ejus dedi Ruben et Gad.
verses.english: At that specific time, we took possession of this land. It stretched from Aroer, which is located by the Arnon Stream, including half of the mountainous region of Gilead and its cities, all of which I assigned to the tribes of Reuben and Gad.

verses.latin: Et reliquam partem Galaad, et omnem Basan regni Og, dedi medio tribui Manasse, omnem regionem Argob: cunctam Basan vocant Refaim.
verses.english: The remaining part of Gilead, and all of Bashan, which was Og's kingdom, I assigned to the half-tribe of Manasseh. This included the entire region of Argob. All of Bashan was known as the land of the Rephaim, or 'giants'.

verses.latin: Jair filius Manasse obtinuit omnem regionem Argob usque ad terminos Gesuri et Machati: appellavitque ex nomine suo Basan, Havoth Jair, id est, villas Jair, usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, took possession of the entire region of Argob, extending all the way to the borders of Geshur and Maacah. He renamed Bashan after himself, calling it Havoth Jair—meaning 'Jair's settlements'—a name it still bears today.

verses.latin: Machir quoque dedi Galaad.
verses.english: To Machir, I also gave the land of Gilead.

verses.latin: Et tribubus Ruben et Gad dedi de terra Galaad usque ad torrentem Arnon, medium torrentis et confinium usque ad torrentem Jabboc, qui est terminus filiorum Ammon:
verses.english: And to the tribes of Reuben and Gad, I gave a portion of the land of Gilead, extending as far as the Arnon Stream. This included the middle of the stream itself, acting as a boundary, and extended up to the Jabbok Stream, which marked the border of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: et planitiem, ac solitudines, et Araba, et Jordanem, et terminos Cenereth usque ad mare deserti, quod est salsissimum, ad radices Asedoth Phasga ab oriente.
verses.english: I also gave them the plain, the desert areas, the Arabah valley, and the Jordan River itself, including the region of Chinnereth, stretching all the way to the Sea of the Desert, which is the very salty Dead Sea. This eastern boundary extended to the foothills of Pisgah.

verses.latin: Et praecepi vobis in tempore illo, dicens: Dominus Deus vester dedit vobis terram hanc in possessionem: fortes viri, accingimini, et ite ante fratres vestros filios Israel.
verses.english: At that time, I gave you these instructions, saying: 'The Lord your God has given you this land as your inheritance. So, all you valiant warriors, arm yourselves and march ahead of your Israelite brothers.

verses.latin: Absque uxoribus tantum, et parvulis, et jumentis: scio enim habere vos plurima praesidia, manere in urbibus vestris, quas tradidi vobis,
verses.english: Your wives, little children, and livestock—and I know you have many of them—can stay safely in the cities I have given you.

verses.latin: donec requiem tribuat Dominus fratribus vestris, sicut et vobis dedit: et possideant pari modo terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est eis trans Jordanem: tunc unicuique vestrum licebit reverti ad possessionem suam, quam dedi.
verses.english: You must continue until the Lord grants peace and rest to your brothers, just as He has given it to you. This means until they also take possession of the land that the Lord your God is about to give them on the other side of the Jordan River. Only then will each of you be free to return to the land and property I have given you.'

verses.latin: Moyses quoque praecepi Josue in tempore illo, dicens: Viderunt oculi tui omnia quae fecit Dominus Deus vester duobus his regibus: sic faciet omnibus provinciis ad quas transibis.
verses.english: At that same time, I also instructed Joshua, saying: 'You have personally witnessed everything the Lord your God did to these two Amorite kings. He will do the same to all the kingdoms you are about to enter.

verses.latin: Ne timeatis eos: quia Dominus Deus vester pro vobis ipse pugnabit.
verses.english: Do not be afraid of them, because the Lord your God Himself will fight on your behalf.

verses.latin: Et precatus sum Dominum in tempore illo, dicens:
verses.english: At that moment, I also pleaded with the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Domine Deus, tu coepisti ostendere servo tuo magnitudinem tuam, et manum fortissimam: neque est alius Deus in caelo, aut in terra, qui possit facere opera tua, et juxta fortitudinem tuam.
verses.english: 'Lord God, You are the One who began to reveal Your majesty and Your mighty power to Your servant. There is no other God in the universe, nor anywhere on the earth, who can perform the works You do, or display Your strength.

verses.latin: Transibo igitur, et videbo terram hanc optimam trans Jordanem, et montem istum egregium, et Libanum.
verses.english: Please allow me to cross over and see this excellent land beyond the Jordan River, that magnificent mountain range, and the region of Lebanon.'

verses.latin: Et iratus est Dominus contra me propter vos, nec exaudivit me, dicens:
verses.english: But the Lord was angry with me because of your transgressions, and He would not listen to my plea. He said to me:

verses.latin: Sufficit tibi: ne ultra loquaris mihi de hac re.
verses.english: 'That is enough for you. Do not speak to me about this matter again.

verses.latin: Ascende cacumen Phasga, et illuc oculis tuis circumspice ad occidentem, et aquilonem, et austrum, et orientem, et vide: quia non transibis Jordanem istum.
verses.english: Go up to the summit of Pisgah, and from there, look out with your own eyes towards the west, north, south, and east, and truly see the land. For you will not be crossing this Jordan River.

verses.latin: Precipe Josue, et consolida eum, atque conforta: quia ipse praecedet populum istum, et ipse dividet eis terram, quam cernis. Seditque in valle contra Bethphegor.
verses.english: Instead, give instructions to Joshua. Strengthen him and encourage him, because he is the one who will lead this people, and he is the one who will divide the land that you are now seeing among them.' So we (the Israelites) remained settled in the valley directly opposite Beth-peor.

verses.latin: Et conversi adscendimus per viam Basan: egressusque est Og rex Basan in occursum nobis, ipse et omnis populus ejus in prælio in Edrai.
verses.english: And we turned and went up the road to Bashan. And Og, the king of Bashan, came out against us—he and all his people—to fight us at Edrei.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad me: Ne timeas eum, quia in manu tua tradidi illum, et omnem populum ejus, universamque terram illius: faciesque illi sicut fecisti Sehon regi Amorrhæorum, qui habitavit in Hesebon.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me, 'Do not fear him, for I have delivered him and all his people and all his land into your hand. You shall do to him just as you did to Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.'

verses.latin: Itaque tradidit Dominus Deus noster in manibus nostris etiam Og regem Basan, et universum populum ejus: percussimusque eum usque ad internecionem.
verses.english: So the Lord our God delivered Og, the king of Bashan, and all his people into our hands. We struck him down until not a single person remained alive.

verses.latin: Cunctasque civitates illius cepimus illo tempore: non fuit oppidum, quod nos effugeret: sexaginta urbes, omnem regionem Argob regni Og in Basan.
verses.english: At that time, we captured all of his cities—there wasn't a single town that escaped us. We took sixty cities, all the region of Argob, which was part of Og's kingdom in Bashan.

verses.latin: Omnes civitates erant munitionibus altissimis, murisque et portis firmissimis roboratæ, absque oppidis innumeris, quæ erant absque muris.
verses.english: All these cities were fortified with very high walls, and strengthened with the most secure walls and gates, besides countless other towns that had no walls at all.

verses.latin: Et delevimus eos, sicut fecimus Sehon regi Hesebon, perdentes omnem civitatem, viros ac mulieres et parvulos.
verses.english: And we utterly destroyed them, just as we did to Sihon, the king of Heshbon. We completely destroyed every city, including the men, women, and little children.

verses.latin: Prædam vero, et pecora universa diripuimus nobis.
verses.english: However, we took all the plunder and livestock for ourselves.

verses.latin: Tulimusque illo tempore terram duorum regum Amorrhæorum, qui erant trans Jordanem, a torrente Arnon usque ad montem Hermon,
verses.english: At that time, we took the land of the two kings of the Amorites who were across the Jordan River, from the Arnon Torrent all the way to Mount Hermon.

verses.latin: quem Sidonii Sarion vocant, et Amorrhæi Sanir:
verses.english: The Sidonians call Mount Hermon 'Sirion,' but the Amorites call it 'Senir'.

verses.latin: universas civitates campestres, et omnem terram Galaad, et Basan usque Salcha et Edrai civitates regni Og in Basan.
verses.english: We took all the cities of the plain, and all the land of Gilead and Bashan, as far as Salecah and Edrei, which were cities of Og's kingdom in Bashan.

verses.latin: Solus quippe Og rex Basan restiterat de reliquiis Raphaim. Monstratur sepulchrum ejus in Ammæn, quod est cubitorum novem longitudinis, et quatuor latitudinis ad mensuram cubiti virilis manus.
verses.english: Only Og, the king of Bashan, remained of the remnant of the Rephaim giants. His sarcophagus can be seen in Rabbah of the Ammonites; it is nine cubits long and four cubits wide, measured by the standard cubit of a man's forearm.

verses.latin: Terramque illam in tempore illo possedimus ab Aroer, quæ est super torrentem Arnon, mediam partem montis Galaad, et civitates ejus dedi Ruben et Gad.
verses.english: At that time, we took possession of that land from Aroer, which is by the Arnon Torrent. I gave the middle part of the hill country of Gilead and its cities to the tribes of Reuben and Gad.

verses.latin: Et reliquam partem Galaad, et omnem Basan regni Og, dedi mediæ tribui Manasse, omnem regionem Argob: cuncta Basan vocatur terra Raphaim.
verses.english: And the rest of Gilead and all of Bashan, which was Og's kingdom, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh, which included all the region of Argob. All of Bashan is called 'the land of the Rephaim' —the land of the giants.

verses.latin: Jair filius Manasse possedit omnem regionem Argob usque ad terminos Gessuri et Machati: et vocavit ex nomine suo Basan, Avoth Jair, id est, Villas Jair, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: Jair, a son of Manasseh, took possession of all the region of Argob, as far as the borders of Geshur and Maachah. He named Bashan, Avoth Jair —that is, 'The Villages of Jair'—after himself, a name that remains to this very day.

verses.latin: Et Machir dedi Galaad.
verses.english: And to Machir I gave Gilead.

verses.latin: Et tribubus Ruben et Gad dedi de terra Galaad usque ad torrentem Arnon, medium torrentis, et confinium usque ad torrentem Jaboc, qui est terminus filiorum Ammon:
verses.english: And to the tribes of Reuben and Gad I gave land from Gilead as far as the Arnon Torrent—the middle of the torrent serving as their boundary—and up to the Jabbok Torrent, which is the boundary of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: et planitiem solitudinis, et Jordanem, et confinia Cenereth usque ad mare deserti, quod est salsissimum, sub Asedoth Phasga ab oriente.
verses.english: I also gave them the plain of the desert, and the Jordan River, and the borders of Chinnereth—which is the Sea of Galilee—as far as the Sea of the Arabah, which is the Salt Sea, or Dead Sea, eastward below the slopes of Pisgah.

verses.latin: Mandavique vobis in tempore illo, dicens: Dominus Deus vester dedit vobis terram istam in possessionem, accincti ite ante fratres vestros filios Israel, omnes viri robusti:
verses.english: At that time, I commanded you, saying: 'The Lord your God has given you this land to possess. All you strong men must arm yourselves and cross over before your Israelite brothers.'

verses.latin: absque uxoribus et parvulis, ac jumentis, quas scio habere opes plurimas, quæ in urbibus remaneant, quas tradidi vobis:
verses.english: But your wives, your little ones, and your livestock—which I know you have in great abundance—shall remain in the cities that I have given you.

verses.latin: donec requiem tribuat Dominus fratribus vestris, sicut et vobis dedit: et possideant ipsi quoque terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est eis trans Jordanem: et tunc unusquisque revertetur in possessionem suam, quam dedi vobis.
verses.english: You shall remain there until the Lord grants rest to your brothers, just as He has given it to you, and until they also possess the land that the Lord your God is about to give them across the Jordan. Then each of you may return to his own possession, which I have given you.'

verses.latin: Josue quoque præcepi in tempore illo, dicens: Oculi tui viderunt quæcunque fecit Dominus Deus vester duobus his regibus: sic faciet omnibus regnis, ad quæ transiturus es.
verses.english: And to Joshua I commanded at that time, saying: 'Your own eyes have seen everything that the Lord your God has done to these two kings. So will He do to all the kingdoms into which you are about to cross.'

verses.latin: Ne timeas eos: quia Dominus Deus vester pro vobis ipse pugnabit.
verses.english: 'Do not fear them, for the Lord your God Himself will fight for you.'

verses.latin: Et deprecatus sum Dominum in tempore illo, dicens:
verses.english: At that time, I also pleaded with the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Domine Deus, tu cœpisti ostendere servo tuo magnitudinem tuam, et manum potentem: neque est alius Deus supra te in cælo et in terra, qui possit facere opera et fortes similes tuis.
verses.english: 'Lord God, You have begun to show Your servant Your greatness and Your mighty hand! For there is no other God above You, in the universe and on earth, who can perform such works and powerful deeds like Yours.'

verses.latin: Transibo igitur, et videbo terram hanc optimam trans Jordanem, et montem istum egregium, atque Libanum.
verses.english: 'Please let me cross over and see this good land beyond the Jordan, and this excellent mountain, and Lebanon.'

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus contra me propter vos, nec exaudivit me, sed respondit: Sufficit tibi: ne ultra loquaris de hac re ad me.
verses.english: But the Lord was angry with me because of you, and He did not listen to me. Instead, He answered, 'Enough for you! Do not speak to Me any further about this matter.'

verses.latin: Ascende cacumen Phasgæ, et illuc oculis tuis circumspice ad occidentem, et aquilonem, et austrum, atque orientem, et vide: quia non transibis Jordanem istum.
verses.english: 'Go up to the top of Pisgah, and look around with your eyes to the west, and to the north, and to the south, and to the east, and see it! For you shall not cross this Jordan River.'

verses.latin: Præcipe Josue, et hortare eum, atque conforta: quia ipse præcedet populum istum, et dividet eis terram, quam visurus es.
verses.english: 'But command Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him, because he himself shall go before this people, and he shall distribute to them the land that you are about to see.'

verses.latin: Mansimusque in valle contra Phogor.
verses.english: So we remained in the valley opposite Beth-peor.

verses.latin: Et nunc, Israël, audi præcepta, et judicia quæ ego doceo te, ut faciens ea, vivas, et ingrediaris, et possideas terram, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum daturus est vobis.
verses.english: And now, Israel, listen carefully to the commands and judgments which I am teaching you today. Obey them, so that you may live and enter and take possession of the land which the Lord, the God of your fathers, is about to give you.

verses.latin: Non addetis ad verbum, quod vobis loquor, nec auferetis ex eo: custodite mandata Domini Dei vestri, quæ ego præcipio vobis.
verses.english: You shall not add anything to the word which I speak to you, nor shall you take anything away from it. Instead, you must keep the commands of the Lord your God, which I am giving to you.

verses.latin: Oculi vestri viderunt quæ fecerit Dominus contra Beelphegor, quomodo omnes viros, qui sunt secuti eum, interemerit de medio vestri.
verses.english: Your own eyes have seen what the Lord did against Baal-Peor, where the Israelites worshipped pagan gods. The Lord destroyed all the men who followed those false gods, removing them from your midst.

verses.latin: Vos autem, qui adhæretis Domino Deo vestro, vivitis universi usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: But you, who clung faithfully to the Lord your God, are all alive to this very day.

verses.latin: En docui vos præcepta atque judicia, sicut mandavit mihi Dominus Deus meus: ut faciatis ea in terra, ad quam ingrediemini possidendam.
verses.english: Behold, I have taught you commands and judgments, just as the Lord my God commanded me to do. My purpose is for you to follow these laws in the land which you are about to enter and possess.

verses.latin: Custodite ergo et implete illa. Hæc est enim vestra sapientia, et intelligentia coram populis: ut audientes omnia hæc præcepta, dicant: En populus sapiens, et intelligens, gens magna.
verses.english: Therefore, keep these laws and fulfill them. For this will be your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of all the surrounding nations. When they hear all these commands, they will declare, 'This truly is a wise and understanding people; a great nation!'

verses.latin: Nec est ulla natio tam grandis, quæ habeat deos appropinquantes sibi, sicut Dominus Deus noster adest cunctis supplicantibus sibi.
verses.english: There is no nation so great that has gods drawing so near to it, as the Lord our God is present to all who call upon Him with sincere hearts.

verses.latin: Et quæ est alia natio tam inclyta, ut habeat cæremonias, justaque judicia, et universam legem, quam ego proponam hodie ante oculos vestros?
verses.english: And what other nation is so renowned and glorious, that it has such ceremonies, just judgments, and an entire body of law like the one I am setting before you today?

verses.latin: Custodi igitur temetipsum et animam tuam sollicite. Ne obliviscaris verborum, quæ viderunt oculi tui, et ne excidant de corde tuo cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ. Docebis ea filios ac nepotes tuos,
verses.english: Therefore, guard yourself and your soul diligently. Do not forget the words that your own eyes have witnessed, and do not let them fade from your heart throughout all the days of your life. You must teach them to your children and to your grandchildren—that is, the generations to come.

verses.latin: diem, quo stetisti coram Domino Deo tuo in Horeb, quando dixit Dominus ad me: Congrega ad me populum, ut audiat sermones meos, et discat timere me omni tempore, quo vivit in terra, et doceat filios suos.
verses.english: Remember the day when you stood before the Lord your God in Horeb, Mount Sinai, when the Lord said to me: 'Gather the people to Me, so they may hear My words. In this way, they will learn to reverence and obey Me all the time that they live on the earth, and they will teach their children to do the same.'

verses.latin: Et accessistis ad radices montis, qui ardebat usque ad cælum: erantque in eo tenebræ, nubes, et caligo.
verses.english: And you approached the foot of that mountain, which burned with fire up to the visible sky. There was also deep darkness, thick clouds, and a dense mist upon it.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad vos de medio ignis. Vocem verborum ejus audistis, et formam non vidistis.
verses.english: The Lord spoke to you from the midst of that fire. You heard the sound of His words clearly, but you did not see any physical form or likeness of Him.

verses.latin: Et indicavit vobis pactum suum, et præcepit ut faceretis decem verba, et scripsit ea in duabus tabulis lapideis.
verses.english: And He declared His covenant to you, commanding you to keep the Ten Words—meaning the Ten Commandments. He then wrote them on two stone tablets.

verses.latin: Mihi quoque præcepit in illo tempore, ut docerem vos cæremonias et judicia, quæ facere deberetis in terra, quam possessuri estis.
verses.english: The Lord also commanded me at that time to teach you the ceremonies and the judgments which you ought to perform in the land which you are about to possess.

verses.latin: Custodite igitur sollicite animas vestras. Non vidistis aliquam similitudinem in die, qua locutus est Dominus vobiscum in Horeb de medio ignis:
verses.english: Therefore, diligently guard your souls and pay close attention. Remember that you saw no likeness or image on the day when the Lord spoke with you in Horeb from the midst of the fire.

verses.latin: ne forte decepti faciatis vobis sculptam similitudinem, aut imaginem masculi, vel feminæ,
verses.english: Be careful, lest perhaps you be deceived and make for yourselves a carved likeness of anything: an image of a male or a female person.

verses.latin: similitudinem omnium jumentorum, quæ sunt super terram, vel avium sub cælo volantium,
verses.english: Or a likeness of any beasts that are on the earth, or of any birds flying under the sky.

verses.latin: aut reptilium, quæ moventur in terra, sive piscium, qui sub terris et aquis morantur:
verses.english: Or of any creeping things that move on the earth, or of any fish that dwell beneath the earth and in the waters.

verses.latin: ne forte elevatis oculis ad cælum, videas solem et lunam, et omnia astra cæli, et errore deceptus adores ea, et colas quæ creavit Dominus Deus tuus in ministerium cunctis gentibus, quæ sub cælo sunt.
verses.english: Be careful also, lest perhaps, lifting your eyes to the sky, you see the sun, the moon, and all the stars of the sky—the entire host of heaven—and being deceived by error, you adore them and worship them. These are things which the Lord your God created for the service of all the nations that are under the sky; they are not to be worshipped.

verses.latin: Vos autem tulit Dominus, et eduxit de fornace ferrea Ægypti, ut essetis ei in populum hæreditarium, sicut est in præsenti die.
verses.english: But the Lord took you and led you out of the iron furnace of Egypt, a place of hard labor and oppression. He did this so that you might be for Him a people of inheritance—His very own possession—as you are on this present day.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus contra me propter sermones vestros, et juravit ut non transirem Jordanem, nec ingrederer terram optimam, quam daturus est vobis.
verses.english: The Lord also became angry with me because of your complaints and your words of rebellion. He swore that I would not cross the Jordan River, nor enter that excellent land which He is about to give you.

verses.latin: Ecce morior in hac terra, nec transibo Jordanem: vos transibitis, et possidebitis eam.
verses.english: Behold, I will die in this land, and I will not cross the Jordan. But you will cross over and you will possess the land.

verses.latin: Cavete nequando obliviscamini pacti Domini Dei vestri, quod pepigit vobiscum: et faciatis vobis sculptam similitudinem eorum, quæ vetuit Dominus.
verses.english: Beware lest you ever forget the covenant of the Lord your God, which He made with you. Do not make for yourselves a carved likeness of any of those things which the Lord has forbidden.

verses.latin: Quia Dominus Deus tuus ignis consumens est, Deus æmulator.
verses.english: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire—He is passionate and severe against sin. He is a jealous God who will not tolerate idolatry.

verses.latin: Si genueritis filios et nepotes, et diu manseritis in terra, et decepti feceritis vobis sculptam similitudinem, committentes malum coram Domino Deo vestro, ut eum ad iracundiam provocetis:
verses.english: If you beget children and grandchildren, and you remain for a long time in the land, and then, being deceived, you make for yourselves a carved likeness of anything, committing evil before the Lord your God, so as to provoke Him to anger—

verses.latin: testes invoco hodie cælum et terram, cito perituros vos esse de terra, quam transito Jordane possessuri estis. Non morabimini in ea longissimo tempore, sed commovebit vos Dominus, atque disperget in omnes nationes.
verses.english: I call the sky and the earth to witness against you today: you will quickly perish from the land which you are about to possess after crossing the Jordan. You will not remain in it for a very long time, but the Lord will stir you up and scatter you among all the nations.

verses.latin: Et remanebitis pauci in nationibus, ad quas vos Dominus transtulerit.
verses.english: And you will remain few in number among the nations to which the Lord will have led you into exile.

verses.latin: Et servietis ibi diis ligneis et lapideis, qui non vident, nec audiunt, nec comedunt, nec odorantur.
verses.english: And there, in exile, you will serve gods made of wood and stone. These are idols that cannot see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell anything.

verses.latin: Cumque quæsieris ibi Dominum Deum tuum, invenies eum: si tamen toto corde tuo, et tota tribulatione animæ tuæ quæsieris eum.
verses.english: But if, when you are in exile, you seek the Lord your God, you will find Him. This will happen only if you seek Him with all your heart, and with all the tribulation and distress of your soul.

verses.latin: Postquam te invenerint omnia quæ supra diximus, in novissimo tempore reverteris ad Dominum Deum tuum, et audies vocem ejus.
verses.english: After all the things that we have spoken of above happen to you—after you experience these calamities—in the latter days you will return to the Lord your God, and you will listen to His voice.

verses.latin: Quia Deus misericors Dominus Deus tuus est: non dimittet te, nec omnino delebit, nec obliviscetur pacti, in quo juravit patribus tuis.
verses.english: Because the Lord your God is a merciful God, He will not abandon you, nor will He utterly destroy you. He will not forget the covenant which He swore to your fathers.

verses.latin: Interroga de diebus antiquis, qui fuerunt ante te, ex die quo creavit Deus hominem super terram, a summo cæli usque ad summum ejus, si factum est aliquando hujuscemodi verbum, aut auditum?
verses.english: Inquire about the ancient days that were before you, from the day when God created mankind on the earth. Ask from one end of the sky to the other, if such a word as this has ever happened, or if such a thing has ever been heard?

verses.latin: audivitne populus vocem Dei loquentis de medio ignis, sicut tu audisti, et vixisti?
verses.english: Did any people ever hear the voice of God speaking from the midst of a fire, as you heard, and yet lived to tell of it?

verses.latin: aut si tentavit Deus ut ingrederetur, et tolleret sibi gentem de medio nationum, per tentationes, signa, atque portenta, et pugnam validam, et manum extensam, et brachium excelsum, et horribiles visiones, juxta omnia quæ fecit pro vobis Dominus Deus vester in Ægypto, coram oculis tuis?
verses.english: Or has God ever attempted to go in and take for Himself a nation from the midst of other nations? He did this through trials, signs, and wonders, and by strong warfare, and an outstretched hand, and a high arm, and terrible visions—just as the Lord your God did for you in Egypt, right before your very eyes.

verses.latin: Ut scires, quod Dominus ipse sit Deus, et non sit alius præter eum.
verses.english: All of this happened so that you might know that the Lord Himself is God, and that there is no other God besides Him.

verses.latin: De cælo te fecit audire vocem suam, ut doceret te. Et super terram ostendit tibi ignem suum maximum, et voces ejus audisti de medio ignis:
verses.english: From the sky above, He made you hear His voice, so that He might teach you. And on the earth, He showed you His great fire, and you heard His powerful voices from the midst of the fire.

verses.latin: Eo quod dilexerit patres tuos, et elegerit semen eorum post eos: idcirco eduxit te, præcedens in virtute sua magna de Ægypto,
verses.english: It was because He loved your fathers, and chose their offspring after them, that He led you out. He went before you with His great power from Egypt.

verses.latin: ut deleret nationes maximas, et fortissimas te, in introitu tuo: et introduceret te, daretque tibi terram earum in possessionem, sicut cernis in præsentem diem.
verses.english: He did this to destroy nations greater and stronger than you as you entered their land. He brought you in and gave you their land as a possession, as you see on this present day.

verses.latin: Scito ergo hodie, et cogita in corde tuo, quod Dominus ipse sit Deus in cælo sursum, et in terra deorsum, et non sit alius.
verses.english: Know therefore today, and consider in your heart, that the Lord Himself is God in the heavens above and on the earth below. There is truly no other God.

verses.latin: Custodi præcepta ejus, atque mandata quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, ut bene sit tibi, et filiis tuis post te, et permaneas multo tempore super terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi.
verses.english: Therefore, keep His commands and precepts which I am giving to you today. This is so that it may be well with you and with your children after you, and that you may remain for a long time upon the land which the Lord your God is about to give you.

verses.latin: Et nunc, Israel, audi praecepta et judicia quae ego doceo te, ut faciens ea vivas, et ingrediaris, ac possideas terram, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum daturus est vobis.
verses.english: Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and ordinances that I am teaching you today. If you obey them, you will live, and you will enter and possess the land—the promised land—which the Lord God of your fathers is about to give to you.

verses.latin: Non addetis ad verbum quod ego loquor vobis, nec auferetis ex eo: custodite mandata Domini Dei vestri, quae ego praecipio vobis.
verses.english: You must not add to the word that I speak to you, nor take anything away from it. Instead, you must keep the commandments of the Lord your God, which I am commanding you today.

verses.latin: Oculi vestri viderunt omnia quae fecit Dominus contra Beelphegor, quomodo contriverit omnes cultores ejus de medio vestri.
verses.english: Your own eyes have seen everything that the Lord did against Baal-Peor. The Lord completely destroyed all of his worshipers from among you.

verses.latin: Vos autem, qui adhaesistis Domino Deo vestro, vivitis omnes usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: But you, who held fast to the Lord your God, all of you are still alive to this very day.

verses.latin: Ecce docui vos praecepta atque judicia, sicut mandavit mihi Dominus Deus meus: ut faciatis ea in terra, ad quam ingrediemini possidendam.
verses.english: Look, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, just as the Lord my God commanded me. You are to obey them in the land that you are about to enter and possess.

verses.latin: Custodite ergo, et implete illa. Haec est enim sapientia vestra, et intelligentia coram populis: ut audientes omnia praecepta haec, dicant: Ecce populus sapiens et intelligens, gens magna.
verses.english: Therefore, observe and perform them. For this will be your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations. When they hear all these statutes, they will say, 'Indeed, this great nation is a wise and understanding people.'

verses.latin: Nec est ulla natio tam grandis, quae habeat deos appropinquantes sibi, sicut Deus noster adest omnibus invocantibus se.
verses.english: For there is no other great nation that has gods so near to them, as our God is near to all who call upon Him.

verses.latin: Et praecepta, ceremoniæque et judicia, quæ hodie proponam ante oculos vestros, ut justa sunt.
verses.english: And what other nation has statutes, ceremonies, and ordinances that are as righteous as all these which I set before your eyes today?

verses.latin: Custodi igitur temetipsum, et animam tuam sollicite. Ne obliviscaris verborum, quæ viderunt oculi tui, et ne excedant de corde tuo omnibus diebus vitæ tuæ. Docebis ea filios ac nepotes tuos.
verses.english: Therefore, be careful and diligently guard your soul. Do not forget the words that your own eyes have seen, and do not let them depart from your heart all the days of your life. You are to teach them to your children and your grandchildren.

verses.latin: in die qua stetisti in Horeb coram Domino Deo tuo, quando dixit Dominus ad me: Congrega ad me populum, ut audiat sermones meos, et discant timere me omni tempore quo vivunt in terra, et doceant filios suos.
verses.english: —especially on the day that you stood at Horeb before the Lord your God, when the Lord said to me, 'Gather the people to Me, so that they may hear My words. They are to learn to fear Me all the time that they live on the earth, and they are to teach their children.'

verses.latin: Et accessistis ad radices montis, qui ardebat igne usque ad cælum, et caligo, et nubes, et tenebræ.
verses.english: And you approached the base of the mountain, which was burning with fire up to the sky, surrounded by darkness, cloud, and deep gloom.

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad vos de medio ignis. Vocem verborum ejus audistis, et formam penitus non vidistis.
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to you from the midst of the fire. You heard the sound of His words, but you did not see any form or likeness.

verses.latin: Et annuntiavit vobis pactum suum, et decem verba, quæ scripsit in duabus tabulis lapideis.
verses.english: And He declared to you His covenant—His ten words, the Ten Commandments—which He wrote on two tablets of stone.

verses.latin: Mihi quoque præcepit in illo tempore ut docerem vos cæremonias et judicia, quæ facere deberetis in terra, quam possessuri estis.
verses.english: And at that time, the Lord commanded me to teach you the ceremonies and ordinances that you were to perform in the land which you are about to possess.

verses.latin: Custodite igitur animas vestras diligentissime. Non vidistis aliquam similitudinem in die qua locutus est Dominus vobis in Horeb de medio ignis,
verses.english: Therefore, guard your souls very carefully. For you saw no form or likeness on the day when the Lord spoke to you at Horeb from the midst of the fire.

verses.latin: ne forte decepti faciatis vobis sculptam imaginem, similitudinem omnis figuræ, aut masculi aut feminæ,
verses.english: Be careful that you are not deceived into making for yourselves any carved image, any likeness of any figure, whether male or female.

verses.latin: similitudinem omnium jumentorum quæ sunt super terram, vel avium sub cælo volantium,
verses.english: Be careful not to make any likeness of any animals that are on the earth, or of any birds that fly under the sky.

verses.latin: aut reptilium quæ moventur in terra, sive piscium qui sub terra morantur in aquis:
verses.english: or of any creeping things that move on the ground, or of any fish that live in the waters beneath the earth.

verses.latin: ne forte elatis oculis ad cælum, videas solem et lunam et omnia astra cæli, omnes stellas, et errore deceptus adores ea, et colas quæ creavit Dominus Deus tuus in ministerium cunctis gentibus quæ sub cælo sunt.
verses.english: And beware, lest you lift your eyes to the sky and see the sun and the moon and all the stars of the universe—all the celestial bodies—and be led astray by error to worship and serve them. For the Lord your God created these for the service of all the nations under the sky.

verses.latin: Vos autem tulit Dominus, et eduxit de fornace ferrea Ægypti, ut essetis ei in populum hæreditarium, sicut est in praesenti die.
verses.english: But the Lord took you and brought you out of the iron furnace of Egypt—a metaphor for severe oppression—so that you might be His inheritance, His own people, as you are this present day.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus contra me propter sermones vestros, et juravit ut non transirem Jordanem, nec ingrederer terram optimam, quam daturus est vobis.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Lord was angry with me because of your words, and He swore that I would not cross the Jordan River, nor enter that excellent land which He is about to give to you.

verses.latin: Sed moriar in terra hac, nec transibo Jordanem. Vos transibitis, et possidebitis eam.
verses.english: But I will die in this land; I will not cross the Jordan. You yourselves will cross over and possess it.

verses.latin: Cave ne obliviscaris pacti Domini Dei tui, quod pepigit tecum: et ne facias tibi sculptam imaginem eorum, de quibus præcepit Dominus ut non faceres.
verses.english: Be careful not to forget the covenant of the Lord your God, which He made with you. And do not make for yourselves any carved image of anything that the Lord has commanded you not to make.

verses.latin: Quia Dominus Deus tuus ignis consumens est, Deus æmulator.
verses.english: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.

verses.latin: Si genueritis filios et nepotes, et diu manseritis in terra, et decepti feceritis vobis sculptam imaginem, supponentes manum et facientes malum coram Domino Deo vestro, ut eum ad iracundiam provocetis:
verses.english: If you beget children and grandchildren, and you remain a long time in the land, and then you are deceived into making for yourselves any carved image, committing evil in the sight of the Lord your God, so as to provoke Him to anger:

verses.latin: testes invoco hodie cælum et terram, cito perituros vos esse de terra, quam transito Jordane possessuri estis. Non morabimini in ea longissimo tempore, sed comminuti penitus delebimini.
verses.english: I call today the universe and the earth to witness against you. You will quickly perish from the land that you are about to possess after crossing the Jordan. You will not remain in it for a very long time, but you will be utterly destroyed and brought to nothing.

verses.latin: Atque disperget vos Dominus in omnes gentes, et remanebitis pauci in nationibus, ad quas te transduxerit Dominus.
verses.english: And the Lord will scatter you among all the nations, and you will remain few in number among the nations to which the Lord will lead you.

verses.latin: Et servietis ibi diis ligneis et lapideis, qui non vident, nec audiunt, nec comedunt, nec odorantur.
verses.english: There you will serve gods made of wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.

verses.latin: Cumque quæsieris ibi Dominum Deum tuum, invenies eum: si tamen toto corde quæsieris, et tota tribulatione animæ tuæ.
verses.english: But if you seek the Lord your God there, you will find Him, provided that you search for Him with all your heart and with all the tribulation of your soul.

verses.latin: Postquam te invenerint omnia quæ prædicta sunt, novissimo tempore venies ad Dominum Deum tuum, et audies vocem ejus.
verses.english: After all these things that have been foretold come upon you, in the last days you will return to the Lord your God, and you will listen to His voice.

verses.latin: Quia Deus misericors Dominus Deus tuus est: non dimittet te, nec omnino delebit, neque obliviscetur pacti, in quo juravit patribus tuis.
verses.english: For the Lord your God is a merciful God; He will not abandon you, nor will He utterly destroy you, nor will He forget the covenant which He swore to your fathers.

verses.latin: Interroga de diebus antiquis, qui fuerunt ante te, ex die quo creavit Deus hominem super terram, a summo cælo usque ad summum cælum, si facta est aliquando hujuscemodi res, aut si audita est unquam similis.
verses.english: Indeed, inquire of the days of old, which were before you, from the day that God created mankind on the earth, from one end of the universe to the other. Has such a thing ever happened, or has anything similar ever been heard?

verses.latin: Numquid audivit populus vocem Dei loquentis de medio ignis, sicut tu audisti, et vixisti?
verses.english: Has any people ever heard the voice of God speaking from the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and remained alive?

verses.latin: Aut si tentavit Deus ut ingrederetur, et tolleret sibi gentem de medio nationum, per tentationes, in signis et portentis, et manu valida, et brachio extento, magnisque terroribus, sicut fecit pro vobis Dominus Deus vester in Ægypto, videntibus oculis tuis?
verses.english: Or has God ever attempted to go and take for Himself a nation from the midst of other nations, by trials, by signs and wonders, by a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, just as the Lord your God did for you in Egypt, before your very eyes?

verses.latin: Ut scires quia Dominus ipse est Deus, et non est alius præter illum.
verses.english: This was so that you might know that the Lord Himself is God, and there is no other besides Him.

verses.latin: De cælo te fecit audire vocem suam, ut doceret te. Et super terram ostendit tibi ignem suum maximum, et vocem illius audisti de medio ignis:
verses.english: From the heavens, He made you hear His voice, so that He might teach you. And on the earth, He showed you His great fire, and you heard His voice from the midst of the fire.

verses.latin: Quia dilexit patres tuos, et elegit semen eorum post eos: idcirco eduxit te præcedens in virtute sua magna ex Ægypto,
verses.english: Because He loved your fathers, and chose their descendants after them, He therefore brought you out, going before you with His great power, from Egypt.

verses.latin: ut deleret nationes multas et robustissimas te, in introitu tuo: et introduceret te, daretque tibi terram earum in possessionem, sicut cernis in præsentem diem.
verses.english: He did this to destroy many nations, even those mightier than you, at your entrance. He brought you in and gave their land to you as a possession, as you see this present day.

verses.latin: Scito ergo hodie, et cogita in corde tuo, quod Dominus ipse sit Deus in cælo sursum, et in terra deorsum, et non sit alius.
verses.english: Know therefore today, and consider in your heart, that the Lord Himself is God in the heavens above, and on the earth below, and there is no other.

verses.latin: Custodi præcepta ejus, et mandata illius, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, ut bene sit tibi, et filiis tuis post te, et permaneas multo tempore super terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi.
verses.english: Therefore, keep His statutes and His commandments, which I am commanding you today, so that it may be well with you and with your children after you, and that you may remain for a long time on the land which the Lord your God is about to give to you.

verses.latin: Vocavit autem Moyses omnem Israel et dixit ad eos: Audi, Israel, praecepta et iudicia quae ego loquor in auribus vestris hodie: discite ea et custodite opere.
