verses.english: Moses then summoned all of Israel and said to them: 'Listen, O Israel, to the commandments and judgments which I am speaking in your hearing today; learn them and keep them through your actions.'

verses.latin: Dominus Deus noster pepigit nobiscum foedus in Horeb.
verses.english: The Lord Our God made a covenant with us on Mount Horeb.

verses.latin: Non cum patribus nostris pepigit pactum, sed nobiscum, qui hic sumus omnes hodie viventes.
verses.english: He did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, all of us who are alive here today.

verses.latin: Facie ad faciem locutus est vobiscum in monte de medio ignis,
verses.english: Face to face He spoke with you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire,

verses.latin: ego mediator et pronuntiator sermonis eius fui inter Dominum et vos tunc, ut annuntiarem vobis de verbo Domini, timuistis enim ignem et non ascendistis in montem.
verses.english: I stood between the Lord and you at that time, as a mediator and announcer of His words, to declare to you the word of the Lord; for you were afraid of the fire and did not go up the mountain.

verses.latin: Ego Dominus Deus tuus, qui eduxi te de terra Aegypti, de domo servitutis.
verses.english: I am the Lord your God, who led you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.

verses.latin: Non habebis deos alienos coram me.
verses.english: You shall not have other gods standing before Me.

verses.latin: Non facies tibi sculptile, neque omnem similitudinem eorum quae in caelo sunt sursum, et quae in terra deorsum, et quae versantur in aquis sub terra.
verses.english: You shall not make for yourself any carved image, nor any likeness of anything that is in the universe above, or that is on the earth beneath, or that is in the waters under the earth.

verses.latin: Non adorabis ea, neque coles: quia ego sum Dominus Deus tuus, Deus aemulator, reddens iniquitatem patrum super filios in tertiam et quartam generationem his qui oderunt me,
verses.english: You shall not adore them, nor shall you worship them; for I am the Lord your God, a jealous God, repaying the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, even to the third and fourth generation of those who hate Me,

verses.latin: et faciens misericordiam in multa millia diligentibus me et custodientibus praecepta mea.
verses.english: and showing mercy to thousands of those who love Me and keep My commandments.

verses.latin: Non usurpabis nomen Domini Dei tui frustra: quia nec ille impunitus erit qui super re vana nomen eius assumpserit.
verses.english: You shall not use the name of the Lord your God in vain; for He will not leave unpunished anyone who takes His name for a useless purpose.

verses.latin: Observa diem sabbati, ut sanctifices eum, sicut praecepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: Observe the Sabbath day to keep it holy, just as the Lord your God commanded you.

verses.latin: Sex diebus operaberis et facies omne opus tuum.
verses.english: For six days you shall work and perform all your labor.

verses.latin: Septimo autem die sabbatum Domini Dei tui est: non facies in eo quidquam operis tu, et filius tuus, et filia, et servus, et ancilla, et bos, et asinus, et omne iumentum tuum, et peregrinus qui est intra portas tuas: ut requiescat servus et ancilla tua sicut et tu.
verses.english: But the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord your God. On it you shall do no work, neither you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your animals, nor the stranger who is within your gates; so that your male and female servants may rest just as you do.

verses.latin: Memento quod servieris in Aegypto, et eduxerit te Dominus Deus tuus inde in manu forti et brachio extento: idcirco praecepit tibi ut custodias diem sabbati.
verses.english: Remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and that the Lord your God led you out from there with a strong hand and an outstretched arm; therefore the Lord your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: Honora patrem tuum et matrem, sicut praecepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus, ut longo vivas tempore, et bene sit tibi in terra quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi.
verses.english: Honor your father and your mother, just as the Lord your God commanded you, so that you may live long and that it may be well with you in the land that the Lord your God is about to give you.

verses.latin: Non occides.
verses.english: You shall not murder.

verses.latin: Non moechaberis.
verses.english: You shall not commit adultery.

verses.latin: Non furtum facies.
verses.english: You shall not steal.

verses.latin: Non loqueris contra proximum tuum falsum testimonium.
verses.english: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

verses.latin: Non concupisces uxorem proximi tui: non domum, non agrum, non servum, non ancillam, non bovem, non asinum, et universa quae illius sunt.
verses.english: You shall not covet your neighbor's wife; you shall not covet his house, his field, his male servant, his female servant, his ox, his donkey, or anything else that belongs to him.

verses.latin: Haec verba locutus est Dominus ad omnem multitudinem vestram in monte de medio ignis et nubis et caliginis, voce magna nihil ultra addens: et scripsit ea in duabus tabulis lapideis, quas dedit mihi.
verses.english: These words the Lord spoke to all your assembly on the mountain out of the midst of the fire, the cloud, and the thick darkness, with a loud voice, adding nothing more. And He wrote them on two stone tablets, which He then gave to me.

verses.latin: Audientes autem vocem de medio tenebrarum, et montem ardentem, accessistis ad me omnes principes tribuum et maiores.
verses.english: But when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness, and saw the mountain burning, all the leaders of your tribes and your elders approached me.

verses.latin: Et dixistis: Ecce ostendit nobis Dominus Deus noster maiestatem et magnitudinem suam: vocem eius audivimus de medio ignis, et probavimus hodie quod loquente Deo cum homine, vixerit homo.
verses.english: And you said: 'Behold, the Lord our God has shown us His majesty and His greatness. We have heard His voice from the midst of the fire, and we have proven today that a person can live even when God speaks with them.'

verses.latin: Nunc igitur cur morimur? consumet enim nos ignis hic maximus: si ultra audierimus vocem Domini Dei nostri, moriemur.
verses.english: 'Now therefore, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us. If we hear the voice of the Lord our God any longer, we will die!'

verses.latin: Quis est enim ex omni carne, qui audiat vocem Dei viventis de medio ignis, ut nos audivimus, et possit vivere?
verses.english: 'For who is there among all flesh that has heard the voice of the living God speaking from the midst of the fire, as we have heard, and has been able to live?'

verses.latin: Tu potius accede, et audi omnia quae dixerit Dominus Deus noster tibi, et tu loquere nobis, et nos audientes faciemus ea.
verses.english: 'You yourself, Moses, rather, go near and hear all that the Lord our God says to you, and then you speak to us; and we will listen and do them.'

verses.latin: Quibus auditis, Dominus ait mihi: Audivi vocem verborum populi huius quae locuti sunt tibi: bene omnia sunt locuti.
verses.english: When the Lord heard these words, He said to me: 'I have heard the voice of the words which this people have spoken to you; they have spoken everything well.'

verses.latin: Quis det eis hanc mentem, ut timeant me, et custodiant universa mandata mea in omni tempore, ut bene sit eis et filiis eorum in sempiternum?
verses.english: 'Oh, that they would have this mindset, to fear Me and keep all My commandments at all times, so that it may be well with them and their children forever!'

verses.latin: Vade et dic eis: Revertimini in tentoria vestra.
verses.english: 'Go and tell them: "Return to your tents."'

verses.latin: Tu vero hic sta mecum, et loquar tibi omnia mandata, et caeremonias, atque iudicia, quae docebis eos, ut faciant ea in terra quam daturus sum illis in possessionem.
verses.english: 'But you, Moses, stand here with Me, and I will speak to you all the commandments, and the ceremonies, and the judgments, which you shall teach them, so that they may perform them in the land which I am about to give to them as a possession.'

verses.latin: Custodite igitur et facite quae Dominus Deus vester praecepit vobis: non declinabitis nec ad dextram nec ad sinistram.
verses.english: Therefore be diligent to keep and do what the Lord your God has commanded you; you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.

verses.latin: Sed per viam quam praecepit vobis Dominus Deus vester ambulabitis: ut vivatis, et bene sit vobis, et multiplici numero succedatis terra possessione.
verses.english: Instead, you shall walk in the way which the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live, and that it may be well with you, and that you may have abundant success in possessing the land.

verses.latin: Et vocavit Moyses omnem Israël, et dixit ad eos : Audi, Israël, cæremonias et judicia quæ ego loquor in auribus vestris hodie : ut discatis ea, et opere compleatis.
verses.english: Moses called together all the people of Israel and said to them: "Listen, O Israel, to the statutes and ordinances that I am speaking for you to hear today, so that you may learn them and carry them out through your actions."

verses.latin: Dominus Deus noster pepigit nobiscum fœdus in Horeb.
verses.english: "The Lord our God made a covenant with us at Horeb."

verses.latin: Non cum patribus nostris iniit pactum, sed nobiscum, qui adhuc hodie omnes hic sumus.
verses.english: "He did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us—all of us who are still alive and present here today."

verses.latin: Facie ad faciem locutus est vobiscum in monte de medio ignis:
verses.english: "He spoke with you face to face on the mountain, from the midst of the fire."

verses.latin: ego sequester et medius fui inter Dominum et vos in tempore illo, ut annuntiarem vobis verba ejus : timuistis enim ignem, et non ascendistis in montem.
verses.english: "I was standing as a mediator between the Lord and you at that time, to announce His words to you, for you were afraid of the fire and did not go up the mountain."

verses.latin: Ego Dominus Deus tuus, qui eduxi te de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis.
verses.english: "I am the Lord your God, who led you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery."

verses.latin: Non habebis deos alienos coram me.
verses.english: "You shall have no other gods before Me."

verses.latin: Non facies tibi sculptile, nec omnem similitudinem eorum quæ in cælo sunt sursum, et quæ in terra deorsum, et quæ versantur in aquis sub terra.
verses.english: "You shall not make for yourself a graven image, nor any likeness of anything that is in the sky above, or that is on the earth below, or that is in the waters beneath the earth."

verses.latin: Non adorabis ea, et non coles : Ego enim sum Dominus Deus tuus, Deus æmulator, reddens iniquitatem patrum super filios in tertiam et quartam generationem his qui oderunt me,
verses.english: "You shall not adore them, nor shall you worship them, for I am the Lord your God, a jealous God, who punishes the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, to the third and fourth generation of those who hate Me."

verses.latin: et faciens misericordiam in millia his qui diligunt me, et custodiunt præcepta mea.
verses.english: "And shows mercy to thousands of those who love Me and keep My precepts."

verses.latin: Non usurpabis nomen Domini Dei tui frustra : quia nec ille impunitus erit qui super re vana nomen ejus assumpserit.
verses.english: "You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for neither shall he be unpunished who takes His name lightly or uses it for empty things."

verses.latin: Observa diem sabbati, ut sanctifices eum, sicut præcepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: "Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as the Lord your God has commanded you."

verses.latin: Sex diebus operaberis, et facies omnia opera tua.
verses.english: "For six days you shall labor and do all your work."

verses.latin: Septimus dies sabbati est, id est, requiei Domini Dei tui. Non facies in eo quidquam operis, tu et filius tuus et filia, servus et ancilla, et bos et asinus et omne jumentum tuum, et peregrinus qui est intra portas tuas : ut requiescat servus et ancilla tua, sicut et tu.
verses.english: "But the seventh day is the Sabbath, that is, a day of rest for the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, neither you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male or female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your livestock, nor the stranger who is within your gates, so that your male and female servant may rest as well as you."

verses.latin: Memento quod et ipse servieris in Ægypto, et eduxerit te Dominus Deus tuus inde in manu forti et brachio extento, idcirco præcepit tibi ut observares diem sabbati.
verses.english: "Remember that you also were a slave in Egypt, and the Lord your God led you out from there with a strong hand and an outstretched arm. Therefore, the Lord your God commanded you to observe the Sabbath day."

verses.latin: Honora patrem tuum et matrem, sicut præcepit Dominus Deus tuus tibi, ut longo tempore vivas, et bene sit tibi in terra quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi.
verses.english: "Honor your father and your mother, as the Lord your God has commanded you, that you may live a long time, and that it may go well with you in the land which the Lord your God will give you."

verses.latin: Non occides.
verses.english: "You shall not kill."

verses.latin: Non moechaberis.
verses.english: "You shall not commit adultery."

verses.latin: Non furtum facies.
verses.english: "You shall not steal."

verses.latin: Non loqueris contra proximum tuum falsum testimonium.
verses.english: "You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor."

verses.latin: Non concupisces uxorem proximi tui : non domum, non agrum, non servum, non ancillam, non bovem, non asinum, et non omnia quæ illius sunt.
verses.english: "You shall not covet your neighbor's wife; you shall not covet his house, his field, his male servant, his female servant, his ox, his donkey, nor anything that belongs to him."

verses.latin: Hæc sunt verba quæ locutus est Dominus ad omnem multitudinem vestram in monte de medio ignis, et nubis, et caliginis, voce magna, nihil ultra addens : et scripsit ea in duabus tabulis lapideis, et tradidit mihi.
verses.english: "These are the words which the Lord spoke to all your assembly on the mountain, from the midst of the fire, and the cloud, and the darkness, with a great voice, and He added nothing more. And He wrote these ten commandments on two stone tablets and delivered them to me."

verses.latin: Facto autem coetu, cum audissetis vocem de medio tenebrarum, et montem ardere vidissetis : accessistis ad me omnes principes tribuum et majores natu, atque dixistis :
verses.english: "Now, when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness, and saw the mountain burning, all the leaders of your tribes and your elders approached me and said:"

verses.latin: Ecce ostendit nobis Dominus Deus noster majestatem et magnitudinem suam : vocem ejus audivimus de medio ignis, et probavimus hodie, quod loquente Deo cum homine, vixerit homo.
verses.english: "Behold, the Lord our God has shown us His majesty and greatness. We have heard His voice from the midst of the fire, and we have seen today that a man can live even when God speaks with him."

verses.latin: Nunc igitur cur morimur, et devorabit nos ignis hic maximus ? Si enim ultra audierimus vocem Domini Dei nostri, moriemur.
verses.english: "Now therefore, why should we die, and why should this great fire consume us? For if we hear the voice of the Lord our God any more, we shall die."

verses.latin: Quis est ex omni carne, qui audiat vocem Dei viventis de medio ignis, sicut nos audivimus, et possit vivere ?
verses.english: "For what flesh is there, that has heard the voice of the living God from the midst of the fire, as we have heard it, and could live?"

verses.latin: Tu potius accede, et audi omnia quæ dixerit Dominus Deus noster, et loquere nobis : audiemus, et faciemus.
verses.english: "You, Moses, go near, and hear all that the Lord our God shall say, and then speak to us; we will hear and we will do it."

verses.latin: Quibus auditis, ait Dominus ad me : Audivi vocem verborum populi hujus, quæ locuti sunt tibi : bene omnia sunt locuti.
verses.english: "And when the Lord heard these words, He said to me: 'I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken to you. They have spoken well in all that they have said.'"

verses.latin: Quis det eis hanc mentem, ut timeant me, et custodiant universa mandata mea in omni tempore, ut bene sit eis et filiis eorum in sempiternum ?
verses.english: "'Who will grant them this mind, that they may fear Me, and keep all My commandments at all times, so that it may go well with them and with their children forever?'"

verses.latin: Vade, et dic eis : Revertimini in tentoria vestra.
verses.english: "Go, and tell them: 'Return to your tents.'"

verses.latin: Tu vero sta juxta me : et loquar tibi omnia mandata, et cæremonias, atque judicia, quæ docebis eos, ut faciant in terra quam dabo eis in possessionem.
verses.english: "But you, Moses, stand here by Me, and I will speak to you all the commandments, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which you shall teach them, so that they may observe them in the land that I am giving them as a possession."

verses.latin: Custodite igitur et facite quæcumque præcepit Dominus Deus vester vobis : non declinabitis nec ad dexteram nec ad sinistram.
verses.english: "Therefore, be careful to do exactly as the Lord your God has commanded you: you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left."

verses.latin: Sed per viam quam præcepit Dominus Deus vester vobis, ambulate : ut vivatis, et bene sit vobis, et longo tempore maneatis in terra quam possessuri estis.
verses.english: "But you shall walk in the way which the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live and that it may go well with you, and that you may remain a long time in the land which you are going to possess."

verses.latin: Hæc sunt præcepta, et cæremoniæ, atque judicia, quæ mandavit Dominus Deus vester, ut docerem vos, et faciatis ea in terra, ad quam transgredimini possidendam:
verses.english:
These are the commands, and the ceremonies, and the laws
which the Lord your God has commanded me to teach you,
so that you may do them in the land which you are about to enter and possess.

verses.latin: ut timeas Dominum Deum tuum, et custodias omnia mandata, ac præcepta ejus, quæ ego mando tibi, et filii tui, et nepotum tuorum, cunctis diebus vitæ tuæ, et ut prolongentur dies tui.
verses.english:
This is so that you may fear the Lord your God
and keep all His commands and precepts which I give you today—
you, and your children, and your grandchildren—all the days of your life,
and so that your days may be long upon the land.

verses.latin: Audi, Israël, et custodi ut facias, et bene sit tibi, et multipliceris vehementer, sicut locutus est Dominus Deus patrum tuorum tibi terram lacte et melle manantem.
verses.english:
Hear, O Israel, and be careful to do them,
so that it may be well with you, and that you may multiply greatly,
just as the Lord God of your fathers has promised you a land flowing with milk and honey.

verses.latin: Audi, Israël: Dominus Deus noster, Dominus unus est.
verses.english: Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.

verses.latin: Diliges Dominum Deum tuum ex toto corde tuo, et ex tota anima tua, et ex tota fortitudine tua.
verses.english: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength.

verses.latin: Et erunt verba hæc, quæ ego mando tibi hodie, in corde tuo:
verses.english: And these words, which I command you today, shall be in your heart.

verses.latin: et narrabis ea filiis tuis, et meditaberis sedens in domo tua, et ambulans in itinere, dormiens atque consurgens.
verses.english:
You shall tell them to your children
and you shall meditate on them when you sit in your house, and when you walk on the road,
and when you lie down, and when you rise up.

verses.latin: Et ligabis ea quasi signum in manu tua, et erunt inter oculos tuos pendentes.
verses.english:
You shall bind them as a sign on your hand,
and they shall be as frontlets [phylacteries] between your eyes.

verses.latin: Scribesque in postibus domus tuæ, et in foribus tuis.
verses.english: And you shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.

verses.latin: Cum introduxerit itaque te Dominus Deus tuus in terram, pro qua juravit patribus tuis, Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob: et dederit tibi civitates magnas et optimas, quas non ædificasti:
verses.english:
Therefore, when the Lord your God brings you into the land
concerning which He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob,
and He gives you great and good cities, which you did not build,

verses.latin: et domos plenas cunctis bonis, quas non extruxisti, cisternasque quas non fodisti, et vineas, et oliveta, quæ non plantasti:
verses.english:
and houses full of all good things, which you did not furnish,
and cisterns which you did not dig, and vineyards and olive groves, which you did not plant,

verses.latin: et comederis, et saturatus fueris:
verses.english: and you eat and are satisfied,

verses.latin: cave, ne obliviscaris Domini, qui eduxit te de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis.
verses.english: be careful lest you forget the Lord, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

verses.latin: Dominum Deum tuum timebis, et illi servies, ac per nomen illius jurabis.
verses.english: You shall fear the Lord your God; you shall serve Him, and swear by His Name.

verses.latin: Non ibitis post deos alienos, cunctarum gentium quæ in circuitu vestro sunt:
verses.english: You shall not go after other gods of any of the peoples who are around you.

verses.latin: quoniam Deus æmulator Dominus Deus tuus in medio tui est: ne forte irascatur furor Domini Dei tui contra te, et auferat te de superficie terræ.
verses.english:
For the Lord your God is a jealous God in your midst—
a God who demands your exclusive worship and fidelity—
lest the wrath of the Lord your God be kindled against you
and He destroy you from the face of the land.

verses.latin: Non tentabitis Dominum Deum vestrum, sicut tentastis in loco tentationis.
verses.english: You shall not put the Lord your God to the test, as you tested Him at Massah [the place of testing].

verses.latin: Ut faciatis quod placitum est et bonum in conspectu Domini Dei tui, ut bene sit tibi, et ingressus possideas terram optimam, de qua juravit Dominus patribus tuis,
verses.english:
So that you may do what is pleasing and good in the sight of the Lord your God,
that it may be well with you, and that you may enter and possess the good land, concerning which the Lord swore to your fathers.

verses.latin: ut auferat omnes inimicos tuos a facie tua, sicut locutus est.
verses.english: He will cast out all your enemies before you, just as He has promised.

verses.latin: Cum interrogaverit te filius tuus cras, dicens: Quid sibi volunt testimonia hæc, et cæremoniæ, atque judicia, quæ præcepit Dominus Deus noster nobis?
verses.english:
When your son asks you in the future, saying:
"What do these testimonies, and these ceremonies, and these laws mean, which the Lord our God has commanded us?"

verses.latin: dices ei: Servi eramus Pharaonis in Ægypto, et eduxit nos Dominus de Ægypto in manu forti,
verses.english:
Then you shall say to him: "We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt,
and the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.

verses.latin: et fecit signa atque portenta magna et pessima in Ægypto contra Pharaonem, et omnem domum ejus in conspectu nostro:
verses.english:
And the Lord performed great and terrible signs and wonders in Egypt
against Pharaoh and all his household, before our very eyes.

verses.latin: et nos inde eduxit, ut introduceret, et daret nobis terram, super qua juravit patribus nostris.
verses.english:
And He brought us out from there, to bring us in, and to give us the land
concerning which He swore to our fathers.

verses.latin: Præcepitque nobis Dominus omnia judicia hæc, ut timeamus Dominum Deum nostrum, et bene sit nobis cunctis diebus vitæ nostræ, sicut est hodie.
verses.english:
And the Lord commanded us all these laws, so that we should fear the Lord our God,
for our good always, as it is today.

verses.latin: Et erit nostri misereretur, si custodierimus, et fecerimus omnia mandata hæc coram Domino Deo nostro, sicut mandavit nobis.
verses.english:
And He will be merciful to us if we are careful to observe and do all these commands
before the Lord our God, just as He has commanded us.

verses.latin: CUM introieris terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi possidendam, et multas nationes deleverit coram te, Hethæum, et Gergesæum, et Amorrhæum, Chananæum, et Pherezæum, et Hevæum, et Jebusæum, septem nationes multo majoribus te, et fortioribus:
verses.english: When you enter the land that the Lord your God will give you to possess, and He has destroyed many nations before you—the Hittites, and the Girgashites, and the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites—these are seven nations much larger and stronger than you.

verses.latin: et tradiderit eas Dominus Deus tuus tibi, percusserisque eas, interficies eas. Non inibis cum eis fœdus, nec misereberis earum:
verses.english: And the Lord your God has delivered them to you, and you have struck them down. You must utterly destroy them. You shall not make any treaty with them, nor show them any mercy.

verses.latin: neque jungere matrimonii commercio. Filiam tuam non dabis filio ejus, nec filiam illius accipies filio tuo:
verses.english: Nor shall you join them through marriage. You shall not give your daughter to their son, nor shall you take their daughter for your son.

verses.latin: quoniam averteret filium tuum ne sequeretur me, et magis serviret diis alienis: irasceturque Dominus contra vos, et delebit te velociter.
verses.english: For they would turn your son away from following Me, and he would rather serve foreign gods. Then the Lord's anger will burn against you, and He will quickly destroy you.

verses.latin: Quin potius hæc facietis eis: aras eorum subvertetis, et statuas confringetis, lucosque succidetis, et sculptilia comburetis.
verses.english: Instead, you shall do this to them: you must tear down their altars, shatter their statues, cut down their sacred groves, and burn their carved idols with fire.

verses.latin: Quia populus sanctus es Domino Deo tuo. Te elegit Dominus Deus tuus ut sis ei populus peculiaris de cunctis populis qui sunt super terram.
verses.english: For you are a holy people to the Lord your God. The Lord your God has chosen you to be a special people for Himself, out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.

verses.latin: Non quia multitudine cæteras nationes superatis, vobis Dominus junctus est, et elegit vos, cum omnibus sitis pauciores:
verses.english: It was not because you were greater in number than any other nation that the Lord joined Himself to you and chose you, for you were the fewest of all peoples.

verses.latin: sed quia Dominus dilexit vos, et custodivit juramentum quod juravit patribus vestris: eduxitque vos manu forti, et redemit de domo servitutis, de manu Pharaonis regis Ægypti.
verses.english: But it was because the Lord loved you and kept the oath that He swore to your fathers that He brought you out with a strong hand and redeemed you from the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et scies quia Dominus Deus tuus, ipse est Deus fortis et fidelis, custodiens pactum et misericordiam iis qui diligunt eum, et observant mandata ejus, in mille generationes:
verses.english: Know then that the Lord your God, He is God—a mighty and faithful God, who keeps His covenant and shows mercy to those who love Him and observe His commandments, to a thousand generations.

verses.latin: et reddens illis qui oderunt eum statim, ita ut disperdat eos, et ultra non differat, illi qui odit, protinus reddat quod meretur.
verses.english: But He immediately repays those who hate Him by utterly destroying them, and He does not delay to repay the one who hates Him—He promptly gives him what he deserves.

verses.latin: Custodi ergo mandata et cæremonias atque judicia, quæ ego hodie præcipio tibi ut facias.
verses.english: Therefore, keep the commandments and the ceremonies, and the judgments that I am commanding you today to perform.

verses.latin: Si audieritis hæc judicia, et custodieritis, et feceritis ea, custodiet et Dominus Deus tuus tibi pactum et misericordiam, quam juravit patribus tuis:
verses.english: If you listen to these judgments and carefully observe and perform them, then the Lord your God will also keep for you the covenant and the mercy which He swore to your fathers.

verses.latin: et diliget te, et multiplicabit, et benedicet fructui ventris tui, et fructui terræ tuæ, frugi tuæ, atque vindemiæ, oleo, et armentis, et ovibus gregis tui super terram, quam juravit patribus tuis ut daret tibi.
verses.english: And He will love you, and multiply you, and bless the fruit of your womb, and the fruit of your land—your grain, and your wine, your oil, and the increase of your cattle and the lambs of your flock in the land that He swore to your fathers to give you.

verses.latin: Benedictus eris inter omnes populos. Non erit apud te sterilis utriusque sexus, tam de hominibus, quam de pecoribus.
verses.english: You will be blessed above all peoples. There will be no barrenness among you, neither male nor female, whether among your people or your livestock.

verses.latin: Auferet Dominus a te omnem languorem: et infirmitates Ægypti pessimas, quas nosti, non inferet tibi, sed cunctis hostibus tuis.
verses.english: The Lord will remove from you every sickness, and He will not bring upon you any of the dreadful diseases of Egypt, which you know so well, but He will inflict them upon all your enemies.

verses.latin: Et commedes universos populos, quos Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi. Non parcet oculus tuus illis, nec servies diis eorum, quoniam in ruinam tuam cederet hoc tibi.
verses.english: And you shall devour all the peoples whom the Lord your God will deliver to you. Your eye shall not pity them, nor shall you serve their gods, for that would become a ruin for you—a snare.

verses.latin: Si dixeris in corde tuo: Plures sunt gentes istæ quam ego, quomodo potero delere eas?
verses.english: If you should say in your heart: "These nations are more numerous than I am; how can I destroy them?"

verses.latin: Non timebis, sed recordaberis quæ fecerit Dominus Deus tuus Pharaoni et cunctis Ægyptiis:
verses.english: Do not fear them, but remember what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all the Egyptians.

verses.latin: plagas maximas, quas viderunt oculi tui, et signa atque prodigia, manumque robustam, et brachium extentum, quo eduxit te Dominus Deus tuus: sic faciet cunctis populis, quos metuis.
verses.english: Remember the great plagues which your eyes saw, and the signs and wonders, and the strong hand, and the outstretched arm by which the Lord your God brought you out. So will the Lord do to all the peoples whom you fear.

verses.latin: Insuper et crabrones mittet Dominus Deus tuus in eos, donec commorientes interficiat omnes qui reliqui fuerint et latuerint te fugientes.
verses.english: Moreover, the Lord your God will send hornets among them, until all who remain and have hidden themselves from you in flight are destroyed to death.

verses.latin: Non timebis eos, quia Dominus Deus tuus in medio tui est, Deus magnus et terribilis:
verses.english: You shall not fear them, because the Lord your God is in your midst—a great and terrible God.

verses.latin: ipse consumet nationes istas in conspectu tuo paulatim atque per partes. Non poteris eas simul delere, ne multitudine succrescant bestiæ terræ contra te.
verses.english: He Himself will consume these nations before you little by little, and piece by piece. You will not be able to destroy them all at once, so that the beasts of the earth do not increase against you in great numbers.

verses.latin: Tradetque eos Dominus Deus tuus in conspectu tuo, et interficiet illos conturbatione magna, donec deleantur.
verses.english: And the Lord your God will deliver them into your sight and will destroy them with a great confusion until they are utterly wiped out.

verses.latin: Et reges eorum tradet in manus tuas, et perdes nomina eorum sub cælo. Nullus poterit tibi resistere, donec conteras eos.
verses.english: He will deliver their kings into your hands, and you shall blot out their names from under the sky. No one will be able to resist you until you have crushed them.

verses.latin: Sculptilia eorum igne combures: non concupisces argentum et aurum de quibus facta sunt, neque assumes ex eis quidquam, ne offendaris propter illud: quia abominatio est Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: You shall burn their carved images with fire. Do not covet the silver and gold that is on them, nor take anything from them for yourself, lest you be ensnared by it. For it is an abomination to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Nec inferes quippiam ex idolo in domum tuam, ne fias anathema sicut et illud est. Quasi spurcitiam et sicut immunditiam detestaberis, et velut inquinamentum fugies, quia anathema est.
verses.english: And you shall not bring anything from an idol into your house, lest you become accursed like it. You shall utterly detest it as filth and abomination, and flee from it as defilement, for it is something dedicated to destruction.

verses.latin: Omne mandatum, quod ego præcipio tibi hodie, custodies et facies, ut vivere possitis et multiplicemini, ingressique possideatis terram, pro qua juravit Dominus patribus vestris.

verses.english: All the commandments that I am giving you today, you must keep and obey. You must do this so that you may live and become many in number. This is how you will be able to enter and take possession of the land that the Lord your God swore to give to your fathers.

verses.latin: Et recordaberis cuncti itineris, per quod eduxit te Dominus Deus tuus quadraginta annis per desertum, ut affligeret te, atque tentaret, et sciretur quid esset in animo tuo, utrum custodires mandata illius, an non.

verses.english: And you must remember the entire journey through which the Lord your God led you for forty years through the desert. He did this to humble you and to test you. This was to determine what was truly in your heart: whether you would keep His commandments or not.

verses.latin: Afflixit te inopia, et dedit tibi cibum manna, quod ignorares tu et patres tui: ut ostenderet tibi quod non in solo pane vivat homo, sed in omni verbo quod egreditur de ore Domini.

verses.english: He humbled you with hunger and then gave you manna to eat—food that neither you nor your fathers had ever known. He did this to show you that a human being does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Vestimentum tuum non vetustate defecit, et pes tuus non est attritus per quadraginta annos.

verses.english: Throughout those forty years, your clothing did not wear out from age, and your feet did not swell or blister.

verses.latin: Ut intelligas, quod sicut erudit homo filium suum, ita Dominus Deus tuus erudivit te.

verses.english: This was so you would understand that just as a person trains his son, so the Lord your God trained you.

verses.latin: Custodi ergo mandata Domini Dei tui, et ambula in viis ejus, et time eum.

verses.english: Therefore, you must keep the commandments of the Lord your God, walk in His ways, and fear Him.

verses.latin: Dominus enim Deus tuus introducet te in terram optimam, terram rivorum, aquarumque et fontium: in cujus campis et montibus erumpunt abyssi:

verses.english: For the Lord your God is bringing you into an excellent land—a land of rivers, streams, and springs, where water gushes forth from the depths in its valleys and mountains.

verses.latin: terram frumenti, hordei, ac vinearum, in qua ficus, et mala granata, et oliveta nascuntur: terram olei et mellis,

verses.english: It is a land of wheat, barley, and vineyards, where fig trees, pomegranates, and olive groves grow. It is a land flowing with oil and honey.

verses.latin: ubi absque ulla penuria comedes panem tuum, et rerum omnium abundantia perfrueris: cujus lapides ferrum sunt, et de montibus ejus æris metalla fodiuntur:

verses.english: In that land, you will eat your bread without any scarcity, and you will enjoy an abundance of all things. Its rocks contain iron, and from its mountains, you will mine copper ore.

verses.latin: ut comedas et satures, et benedicas Domino Deo tuo pro terra optima, quam tradidit tibi.

verses.english: When you have eaten and are satisfied, you must bless the Lord your God for the excellent land that He has given you.

verses.latin: Cave nequando obliviscaris Domini Dei tui, et negligas mandata ejus atque judicia et caeremonias, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie:

verses.english: Be careful never to forget the Lord your God, nor to neglect His commandments, His ordinances, and His rituals that I am giving you today.

verses.latin: ne postquam comederis et saturatus fueris, domos pulchras ædificaveris, et habitaveris in eis,

verses.english: Do not let it happen that after you have eaten and are satisfied, you build beautiful houses and settle comfortably in them.

verses.latin: habuerisque armenta et ovium greges, argenti et auri et omnium rerum copiam,

verses.english: And you acquire herds of cattle and flocks of sheep, and an abundance of silver and gold and all sorts of other possessions.

verses.latin: elevetur cor tuum, et non memineris Domini Dei tui, qui eduxit te de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis,

verses.english: Do not let your heart become proud and then forget the Lord your God, who led you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery.

verses.latin: et ductor tuus fuit in solitudine magna atque terribili, in qua erat serpens flatu adurens, et scorpio, et dipsas, et sitis, nullæque omnino aquæ: qui eduxit rivos de durissima petra,

verses.english: He was your guide in that great and terrifying wilderness, where there were fiery serpents and scorpions, and venomous snakes, and a thirst where there was no water at all. Yet it was He who brought forth streams of water from the hardest rock.

verses.latin: et cibavit te manna in solitudine, quod nescierunt patres tui: et afflixit atque tentavit, ut postea tibi benefaceret,

verses.english: It was He who fed you manna in the wilderness, which your fathers had not known. He humbled you and tested you, so that in the end, He might do good to you.

verses.latin: ne diceres in corde tuo: Fortitudo mea, et robur manus meæ, hæc mihi omnia præstiterunt.

verses.english: Do not say in your heart: 'My own strength and the power of my hand have accomplished all these things for me.'

verses.latin: Sed recorderis Domini Dei tui, quod ipse tibi dederit vires, ut impleres fœdus suum, super quo juravit patribus tuis, sicut et in præsenti die comprobatur.

verses.english: Instead, remember the Lord your God, for it is He who gives you the strength to fulfill His covenant—the covenant He swore to your fathers, as is evident today.

verses.latin: Sin autem oblitus Domini Dei tui, secutus fueris deos alienos, et servieris illis, et adoraveris eos: ecce nunc prædico tibi quod vere pereatis.

verses.english: But if you forget the Lord your God, and follow other gods, and serve them, and worship them, then I solemnly warn you today that you will truly perish.

verses.latin: Sicut nationes, quas delevit Dominus in introitu vestro, ita et vos peribitis, si inobedientes fueritis Domino Deo vestro.

verses.english: Just as the nations that the Lord destroyed before you, so also will you perish if you are disobedient to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Omnia mandata, quae ego praecipio tibi hodie, custodi et fac: ut vivatis, et multiplicemini, ingressique possideatis terram, super qua juravit Dominus patribus vestris.
verses.english: All the commandments which I give to you today, you must keep and do, so that you may live and multiply. And you will enter and possess the land, which the Lord swore to your fathers.

verses.latin: Et recordaberis cuncti itineris, per quod adduxit te Dominus Deus tuus quadraginta annis per desertum, ut affligeret te, atque tentaret, et sciretur quid esset in corde tuo, an custodires mandata illius, an non.
verses.english: And you will remember all the journey through which the Lord your God led you for forty years through the desert, so that He might humble you and test you. This was to reveal what was truly in your heart, whether you would keep His commandments or not.

verses.latin: Afflixit te inopia, et dedit tibi cibum manna, quod ignorares tu et patres tui: ut ostenderet tibi, quod non in solo pane vivat homo, sed in omni verbo, quod egreditur de ore Domini.
verses.english: He humbled you with scarcity and gave you manna to eat, which neither you nor your fathers had known. This was to show you that humanity does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of the Lord.

verses.latin: Vestimentum tuum non conputruit ullo tempore, et calceamentum tuum non est scissum in pedibus tuis, quadraginta annis.
verses.english: Your clothing did not wear out at any time, and your sandals did not tear on your feet throughout those forty years.

verses.latin: Ut cognoscas, quod sicut erudit homo filium suum, ita Dominus Deus tuus erudivit te.
verses.english: So you must know that just as a father disciplines his son, so the Lord your God disciplined you.

verses.latin: Ut custodias mandata Domini Dei tui, et ambules in viis ejus, et timeas eum.
verses.english: You are to keep the commandments of the Lord your God, walk in His ways, and revere Him.

verses.latin: Dominus enim Deus tuus introducet te in terram bonam, terram rivorum aquarum, fontiumque et abyssorum: de convallibus et montibus egredientium:
verses.english: For the Lord your God will bring you into a good land—a land of flowing streams, springs, and deep waters that emerge from valleys and mountains.

verses.latin: Terram frumenti, hordei, ac vinearum, in qua ficus, et malogranata, et olivarum nascentur olea:
verses.english: A land of wheat, barley, and vineyards, where figs, pomegranates, and olives—from which oil is pressed—will grow.

verses.latin: Terram olei et mellis, ubi absque ulla penuria comedes panem tuum, et rerum omnium abundantia perfrueris: nec erit in ea inopia ulla.
verses.english: A land of oil and honey, where you will eat your bread without any scarcity, and you will enjoy the abundance of all things, with no scarcity whatsoever.

verses.latin: Ut comedas et satures, et benedicas Domino Deo tuo pro terra optima, quam tradidit tibi.
verses.english: So that you may eat and be satisfied, and bless the Lord your God for the excellent land which He has given to you.

verses.latin: Observa diligenter, ne quando obliviscaris Domini Dei tui, et neglegas mandata ejus atque judicia et caeremonias, quae ego hodie praecipio tibi:
verses.english: Be very careful never to forget the Lord your God and neglect His commandments, judgments, and ceremonies, which I command you today.

verses.latin: ne postquam comederis et saturatus fueris, domos pulchras ædificaveris, et habitaveris in eis,
verses.english: Lest after you have eaten and are satisfied, you build beautiful houses and settle in them—

verses.latin: et ovium ac armentorum armenta multiplicata fuerint, argenti et auri, omniumque rerum copia creverit,
verses.english: and your flocks of sheep and herds of cattle have multiplied, and your abundance of silver, gold, and all possessions has grown—

verses.latin: elevatumque cor tuum obliviscatur Domini Dei tui, qui eduxit te de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis,
verses.english: and your heart becomes proud, causing you to forget the Lord your God, who led you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.

verses.latin: et eduxit te de deserto magno atque terribili, in quo erat serpens flatu adurens, et scorpio, et dipsas, et terra sine aqua: qui eduxit tibi rorem de petra durissima,
verses.english: He led you through that great and terrible desert, where there were fiery serpents, scorpions, and vipers, and a land without water. He brought forth water for you from the hardest rock.

verses.latin: et cibavit te manna in solitudine, quod nescierunt patres tui: et postea sustentavit, ac probavit te, ut in novissimis misereretur tui.
verses.english: And He fed you with manna in the wilderness, which your fathers had not known. He sustained and tested you with these trials so that, in the end, He might show you His mercy.

verses.latin: ne diceres in corde tuo: Fortitudo mea, et robur manus meae, haec mihi omnia praestiterunt.
verses.english: You must not say in your heart, 'My own strength and the might of my hand have provided all these things for me.'

verses.latin: Sed recordaberis Domini Dei tui, quod ipse det tibi vires, ut possideas, et impleat pactum suum, super quo juravit patribus tuis, sicut hodie est.
verses.english: Instead, you must remember the Lord your God, for it is He who gives you the strength to possess this land. He does this to fulfill His covenant, which He swore to your fathers, just as it is being fulfilled today.

verses.latin: Sin autem oblitus Domini Dei tui, secutus fueris deos alienos, et servieris illis, et adoraveris eos: ecce nunc praedico tibi, quod penitus interibis.
verses.english: But if you forget the Lord your God and follow foreign gods, serving and worshipping them, behold, I declare to you now that you will utterly perish.

verses.latin: Sicut gentes, quas Dominus in introitu tuo delevit, ita et vos peribitis, si inobedientes fueritis Domino Deo vestro.
verses.english: Just as the Lord destroyed the nations when you entered their land, so you also will perish if you are disobedient to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Audi, Israel: Tu transibis Jordanem hodie, ut possideas nationes maximas, et fortissimas, civitates ingentes, et ad cælum usque muratas,
verses.english: Listen, Israel: Today you will cross over the Jordan River. You are going to take possession of nations that are very great and strong, and their cities are huge, with walls built up to the sky.

verses.latin: populum magnum atque sublimem, filios Enacim, quos tu nosti, et audisti per sermonem: Quis poterit resistere filiis Enac?
verses.english: You will encounter a great and towering people, the sons of Anak, whom you already know, and about whom you have heard it said: 'Who can stand against the sons of Anak?'

verses.latin: Scito ergo hodie quod Dominus Deus tuus ipse transibit ante te ignis devorans, qui conteret illos, et delebit atque subvertet ante faciem tuam: et cito defacies eos, atque perduces velociter.
verses.english: Understand this today: The Lord your God Himself will cross over before you, like a consuming fire. He will crush these nations, and He will destroy and overthrow them before your very eyes. He will quickly wipe them out, and you will drive them out swiftly.

verses.latin: Ne dicas in corde tuo, cum deleverit eos Dominus Deus tuus in conspectu tuo: Propter justitiam meam introduxit me Dominus ut possiderem terram hanc: cum propter impietates earum nationum Dominus eas deleverit introitus tui.
verses.english: Do not say in your heart, when the Lord your God has destroyed these nations before you, that He brought you in to possess this land because of your own righteousness. Instead, the Lord will destroy them as you enter the land because of the wickedness of those nations.

verses.latin: Non enim propter justitias tuas, et æquitatem cordis tui ingredieris ad possidendas terras eorum: sed quia illæ peccaverunt impie, idcirco delebit eos in introitu tuo: et ut compleret verbum suum, quod sub juramento pollicitus est patribus tuis Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob.
verses.english: You are not entering to take possession of their lands because of your own righteousness or the uprightness of your heart. It is because those nations have sinned wickedly that He will destroy them as you enter. This is also so that He may fulfill His promise, which He swore to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.latin: Scito igitur quod non propter justitias tuas Dominus Deus tuus dat tibi terram hanc optimam ad possidendam, cum durissimæ cervicis sis populus.
verses.english: Know, therefore, that the Lord your God is not giving you this excellent land to possess because of your own righteousness. This is because you are a stubborn people, hard-headed and unyielding.

verses.latin: Mementote, et ne obliviscamini quomodo ad iracundiam provocastis Dominum Deum vestrum in solitudine: ex eo die quo egressi estis de Ægypto, usque ad locum istum, semper contendistis cum Domino.
verses.english: Remember, and do not forget, how you provoked the Lord your God to anger in the wilderness. From the day you left Egypt until you arrived at this very place, you have always contended with the Lord, opposing His will.

verses.latin: Nam et in Horeb ad iracundiam provocastis eum, et iratus Dominus voluit te conterere:
verses.english: For even at Horeb, you provoked Him to anger, and the Lord was so furious that He wanted to destroy you entirely.

verses.latin: quando ascendi in montem ut acciperem tabulas lapideas, tabulas pacti quod pepigit Dominus vobiscum: et eram in monte quadraginta diebus, et quadraginta noctibus, panem non comedens, et aquam non bibens.
verses.english: This was when I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets—the tablets of the covenant that the Lord had made with you. I remained on the mountain for forty days and forty nights, during which I ate no bread and drank no water.

verses.latin: Deditque mihi Dominus duas tabulas lapideas scriptas digito Dei, continentes omnia verba quæ vobis locutus est in monte de medio ignis, quando concilio populi congregati.
verses.english: Then the Lord gave me two stone tablets, written with the very finger of God. These contained all the words He had spoken to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire, when the people were gathered together.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent quadraginta dies, et totidem noctes, dedit mihi Dominus duas tabulas lapideas, tabulas fœderis.
verses.english: And when the forty days and forty nights had passed, the Lord gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.

verses.latin: Dixitque mihi: Surge, et descende hinc cito: quia peccavit populus tuus, quem eduxisti de Ægypto: deseruerunt velociter viam, quam ostendisti eis, feceruntque sibi conflatile.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: 'Get up and go down from here quickly, because your people, whom you brought out of Egypt, have sinned. They have very quickly abandoned the way that I commanded them, and they have made a molten idol for themselves.'

verses.latin: Et rursum ait Dominus ad me: Cerno quod populus iste duræ cervicis sit:
verses.english: And again, the Lord said to me: 'I see that this people is stubborn and unyielding.'

verses.latin: dimitte me, ut conteram eum, et deleam nomen ejus sub cælo, et faciam te gentem multo majorem, et fortiorem quam hac est.
verses.english: 'Let me alone, so that I may crush them and erase their name from under the sky. Then I will make you into a nation much greater and stronger than this one is.'

verses.latin: Cumque de monte ardentissimo descenderem, et duas tabulas utriusque fœderis haberem in manibus, vidi vos peccasse Domino Deo vestro, feceratisque vobis vitulum conflatilem, et deserueratis cito viam ejus, quam vobis ostenderat.
verses.english: So, as I came down from the mountain, which was burning fiercely, and held the two tablets of the covenant in my hands, I saw that you had sinned against the Lord your God. You had made yourselves a molten calf, and you had quickly abandoned His way that He had shown you.

verses.latin: Et projeci ambas tabulas de manibus meis, atque confregi eas in conspectu vestro.
verses.english: And I threw both tablets from my hands, shattering them before your very eyes.

verses.latin: Procidi, et jacui coram Domino quadraginta diebus ac noctibus, cibum non comedens, et aquam non bibens, propter omnia peccata vestra quibus peccaveratis contra Dominum, et ad iracundiam provocaveratis eum.
verses.english: Then I fell down and lay prostrate before the Lord for forty days and forty nights. I ate no food and drank no water, because of all the sins you had committed, by which you had sinned against the Lord and provoked Him to wrath.

verses.latin: Timui enim iram et indignationem ejus, qua adversum vos concitatus, delere vos voluerat. Exaudivitque me Dominus etiam in hac vice.
verses.english: For I was afraid of His fierce anger and indignation, with which He was stirred up against you, wanting to destroy you. But the Lord listened to me on this occasion as well, and relented.

verses.latin: Adversus Aaron quoque vehementer iratus est, volens eum conterere: et pro illo deprecatus sum.
verses.english: Even against Aaron, the Lord was intensely angry, wanting to destroy him. And I interceded for him also.

verses.latin: In Thabera quoque, et in Massah, et in sepulchris concupiscentiæ provocastis Dominum.
verses.english: Also, at Taberah, and at Massah, and at the graves of craving, you provoked the Lord with your complaints and desires.

verses.latin: Quando et misit vos Dominus de Cadesbarne, dicens: Ascendite, et possidete terram, quam dedi vobis. Et contempsistis mandatum Domini Dei vestri, et non credidistis ei, nec vocem illius audire voluistis.
verses.english: It was also when the Lord sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying: 'Go up and take possession of the land which I have given to you.' Yet you despised the command of the Lord your God, and you did not believe Him, nor were you willing to listen to His voice.

verses.latin: A die qua egressi estis de Ægypto usque ad locum istum, semper fuistis rebelles contra Dominum.
verses.english: From the day you left Egypt until this very place, you have always been rebellious against the Lord.

verses.latin: Et cum me Dominus mitteret de Cadesbarne, dicens: Ascendite, et possidete terram, quam dedi vobis. Et contempsistis mandatum Domini Dei vestri, et non credidistis ei, nec vocem illius audire voluistis.
verses.english: And when the Lord sent me from Kadesh-barnea, saying, 'Go up and take possession of the land that I have given you,' you despised the command of the Lord your God. You did not believe Him, nor were you willing to listen to His voice.

verses.latin: Procidi, et jacui coram Domino quadraginta diebus ac noctibus, quibus et ante prostratus fueram, ne deleret vos.
verses.english: Again, I fell down and lay prostrate before the Lord for forty days and forty nights, just as I had previously, so that He would not destroy you.

verses.latin: Et deprecatus sum Dominum, dicens: Domine Deus, ne disperdas populum tuum, et hereditatem tuam, quam redemisti in magnitudine tua, quos eduxisti de Ægypto in manu valida.
verses.english: And I prayed to the Lord, saying: 'O Lord God, do not destroy Your people and Your inheritance, whom You redeemed in Your great power and led out of Egypt with a mighty hand.'

verses.latin: Recordare servorum tuorum Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob: ne aspicias duritiam populi hujus, et impietatem illius, atque peccatum:
verses.english: 'Remember Your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Do not look upon the stubbornness of this people, nor their wickedness, nor their sin.'

verses.latin: ne forte dicant habitatores terræ de qua eduxisti nos: Non poterat Dominus introducere eos in terram, quam pollicitus est eis, et oderat illos: idcirco eduxit, et occidit in solitudine.
verses.english: 'Otherwise, the inhabitants of the land from which You brought us out might say: 'The Lord was not able to bring them into the land He promised them, and He hated them; therefore, He led them out and killed them in the wilderness.''

verses.latin: Qui sunt populus tuus, et hereditas tua, quos eduxisti in fortitudine tua magna, et in brachio tuo extento.
verses.english: 'Yet they are Your people and Your inheritance, whom You brought out with Your great strength and with Your outstretched arm.'

verses.latin: Hæc sunt verba quæ locutus est Dominus ad Moysen in monte Sina.
verses.english: These are the words which the Lord spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai.

verses.latin: Audi, Israël: tu transis hodie Jordanem, ut possideas nationes maximas, et fortissimas, civitates ingentes, et ad caelum usque muratas.
verses.english: Hear this, O Israel! You are about to cross the Jordan River this very day to dispossess nations far greater and stronger than yourselves, possessing immense cities with walls so fortified they seem to touch the very sky.

verses.latin: Populus ingentis magnitudinis, et in celsis habitans muris: Filii Enacim, quos tu nosti, et audisti: Quorum stirpis viro forti nullus potest resistere.
verses.english: You will face a people of immense stature, dwelling behind high walls. These are the Anakim, whom you already know and have heard about, a lineage so mighty that no one, however strong, has ever been able to resist them.

verses.latin: Scies igitur hodie, quod Dominus Deus tuus ipse transibit ante te, ignis devorans atque consumens: et ipse conteret eos, et delebit ante faciem tuam velociter: atque expelles, et perdes illos cito, sicut locutus est Dominus tibi.
verses.english: Therefore, know this day that the Lord your God Himself will go before you. He is a consuming and devouring fire, and He Himself will utterly crush them and swiftly destroy them before your very eyes. You will drive them out and swiftly annihilate them, just as the Lord has promised you.

verses.latin: Ne dicas in corde tuo, cum deleverit eos Dominus Deus tuus in conspectu tuo: Propter justitiam meam introduxit me Dominus, ut possiderem terram hanc: cum propter impietates illarum gentium expellat eas Dominus a tuo conspectu.
verses.english: Do not say in your heart, once the Lord your God has destroyed them before you: 'It is because of my own righteousness that the Lord has brought me in to possess this land.' Understand instead that it is because of the wickedness of those nations that the Lord drives them out from before you.

verses.latin: Neque enim propter justitias tuas, et aequitatem cordis tui ingredieris, ut possideas terras eorum: sed quia illae gentes impie egerunt, et ut impleret verbum suum, quod sub juramento pollicitus est patribus tuis Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob.
verses.english: For you are not entering to possess their land because of your own righteousness or the uprightness of your heart. Rather, it is because those nations acted wickedly, and also so that the Lord might fulfill His word, which He solemnly promised to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.latin: Scito igitur quod non propter justitias tuas Dominus Deus tuus dat tibi terram hanc optimam in possessionem, cum durissimae cervicis sis populus.
verses.english: Know therefore that it is not because of your own righteousness that the Lord your God is giving you this excellent land as a possession, for you are truly a stiff-necked people, stubbornly resistant to His will.

verses.latin: Mementote, et ne obliviscamini, quomodo ad iracundiam provocastis Dominum Deum vestrum in solitudine: ex eo die quo egressi estis de Aegypto, usque ad locum istum, semper contendistis cum Domino.
verses.english: Remember this and never forget how you provoked the Lord your God to anger in the wilderness. From the very day you departed from Egypt until you reached this present place, you have continually contended against the Lord.

verses.latin: Nam et in Horeb ad iracundiam provocastis Dominum, et iratus adeo interficere vos voluit.
verses.english: Indeed, even at Horeb you provoked the Lord to anger, and His wrath became so great that He intended to destroy you completely.

verses.latin: Quando ascendi in montem, ut acciperem tabulas lapideas, tabulas pacti quod pepigit vobiscum Dominus: et fui in monte quadraginta diebus, et quadraginta noctibus, panem non comedi, et aquam non bibi.
verses.english: I recall when I ascended the mountain to receive the stone tablets, the very tablets of the covenant which the Lord had made with you. I remained on the mountain for forty days and forty nights, during which I neither ate bread nor drank water.

verses.latin: Deditque mihi Dominus duas tabulas lapideas scriptas digito Dei, continentes omnes sermones, quos vobis locutus est in monte de medio ignis, quando concionatus est populo.
verses.english: And the Lord gave me two stone tablets inscribed by the finger of God, containing all the words that He had spoken to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire, when He addressed the people directly.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent quadraginta dies, et quadraginta noctes, dedit mihi Dominus duas tabulas lapideas, tabulas pacti.
verses.english: And when the forty days and forty nights had passed, the Lord gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.

verses.latin: Dixitque mihi: Surge, et descende hinc cito: quia corrupit se populus tuus, quem eduxisti de Aegypto: velociter recesserunt a via, quam ostendisti eis, feceruntque sibi conflatile.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: 'Arise, and descend from here quickly, for your people, whom you brought out of Egypt, have thoroughly corrupted themselves. They have swiftly departed from the path I commanded them, and they have made for themselves a molten idol.'

verses.latin: Et rursum ait Dominus ad me: Cerno quod populus iste durae cervicis sit.
verses.english: And again the Lord said to me: 'I perceive that this people is indeed stiff-necked and rebellious.'

verses.latin: Dimitte me, ut conteram eum, et deleam nomen ejus sub caelo, et faciam te gentem multo majorem, et fortiorem, quam haec est.
verses.english: 'Leave Me alone now, that I may utterly crush them and blot out their name from under the entire sky. Then I will make you into a nation far greater and stronger than this one.'

verses.latin: Cumque de monte descendere, ardente et igne, et duas tabulas utriusque manus portarem:
verses.english: So I turned and began to descend from the mountain, which was burning with fire, carrying the two tablets in my two hands.

verses.latin: vidi vos peccasse Domino Deo vestro, et fecisse vobis vitulum conflatilem, ac recessisse velociter de via ejus, quam vobis ostenderat.
verses.english: And there I saw that you had sinned against the Lord your God, and had made for yourselves a molten calf. You had swiftly departed from His way which He had clearly shown to you.

verses.latin: Abjeci igitur duas tabulas de manibus meis, confregique eas in conspectu vestro.
verses.english: Therefore, I threw down the two tablets from my hands and shattered them before your very eyes, as a sign of the covenant you had broken.

verses.latin: Et procidi ante Dominum sicut prius, quadraginta diebus, et quadraginta noctibus, panem non comedens, et aquam non bibens, propter omnem peccatum vestrum, quod peccaveratis contra Dominum, et feceratis malum coram eo, ad provocandam iracundiam illius.
verses.english: Then I prostrated myself before the Lord, just as before, for forty days and forty nights, neither eating bread nor drinking water, all on account of your great sin—the sin by which you had offended the Lord and done evil in His sight, provoking His burning anger.

verses.latin: Timui quippe iram, et indignationem illius, qua iratus fuerat vobis, et vos delere voluerat. Et exaudivit me Dominus etiam hac vice.
verses.english: For I was terrified by the fierce anger and indignation with which He was enraged against you, and by His desire to utterly destroy you. Yet, the Lord listened to me even on this occasion.

verses.latin: Adversus Aaron quoque vehementer iratus est, voluitque eum conterere: et pro illo deprecatus sum.
verses.english: The Lord was also exceedingly angry with Aaron, intending to destroy him. And I interceded for Aaron as well.

verses.latin: Scelus autem vestrum, quod feceratis, id est, vitulum, arsi igne, et comminui in frusta, conspergénsque in pulverem, projeci in torrentem, qui de monte fluebat.
verses.english: As for the heinous idol you had made—that calf—I burned it with fire, then ground it into small pieces, pulverizing it into dust. I then scattered this dust into the torrent that flowed down from the mountain.

verses.latin: In Incendio quoque, et in Tentatione, et in Sepulchris concupiscentiae provocastis Dominum.
verses.english: Even at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah, you again provoked the Lord to anger with your incessant complaints and desires.

verses.latin: Et quando misit vos Dominus de Cadesbarne, dicens: Ascendite, et possidete terram, quam dedi vobis, et noluistis ascendere, sed increduli ad sermonem Domini Dei vestri, et non obedientes jussioni ejus:
verses.english: And when the Lord sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying: 'Go up and take possession of the land which I have given to you,' you refused to go up. Instead, you were disobedient to the command of the Lord your God, showing disbelief in His word.

verses.latin: semper fuistis rebelles a die qua nosse vos cœpi.
verses.english: Indeed, you have been rebellious against the Lord from the very first day I began to know you.

verses.latin: Et jacui ante Dominum quadraginta diebus, et quadraginta noctibus, quibus eum rogabam, ne deleret vos, sicut fuerat comminatus:
verses.english: And so, I lay prostrate before the Lord for forty days and forty nights, during which I continually pleaded with Him not to destroy you, just as He had threatened to do.

verses.latin: et orans, dicebam: Domine Deus, ne disperdas populum tuum, et haereditatem tuam, quam redemisti in magnitudine tua, quos eduxisti de Aegypto in manu forti.
verses.english: And as I prayed, I said: 'O Lord God, do not destroy Your people and Your inheritance, whom You have redeemed by Your magnificent power, and whom You led out of Egypt with a mighty hand.'

verses.latin: Recordare servorum tuorum Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob: ne aspicias duritiam populi hujus, nec impietatem, vel peccatum eorum:
verses.english: 'Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Do not regard the stubbornness of this people, nor their wickedness, nor their sin.'

verses.latin: ne dicant forte habitatores terrae, de qua eduxisti nos: Non poterat Dominus introducere eos in terram, quam eis pollicitus est, et oderat illos: idcirco eduxit in solitudinem, atque interfecit.
verses.english: 'Otherwise, the inhabitants of the land from which You brought us out might say: "Because the Lord was unable to bring them into the land He promised them, and because He hated them, He led them out into the wilderness to kill them."

verses.latin: Qui sunt populus tuus, et haereditas tua, quos eduxisti in fortitudine tua magna, et in brachio tuo extento.
verses.english: 'Yet, they are Your people and Your inheritance, whom You brought out with Your great strength and Your outstretched arm.'

verses.latin: Cumque transissent quadraginta dies, et quadraginta noctes, dedit mihi Dominus duas tabulas lapideas, tabulas pacti.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 11 in the Clementine Vulgate. According to the text, it says: 'And when the forty days and forty nights had passed, the Lord gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.'

verses.latin: Et rursum ait Dominus ad me: Cerno quod populus iste durae cervicis sit.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 13 in the Clementine Vulgate. Following the text: 'And again the Lord said to me: "I perceive that this people is indeed stiff-necked and rebellious."'

verses.latin: Dimitte me, ut conteram eum, et deleam nomen ejus sub caelo, et faciam te gentem multo majorem, et fortiorem, quam haec est.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 14 in the Clementine Vulgate. According to the text: '"Leave Me alone now, that I may utterly crush them and blot out their name from under the entire sky. Then I will make you into a nation far greater and stronger than this one."'

verses.latin: Cumque de monte descendere, ardente et igne, et duas tabulas utriusque manus portarem:
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 15 in the Clementine Vulgate. Translating the given text: 'So I turned and began to descend from the mountain, which was burning with fire, carrying the two tablets in my two hands.'

verses.latin: vidi vos peccasse Domino Deo vestro, et fecisse vobis vitulum conflatilem, ac recessisse velociter de via ejus, quam vobis ostenderat.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 16 in the Clementine Vulgate. The text states: 'And there I saw that you had sinned against the Lord your God, and had made for yourselves a molten calf. You had swiftly departed from His way which He had clearly shown to you.'

verses.latin: Abjeci igitur duas tabulas de manibus meis, confregique eas in conspectu vestro.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 17 in the Clementine Vulgate. Translating directly: 'Therefore, I threw down the two tablets from my hands and shattered them before your very eyes, as a sign of the covenant you had broken.'

verses.latin: Et procidi ante Dominum sicut prius, quadraginta diebus, et quadraginta noctibus, panem non comedens, et aquam non bibens, propter omnem peccatum vestrum, quod peccaveratis contra Dominum, et feceratis malum coram eo, ad provocandam iracundiam illius.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 18 in the Clementine Vulgate. The text is: 'Then I prostrated myself before the Lord, just as before, for forty days and forty nights, neither eating bread nor drinking water, all on account of your great sin—the sin by which you had offended the Lord and done evil in His sight, provoking His burning anger.'

verses.latin: Timui quippe iram, et indignationem illius, qua iratus fuerat vobis, et vos delere voluerat. Et exaudivit me Dominus etiam hac vice.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 19 in the Clementine Vulgate. Following the text: 'For I was terrified by the fierce anger and indignation with which He was enraged against you, and by His desire to utterly destroy you. Yet, the Lord listened to me even on this occasion.'

verses.latin: Adversus Aaron quoque vehementer iratus est, voluitque eum conterere: et pro illo deprecatus sum.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 20 in the Clementine Vulgate. It states: 'The Lord was also exceedingly angry with Aaron, intending to destroy him. And I interceded for Aaron as well.'

verses.latin: Scelus autem vestrum, quod feceratis, id est, vitulum, arsi igne, et comminui in frusta, conspergénsque in pulverem, projeci in torrentem, qui de monte fluebat.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 21 in the Clementine Vulgate. The text reads: 'As for the heinous idol you had made—that calf—I burned it with fire, then ground it into small pieces, pulverizing it into dust. I then scattered this dust into the torrent that flowed down from the mountain.'

verses.latin: In Incendio quoque, et in Tentatione, et in Sepulchris concupiscentiae provocastis Dominum.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 22 in the Clementine Vulgate. Translating: 'Even at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah, you again provoked the Lord to anger with your incessant complaints and desires.'

verses.latin: In tempore illo dixit mihi Dominus: Sculpe tibi duas tabulas lapideas, sicut priores fuerunt, et ascende ad me in montem: faciesque arcam ligneam.
verses.english: At that time, the Lord said to me: "Carve out two tablets of stone for yourself, just like the first ones were, and come up to me on the mountain; and you will also make a wooden ark."

verses.latin: Et scribam in tabulis verba quæ fuerunt in prioribus, quas contrivisti: ponesque eas in arca.
verses.english: "And I will write on these tablets the very same words that were on the first ones, which you broke; and you will place these new tablets in the ark."

verses.latin: Feci igitur arcam de lignis setim: et sculpsi duas tabulas lapideas, sicut priorum similitudinem, et ascendi in montem, habens in manibus.
verses.english: So I made an ark from acacia wood, and I carved out two tablets of stone in the exact likeness of the first ones, and I went up onto the mountain, holding them in my hands.

verses.latin: Scripsitque in tabulis, secundum id quod prius scripserat, decem verba, quæ locutus est Dominus ad vos in monte de medio ignis, quando omnis populus congregatus est: et dedit eas mihi.
verses.english: And He wrote on these tablets, just as He had written before, the ten words—the Ten Commandments—which the Lord had spoken to all of you on the mountain from the midst of the fire when all the people were gathered; and then He gave these tablets to me.

verses.latin: Egoque reversus de monte, deposui tabulas in arcam quam feceram, sicut mihi præceperat Dominus: quæ hactenus illic sunt.
verses.english: And I, having returned from the mountain, placed the tablets in the ark which I had made, just as the Lord had commanded me; and those tablets have remained there in the ark to this very day.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israël castra moverunt ex Beeroth filiorum Jacan in Moserath: ibi Aaron mortuus est, sepultusque. Et sacerdotio functus est Eleazar filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Now the children of Israel moved their camp from Beeroth of the sons of Jaacan to Moserath; it was there that Aaron died and was buried. And Eleazar, his son, served in the priesthood in his place.

verses.latin: Inde profecti de Moserath, venerunt in Gadgad: de Gadgad in Jetebatha, locum aquarum plurimarum.
verses.english: From there, departing from Moserath, they came to Gadgad; and from Gadgad they moved on to Jotbathah, a place known for its many waters.

verses.latin: In illo tempore separavit Dominus tribum Levi, ut portaret arcam fœderis Domini, et staret coram eo in ministerio, ac benediceret in nomine illius usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: At that very time, the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the Lord's covenant, and to stand before Him in dedicated service, and to bless the people in His name, a role that continues even to this present day.

verses.latin: Propterea non habuit Levi partem, neque possessionem cum fratribus suis: quia ipse Dominus possessio ejus est, sicut locutus est ei Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: Therefore, the tribe of Levi has no share or inheritance alongside their brothers, because the Lord Himself is their inheritance and possession, just as the Lord your God spoke to them.

verses.latin: Ego autem steti in monte sicut prius, quadraginta diebus ac noctibus: exaudivitque me Dominus etiam in hac re, et non te perdere voluit.
verses.english: And I, as before, stood on the mountain for forty days and forty nights; and the Lord heard my prayer even concerning this matter, and He did not wish to destroy you.

verses.latin: Dixitque mihi Dominus: Surge, et vade ante populum, ut ingrediantur, et possideant terram, quam juravi patribus eorum ut traderem eis.
verses.english: And the Lord then said to me: "Arise, and go before the people, so that they may enter and take possession of the land which I swore to their fathers I would give to them."

verses.latin: Et nunc, Israël, quid Dominus Deus tuus petit a te, nisi ut timeas Dominum Deum tuum, et ambules in viis ejus, et diligas eum, et servias Domino Deo tuo in toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua,
verses.english: And now, O Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you, but that you fear the Lord your God—meaning, hold Him in reverential awe—and walk in His ways, and love Him, and serve the Lord your God with your whole heart and with your whole soul?

verses.latin: et custodias mandata Domini, et cæremonias ejus, quas ego hodie præcipio tibi, ut bene sit tibi?
verses.english: What He asks is that you keep the commandments of the Lord and His ordinances, which I command you today, so that it may be well with you.

verses.latin: Ecce Domini Dei tui est cælum, et cælum cælorum, terra, et omnia quæ in ea sunt.
verses.english: Behold, the Lord your God owns the entire universe, and the highest heavens beyond our comprehension, the earth, and everything that exists in it.

verses.latin: Et tamen patribus tuis placuit Dominus, et dilexit eos: et elegit semen eorum post eos, id est, vos, de cunctis populis, sicut et hodie comprobatur.
verses.english: Yet, despite His infinite dominion, the Lord took delight in your fathers and loved them; and He chose their descendants after them—that is, all of you—from all the peoples of the earth, just as it is proven even to this very day.

verses.latin: Circumcidite igitur præputium cordis vestri, et cervicem vestram ne induretis amplius:
verses.english: Therefore, spiritually circumcise the foreskin of your heart, meaning, cut away all that is sinful and worldly, and do not stiffen your neck in stubbornness any longer.

verses.latin: quia Dominus Deus vester ipse est Deus deorum, et Dominus dominantium, Deus magnus, et potens, et terribilis, qui personam non accipit, nec munera.
verses.english: Because the Lord your God, He alone is the God of all gods and the Lord of all lords, a great, mighty, and awe-inspiring God, who shows no partiality and takes no bribes.

verses.latin: Facit judicium pupillo et viduæ, amat peregrinum, et dat ei cibum ac vestitum.
verses.english: He executes justice for the orphan and the widow, and He loves the stranger, giving him food and clothing.

verses.latin: Et vos ergo amate peregrinos: quia et ipsi fuistis advenæ in terra Ægypti.
verses.english: Therefore, you also must love strangers, because you yourselves were once strangers in the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Dominum Deum tuum timebis, et illi soli servies: illi adhærebis, jurabisque in nomine illius.
verses.english: You shall fear the Lord your God, and you shall serve Him alone; you shall cling to Him, and you shall swear by His holy name.

verses.latin: Ipse est laus tua, et Deus tuus, qui fecit te omnia hæc magna et terribilia, quæ viderunt oculi tui.
verses.english: He is your praise, and your God, who has done for you all these great and awe-inspiring things that your very eyes have seen.

verses.latin: In septuaginta animabus descenderunt patres tui in Ægyptum: et ecce nunc multiplicavit te Dominus Deus tuus sicut stellas cæli.
verses.english: Your fathers went down to Egypt with only seventy souls, and behold, now the Lord your God has multiplied you until you are as numerous as the stars of the universe.

verses.latin: In tempore illo dixit Dominus ad me: Dola tibi duas tabulas lapideas, sicut priores fuerunt, et ascende ad me in montem: faciesque arcam ligneam.
verses.english: At that time, the Lord said to me: 'Cut for yourself two stone tablets, just like the first ones you broke, and come up to me on the mountain. And then make a wooden ark, a special box to hold these new tablets.'
