verses.latin: Et scribam in tabulis verba quæ fuerunt in prioribus, quas contrivisti, ponesque eas in arca.
verses.english: And I will write on these new tablets the same words that were on the first ones you shattered. Then, you will place these tablets inside the ark you made.

verses.latin: Feci igitur arcam de lignis setim: et dolavi duas tabulas lapideas, sicut priores fuerunt, et ascendi in montem, habens in manibus duas tabulas.
verses.english: So I constructed the ark from acacia wood, and I carved two stone tablets, just like the original ones. Then, I ascended the mountain, carrying these two tablets with me.

verses.latin: Scripsitque in tabulis, juxta id quod prius scripserat, verba decem, quæ locutus est Dominus ad vos in monte de medio ignis, quando concio populi congregata est: et dedit eas mihi.
verses.english: And the Lord wrote on these tablets the ten sacred commands, exactly as He had written them the first time. These were the very words the Lord spoke to you on the mountain, from the heart of the fire, when all the people were gathered. And then He gave them to me.

verses.latin: Descendensque de monte veni ad vos, et posui tabulas in arcam, quam feceram: quæ huc usque ibi sunt, sicut mihi præceperat Dominus.
verses.english: Then, I descended from the mountain and returned to you. I placed the tablets inside the ark that I had made, and they have remained there to this very day, just as the Lord had commanded me.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israël tollentes castra de Beroth filiorum Jacan, venerunt in Moserath, ibi Aaron mortuus est, sepultusque: pro quo sacerdotio functus est Eleazar filius ejus.
verses.english: Now, the sons of Israel moved their camp from Beeroth Bene Jaakan and came to Moserah. It was there that Aaron died and was buried, and his son Eleazar took his place as priest.

verses.latin: Inde profecti de Moserath, venerunt Gadgad: et de Gadgad, in Jetebatha, in terram aquarum atque torrentium.
verses.english: From Moserah, they journeyed to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah, they moved to Jotbathah, a land where there were streams and running water.

verses.latin: Eo tempore separavit Dominus tribum Levi, ut portaret arcam fœderis Domini, et staret coram eo in ministerio, ac benediceret in nomine illius usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: At that particular time, the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi. They were designated to carry the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, to stand before Him in service, and to bless the people in His name, a role they continue to fulfill to this present day.

verses.latin: Propter quod non habuit Levi partem, neque possessionem cum fratribus suis: quia ipse Dominus possessio ejus est, sicut locutus est ei Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: This is why the Levites did not receive a share of the land or an inheritance alongside their fellow tribes. For the Lord Himself is their inheritance and their portion, just as the Lord your God told them.

verses.latin: Ego autem steti in monte, sicut prius, quadraginta diebus ac noctibus: et exaudivit me Dominus etiam in hac parte, ne deleret te.
verses.english: As for me, I stood on the mountain for forty days and forty nights, just as I had done before. And the Lord listened to my pleas even on this occasion, and He chose not to destroy you, the people.

verses.latin: Dixitque mihi: Surge, et vade ante populum, ut ingrediatur, et possideat terram, quam juravi patribus eorum, ut traderem eis.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to me: 'Rise, and lead the people forward, so that they may enter and take possession of the land that I swore to give to their ancestors.'

verses.latin: Et nunc Israël, quid Dominus Deus tuus petit a te, nisi ut timeas Dominum Deum tuum, et ambules in viis ejus, et diligas eum, et servias Domino Deo tuo in toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua:
verses.english: And now, O Israel, what does the Lord your God truly ask of you? Is it not to revere the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways, to love Him, and to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul?

verses.latin: custodiasque mandata Domini, et ceremonias ejus, quas ego hodie præcipio tibi, ut bene sit tibi?
verses.english: What He asks is that you keep the commandments of the Lord and His ceremonies, which I am giving to you today, so that things may go well for you and you may prosper.

verses.latin: Ecce Domini Dei tui est cælum, et cælum cælorum, terra, et omnia quæ in ea sunt.
verses.english: Behold, the Lord your God is the Creator and Owner of the sky, and even the highest heavens, the earth, and everything that exists within it. All belongs to Him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen patribus tuis voluit Dominus copulari, et amavit eos: et elegit semen eorum post eos, id est, vos, de cunctis gentibus, sicut hodie comprobatur.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the Lord desired to bind Himself to your ancestors and He loved them. And He chose their descendants after them—that is, you—from all the nations, as is clearly evident today.

verses.latin: Circumcidite igitur præputium cordis vestri, et cervicem vestram ultra ne induretis:
verses.english: Therefore, circumcise the foreskin of your heart, meaning, cut away all spiritual impurities and harden your neck no longer against God’s will. Do not be stubborn.

verses.latin: quia Dominus Deus vester ipse est Deus deorum, et Dominus dominantium, Deus magnus, et potens, et terribilis, qui personam non accipit, nec munera.
verses.english: For the Lord your God is indeed the God of all lesser gods, and the Lord of all earthly rulers. He is a great, mighty, and awe-inspiring God who shows no partiality and cannot be bribed.

verses.latin: Facit judicium pupillo et viduæ: amat peregrinum, et dat ei cibum ac vestitum.
verses.english: He renders justice for the orphan and the widow. He loves the foreigner and provides him with food and clothing.

verses.latin: Et vos igitur amate peregrinos: quia et ipsi fuistis advenæ in terra Ægypti.
verses.english: So you too must love foreigners, for you yourselves were once foreigners in the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Dominum Deum tuum timebis, et ipsi soli servies: illi adhærebis, jurabisque in nomine illius.
verses.english: You shall revere the Lord your God, and Him alone you shall serve. To Him you shall hold fast, and by His name alone you shall swear your oaths.

verses.latin: Ipse est laus tua, et Deus tuus, qui fecit tecum magna et terribilia hæc, quæ viderunt oculi tui.
verses.english: He is your praise and your God, the one who performed these great and awesome deeds for you, which your own eyes have witnessed.

verses.latin: In septuaginta animabus descenderunt patres tui in Ægyptum: et ecce nunc multiplicavit te Dominus Deus tuus sicut stellas cæli.
verses.english: Your ancestors went down into Egypt with only seventy people. But now, behold, the Lord your God has multiplied you until you are as numerous as the stars in the sky.

verses.latin: Non dabo ultra de hoc in vobis: quia omnia opera vestra sunt facta, et omnes cogitationes vestræ sunt occultæ meæ.
verses.english: I will not give further commandments concerning this among you now, because all your deeds are known to me, and all your thoughts are hidden from no one and known to me.

verses.latin: Non dabo ultra de hoc in vobis: quia omnia opera vestra sunt facta, et omnes cogitationes vestræ sunt occultæ meæ.
verses.english: I will not speak further about this among you, for all your deeds are already accomplished and known, and all your thoughts are known to me and cannot be hidden.

verses.latin: Si quid adversum me machinatus fueris, non dabo tibi ultra de hoc.
verses.english: If you devise any schemes against me, I will no longer tolerate this, and will not grant you any further reprieve.

verses.latin: Dabo vobis de hoc, quæcumque volueritis, si non fueritis adversum me.
verses.english: I will grant you whatever you desire concerning this, provided that you are not against me.

verses.latin: Etsi peccaveritis, dabo vobis de hoc veniam.
verses.english: Even if you sin, I will grant you forgiveness for this.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis pertinaces, et nolueritis audire sermonem meum.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, however, if you are stubborn and refuse to listen to my word.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis idololatræ, et colueritis idola.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are idolaters and worship false idols.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis blasphemi, et juramento falso mentiti fueritis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are blasphemous and lie under false oaths.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis impii, et sanguinem innocentem effuderitis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are impious and shed innocent blood.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis fornicatores, et adulteria commiseritis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are fornicators and commit adultery.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis avari, et pecuniam iniuste acquisiveritis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are greedy and acquire money unjustly.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis superbi, et proximo vestro contempseritis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are proud and despise your neighbor.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis invidi, et de bonis alienis gaudeatis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are envious and rejoice at the misfortunes of others.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis detrahentes, et in secreto proximo vestro noceatis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are slanderers and secretly harm your neighbor.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis iracundi, et in furore proximo vestro injuriam feceritis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are quick to anger and injure your neighbor in your wrath.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis litigiosi, et in contentionibus proximo vestro damnum feceritis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are contentious and cause harm to your neighbor in disputes.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis rebelles, et contra me et contra legem meam surrexeritis.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are rebellious and rise up against me and against my law.

verses.latin: Non dabo vobis de hoc, si fueritis increduli, et non credideritis in me, et in verba mea.
verses.english: I will not grant you this, if you are faithless and do not believe in me and in my words.

verses.latin: Igitur diliges Dominum Deum tuum, et custodies præcepta ejus, et cæremonias, atque judicia et mandata omni tempore.
verses.english: Therefore, you will love the Lord your God, and keep His commandments, His rituals, His judgments, and His instructions at all times.

verses.latin: Cognoscite hodie quæ ignoraverunt filii vestri: quoniam ipsi non viderunt disciplinam Domini Dei vestri, magnalia ejus, et manum robustam, extendumque brachium,
verses.english: Understand today what your children did not know or experience, because they did not see the discipline of the Lord your God. They did not see His great deeds, His mighty hand, and His outstretched arm—

verses.latin: signa et opera quæ fecit in medio Ægypti Pharaoni regi, et omni terræ ejus,
verses.english: —the signs and wonders He performed in the midst of Egypt against Pharaoh, its king, and against all of his land.

verses.latin: et exercitui Ægyptiorum, et equis ac curribus: quomodo operuit aquis maris Rubri, cum vos persequerentur, et deleverit eos Dominus usque in præsentem diem:
verses.english: You also saw what He did to the Egyptian army, their horses, and their chariots: how He covered them with the waters of the Red Sea when they pursued you. The Lord destroyed them, and that destruction continues to this very day.

verses.latin: quæque vobis fecerit in solitudine, donec veniretis ad locum istum:
verses.english: You saw what He did for you in the desert until you came to this very place.

verses.latin: et Dathan atque Abiron filiis Eliab, qui fuit filius Ruben: quos aperto ore suo terra absorbuit cum domibus, et tabernaculis, et universa substantia eorum, quam habebant in medio Israël.
verses.english: And you saw what happened to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, who was the son of Reuben. The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them with their households, their tents, and all their possessions that they had in the midst of Israel.

verses.latin: Oculi vestri viderunt opera Domini magna quæ fecit.
verses.english: Your own eyes have seen all the great works that the Lord performed.

verses.latin: Custodite ergo universa mandata illius, quæ ego hodie præcipio vobis: ut possitis vivere, et multiplicemini, et intrantes possideatis terram, ad quam pergitis,
verses.english: Therefore, keep all His commandments which I command you today, so that you may live, multiply, and go in to possess the land to which you are heading.

verses.latin: multisque diebus moramini in ea, quam sub juramento pollicitus est Dominus patribus vestris, et semini eorum, lacte et melle manantem.
verses.english: And you will live in it for many days—a land that the Lord promised with an oath to your fathers and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.

verses.latin: Terra enim ad quam ingrederis possidendam, non est sicut terra Ægypti, de qua existi, ubi jacta semente, irrogabantur aquæ pedibus tuis, quasi hortus irriguus.
verses.english: For the land you are entering to possess is not like the land of Egypt, from which you came. There, after sowing your seed, you had to irrigate it by foot, like a vegetable garden.

verses.latin: Sed montuosa est et campestris, de cælo expectans pluviam.
verses.english: But this land is mountainous and has plains, and it relies on rain from the sky.

verses.latin: Quam Dominus Deus tuus semper invisit, et oculi ejus in ea sunt a principio anni usque ad finem ejus.
verses.english: The Lord your God always watches over it, and His eyes are upon it from the beginning of the year to its end.

verses.latin: Si ergo obedieritis mandatis meis, quæ ego hodie præcipio vobis, ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum, et serviatis ei in toto corde vestro, et in tota anima vestra:
verses.english: Therefore, if you obey My commandments which I command you today—that you love the Lord your God and serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul—

verses.latin: dabo pluviam terræ vestræ temporaneam et serotinam, ut colligatis frumentum, et vinum, et oleum.
verses.english: —then I will give rain to your land at its proper time, both the early and the late rains, so that you may gather your grain, your wine, and your oil.

verses.latin: Daboque fœnum in agris vestris pecudibus, ut comedatis et saturemini.
verses.english: I will also provide grass in your fields for your livestock, so that you may eat and be satisfied.

verses.latin: Cavete ne forte decipiatur cor vestrum, et avertamini a Domino, et serviatis diis alienis, et adoretis eos:
verses.english: Be careful, lest your heart be deceived, and you turn away from the Lord to serve foreign gods and worship them.

verses.latin: et irascatur Dominus super vos, et claudat cælum, ut pluviæ non descendant, et terra non tribuat germen suum, et pereatis velociter de terra optima, quam Dominus daturus est vobis.
verses.english: Otherwise, the Lord will be angry with you and shut up the sky, so that no rain will fall, and the earth will not yield its produce. Then you will quickly perish from the excellent land that the Lord is giving you.

verses.latin: Ponite hæc verba mea in cordibus et in animis vestris, et suspendite ea pro signo in manibus vestris, et inter oculos vestros reponite.
verses.english: Therefore, lay these words of mine in your hearts and in your souls. Tie them as a sign on your hands and place them between your eyes as a reminder.

verses.latin: Docete filios vestros ut meditentur ea, cum sederis in domo tua, et ambulaveris in via, et dormieris atque surrexeris.
verses.english: Teach them to your children, that they may meditate on them when you sit in your house, when you walk on the road, when you lie down, and when you rise up.

verses.latin: Scribes quoque ea in postibus et januis domus tuæ:
verses.english: You shall also write them on the doorposts and gates of your house.

verses.latin: ut multiplicentur dies tui, et dierum filiorum tuorum in terra, quam juravit Dominus patribus vestris, ut daret eis, quamdiu cælum imminet terræ.
verses.english: Do this so that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied in the land that the Lord swore to your fathers to give them, for as long as the sky stretches over the earth.

verses.latin: Si enim custodieritis mandata hæc, quæ ego præcipio vobis, et feceritis ea, ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum, et ambuletis in omnibus viis ejus, adhærentes ei,
verses.english: For if you carefully keep all these commandments that I am giving you today, and carry them out, so that you love the Lord your God, and walk in all His ways, and cling to Him—

verses.latin: auferet Dominus omnes gentes istas ante faciem vestram, et possidebitis illas, quæ majores et fortiores vobis sunt.
verses.english: —then the Lord will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess them, even those nations that are larger and stronger than you.

verses.latin: Omnis locus, quem calcaverit pes vester, vester erit: a deserto et Libano, ab Euphrate flumine usque ad mare occidentale erunt termini vestri.
verses.english: Every place that your foot steps upon will be yours. Your territory will extend from the desert and Lebanon, from the River Euphrates to the western sea.

verses.latin: Nullus stabit contra vos: terrorem vestrum, et formidinem dabit Dominus Deus vester super omnem terram, quam calcaturi estis, sicut locutus est vobis.
verses.english: No one will be able to stand against you. The Lord your God will put the dread and fear of you upon all the land that you are about to tread upon, just as He promised you.

verses.latin: Ecce propono in conspectu vestro hodie benedictionem et maledictionem:
verses.english: See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse.

verses.latin: benedictionem, si obedieritis mandatis Domini Dei vestri, quæ ego hodie præcipio vobis:
verses.english: The blessing will come if you obey the commandments of the Lord your God, which I am giving you today.

verses.latin: maledictionem autem, si non obedieritis mandatis Domini Dei vestri, sed recesseritis de via, quam ego nunc ostendo vobis, et ambulaveritis post deos alienos, quos ignoratis.
verses.english: The curse will come if you do not obey the commandments of the Lord your God, but turn aside from the way that I am showing you today, and follow other gods whom you have not known.

verses.latin: Cumque introduxerit te Dominus Deus tuus in terram, ad quam pergis possidendam, pones benedictionem super montem Garizim, et maledictionem super montem Hebal:
verses.english: When the Lord your God brings you into the land that you are going to possess, you shall set the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.

verses.latin: qui sunt trans Jordanem, contra viam quæ vergit ad solis occasum, in terra Chananæi, qui habitat in campestribus contra Galgalam, quæ est juxta vallem Moere consurgens ex adverso.
verses.english: These mountains are across the Jordan, along the road that leads toward the sunset, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the plains opposite Gilgal, near the valley of Moreh which rises from the opposite side.

verses.latin: Vos enim transibitis Jordanem, ut possideatis terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis, ut teneatis eam, et habitetis in illa.
verses.english: For you are about to cross the Jordan to take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving you. You will hold it and live in it.

verses.latin: Videte ergo ut impleatis universas cæremonias atque judicia, quæ ego hodie ponam in conspectu vestro.
verses.english: Therefore, be careful to diligently observe all the rituals and judgments that I am setting before you today.

verses.latin: Ama ergo Dominum Deum tuum, et observa mandata ejus et cærimonias, atque judicia et præcepta, omni tempore.
verses.english: Therefore, you must love the Lord your God. You must also keep His commands, rituals, ordinances, and statutes at all times.

verses.latin: Cognoscite hodie, quia non ad filios vestros loquor, qui nescierunt, et non viderunt disciplinam Domini Dei vestri: magnalia ejus et fortem manum, et extentum brachium,
verses.english: Understand this today: I am not speaking to your children, who have not known and have not seen the instruction of the Lord your God. They did not see His great deeds, His strong hand, and His outstretched arm.

verses.latin: miracula et opera quæ fecit in medio Ægypti Pharaoni regi, et omni terræ ejus,
verses.english: They did not see the miracles and works He performed in the midst of Egypt against Pharaoh the king, and against all of his land.

verses.latin: et exercitui Ægyptiorum, et equis ac curribus eorum: quomodo operuerint aquæ maris Rubri illud, cum vos persequerentur, et deleverit eos Dominus usque in præsentem diem:
verses.english: They did not see what He did to the army of the Egyptians, to their horses and chariots. They did not see how the waters of the Red Sea covered them when they were pursuing you, and how the Lord utterly destroyed them, even to this present day.

verses.latin: et quæ fecerit vobis in solitudine, donec veniretis ad locum istum:
verses.english: They did not see what He did for you in the wilderness, until you came to this place.

verses.latin: et Dathan et Abiram, filiis Eliab, qui fuit filius Ruben: quomodo aperiens terra os suum devoraverit illos cum tabernaculis suis et universa substantia eorum, quam habebant in medio Israël.
verses.english: They did not see what happened to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, who was the son of Reuben. They did not see how the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, along with their tents and all their possessions which they had in the midst of Israel.

verses.latin: Vestri quippe oculi viderunt opera Domini magna quæ fecit.
verses.english: Indeed, your very own eyes have seen all the great works of the Lord which He performed.

verses.latin: Custodite ergo universa mandata quæ ego hodie præcipio vobis, ut possitis vivere, et multiplicemini, et intrantes possideatis terram, ad quam pergitis.
verses.english: Therefore, keep all the commands that I am giving you today, so that you may live and multiply. You will then enter and possess the land to which you are going.

verses.latin: Et dierum numero esse longævi super terram, propter quam juravit Dominus patribus vestris, et semini eorum, ut daret eis terram lacte et melle manantem.
verses.english: This is so you may live long lives in the land that the Lord swore to your fathers and to their descendants to give them—a land flowing with milk and honey.

verses.latin: Terra enim, ad quam ingrederis possidendam, non est sicut terra Ægypti, de qua existis, ubi jacta semente, aridam rigabat pede tuo quasi hortum irriguum.
verses.english: For the land you are entering to possess is not like the land of Egypt, from which you came. In Egypt, you sowed your seed and watered the dry ground with your foot, like a garden that is irrigated by hand or foot-powered pumps.

verses.latin: Sed montuosa et campestris, de cælo expectans pluvias.
verses.english: But this land is mountainous and has level plains, and it relies on rain from the sky.

verses.latin: Quam Dominus Deus tuus semper invisit, et oculi ejus in ea sunt a principio anni usque ad finem ejus.
verses.english: The Lord your God always watches over this land. His eyes are upon it from the beginning of the year to its very end.

verses.latin: Si ergo obedieritis mandatis meis, quæ ego hodie præcipio vobis, ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum, et serviatis ei in toto corde vestro et in tota anima vestra:
verses.english: Therefore, if you obey my commands that I am giving you today, so that you love the Lord your God and serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul,

verses.latin: dabo pluviæ terræ vestræ temporaneam et serotinam, ut colligatis frumentum, et vinum, et oleum.
verses.english: then I will give rain to your land at its proper time—the early rain and the latter rain. This is so you may gather your grain, your wine, and your oil.

verses.latin: Et pœnis ad fœnum in agris vestris, ut comedant jumenta vestra, et ipsi saturemini.
verses.english: I will also provide green pasture in your fields, so that your livestock may eat and you yourselves may be satisfied.

verses.latin: Cavete ne forte decipiatur cor vestrum, et recedatis a Domino, et serviatis diis alienis, et adoretis eos:
verses.english: Beware lest your heart be deceived and you turn away from the Lord. Do not serve foreign gods and worship them.

verses.latin: et irascatur Dominus furor suus contra vos, et claudat cælum, ut pluviæ non descendant, et terra non reddat fructum suum, et pereatis velociter de terra optima, quam Dominus daturus est vobis.
verses.english: Otherwise, the Lord's anger will burn against you. He will close the sky so that no rain comes down, and the land will not yield its fruit. You will quickly perish from the excellent land which the Lord is about to give you.

verses.latin: Ponite hæc verba mea in cordibus et in animis vestris, et suspendite ea pro signo in manibus vestris, et inter oculos vestros reponite.
verses.english: Therefore, place these words of mine in your hearts and in your souls. Tie them as a sign on your hands for a constant reminder, and place them between your eyes as a visible token.

verses.latin: Docete filios vestros ut meditentur semper, quando sedetis in domo vestra, et ambulatis in via, et concumbitis atque consurgitis.
verses.english: Teach them to your children, so that they may always ponder these words. Speak of them when you sit in your house, when you walk on the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up.

verses.latin: Scribe quoque illa in postibus et in foribus domus tuæ:
verses.english: Also, write them on the doorposts and on the gates of your house.

verses.latin: ut multiplicentur dies tui et filiorum tuorum in terra, quam juravit Dominus patribus vestris ut daret eis, quamdiu cælum imminet terræ.
verses.english: This is so that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied in the land which the Lord swore to your fathers to give them, as long as the sky hangs over the earth—which means forever.

verses.latin: Si enim custodieritis mandata hæc, quæ ego præcipio vobis, et feceritis ea, ut diligatis Dominum Deum vestrum, et ambuletis in omnibus viis ejus, adhærentes ei:
verses.english: For if you keep these commands that I am giving you and perform them, so that you love the Lord your God and walk in all His ways, holding fast to Him,

verses.latin: auferet Dominus omnes gentes istas ante faciem vestram, et possidebitis eas, multo majores et fortiores vobis.
verses.english: then the Lord will drive out all these nations before your presence. You will possess them, even though they are much greater and stronger than you.

verses.latin: Omnis locus, quem calcaverit pes vester, vester erit: a deserto et Libano, a flumine magno Euphrate, usque ad mare occidentale erunt termini vestri.
verses.english: Every place that your foot treads upon will be yours. Your boundaries will extend from the wilderness and Lebanon, from the great river Euphrates, even to the western sea—the Mediterranean.

verses.latin: Nullus stabit contra vos: terrorem vestrum et formidinem dabit Dominus Deus vester super omnem terram, quam calcaturi estis, sicut locutus est vobis.
verses.english: No one will be able to stand against you. The Lord your God will put the dread and fear of you upon all the land that you are about to tread upon, just as He promised you.

verses.latin: Propono in conspectu vestro hodie benedictionem et maledictionem:
verses.english: I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse.

verses.latin: benedictionem, si obedieritis mandatis Domini Dei vestri, quæ ego hodie præcipio vobis:
verses.english: A blessing, if you obey the commands of the Lord your God that I am giving you today.

verses.latin: maledictionem autem, si non obedieritis mandatis Domini Dei vestri, sed recesseritis de via, quam ego nunc ostendo vobis, et ambulaveritis post deos alienos, quos ignoratis.
verses.english: But a curse, if you do not obey the commands of the Lord your God, and instead turn aside from the way that I am now showing you. This curse will come if you walk after foreign gods whom you do not know.

verses.latin: Cum introieris itaque terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi, pones benedictionem super montem Garizim, maledictionem super montem Hebal:
verses.english: Therefore, when you enter the land that the Lord your God is about to give you, you shall pronounce the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.

verses.latin: Qui sunt trans Jordanem, post viam quæ vergit ad solis occubitum, in terra Chananæi, qui habitat in campestribus contra Galgalam, quæ est juxta vallem tendentem et intrantem procul.
verses.english: These mountains are beyond the Jordan, following the road that leads westward, in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the plains opposite Gilgal. This Gilgal is near the valley that extends far inward.

verses.latin: Vos enim transibitis Jordanem, ut possideatis terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis, et teneatis eam.
verses.english: For you are about to cross the Jordan to possess the land that the Lord your God is giving you, and you will hold it.

verses.latin: Observate et implete omnes cærimonias atque judicia, quæ ego hodie propono in conspectu vestro.
verses.english: Therefore, observe and fulfill all the rituals and ordinances that I am setting before you today.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt præcepta et cæremoniæ atque judicia, quæ facere debetis in terra, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum daturus est vobis ut possidendam: omnibus diebus, quibus super terram gradientes estis.
verses.english:
These are the commandments, the regulations, and the rulings
which you must carefully observe in the land that the Lord God of your fathers is about to give you to possess—
for as long as you live on that land.

verses.latin: Subvertite omnia loca, in quibus coluerunt gentes, quas possessuri estis, deos suos super montes excelsos, et colles, et sub omni ligno frondoso.
verses.english:
You must completely demolish every place where the nations you are about to dispossess have worshipped their false gods—
whether on high mountains, or on hills, or under every lush, leafy tree.

verses.latin: Dissipate aras eorum, et confringite statuas: lucos succidite, et simulacra comburite igni: et nomina illorum de locis illis auferte.
verses.english:
You must tear down their altars, and shatter their sacred statues.
Cut down their groves of false worship, and burn their idols with fire.
And completely erase the names of those gods from those places.

verses.latin: Non facietis ita Domino Deo vestro:
verses.english: You must not worship the Lord your God in that manner.

verses.latin: sed ad locum, quem elegerit Dominus Deus vester de cunctis tribubus vestris, ut ponat nomen suum ibi, et commoretur: illuc venietis,
verses.english:
Instead, you must go to the specific place that the Lord your God chooses from all your tribes
to establish His name there and to make His dwelling permanent—
that is the only place you must go to worship Him.

verses.latin: et offeretis in illo holocausta et victimas vestras, decimas et primitias manuum vestrarum, et vota atque donaria, primogenita boum et ovium.
verses.english:
And in that place alone, you are to offer your burnt offerings and your sacrificial victims,
your tithes and the firstfruits of your labor,
your vowed offerings and your freewill offerings,
along with the firstborn of your cattle and your sheep.

verses.latin: Et comedetis ibi in conspectu Domini Dei vestri, atque lætabimini in cunctis quæcumque feceritis, vos et domus vestræ, in quibus benedixerit vobis Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english:
And there, in the presence of the Lord your God, you are to eat your sacred meals and rejoice
in everything you have accomplished, you and your households,
for the Lord your God has blessed you in all these things.

verses.latin: Non facietis ibi quæ nos hodie hic facimus, unusquisque quod sibi rectum videtur:
verses.english:
You must not continue to do there—in the Promised Land—what we do here today in the wilderness,
where everyone does what seems right in his own eyes.

verses.latin: neque enim usque in præsens tempus venistis ad requiem, et possessionem, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis.
verses.english:
For up until this present time, you have not yet reached the place of rest
and the possession that the Lord your God is about to give you.

verses.latin: Transibitis Jordanem, et habitabitis in terra, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis, ut requiescamini a cunctis inimicis vestris per circuitum: et absque ullo timore habitabitis in ea.
verses.english:
You will cross the Jordan River and settle in the land that the Lord your God is about to give you,
so that you may be at rest from all your enemies on every side.
Then you will live in that land without any fear.

verses.latin: Et erit locus, quem elegerit Dominus Deus vester, ut in eo nomen ejus resideat, illuc omnia quæ præcipio vobis, afferetis: holocausta, et hostias, et decimas, et primitias manuum vestrarum, et quicquid ex voto reddideritis Domino.
verses.english:
And there will be one specific place that the Lord your God will choose for His name to dwell permanently.
To that one place alone, you must bring everything I command you:
your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the firstfruits of your labor,
and whatever you have vowed to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et epulabimini ibi coram Domino Deo vestro, vos et filii vestri et filiæ, servi et ancillæ, atque Levitæ, qui morantur in urbibus vestris: quoniam non habent aliam partem et possessionem vobiscum.
verses.english:
And you are to feast there before the Lord your God, you and your sons and daughters,
your male and female servants, and the Levites who live in your towns,
because the Levites have no other allotted portion or possession with you.

verses.latin: Cave ne offeras holocausta tua in omni loco quem videris:
verses.english: Be careful not to offer your burnt offerings in just any place you see fit.

verses.latin: sed in loco quem elegerit Dominus in una tribuum tuarum, offeres oblationes tuas, et facies omnia quæ præcipio tibi.
verses.english:
Instead, you must offer your oblations only in the place that the Lord chooses in one of your tribes,
and there you must do everything I command you today.

verses.latin: Verumtamen, si esurire te videris, et carnes comedere volueris, juxta desiderium animæ tuæ comedas, exceptis his quæ immolantur Domino, et quas in urbibus tuis comedere tibi licet.
verses.english:
However, if you find yourself hungry and wish to eat meat, you may eat as much as your soul desires,
in all your towns, except for those animals that are offered as sacrifices to the Lord—these you are permitted to eat.

verses.latin: Tantum sanguinem non comedetis, sed effundetis super terram quasi aquam.
verses.english: Only, you must not consume the blood. Instead, you must pour it out on the ground like water.

verses.latin: Non poteris comedere in oppidis tuis decimam frumenti, et vini, et olei tui, et primogenita armentorum et ovium, et quicquid voveris, et sponte obtuleris, et primitias manuum tuarum.
verses.english:
You will not be allowed to eat in your own towns the tithe of your grain, wine, and oil,
nor the firstborn of your herds and flocks, nor anything you have vowed as an offering,
nor any freewill offering, nor the firstfruits of your labor.

verses.latin: Sed coram Domino Deo tuo comedes ea in loco, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, tu et filius tuus ac filia, et servus famulaque, et Levites qui habitat in urbibus tuis: et lætaberis et reficieris coram Domino Deo tuo in cunctis operibus manuum tuarum.
verses.english:
Instead, you must eat these things before the Lord your God
in the place that the Lord your God chooses—you and your son and daughter, your male and female servant,
and the Levite who lives in your towns.
And you will rejoice and be refreshed before the Lord your God in all the work of your hands.

verses.latin: Cave ne derelinquas Levitam in omni tempore, quo peregrinaris in terra tua.
verses.english: Be careful not to neglect the Levite throughout all the time you are living as a sojourner in your land.

verses.latin: Cum dilataverit Dominus Deus tuus terminos tuos, sicut locutus est tibi, et volueris vesci carnibus, quas desiderat anima tua:
verses.english:
When the Lord your God enlarges your territory, just as He has promised you,
and you desire to eat meat, because your soul longs for it,

verses.latin: et fuerit procul locus, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut ponat nomen suum ibi, mactabis de armentis et ovibus tuis, quas Dominus dederit tibi, sicut præcepi tibi: et comedes in urbibus tuis juxta omne desiderium animæ tuæ.
verses.english:
and if the chosen place, where the Lord your God has placed His name, is too far away for you to bring your sacrifices to,
then you may slaughter any of your cattle or sheep that the Lord has given you, just as I have commanded you.
And you may eat the meat in your own towns, according to all that your soul desires.

verses.latin: Sicut comeditur caprea et cervus, ita vesceris eis: tam mundus quam immundus pariter comedent.
verses.english:
You may eat it just as you would eat a gazelle or a deer; anyone, whether ritually clean or unclean,
may eat it together, freely.

verses.latin: Hoc solum cave, ne sanguinem comedas: sanguis enim eorum pro anima est, et idcirco non debes animam comedere carnis.
verses.english:
Only be very careful not to eat the blood; for the blood is their life itself.
And for that reason, you must not consume the life of the meat.

verses.latin: Sed super terram fundes in modum aquæ.
verses.english: Instead, you must pour it out on the ground like water.

verses.latin: Ut si feceris quod non placet Domino, et quod malum est coram eo, bene sit tibi et filiis tuis post te.
verses.english:
If you do what is displeasing to the Lord, and what is evil in His sight,
it will go well for you and for your children after you.

verses.latin: Hæc ergo quæ sanctificaveris et voveris Domino, tollet Cœtus tuus, et venies in locum, quem elegerit Dominus.
verses.english:
Therefore, the holy things that you have consecrated and vowed to the Lord,
your assembly must take up, and you must come to the place that the Lord chooses.

verses.latin: Et offeres holocausta tua carnem et sanguinem super altare Domini Dei tui: hostiarum vero carnes inmolabuntur, et sanguis super altare effundetur.
verses.english:
And you are to offer your burnt offerings, both the meat and the blood, on the altar of the Lord your God.
As for the meat of your other sacrifices, it shall be slaughtered,
and its blood will be poured out upon the altar.

verses.latin: Observa et audi omnia quæ ego præcipio tibi, ut bene sit tibi et filiis tuis post te usque in sempiternum, cum feceris quod bonum est et placitum est in conspectu Domini Dei tui.
verses.english:
Observe and obey all these things that I command you today,
so that it may go well for you and for your children after you forever,
when you do what is good and pleasing in the sight of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Quando succiderit Dominus Deus tuus nationes, ad quas ingredieris, ut possideas eas, et deleveris illas, et habitaveris in terra earum:
verses.english:
When the Lord your God cuts off the nations before you, whom you are going in to dispossess,
and you have driven them out and settled in their land,

verses.latin: cave ne imiteris ritus earum, postquam fuerint delete in conspectu tuo: ne requiras, quomodo coluerunt deos suos, dicens: Et ego similiter faciam.
verses.english:
be careful that you are not ensnared by their ways, after they have been destroyed from before you.
Do not inquire about how they worshipped their gods, saying to yourself, 'I will do the same.'

verses.latin: Non facies ita Domino Deo tuo: omnes enim abominationes, quas aversatur Dominus, fecerunt diis suis, offerentes filios et filias suas et comburentes igni.
verses.english:
You must not act in that manner toward the Lord your God.
For they have committed against their gods all the abominable practices that the Lord detests,
even burning their own sons and daughters in the fire as offerings.

verses.latin: Quod ego præcipio tibi, hoc tantum facito Domino: nec addas quidquam, nec minuas.
verses.english:
Everything that I command you, that alone you must do for the Lord your God.
You must not add anything to it, nor take anything away from it.

verses.latin: Haec sunt praecepta, et judicia, quae facere debetis in terra, quam Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum daturus est vobis, ut possideatis eam omnibus diebus, quibus super terram vivere potueritis.
verses.english: These are the commands and the judgments that you must obey in the land that the Lord God of your ancestors is about to give you. You are to possess this land and live upon it for as long as you are able.

verses.latin: Subvertite omnia loca, in quibus coluerunt gentes, quas possessuri estis, deos suos super montes excelsos, et colles, et sub omni ligno frondoso.
verses.english: You must completely destroy all the places where the nations you are about to dispossess have worshipped their gods: on the highest mountains, on the hills, and under every leafy tree.

verses.latin: Diruite aras eorum, et confringite statuas, lucosque succidite, et sculptilia comburite igni: et perdetis nomina eorum de locis illis.
verses.english: Tear down their altars, smash their idols, cut down their sacred groves, and burn their carved images with fire. You must erase the very names of their gods from those places.

verses.latin: Non facietis ita Domino Deo vestro:
verses.english: You must not do anything like this to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: sed ad locum, quem elegerit Dominus Deus vester de cunctis tribubus vestris, ut ponat nomen suum ibi, et habitet: illuc venietis,
verses.english: Instead, you must come to the specific place that the Lord your God will choose out of all your tribes, to establish His Name there and to dwell there.

verses.latin: et offeretis holocausta et victimas vestras, decimas et primitias manuum vestrarum, et vota atque donaria, primogenita boum et ovium vestrarum.
verses.english: There, you are to offer your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the firstfruits of your labor, your vowed offerings and your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your cattle and your sheep.

verses.latin: Et comedetis ibi in conspectu Domini Dei vestri, et laetamini in cunctis, ad quae tetigerit manus vestra, vos et familiae vestrae: in quibus benedixit vobis Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: And you will eat there in the presence of the Lord your God, and you will rejoice with all that you have accomplished, you and your households, for all the ways in which the Lord your God has blessed you.

verses.latin: Non facietis ibi quae nos hodie hic facimus, unusquisque quod sibi rectum videtur.
verses.english: You must not do there what we do here today, where each person does whatever seems right in their own eyes.

verses.latin: Non enim usque in praesens tempus venistis ad requiem, et possessionem, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis.
verses.english: For up to the present time, you have not yet come to the rest and the possession of the land that the Lord your God is about to give you.

verses.latin: Transibitis Jordanem, et habitabitis in terra, quam vobis Dominus Deus vester daturus est, ut requiescatis a cunctis hostibus vestris per circuitum: et absque ullo timore habitetis,
verses.english: You will cross the Jordan River and dwell in the land that the Lord your God is about to give you, so that you may find rest from all your enemies on every side and live without any fear.

verses.latin: in loco, quem elegerit Dominus Deus vester, ut sit nomen ejus ibi: illuc omnia quae praecipio vobis, afferetis, holocausta et hostias, et decimas, et primitias manuum vestrarum, et quicquid ex voto reddidistis Domino.
verses.english: In the place that the Lord your God will choose to establish His Name there, you are to bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the firstfruits of your labor, and whatever you have vowed to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et epulabimini coram Domino Deo vestro, vos et filii vestri, et filiae, et servi, et ancillae, et Levites qui intra portas vestras est: quia non habet partem, nec possessionem vobiscum.
verses.english: And you will feast there before the Lord your God, you and your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, and the Levite who lives within your gates, because he has no portion or inheritance with you.

verses.latin: Cave ne offeras holocausta tua in omni loco, quem videris:
verses.english: Be careful not to offer your burnt offerings in every place you might see.

verses.latin: sed in loco, quem elegerit Dominus in una de tribubus tuis, offeres holocausta tua, et facies omnia quae praecipio tibi.
verses.english: But only in the place that the Lord will choose in one of your tribes are you to offer your burnt offerings, and there you must do all that I command you.

verses.latin: Verumtamen et in omni civitate tua occidere potes, et vesci carnibus juxta omne desiderium animae tuae, quam benedictionem Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi, tam mundum, quam immundum: et comedetis quasi capream, aut cervum.
verses.english: Nevertheless, in every city you may slaughter and eat meat according to all the desire of your soul, from whatever the Lord your God has blessed you with, whether it is ritually clean or ritually unclean. You may eat it as you would a gazelle or a deer.

verses.latin: Absque sanguine tantum ne comedatis: sed effundetis id super terram quasi aquam.
verses.english: Only do not eat the blood; instead, you must pour it out upon the ground like water.

verses.latin: Non poteris comedere in oppidis tuis decimam frumenti, et vini, et olei tui, nec primogenita armentorum et ovium tuarum, nec vota quae vovisti, et sponte oblata, et primitias manuum tuarum:
verses.english: You will not be permitted to eat in your towns the tithe of your grain, or your wine, or your oil, nor the firstborn of your herds and your flocks, nor any of the offerings you have vowed, or your freewill offerings, or the firstfruits of your labor.

verses.latin: sed comedes ea coram Domino Deo tuo in loco, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, tu, et filius tuus, et filia tua, et servus, et ancilla, et Levites qui manet in urbibus tuis: et laetaberis, atque reficieris coram Domino Deo tuo in cunctis, ad quae extenderis manum tuam.
verses.english: Instead, you must eat them before the Lord your God in the place that the Lord your God will choose: you, and your son, and your daughter, your male and female servants, and the Levite who dwells in your cities. And you will rejoice and be refreshed before the Lord your God in all that you accomplish.

verses.latin: Cave ne derelinquas Levitem in omni tempore, quo peregrinaris in terra tua.
verses.english: Be careful not to neglect the Levite at any time while you are dwelling in your land.

verses.latin: Quando dilataverit Dominus Deus tuus terminos tuos, sicut locutus est tibi, et volueris vesci carnibus, quas desiderat anima tua, habebisque potestatem occidendi et comedendi juxta benedictionem Domini Dei tui, et omni desiderio animae tuae:
verses.english: When the Lord your God expands your territory, just as He promised you, and you desire to eat meat—whatever your soul longs for—you will then have the permission to slaughter and eat it according to the blessing of the Lord your God, and according to every desire of your soul.

verses.latin: si longe fuerit locus, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut ponat nomen suum ibi, mactabis de armentis et ovibus tuis, quas Dominus dederit tibi, sicut praecepi tibi, et comedes in civitatibus tuis, juxta omne desiderium animae tuae.
verses.english: If the place that the Lord your God has chosen to establish His Name there is too far away, you may slaughter from your herds and your flocks, which the Lord has given you, just as I have commanded you. You may eat it in your own cities, according to every desire of your soul.

verses.latin: Sicut comeditur caprea et cervus, sic comedetis ex eis: tam mundum, quam immundum, pariter vescentur.
verses.english: You may eat from them just as you would eat a gazelle or a deer: both the ritually clean and the ritually unclean alike may partake.

verses.latin: Hoc solum cave ne sanguinem comedas: sanguis enim eorum pro anima est, et idcirco animam cum carne non comedes.
verses.english: Only be careful not to eat the blood, for the blood is their life, and therefore you must not eat the life with the meat.

verses.latin: Non comedes illud, sed effundes in terram quasi aquam:
verses.english: You must not eat it, but you are to pour it out on the ground like water.

verses.latin: ne comedas, ut bene sit tibi et filiis tuis post te, cum feceris quod placitum est coram Domino.
verses.english: You must not eat it, so that it may go well with you and with your children after you, when you do what is pleasing before the Lord.

verses.latin: Quae voveris, et sponte obtuleris Domino, tolles, et venies in locum, quem elegerit Dominus:
verses.english: But your vowed offerings and your freewill offerings that you have made to the Lord, you must take and bring to the place that the Lord will choose.

verses.latin: et offeres holocausta tua, carnem et sanguinem super altare Domini Dei tui: sanguinem hostiarum fundes ad aram, et carnes ipsas superpones.
verses.english: There you will offer your burnt offerings—both the meat and the blood—upon the altar of the Lord your God. You will pour the blood of the sacrifices at the base of the altar, and lay the meat itself upon the altar.

verses.latin: Observa, et audi omnia quae ego praecipio tibi, ut bene sit tibi et filiis tuis post te in sempiternum, cum feceris quod bonum est et placitum in conspectu Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: Be diligent to observe and listen to all that I command you, so that it may always go well with you and with your children after you, when you do what is good and pleasing in the sight of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Quando disperderit Dominus Deus tuus ante faciem tuam gentes, ad quas ingredieris, ut possideas eas, et deleveris eas, atque habitaveris in terra illorum:
verses.english: When the Lord your God has destroyed before you the nations into whose land you are going to possess, and you have driven them out and settled in their land,

verses.latin: cave ne imiteris ritus earum, postquam fuerint dissipatae in conspectu tuo, et requiras quomodo coluerint deos suos, dicens: Sicut coluerunt gentes istae deos suos, ita et ego colam.
verses.english: Be careful not to imitate their customs after they have been scattered before you. Do not even inquire how they worshipped their gods, saying to yourself, 'Just as these nations worshipped their gods, so will I worship them too.'

verses.latin: Non facies ita Domino Deo tuo: omnes enim abominationes, quas aversatur Dominus, fecerunt diis suis, offerentes filios et filias suas, et exurentes igni.
verses.english: You must not act in this way towards the Lord your God, for they have done to their gods all the abominable practices that the Lord detests, even offering their sons and daughters and burning them with fire.

verses.latin: (31) Omne quod praecipio tibi, hoc tantum facies Domino: nec addes, nec minues.
verses.english: Everything that I command you, this alone you must do for the Lord your God. You must neither add to it nor take away from it.

verses.latin: Si surrexerit in medio tui propheta, aut qui somnium viderit, et prædixerit tibi signum atque portentum,
verses.english: If a prophet, or someone who sees visions or has dreams, arises among you and declares a sign or a wonder to you,

verses.latin: et evenerit quod locutus est, et dixerit: Eamus, et sequamur deos alienos, quos ignoras, et serviamus eis:
verses.english: and what he said actually happens, and then he says to you, "Let us go and follow other gods, gods you do not know, and let us serve them,"

verses.latin: non audies verba prophetæ illius, aut somniatoris, quia tentat vos Dominus Deus vester, ut palam fiat utrum diligatis Eum ex omni corde vestro, et ex omni anima vestra, an non.
verses.english: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer. For the Lord your God is testing you, so that it may be clearly seen whether you love Him with all your heart and with all your soul, or not.

verses.latin: Dominum Deum vestrum sequimini, et ipsum timete, et mandata Ejus custodite, et vocem Ejus audite, et ipsi servite, et ipsi adhærete.
verses.english: You must follow the Lord your God, and you must revere Him, and keep His commands. Listen to His voice, serve Him, and hold fast to Him.

verses.latin: Prophetam autem illum, aut somniatorem, occidetis: quia locutus est ut vos averteret a Domino Deo vestro, Qui eduxit vos de terra Ægypti, et redemit de domo servitutis: ut impellat te de via, quam præcepit tibi Dominus Deus tuus, et audire non sinat. Auferes malum de medio tui.
verses.english: But that prophet or dreamer, you must put him to death. Because he spoke words to turn you away from the Lord your God, Who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of slavery. He sought to drive you from the way the Lord your God commanded you, and he would not let you hear God's commands. You must remove this evil from your midst.

verses.latin: Si tentaverit te frater tuus, filius matris tuæ, aut filius tuus, vel filia, aut uxor quæ est in sinu tuo, aut amicus quem diligis ut animam tuam, clam dicens: Eamus, et serviamus diis alienis, quos ignoras tu, et patres tui,
verses.english: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son, or your daughter, or the wife who shares your bed, or your friend whom you love as your own soul, secretly tries to persuade you, saying, "Let us go and serve other gods," gods whom neither you nor your fathers have known—

verses.latin: deorum qui in circuitu vestro sunt, sive prope, sive longe, de uno fine terræ usque ad alterum,
verses.english: gods of the peoples who are around you, whether they are near or far, from one end of the earth to the other—

verses.latin: non acquiescas ei, nec audias, nec parcat ei oculus tuus, ut miserearis et occultes.
verses.english: you must not agree with him, nor listen to him. Your eye must not show pity for him, you must not spare him, and you must not hide his sin.

verses.latin: Sed statim interficies. Sit primum manus tua super eum, et postea omnis populus.
verses.english: Instead, you must immediately put him to death. Your hand shall be the first upon him to kill him, and afterward, the hands of all the people.

verses.latin: Lapis operiet eum: quia voluit te abstrahere a Domino Deo tuo, Qui eduxit te de terra Ægypti, de domo servitutis.
verses.english: Stones shall cover him and bring about his death. This is because he wanted to draw you away from the Lord your God, Who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery.

verses.latin: Ut omnis Israël audiens timeat, et nequaquam ultra faciat quicquam hujuscemodi.
verses.english: So that all of Israel, hearing about this, may fear and never again do anything of this kind.

verses.latin: Si audieris in una ex civitatibus tuis, quas Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi ad habitandum, dicentes aliquos:
verses.english: If you hear in one of your cities, which the Lord your God is giving you to inhabit, some people saying,

verses.latin: Exierunt filii Belial de medio tui, et averterunt habitatores urbis suæ, atque dixerunt: Eamus, et serviamus diis alienis quos ignoratis:
verses.english: "Worthless men—literally 'sons of Belial'—have gone out from among you and have turned away the inhabitants of their city, saying, 'Let us go and serve other gods whom you have not known,'"

verses.latin: quære et diligenter investiga, et sciscitare singula verissime: si certum est, et de medio tui facinorum detestabilium res comprobatur,
verses.english: then you must inquire, investigate diligently, and ask about every detail with the utmost truthfulness. If it is certain, and the detestable act is proven true among you,

verses.latin: statim percuties habitatores urbis illius in ore gladii, et delebis eam, et omnia quæ in illa sunt, usque ad pecora.
verses.english: you must immediately strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, and you must utterly destroy it, and all that is in it, even its livestock.

verses.latin: Cunctamque prædam illius congregabis in medio platearum ejus, et succendes cum ipsa civitate, et quæcumque illic inventa fuerint, Domino Deo tuo, et erit tumulus æternus: non ædificabitur amplius.
verses.english: And all the plunder of that city you shall gather into the middle of its open square and burn the city with all its goods as a complete offering to the Lord your God. It shall remain a perpetual mound of ruins and shall never be built again.

verses.latin: Et non adhærebit de eo ex eo quicquam manu tuæ ejus, quod est ex hoc execrabili, ut avertatur Dominus ab ira furoris sui, et misereatur tui, multiplicetque te, sicut juravit patribus tuis,
verses.english: Let nothing of the cursed thing cling to your hand, so that the Lord may turn from the fierceness of His anger and show you mercy, and multiply you as He swore to your fathers,

verses.latin: quando audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, et custodieris omnia mandata ejus, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, ut facias quod placitum est coram Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: if you listen to the voice of the Lord your God and keep all His commandments which I command you today, to do what is right in the sight of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Filii Dominus Deus vestri estis: non vos incidetis et non facietis calvitium super mortuo.
verses.english: You are truly children of the Lord your God. Therefore, you must not cut yourselves, nor must you shave your heads as a sign of mourning for the dead.

verses.latin: Quia populus sanctus Domini Dei tui es, et te elegit Dominus, ut sis ei in populum peculiarem de cunctis gentibus quæ sunt in superficie terræ.
verses.english: This is because you are a holy people, belonging to the Lord your God. The Lord chose you specifically to be His own treasured people, distinct from all other nations on the face of the earth.

verses.latin: Non comedes abominationem.
verses.english: You must not eat anything that is an abomination.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt animalia quæ comedere potestis: bovem, et ovem, et capram,
verses.english: These are the animals you may eat: an ox, a sheep, and a goat.

verses.latin: cervum, capreolum, bubalum, tragelaphum, orygem, camelopardalum, et bizonem.
verses.english: Also, you may eat the deer, the roe deer, the wild ox, the tragelaphus (a type of mountain goat or antelope), the oryx, the giraffe, and the bison.

verses.latin: Omne animal quod habet ungulam bifidam et ruminat, comedetis.
verses.english: You may eat every animal that has a completely split hoof and that also chews the cud.

verses.latin: De his autem quæ ruminant, et ungulam non habent bifidam, hæc non comedetis: camelum, leporem, et hyracem: quia ruminant, et ungulam non dividunt, immunda sunt vobis.
verses.english: However, among those that chew the cud or have a split hoof, you must not eat these: the camel, the hare, and the hyrax. Although they chew the cud, their hooves are not fully divided, making them unclean for you.

verses.latin: Sus quoque, quoniam ungulam quidem dividit, sed non ruminat, immunda erit vobis: carnibus eorum non vescemini, et cadavera non tangetis.
verses.english: Also, the pig is unclean for you. Though it has a divided hoof, it does not chew the cud. You must not eat their meat, and you must not touch their dead bodies.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt quæ de aquis comedere potestis: omne quod habet pinnulas et squamas, illud comedite.
verses.english: From all the creatures that live in the water, you may eat these: anything that has both fins and scales.

verses.latin: Quod absque pinnulis et squamis est, ne comedatis, quia immundum est.
verses.english: But anything that does not have both fins and scales, you must not eat, because it is unclean.

verses.latin: Omnes aves mundas comedite.
verses.english: You may eat all clean birds.

verses.latin: Has vero comedere non debetis: aquilam, et gryphem, et haliæetum,
verses.english: However, you must not eat these birds: the eagle, the griffon vulture, and the sea eagle.

verses.latin: et milvum, ac vulturium juxta genus suum,
verses.english: Also the kite, and all kinds of vultures.

verses.latin: et omne corvum in genere suo,
verses.english: And every kind of raven.

verses.latin: et struthionem, et bubonem, et larum, et accipitrem juxta genus suum,
verses.english: Also the ostrich, the horned owl, the seagull, and every kind of hawk.

verses.latin: noctua, et ibin, et cygnum,
verses.english: The little owl, the ibis, and the swan.

verses.latin: et nycticoracem, et mergulum, et corvum,
verses.english: The night heron, the cormorant, and all kinds of raven.

verses.latin: et herodionem, et charadrium singula in genere suo, upupam quoque, et vespertilionem.
verses.english: Also the heron, and all kinds of plover, as well as the hoopoe and the bat.

verses.latin: Omne etiam quod reptat, et de volucribus est, immundum erit vobis, nec comedetur.
verses.english: Furthermore, every winged insect that also crawls on the ground will be unclean for you, and it must not be eaten.

verses.latin: Omne quod mundum est, comedite.
verses.english: You may eat anything that is clean.

verses.latin: Omne morticinum non comedetis: peregrino, qui intra portas tuas est, da ut comedat, aut vende exteris: quia tu populus sanctus Domini Dei tui es. Non coques hædum in lacte matris suæ.
verses.english: You must not eat any animal that has died a natural death. You may give it to a foreigner who lives within your towns, and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a non-Israelite. This is because you are a holy people, belonging to the Lord your God. Also, you must never boil a young goat in its mother's milk.

verses.latin: Decimas cunctarum frugum tuarum, quæ nascuntur singulis annis in terra, separabis.
verses.english: You must set aside a tithe—a tenth—of all the produce from your fields that grows each year in the land.

verses.latin: Et comedes in conspectu Domini Dei tui in loco, quem elegerit Dominus ut nomen suum ibi invocetur, decimam frumenti tui, et vini, et olei, et primogenita de armentis tuis et ovibus: ut discas timere Dominum Deum tuum omni tempore.
verses.english: You must eat this tithe—your tithe of grain, new wine, and olive oil, and the firstborn of your cattle and sheep—in the presence of the Lord your God, at the specific place He will choose for His Name to be invoked. This practice will teach you to revere the Lord your God at all times.

verses.latin: Quod si longior via est, et locus quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, procul remotus, et ferre ea non poteris, aut nolueris vendere, et emere de loco in quo elegerit Dominus Deus tuus:
verses.english: If the journey is too long for you, and the place the Lord your God has chosen is very far away, so that you cannot carry your tithe there—or if the distance makes it impractical to transport it directly—

verses.latin: vades, et vendes omnia, et in pretium refers in manu tua, et perges ad locum quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus:
verses.english: then you may convert all of your tithes into money. Tie the silver or gold securely in your hand, and travel to the place the Lord your God has chosen.

verses.latin: et emes ex eadem pecunia quidquid tibi placuerit, boves, oves, vinum, cervisiam, et omne quod desiderat anima tua: et comedes ibi coram Domino Deo tuo, et epulaberis tu et domus tua.
verses.english: With that money, you may buy whatever you desire: cattle, sheep, wine, or strong drink, or anything else your heart longs for. You are to eat and drink there in the presence of the Lord your God, and you and your entire household are to rejoice together.

verses.latin: Et Levites qui intra portas tuas est, caveat ne derelinquas eum, quia non habet partem nec possessionem tecum.
verses.english: Be sure not to neglect the Levite who lives within your towns, because he does not have an inherited portion or land ownership among you.

verses.latin: Anno tertio separabis aliam decimam ex omnibus quæ nascuntur tibi in anno illo, et repones intra portas tuas.
verses.english: At the end of every three years, you must bring out the entire tithe of your produce from that year and store it within your towns.

verses.latin: Et veniet Levites, qui non habet partem nec possessionem tecum, et peregrinus, et pupillus, ac vidua, qui intra portas tuas sunt, et comedent, et saturabuntur: ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere manuum tuarum quod feceris.
verses.english: Then the Levite, who has no inherited portion or land with you, and the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow who live within your towns, will come and eat until they are satisfied. Do this so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands that you undertake.

verses.latin: Filii Domini Dei vestri non vos incidetis et non facietis calvitium super mortuo
verses.english: You are children of the Lord your God, so you must not wound yourselves or shave your heads for the dead.

verses.latin: Quia populus sanctus es Domino Deo tuo, et te elegit Dominus ut esses ei in populum peculiarem de cunctis gentibus quæ sunt super terram.
verses.english: Because you are a holy people to the Lord your God, and He has chosen you to be His own special people from all the nations on earth.

verses.latin: Non comedes abominabile quidquam.
verses.english: Do not eat anything that is detestable.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt animalia quæ comedere potestis: bovem, et ovem, et capram,
verses.english: These are the animals you are permitted to eat: an ox, a sheep, and a goat,

verses.latin: cervum, capream, bubalum, tragelaphum, orygem, rupicapram, atque camelopardalum.
verses.english: a stag, a gazelle, a roebuck, a wild goat, an ibex, a wild ox, and a chamois.

verses.latin: Omne animal quod scindit ungulam, et in duas partes dividit, et ruminat, comedetis.
verses.english: You may eat any animal that has a completely split hoof and chews the cud.

verses.latin: De his autem quæ ruminant et ungulam non scindunt, hæc non comedetis: camelum, leporem, choerogryllum: quia ruminant et ungulas non scindunt, immunda sunt vobis.
verses.english: But among those that chew the cud or have a split hoof but not both, you must not eat these: the camel, the rabbit, and the rock badger, because they chew the cud but do not have a completely split hoof. They are unclean for you.

verses.latin: Sus quoque, quoniam scindit ungulam et non ruminat, immunda erit vobis. Carnibus eorum non vescemini, et cadavera eorum non tangetis.
verses.english: The pig is also unclean for you, because it has a split hoof but does not chew the cud. You must not eat their meat or touch their dead bodies.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt quæ de aquis comedere potestis: omne quod habet pinnulas et squamas, comedetis.
verses.english: From all the creatures that live in the water, you may eat everything that has fins and scales.

verses.latin: Quod absque pinnulis et squamis est, non comedetis, quia immundum est vobis.
verses.english: But anything that does not have fins and scales you must not eat, because it is unclean for you.

verses.latin: Omnes aves mundas comedite.
verses.english: You may eat all birds that are clean.

verses.latin: Has non comedetis: aquilam, et gryphem, et haliæetum,
verses.english: But these are the birds you must not eat: the eagle, the vulture, and the osprey,

verses.latin: et nycticoracem, et tinnunculum, et milvum juxta genus suum,
verses.english: the kite, the falcon, and any kind of buzzard or kite,

verses.latin: et omne corvini generis,
verses.english: and any kind of raven,

verses.latin: et struthionem, et bubonem, et larum, et accipitrem juxta genus suum,
verses.english: the ostrich, the screech owl, the seagull, and any kind of hawk,

verses.latin: noctua, et ibin, et cygnum,
verses.english: the little owl, the great owl, and the swan,

verses.latin: et onocrotalum, et mergum, et porphyrionem,
verses.english: the pelican, the cormorant, and the purple heron,

verses.latin: et erodium, et charadrium juxta genus suum, upupam quoque, et vespertilionem.
verses.english: the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.

verses.latin: Omne quod reptat et pinnulas habet, immundum erit vobis, et non comedetur.
verses.english: All winged insects that crawl on the ground are unclean for you and must not be eaten.

verses.latin: Omne volucre quod mundum est, comedite.
verses.english: You may eat all other clean winged creatures.

verses.latin: Quidquid morticinum est, ne comedatis ex eo. Peregrino qui intra portas tuas est, da ut comedat, aut vende ei: quia tu populus sanctus es Domino Deo tuo. Non coques hedum in lacte matris suæ.
verses.english: Do not eat anything that dies naturally. You may give it to a foreigner living within your city gates to eat, or you may sell it to a non-Israelite, because you are a holy people to the Lord your God. You must not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.

verses.latin: Decimas omnium frugum tuarum, quæ nascuntur per annum in terra tua, separabis.
verses.english: You must set aside a tithe—one tenth—of all the produce that grows annually from your fields.

verses.latin: Et comedes in conspectu Domini Dei tui in loco quem elegerit Dominus ut in eo nomen illius invocetur, decimam frumenti tui, et vini, et olei, et primogenita de armentis tuis et ovibus: ut discas timere Dominum Deum tuum omni tempore.
verses.english: And you shall eat your tithe of grain, new wine, and olive oil, and the firstborn of your cattle and sheep, in the presence of the Lord your God at the special place He chooses to make His name dwell there. You shall do this so that you may learn to revere the Lord your God always.

verses.latin: Cum autem longior fuerit via, et locus quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, procul remotus, et propterea ferre non poteris decimas, quas benedixit tibi Dominus,
verses.english: But if the journey is too far for you, and the special place the Lord your God chooses is too distant for you to carry your tithe, because the Lord your God has blessed you abundantly and the amount is too great,

verses.latin: vendes omnia, et in pretium dabis manum tuam, et perges ad locum quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus:
verses.english: then you may sell your produce, take the money with you, and go to the special place the Lord your God chooses.

verses.latin: et emes ex eadem pecunia quidquid tibi placuerit, boves, oves, vinum atque sicera, et comedes coram Domino Deo tuo, et epulaberis tu et domus tua:
verses.english: With that money, you may buy anything you desire—cattle, sheep, wine, or strong drink—and you and your household shall eat and rejoice in the presence of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: et Levites qui intra portas tuas est, ne contemnas eum, quia non habet partem nec possessionem tecum.
verses.english: And do not neglect the Levite who lives within your city gates, because he has no share or inheritance of land among you.

verses.latin: Anno tertio separabis aliam decimam ex omnibus quæ nascuntur tibi in anno suo, et repones intra portas tuas.
verses.english: At the end of every third year, you must bring out the tithe—one tenth—of all your produce from that year and store it within your city gates.

verses.latin: Et veniet Levites, qui non habet partem nec possessionem tecum, et peregrinus, et pupillus, ac vidua, qui intra portas tuas sunt, et comedent et saturabuntur: ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere manuum tuarum quod feceris.
verses.english: Then the Levite, who has no share or inheritance of land among you, and the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow who live within your city gates, may come and eat and be satisfied. Do this so that the Lord your God may bless you in everything you put your hand to.

verses.latin: Anno septimo facies remissionem.
verses.english: Every seven years, you must bring about a complete release of all debts—this is the Sabbatical year, for the forgiveness of debts.

verses.latin: Et haec est constitutio remissionis. Omnis creditor, qui aliquid debitori suo dederit, dimittet ei, et repeti non poterit ab eo, eo quod tempus sit remissionis Domini.
verses.english: And this is the specific rule for that debt release: Every creditor who has lent anything to his debtor must release it. He is not to demand repayment from his debtor, for it is the Lord's designated time for debt release.

verses.latin: De alieno et peregrino poteris exigere: Hebraeum vero et proximum tuum, non repetes quod dedisti.
verses.english: You may demand payment from a foreigner and a sojourner, but from your own Hebrew kinsman and neighbor, you must not demand back what you have lent.

verses.latin: Nisi forte et egenus non fuerit in te, ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in terra quam traditurus est tibi.
verses.english: This is to happen, unless it so happens that there is no needy person among you—for the Lord your God will bless you abundantly in the land He is about to give you as your inheritance.

verses.latin: Si tamen audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, et custodieris omnia mandata ejus, quæ ego hodie præcipio tibi.
verses.english: Provided, however, that you truly listen to the voice of the Lord your God and diligently keep all His commandments which I am giving you today.

verses.latin: Benedicet tibi Dominus Deus tuus, sicut locutus est. Et fœnerabis gentibus multis, et ipse a nemine fœnus accipies: dominaberisque nationibus plurimis, et nemo tui dominabitur.
verses.english: Then the Lord your God will bless you, just as He promised. And you will lend money to many nations, but you yourself will not need to borrow from anyone; you will rule over many nations, but no one will rule over you.

verses.latin: Si quando fuerit apud te pauper e fratribus tuis, in una portarum tuarum, in terra quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi, non indurabis cor tuum, nec contrahes manum tuam,
verses.english: If, however, there is ever a poor person among your kinsmen within any of your towns in the land that the Lord your God is giving you, you must not harden your heart or close your hand to him.

verses.latin: sed aperies ei manum tuam, et commodes ei quantum indiguerit, prout necessitas postulaverit.
verses.english: Instead, you must generously open your hand to him and lend him whatever he needs, according to his necessity.

verses.latin: Cave ne forte subripiat tibi impia cogitatio, et dicas in corde tuo: Appropinquat septimus annus, annus remissionis: et avertas oculos tuos a paupere, et nolles ei aliquid commoda: ne forte clamaverit contra te ad Dominum, et fiat tibi in peccatum.
verses.english: Be careful that you do not secretly harbor any wicked thought and say in your heart: 'The seventh year, the year of debt release, is drawing near.' And then you turn your eyes away from the poor, and refuse to lend him anything. Beware that he does not cry out against you to the Lord, and it become a sin for you.

verses.latin: Sed dabis ei: nec tristi oculo, ut in ejus necessitatibus subleves eum: propter hanc enim rem benedicet tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere tuo, et in cunctis quæ manus tua gesserit.
verses.english: Instead, you must give to him; and do so without a grudging spirit, so that you may relieve him in his needs. For because of this very thing, the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything your hand undertakes.

verses.latin: Non enim deficiet pauper de terra tua: idcirco ego præcipio tibi, et dico: Aperias manum tuam fratri tuo, egeno et pauperi, qui tecum versatur in terra.
verses.english: For the poor will never cease to exist in your land. Therefore, I command you and say: You must open your hand generously to your brother, to the needy, and to the poor who live with you in the land.

verses.latin: Cum vendiderit tibi frater tuus Hebraeus, aut Hebraea, et servierit tibi sex annis, in septimo anno dimittes eum liberum:
verses.english: If your Hebrew brother or sister sells himself or herself to you and serves you for six years, then in the seventh year, you must set them free.

verses.latin: cumque dimiseris eum liberum, non dimittes eum vacuum:
verses.english: And when you set them free, you must not send them away empty-handed.

verses.latin: sed dabis ei de ovibus tuis, et de area, et de torculari tuo, quibus te auxilium præbuit Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: Instead, you must provide generously for him from your flock, from your threshing floor, and from your winepress, with which the Lord your God has helped you.

verses.latin: Memento quod et tu servieris in terra Aegypti, et liberavit te Dominus Deus tuus: idcirco ego nunc præcipio tibi.
verses.english: Remember that you yourselves were also enslaved in the land of Egypt, and the Lord your God delivered you. Therefore, I am giving you this commandment today.

verses.latin: Sin autem ille noluerit exire, et responderit: Non egrediar, quoniam diligo te, et domum tuam, et bene mihi est apud te:
verses.english: But if they do not wish to leave, and answer, 'I will not leave, because I love you and your household, and I am content with you,' then this is what you must do.

verses.latin: tolles subulam, et forabis aurem ejus in janua domus tuæ, et serviet tibi usque in æternum: ancillæ quoque tuæ similiter facies.
verses.english: You shall then take an awl and pierce their ear through the door of your house, and they will be your servant forever. You shall do the same for your female servant also.

verses.latin: Non durus tibi videatur, qui a te liber recessit: sex enim annis servivit tibi, mercedem mercenarii duplicis accepit: et Dominus Deus tuus benedicet tibi in universis quæ feceris.
verses.english: Do not consider it a hardship to set them free from you, for they have served you for six years, having earned double the wages of a hired worker. And the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.

verses.latin: De primogenitis quæ nascuntur in armentis et ovibus tuis, quidquid est masculini sexus, sanctificabis Domino Deo tuo: non operaberis in primogenitis vitulorum, et non tondebis primogenita ovium.
verses.english: All the firstborn males that are born from your herds and your flocks—whatever is male, you must consecrate to the Lord your God. You shall not put the firstborn calves to work, nor shall you shear the firstborn lambs.

verses.latin: In conspectu Domini Dei tui comedes ea per singulos annos in loco, quem elegerit Dominus, tu et domus tua.
verses.english: You and your household shall eat them each year in the presence of the Lord your God, in the specific place that the Lord chooses.
