verses.latin: Sin autem habuerit maculam, claudum aut cæcum, vel quodlibet aliud vitium, non immolabis illud Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: But if the animal has a defect—if it is lame, or blind, or has any other serious blemish—you must not sacrifice it to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Sed in locis mansionum tuarum comedes illud: ut et immundum et mundum, sicut capream et cervum, comedere solent.
verses.english: Instead, you may eat it within your own towns, both the ritually unclean and the clean among you, just as one would eat a gazelle or a deer.

verses.latin: Hoc solum cavebis, ne sanguinem eorum comedas: sed effundes in terram quasi aquam.
verses.english: You must only be careful not to eat their blood; instead, you must pour it out on the ground like water.

verses.latin: Septimo anno facies remissionem.
verses.english: In the seventh year, you are to enact the year of release—this is the Sabbatical year for cancelling debts.

verses.latin: Haec erit constitutio remissionis. Omnis creditor, qui mutuam pecuniam dederit proximo suo, non exiget a fratre suo et cive: quia annus Domini est remissionis.
verses.english: This is how the year of release is to be observed: Every creditor who has lent money to his neighbor must not demand its repayment from his fellow Israelite. This is because it is the Lord's designated year for releasing debts.

verses.latin: De alieno poteris exigere, a fratre autem et cive tuo non postulabis id quod debetur tibi:
verses.english: From a foreigner, you may still demand repayment. But from your fellow Israelite, you must not demand what is owed to you.

verses.latin: Et non erit in te pauper et mendicus: ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in terra, quam daturus est tibi in possessionem.
verses.english: And there should be no poor among you—provided you fully obey the Lord your God, He will bless you in the land He is about to give you as your inheritance.

verses.latin: Tantum si audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, et custodieris universa mandata ejus, quae ego hodie praecipio tibi.
verses.english: This will only happen if you truly listen to the voice of the Lord your God and diligently keep all His commandments that I am giving you today.

verses.latin: Dominus Deus tuus benedicet tibi, sicut locutus est: et fenerabis gentibus multis, et ipse a nullo mutuum suscipies: dominaberisque nationibus plurimis, et nemo tui dominabitur.
verses.english: The Lord your God will truly bless you, just as He has promised. You will lend to many nations, but you yourselves will never need to borrow from anyone. You will rule over many nations, and no one will ever rule over you.

verses.latin: Si unus de fratribus tuis, qui morantur intra portas civitatis tuae, in terra quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi, pauper fuerit, non indurabis cor tuum, nec contrahes manum, ut non subvenias indigenti:
verses.english: If one of your fellow Israelites living within the gates of your city—in the land the Lord your God is about to give you—becomes poor, you must not harden your heart or close your hand against the needy person.

verses.latin: Sed aperies ei manum tuam, et commodabis ei quantum indiget, ut possit implere necessitatem suam.
verses.english: Instead, you must open your hand generously to him and lend him whatever he needs to fully satisfy his needs.

verses.latin: Cave ne forte subrepat tibi impia cogitatio, et dicas in corde tuo: Appropinquat septimus annus, annus remissionis, et avertas oculos tuos a paupere fratre tuo, nolens ei aliquid commodare: qui clamabit ad Dominum contra te, et fiat tibi peccatum.
verses.english: Be careful that no evil thought creeps into your mind, leading you to say in your heart: 'The seventh year—the year of release—is approaching,' and then you turn your eyes away from your poor Israelite brother, unwilling to lend him anything. If you do this, he will cry out to the Lord against you, and it will be counted as a sin for you.

verses.latin: Sed dabis ei, nec tristi vultu: ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere tuo, et in cunctis quae manu tua feceris.
verses.english: Instead, you must give to him, and do so cheerfully and without reluctance. Then the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything you do with your hands.

verses.latin: Non enim deficiet pauper de terra tua: idcirco ego praecipio tibi, ut aperias manum tuam fratri tuo indigenti, et pauperi, qui tecum versatur in terra.
verses.english: For there will always be poor people in the land. That is why I am commanding you to open your hand generously to your needy Israelite brother and to the poor who dwell with you in the land.

verses.latin: Cum vendiderit tibi frater tuus Hebraeus, aut Hebraea, et servierit tibi sex annis, in septimo anno dimittes eum liberum:
verses.english: If your fellow Hebrew man or woman sells himself or herself to you as a servant and serves you for six years, then in the seventh year, you must set them free.

verses.latin: Cumque dimiseris eum liberum, non dimittes vacuum:
verses.english: When you set them free, you must not send them away empty-handed.

verses.latin: Sed dabis de ovibus tuis, et area, et torculari tuo, quibus te Dominus Deus tuus benedixerit:
verses.english: Instead, you must provide generously for them from your flock, from your threshing floor, and from your winepress—from all the ways the Lord your God has blessed you.

verses.latin: Memento quod et tu servieris in Aegypto, et liberavit te Dominus Deus tuus: et idcirco ego nunc praecipio tibi hoc.
verses.english: Remember that you yourselves were once slaves in Egypt, and the Lord your God freed you. That is why I am giving you this commandment today.

verses.latin: Sin autem ille dixerit tibi: Nolo egredi, quia diligo te et domum tuam, et bene mihi est apud te:
verses.english: But if the servant says to you, 'I do not want to leave,' because he loves you and your household, and he is well off with you,

verses.latin: Apprehendes subulam, et fodiet in aurem ejus in janua, et serviet tibi usque in aeternum: ancillae quoque tuae similiter facies.
verses.english: Then you must take an awl and pierce his ear through the door—this is a sign of his permanent commitment. He will then serve you for the remainder of his life. You must do the same for your female servant.

verses.latin: Non erit grave in oculis tuis, si liberum dimiseris eum: quia sex annis servivit tibi mercede duplicati mercenarii: et benedicturus est tibi Dominus Deus tuus in universis quae feceris.
verses.english: It should not seem burdensome to you when you set them free, because for six years they served you for twice the wage of a hired worker. If you follow these commands, the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.

verses.latin: Omnia primogenita, quae nascuntur in armento et ovibus tuis, masculi sexus, sanctificabis Domino Deo tuo: non operaberis in primogenitis taurorum, et non totondras primogenita ovium.
verses.english: You must consecrate all the firstborn males born to your cattle and your flock to the Lord your God. You must not use the firstborn of your bulls for work, nor shear the firstborn of your sheep.

verses.latin: Coram Domino Deo tuo comedes ea per singulos annos in loco, quem elegerit Dominus, tu et domus tua.
verses.english: Each year, you and your household must eat them before the Lord your God in the special place that the Lord chooses for His worship.

verses.latin: Si qua vero macula fuerit in eo, claudum vel caecum, vel quodlibet vitium grande, non immolabis illud Domino Deo tuo:
verses.english: However, if there is any blemish in the animal—if it is lame, or blind, or has any serious defect—you must not sacrifice it to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Sed in civitatibus portarum tuarum comedes illud: tam mundum quam immundum.
verses.english: Instead, you may eat it within your own city gates, just as you would any other meat, whether it comes from a ritually clean or unclean animal.

verses.latin: Tantum ne sanguinem ejus comedas, sed effundes in terram quasi aquam.
verses.english: Only be sure not to eat its blood, but pour it out on the ground like water, as a sign of respect for life.

verses.latin: Observa mensis novarum frugum, et fac solemnitatem Paschae Domino Deo tuo: quia in hoc mense eduxit te Dominus Deus tuus de Aegypto nocte.
verses.english: Observe the month of fresh crops —the first month of the religious year, Abib— and celebrate the Passover solemnity to the Lord your God. For in this very month, the Lord your God brought you out of Egypt by night.

verses.latin: Et immolabis Phase Domino Deo tuo de ovibus, et bobus, in loco, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut sit nomen ejus ibi.
verses.english: And you shall offer the Passover sacrifice to the Lord your God from your flocks and herds, in the sacred place which the Lord your God will choose for His name to dwell.

verses.latin: Non comedes super eo fermentatum: septem diebus comedes azymam, panem afflictionis tuae, quoniam in festinatione egressus es de Aegypto: ut memineris diei egressus tui de terra Aegypti, omnibus diebus vitae tuae.
verses.english: You shall not eat anything leavened with it. For seven days, you shall eat unleavened bread —the bread of your affliction— because you came out of Egypt in haste. This is so you will remember the day you left the land of Egypt for all the days of your life.

verses.latin: Non apparebit fermentum in omnibus finibus tuis septem diebus: et non remanebit de carne ejus, quod immolatum est vespere in die primo, usque mane.
verses.english: No leaven shall be found in all your territory for seven days. And none of the meat that was sacrificed in the evening on the first day shall remain until morning.

verses.latin: Non poteris immolare Phase in una qualibet urbium tuarum, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi:
verses.english: You will not be permitted to sacrifice the Passover in just any of your cities that the Lord your God is giving to you.

verses.latin: sed in loco, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut habitaret nomen ejus ibi: illuc immolabis Phase vespere ad occasum solis, quo tempore egressus es de Aegypto.
verses.english: Instead, in the special place that the Lord your God will choose for His name to dwell, there you shall sacrifice the Passover in the evening at sunset, at the exact time you came out of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et coques, et comedes in loco, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus: et mane revertens, in tabernacula tua perges.
verses.english: And you shall cook and eat it in the place which the Lord your God will choose. Then, in the morning, you shall return and go to your tents.

verses.latin: Sex diebus comedes azymam: et in septimo die, solemnitas est Domino Deo tuo: non facies omne opus.
verses.english: For six days, you shall eat unleavened bread. And on the seventh day, there shall be a solemn assembly for the Lord your God; you shall do no work.

verses.latin: Septem hebdomadas numerabis tibi: ab eo die, quo falcem in segetem miseris, septem hebdomadas computabis.
verses.english: You shall count seven weeks for yourself. From the day you first put the sickle to the standing grain, you shall count seven full weeks.

verses.latin: Et celebrabis solemnitatem hebdomadarum Domino Deo tuo, oblationem spontaneam manus tuae, quam offeres juxta benedictionem Domini Dei tui, quam dederit tibi.
verses.english: Then you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks to the Lord your God, bringing a freewill offering from your hand, which you shall give according to the blessing that the Lord your God has bestowed upon you.

verses.latin: Et epulaberis coram Domino Deo tuo, tu, et filius tuus ac filia, et servus tuus ac ancilla, et Levites, qui est intra portas tuas, et advena atque pupillus et vidua, qui tecum morantur, in loco, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut ibi nomen ejus habitet.
verses.english: And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God: you, your son, your daughter, your male and female servants, the Levite who lives within your gates, and the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow who reside among you, in the place which the Lord your God will choose for His name to dwell.

verses.latin: Et memento, quod servieris in Aegypto: custodiesque, et facies quae praecepi tibi.
verses.english: And remember that you were once a slave in Egypt. You shall therefore keep and do all the things that I have commanded you.

verses.latin: Solemnitatem scenopegiae celebrabis septem diebus, quando collegeris de area, et torculari fruges tuas.
verses.english: You shall celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles —the Festival of Booths— for seven days, when you have gathered in your produce from your threshing floor and your winepress.

verses.latin: Et laetaberis in solemnitate tua, tu, et filius tuus ac filia, et servus tuus et ancilla, Levites, et advena, et pupillus, ac vidua, qui morantur intra portas tuas.
verses.english: And you shall rejoice in your feast: you, your son, your daughter, your male and female servants, the Levite, the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow who live within your gates.

verses.latin: Septem diebus solemnitatem celebrabis Domino Deo tuo in loco, quem elegerit Dominus: et benedicet tibi Dominus Deus tuus in cunctis frugibus tuis, et in omni opere manuum tuarum, erisque laetus.
verses.english: For seven days you shall celebrate the feast for the Lord your God in the place which the Lord will choose. And the Lord your God will bless you in all your produce and in all the work of your hands, and you shall be completely joyful.

verses.latin: Tribus vicibus in anno apparebit omne masculinum tuum coram Domino Deo tuo in loco, quem elegerit: in solemnitate azymorum, in solemnitate hebdomadarum, et in solemnitate scenopegiae. Non apparebit vacuus in conspectu Domini:
verses.english: Three times in a year, every male among you shall appear before the Lord your God in the place He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, at the Feast of Weeks, and at the Feast of Tabernacles. No one shall appear empty-handed in the presence of the Lord.

verses.latin: sed offeret unusquisque quod habuerit, juxta benedictionem Domini Dei sui, quam dederit ei.
verses.english: But each one shall offer what he has, according to the blessing of the Lord his God which He has given him.

verses.latin: Judices et magistros constitues in omnibus portis tuis, quas Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, per singulas tribus tuas: ut judicent populum justo judicio.
verses.english: You shall appoint judges and magistrates in all your gates —that is, in every town— which the Lord your God is giving you, throughout your tribes, so that they may judge the people with righteous judgment.

verses.latin: Non accipies personam, nec munera: quia munera excaecant oculos sapientium, et subvertunt verba justorum.
verses.english: You shall not show partiality, nor accept bribes. For bribes blind the eyes of the wise and corrupt the words of the righteous.

verses.latin: Juste quod justum est persequeris: ut vivas, et possideas terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi.
verses.english: You shall pursue justice, and only justice, so that you may live and possess the land which the Lord your God is giving you.

verses.latin: Non plantabis lucum, et omnem arborem juxta altare Domini Dei tui, quod feceris tibi.
verses.english: You shall not plant any sacred tree or grove —used for idol worship— near the altar of the Lord your God, which you shall make for yourself.

verses.latin: Neque statuam facies: quae odit Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: Nor shall you erect any sacred pillar or idol, for the Lord your God detests these things.

verses.latin: Observa mensis novorum, et facies Phase Domino Deo tuo: quia in mense novorum eduxit te Dominus Deus tuus de Aegypto nocte.
verses.english: Observe the month of Abib—the month of new things and the beginning of spring—and you shall celebrate the Passover in honor of the Lord your God, because in this very month of Abib, the Lord your God led you out of Egypt during the night.

verses.latin: Immolabis igitur Phase Domino Deo tuo de ovibus et bubus, in loco quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus ut habitet nomen ejus ibi.
verses.english: Therefore, you shall offer the Passover sacrifice of sheep and oxen to the Lord your God in the specific place the Lord your God will choose for His name to reside there.

verses.latin: Non comedes super eo fermentatum: septem diebus azymos panes comedes, sicut jussum est tibi, panem afflictionis, quoniam in festinatione egressus es de Aegypto: ut memineris diei exitus tui de terra Aegypti cunctis diebus vitae tuae.
verses.english: You shall not eat any leavened bread with it. For seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as has been commanded to you. This is the bread of affliction, because you left Egypt in great haste. You shall do this so that you may remember the day of your departure from the land of Egypt all the days of your life.

verses.latin: Non apparebit fermentum in cunctis terminis tuis per septem dies: et non remanebit de carne ejus quod immolatum est vespere in die primo, usque mane.
verses.english: No leaven shall be seen anywhere in all your territory for these seven days. Also, none of the flesh from what was sacrificed on the first evening shall remain until the next morning.

verses.latin: Non poteris immolare Phase in una qualibet urbium tuarum, quas Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi:
verses.english: You will not be permitted to sacrifice the Passover lamb in just any of your cities that the Lord your God is giving you.

verses.latin: sed in loco quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut ibi nomen ejus habitet, illuc immolabis Phase vespere ad solis occasum, ex quo egressus es de Aegypto.
verses.english: Instead, you must offer the Passover sacrifice in the specific place that the Lord your God will choose for His name to dwell. There you shall sacrifice the Passover offering in the evening, at sunset, the very time you departed from Egypt.

verses.latin: Et coques, et comedes in loco quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus: et mane revertens, in tabernacula tua perges.
verses.english: You shall cook and eat it in the place the Lord your God will choose. Then, in the morning, you may return and go to your own tents or homes.

verses.latin: Sex diebus comedes azymos panes: et in septimo die, quia collecta est solemnitas Domini Dei tui, non facies aliquod opus.
verses.english: For six days you shall eat unleavened bread. But on the seventh day, because it is a solemn assembly for the Lord your God, you shall not do any work.

verses.latin: Septem hebdomadas numerabis tibi: ab eo die quo falcem in segetem posueris, septem hebdomadas numerabis,
verses.english: You shall count seven full weeks for yourself, beginning from the day you first put the sickle to the standing grain—from that day you shall count seven weeks.

verses.latin: et celebrabis solemnitatem hebdomadarum Domino Deo tuo, oblationem spontaneam manus tuae, quam offeres Domino Deo tuo, pro benedictione in qua dederit tibi.
verses.english: Then you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks to the Lord your God, offering a spontaneous gift from your hand, which you shall give to the Lord your God in proportion to the blessing He has given you.

verses.latin: Et epulaberis coram Domino Deo tuo, tu et filius tuus ac filia, et servus tuus ac ancilla, et Levites qui intra portas tuas est, et advena atque pupillus et vidua, qui tecum morantur in loco quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus ut nomen ejus habitet ibi.
verses.english: And you shall feast before the Lord your God—you, your son, your daughter, your male and female servants, the Levite who lives within your gates, and the foreign resident, the orphan, and the widow who live with you—all in the place that the Lord your God will choose for His name to dwell there.

verses.latin: Et memento quod servus fueris in Aegypto: et custodies, atque facies haec mandata.
verses.english: And remember that you were once slaves in Egypt. Therefore, you shall carefully observe and do these specific commands.

verses.latin: Solemnitatem tabernaculorum celebrabis per septem dies, quando collegeris de area et torculari tuo.
verses.english: You shall celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles for seven days, after you have gathered in the harvest from your threshing floor and your winepress.

verses.latin: Et laetaberis in solemnitate tua, tu et filius tuus et filia, et servus tuus et ancilla, Levites et advena, pupillus et vidua, qui intra portas tuas sunt.
verses.english: You shall rejoice in your feast—you, your son, your daughter, your male and female servants, the Levite, the foreign resident, the orphan, and the widow who live within your gates.

verses.latin: Septem diebus Domino Deo tuo festa celebrabis in loco quem elegerit Dominus: benedicet enim te Dominus Deus tuus in omni fruge tua, et in omni opere manuum tuarum, erisque totus in gaudio.
verses.english: For seven days you shall keep the feast for the Lord your God in the place the Lord will choose, because the Lord your God will bless you in all your harvest and in all the work of your hands, so you will be entirely full of joy.

verses.latin: Tribus vicibus in anno apparebit omne masculinum tuum coram Domino Deo tuo in loco quem elegerit: in solemnitate azymorum, in solemnitate hebdomadarum, et in solemnitate tabernaculorum. Non apparebit vacuus coram Domino,
verses.english: Three times a year, all your males shall appear before the Lord your God in the place He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, at the Feast of Weeks, and at the Feast of Tabernacles. No one shall appear empty-handed before the Lord.

verses.latin: sed offeret unusquisque quod habuerit, secundum benedictionem Domini Dei sui, quam dederit ei.
verses.english: Instead, each person shall offer what they are able to give, in proportion to the blessing that the Lord their God has bestowed upon them.

verses.latin: Judices et magistros constitues in omnibus portis tuis, quas Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi, per singulas tribus tuas: ut judicent populum justo judicio,
verses.english: You shall appoint judges and officials in all your towns that the Lord your God is giving you, throughout all your tribes. These officials are to judge the people with righteous judgments.

verses.latin: nec inflectantur in aliquam partem. Non respicias personam, nec accipias munera: quia munera excaecant oculos sapientium, et subvertunt verba justorum.
verses.english: They shall not be swayed to one side or another. You shall not show partiality to anyone, nor accept bribes, because bribes blind the eyes of the wise and corrupt the words of the righteous.

verses.latin: Juste quod justum est persequeris: ut vivas, et possideas terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi.
verses.english: You shall wholeheartedly pursue only what is just and right, so that you may live and possess the land that the Lord your God is giving you.

verses.latin: Non plantabis lucum et omnem arborem juxta altare Domini Dei tui, quod feceris tibi:
verses.english: You shall not plant any sacred pole or any tree of worship beside the altar of the Lord your God that you will build for yourself.

verses.latin: neque statues tibi statuam: quae sunt a Domino Deo tuo abominata.
verses.english: Nor shall you set up for yourself any sacred stone pillar, for these practices are detestable to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Non immolabis Domino Deo tuo bovem, et ovem, in qua est macula, aut aliquid vitii: quia abominatio est Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: You must not offer to the Lord your God any ox or sheep that has a blemish or any other defect. For such an offering is detestable to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Si inventus fuerit apud te in una urbium tuarum, quas Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, vir aut mulier, qui faciat malum in conspectu Domini Dei tui, et transgrediatur pactum illius:
verses.english: If there is found among you, in one of your cities that the Lord your God is giving you to dwell in, a man or a woman who does what is evil in the sight of the Lord your God and breaks His covenant with you—

verses.latin: ut vadat, et serviat diis alienis, et adoret eos, solem, et lunam, et omnem militiam caeli: quae non praecepi.
verses.english: by going and serving other gods and worshipping them—whether it be the sun, or the moon, or any of the celestial bodies in the sky—which I have not commanded you to do or to worship.

verses.latin: Et hoc tibi fuerit nuntiatum, audiensque inquisieris diligenter, et verum esse compereris, et abominatio facta est in Israel:
verses.english: And if this is reported to you, and you hear of it, then you must inquire diligently into the matter. If it is found to be true, and such a detestable thing has indeed occurred within the land of Israel,

verses.latin: educes virum, et mulierem, qui rem sceleratissimam perpetrarunt, ad portas civitatis tuae, et lapidibus obruentur.
verses.english: you shall bring out that man or that woman who has committed such an evil and wicked act to the gates of your city, and they shall be stoned to death with rocks.

verses.latin: In ore duorum aut trium testium peribit qui interficietur: nemo occidetur uno contra se dicente testimonium.
verses.english: At the testimony of two or three witnesses, the person who is to be put to death shall die; no one shall be executed on the testimony of a single witness against him.

verses.latin: Testium primum manus contra eum sit, ut occidat, et postea omnis populus: ut auferas malum de medio tui.
verses.english: The hands of the witnesses shall be the first to cast stones against him, in order to execute him, and afterward the hands of all the people. In this way, you shall purge this evil from among you and your community.

verses.latin: Si difficile et ambiguum apud te judicium esse perspexeris inter sanguinem et sanguinem, causam et causam, lepram et lepram, et judicium intra portas tuas verba variari videris:
verses.english: If you find that judgment is too difficult and ambiguous for you in a legal case—whether it be a dispute between blood and blood (concerning murder), or cause and cause (a legal claim), or leprosy and leprosy (a ritual purity question)—and you see that the words of judgment vary within your gates;

verses.latin: surge, et ascende ad locum, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: then you shall arise and go up to the specific place that the Lord your God will choose to establish His presence and authority.

verses.latin: Veniesque ad sacerdotes Levitici generis, et ad judicem, qui fuerit illo tempore: quaeresque ab eis, qui indicabunt tibi judicii veritatem.
verses.english: You shall then come to the priests of the Levitical lineage and to the judge who is serving at that time. You shall inquire of them, and they will declare to you the truth of the judgment and the proper decision.

verses.latin: Et facies quicquid dixerint, qui praesunt loco, quem elegerit Dominus, et docuerint te, juxta legem ejus: sequerisque sententiam eorum, nec declinabis ad dexteram, vel ad sinistram.
verses.english: And you shall do whatever they tell you, those who preside over the place which the Lord has chosen, and whatever they teach you according to His law. You shall follow their judgment and not turn aside from their decision, neither to the right hand nor to the left.

verses.latin: Qui autem superbierit, nolens obedire sacerdotis imperio, qui eo tempore ministrat Domino Deo tuo, et sententiae judicis, morietur homo ille: et auferes malum de Israel.
verses.english: But the person who acts with arrogance, refusing to obey the command of the priest who ministers there at that time before the Lord your God, or the judgment of the judge—that person shall die. You shall thus purge this evil from Israel.

verses.latin: Omnisque populus audiens timebit, ac nullo unquam tempore superbus assumet.
verses.english: And all the people who hear of it will be struck with fear, and they will never again act with such arrogance or disregard for authority.

verses.latin: Cum ingressus fueris terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, et possederis eam, habitaverisque in illa: et dixeris: Constituam super me regem, sicut habent omnes per circuitum nationes:
verses.english: When you enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you, and you possess it and live in it, and then you say in your hearts: 'I will set a king over me, just as all the nations around me have kings'—

verses.latin: eum constitues, quem Dominus Deus tuus elegerit de numero fratrum tuorum. Non poteris alterius gentis hominem regem facere, qui non sit frater tuus.
verses.english: you may indeed appoint as king over you the one whom the Lord your God will choose from among your own brothers. You may not place a foreigner, who is not one of your own brothers, as king over you.

verses.latin: Qui cum fuerit constitutus, non multiplicabit sibi equos, nec reducet populum in Aegyptum, ut equitatus adjutorio sublevetur, praesertim cum Dominus praeceperit tibi, ut nequaquam amplius per eam viam revertaris:
verses.english: But once he is appointed, he must not acquire many horses for himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt to obtain more horses for his military strength—especially since the Lord has commanded you that you must never again return by that way to Egypt.

verses.latin: non habebit uxores plurimas, quae illiciant animum ejus, neque argenti et auri immoderata pondera.
verses.english: He must not acquire many wives for himself, lest they turn his heart away from God and His commandments. Nor must he accumulate for himself excessive amounts of silver and gold.

verses.latin: Sed postquam sederit in solio regni sui, describet sibi Deuteronomium legis hujus in volumine, accipiens exemplar a sacerdotibus Leviticae tribus:
verses.english: But after he takes his place on the throne of his kingdom, he shall write for himself a copy of this law—this Book of Deuteronomy—in a scroll, taking the exemplar directly from the priests of the Levitical tribe.

verses.latin: habebitque secum, et leget illud omnibus diebus vitae suae, ut discat timere Dominum Deum suum, et custodire verba et caeremonias ejus, quae in lege praecepta sunt.
verses.english: He shall keep this copy with him, and he shall read it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to fear the Lord his God and to carefully observe all the words and statutes of this law that are commanded in it.

verses.latin: Nec elevetur cor ejus in superbiam super fratres suos, neque declinet a mandatis vel ad dexteram, vel ad sinistram: ut longo tempore regnet ipse et filii ejus super Israel.
verses.english: In this way, his heart will not be lifted up in pride above his brothers, and he will not turn aside from these commandments, either to the right or to the left. This is so that he and his sons may reign for a long time over Israel.

verses.latin: Non immolabis Domino Deo tuo bovem, et ovem, in qua est macula, aut aliquid vitii: quia abominatio est Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: You shall not sacrifice to the Lord your God any ox or sheep that has a blemish or any defect, because such an offering would be an abomination to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Cum inveneris apud te, in una urbium tuarum, quas Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, virum, aut mulierem, qui fecerit malum in conspectu Domini Dei tui, et transgressus sit pactum illius:
verses.english: If a man or woman is found among you, in any of your cities that the Lord your God is giving you, who does evil in the sight of the Lord your God, and has transgressed His covenant,

verses.latin: ut vadat, et serviat diis alienis, et adoret eos, solem, et lunam, et omnem militiam cæli:
verses.english: so that they go and serve other gods and worship them—whether the sun, or the moon, or any of the host of the sky—

verses.latin: et hoc tibi fuerit nuntiatum, audiensque inquisieris diligenter, et verum esse repereris, et abominatio facta fuerit in Israël:
verses.english: and if this has been reported to you, and when you hear of it, you inquire diligently, and you find it to be true, and such an abomination has been committed in Israel,

verses.latin: educes virum, et mulierem, qui hoc facinus perpetrarunt, ad portas civitatis tuæ, et lapidibus obruentur.
verses.english: then you shall bring out that man or woman who committed this wicked deed to the gates of your city, and they shall be stoned to death.

verses.latin: In ore duorum, aut trium testium peribit qui interficietur: nemo occidetur uno contra se dicente testimonium.
verses.english: At the mouth of two or three witnesses, the one who is to be put to death shall die; no one shall be executed on the testimony of a single witness against them.

verses.latin: Testium primum manus sit super eum ut occidatur, et postea omnis populus: ut auferas malum de medio tui.
verses.english: The hands of the witnesses shall be the first upon them to put them to death, and afterward the hands of all the people, so that you may remove the evil from your midst.

verses.latin: Si difficile et ambiguum apud te judicium esse perspexeris inter sanguinem et sanguinem, causam et causam, lepram et lepram: et judicum intra portas tuas verba variari videris:
verses.english: If you perceive that a judgment is too difficult and ambiguous for you—concerning matters of bloodshed, or legal cases, or leprosy cases—and you see that the words of the judges within your gates are varying,

verses.latin: surge, et ascende ad locum, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus:
verses.english: then rise and go up to the place that the Lord your God will choose;

verses.latin: veniesque ad sacerdotes Levitici generis, et ad judicem, qui fuerit illo tempore: quæresque ab eis, qui indicabunt tibi judicii veritatem.
verses.english: and you shall come to the Levitical priests and to the judge who will be in office at that time. You shall inquire of them, and they will declare to you the truth of the judgment.

verses.latin: Et facies quæcumque dixerint tibi qui præsunt loco, quem elegerit Dominus: et docuerint te juxta legem ejus:
verses.english: And you shall do whatever they tell you, those who preside in the place that the Lord will choose, and whatever they teach you according to His law;

verses.latin: et sequeris sententiam eorum, nec declinabis ad dexteram, vel ad sinistram.
verses.english: and you shall follow their ruling, and you shall not deviate from it to the right or to the left.

verses.latin: Qui autem superbierit, nolens obedire sacerdotis imperio, qui eo tempore ministrat Domino Deo tuo, et sententiæ judicis, morietur homo ille: et auferes malum de Israël:
verses.english: But if anyone acts presumptuously, unwilling to obey the command of the priest who ministers to the Lord your God at that time, or the ruling of the judge, that man shall die. So you shall remove the evil from Israel.

verses.latin: omnisque populus audiens timebit, ac nullo unquam tempore superbiæ intumescet.
verses.english: And all the people shall hear and fear, and never again shall they swell with pride.

verses.latin: Cum ingressus fueris terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, et possederis eam, habitaverisque in illa: et dixeris: Constituam super me regem, sicut habent omnes per circuitum nationes:
verses.english: When you have entered the land that the Lord your God is giving you, and have taken possession of it, and dwell in it, and you say, "I will set a king over me, just as all the nations around me have,"

verses.latin: eum constitues, quem Dominus Deus tuus elegerit de numero fratrum tuorum. Non poteris alterius gentis hominem regem facere, qui non sit frater tuus.
verses.english: you shall surely appoint as king over you the one whom the Lord your God will choose from among your brothers. You may not set a man of another nation over you as king, who is not your brother.

verses.latin: Non multiplicabit sibi equos, nec reducet populum in Ægyptum, ut equitatus numerum augeat, præsertim cum Dominus præceperit tibi, nequaquam ultra per hanc viam revertaris.
verses.english: He shall not acquire many horses for himself, nor shall he lead the people back to Egypt to increase his cavalry, especially since the Lord has commanded you never to return by that way again.

verses.latin: Non habebit uxores plurimas, quæ illiciant animum ejus, neque argenti, et auri immensa pondera.
verses.english: He shall not have many wives, who might entice his heart away, nor shall he accumulate immense quantities of silver and gold.

verses.latin: Cumque sederit in solio regni sui, descriptum sibi exemplar hujus legis assumet a sacerdotibus Leviticæ tribus:
verses.english: And when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, he shall take a copy of this law, written for himself, from the Levitical priests;

verses.latin: habebitque secum, et leget illud omnibus diebus vitæ suæ, ut discat timere Dominum Deum suum, et custodire verba, ac cæremonias ejus, quæ in lege præcepta sunt:
verses.english: he shall keep it with him and read it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to fear the Lord his God and diligently keep all the words and ceremonies of this law which are commanded.

verses.latin: Non habebunt sacerdotes et Levitæ, et omnes qui de tribu Levi sunt, partem et hæreditatem cum reliquo Israël: de sacrificiis Domini et oblationibus ejus comedent,
verses.english: The priests, the Levites, and all those from the tribe of Levi, will not have a portion or an inheritance among the other tribes of Israel; instead, they shall live on the offerings and sacrifices made to the Lord.

verses.latin: et nihil aliud accipient de possessione fratrum suorum: quoniam ipse Dominus possessio eorum est, sicut locutus est illis.
verses.english: They shall not receive any other property from their brothers, the other tribes of Israel, because the Lord Himself is their inheritance and their possession, just as He promised them.

verses.latin: Hoc erit jus sacerdotum a populo et ab his qui offerunt victimas: sive bovem, sive ovem immolaverint, dabunt sacerdoti armum et duas maxillas ac ventriculum.
verses.english: This is the customary right of the priests from the people who offer sacrifices: whether they sacrifice an ox or a sheep, they shall give the priest the shoulder, both cheeks, and the stomach.

verses.latin: Primitias frumenti, vini, et olei, et de lanis pecorum suorum, dabunt ei:
verses.english: They shall give the priest the first-fruits of their grain, their wine, and their olive oil, and the first sheared wool from their sheep.

verses.latin: ipsum quippe elegit Dominus Deus tuus de cunctis tribubus tuis, ut stet et ministret nomini Domini, ipse et filii ejus in sempiternum.
verses.english: For the Lord your God has chosen the tribe of Levi from all your tribes, so that they may stand to serve and minister in the name of the Lord, both they and their descendants forever.

verses.latin: Si exierit Levites de una urbium tuarum ex omni Israël, in qua habitat, et voluerit venire, desiderans locum quem elegerit Dominus,
verses.english: If a Levite leaves one of your cities, wherever he may be living in any part of Israel, and he desires to come to the place which the Lord will choose for His worship,

verses.latin: ministrabit nomini Domini Dei sui, sicut omnes fratres ejus Levitæ, qui stabunt eo tempore coram Domino:
verses.english: he shall minister in the name of the Lord his God, just like all his fellow Levite brothers who are standing there at that time before the Lord.

verses.latin: partem ciborum eamdem accipiet, exceptis his quæ ex patriis urbibus et domiciliis possident.
verses.english: He shall receive the same portion of food and offerings as them, apart from what he already possesses from the sale of his ancestral property or his dwelling in his hometown.

verses.latin: Quando ingressus fueris terram quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi, cave ne imiteris abominationes illarum gentium.
verses.english: When you enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you, be careful not to imitate the detestable practices of those nations already living there.

verses.latin: Nec inveniatur in te qui lustret filium suum aut filiam, ducens per ignem: aut qui sortibus sciscitetur, et observet somnia atque auguria, nec sit maleficus,
verses.english: Let no one be found among you who offers their son or daughter as a sacrifice by fire, nor anyone who consults oracles, or practices divination, or interprets omens, or observes dreams, or is a sorcerer,

verses.latin: nec incantator, nec qui pythones consulit, nec divinos, aut quærit a mortuis veritatem.
verses.english: nor one who casts spells, nor one who consults spirits of the dead (necromancers), nor a diviner, nor one who seeks answers from the deceased.

verses.latin: Omnia enim hæc abominatur Dominus, et propter istiusmodi scelera delebit eos in tuo introitu.
verses.english: For all who do these things are detestable to the Lord, and because of these detestable practices, He will drive those nations out before you as you enter the land.

verses.latin: Perfectus eris et absque macula cum Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: You shall be blameless and wholehearted in your relationship with the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Gentes istæ, quarum possidebis terram, auguriorum et divinatores audiunt: tu autem a Domino Deo tuo alterius rei doctrina institutus es.
verses.english: These nations whose land you are about to possess listen to diviners and those who interpret omens. But the Lord your God has not permitted you to do such things, having given you a different teaching.

verses.latin: Prophetam de gente tua et de fratribus tuis sicut me, suscitabit tibi Dominus Deus tuus: ipsum audietis,
verses.english: The Lord your God will raise up for you a Prophet from among your own people, from your brothers, just like me—Moses. You must listen to Him.

verses.latin: ut petisti a Domino Deo tuo in Horeb, quando concio congregata est, atque dixisti: Ultra non audiam vocem Domini Dei mei, et ignem hunc maximum ultra non videam, ne moriar.
verses.english: This is exactly what you asked of the Lord your God at Horeb when the assembly was gathered, and you said, 'Let me not hear the voice of the Lord my God again, nor see this great fire anymore, lest I die!'

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus mihi: Bene omnia locuti sunt.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me, 'What they have said is good and correct.'

verses.latin: Prophetam suscitabo eis de medio fratrum suorum similem tui, et ponam verba mea in ore ejus, loqueturque ad eos omnia quæ præcepero illi.
verses.english: 'I will raise up for them a Prophet from among their brothers, one like you, Moses. I will put My words in His mouth, and He will speak to them everything that I command Him.'

verses.latin: Qui autem verba ejus, quæ loquetur in nomine meo, audire noluerit, ego ultor ero.
verses.english: 'But whoever will not listen to His words, which He speaks in My name, I Myself will hold that person accountable.'

verses.latin: Propheta autem qui, spiritu superbiæ, voluerit loqui in nomine meo quæ ego non præcepi illi ut loqueretur, aut ex nomine alienorum deorum, interficietur.
verses.english: However, any prophet who, out of pride, presumes to speak a word in My name that I have not commanded him to speak, or who speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet shall be put to death.

verses.latin: Si cogitaveris in corde tuo: Quomodo possum scire verbum, quod Dominus non est locutus?
verses.english: If you should ask yourself, 'How will we know if a message is truly from the Lord or not?'

verses.latin: Hoc habebis signum: Quod si propheta, in nomine Domini nuntians, non evenerit et inordinatum fuerit sermo, hoc Dominus non locutus est: sed spiritu superbiæ locutus est propheta: et idcirco non timebis eum.
verses.english: You will have this sign: If what the prophet proclaims in the name of the Lord does not come true or if his message is confused and contradictory, then the Lord has not spoken it. Instead, the prophet has spoken it out of pride and presumption. Therefore, you need not fear him nor heed his words.

verses.latin: Non habebunt sacerdotes levitici, et omnes qui de eadem tribu sunt, partem et hæreditatem cum reliquo Israël: de sacrificiis Domini et oblationibus ejus comedent,
verses.english: The Levitical priests, and indeed all men who are from that same tribe of Levi, will not be allowed to have an allotted portion of land or an inheritance among the rest of the people of Israel. Instead, they will live by eating from the sacrifices offered to the Lord and from His offerings.

verses.latin: et nihil aliud accipient de possessione fratrum suorum: quoniam Dominus ipse est hæreditas eorum, sicut locutus est illis.
verses.english: They shall not receive anything else from the possessions of their Israelite brothers, because the Lord Himself is their inheritance, just as He promised them.

verses.latin: Hoc erit jus sacerdotum a populo, et ab his qui offerunt victimas: sive bovem, sive ovem immolaverint, dabunt sacerdoti armum et duas maxillas ac ventriculum.
verses.english: This is what the priests have a right to receive from the people, and from those who offer sacrifices: whether they sacrifice a bull or a sheep, they will give the priest the shoulder, both of the jaws, and the stomach.

verses.latin: Primitias frumenti, vini, et olei, et lanæ ovium in usus suos.
verses.english: They shall also receive the first fruits of the grain, the wine, and the oil, along with the first shearings of the sheep's wool for their own use.

verses.latin: Ipsum quippe elegit Dominus Deus tuus de cunctis tribubus tuis, ut stet et ministret nomini Domini, ipse et filii ejus in sempiternum.
verses.english: For the Lord your God has specifically chosen him, from all your tribes, to stand and to serve in the Name of the Lord, both he and his sons forever.

verses.latin: Si egredietur Levites de una urbium tuarum ex omni Israël, in qua habitat ad libitum suum, et venerit locum quem elegerit Dominus:
verses.english: If a Levite comes out of one of your cities, from any part of Israel where he has been living, and he comes to the place which the Lord has chosen to establish His presence,

verses.latin: ministrabit nomini Domini Dei sui, sicut omnes fratres ejus Levitæ, qui stabunt eo tempore coram Domino.
verses.english: then he shall serve in the Name of the Lord his God, just like all his fellow Levite brothers who stand there at that time before the Lord.

verses.latin: Partem cibi ejusdem accipiet, exceptis his quæ ex paterna ei successerant civitate.
verses.english: He will receive the same portion of food as they do, apart from what he has inherited from his family's city.

verses.latin: Quando ingressus fueris terram quam Dominus Deus tuus tibi dat, cave ne imiteris abominationes illarum gentium.
verses.english: When you enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you, be careful not to imitate the detestable practices of those pagan nations.

verses.latin: Nec inveniatur in te qui filium suum aut filiam per ignem transeat: nec qui ariolos sciscitetur, et observet somnia atque auguria, nec sit maleficus,
verses.english: Let no one be found among you who makes his son or his daughter pass through the fire, or one who consults diviners, or one who observes omens and auguries, nor any sorcerer,

verses.latin: nec incantator, nec qui pythones consulit, nec divinos, aut quærit a mortuis veritatem.
verses.english: nor one who casts spells, nor one who consults spirits, nor a fortuneteller, nor one who seeks truth from the dead.

verses.latin: Omnia enim hæc abominatur Dominus, et propter hujuscemodi scelera delebit eos in tuo introitu.
verses.english: For the Lord detests all these practices, and it is because of such crimes that He will destroy these nations before you when you enter the land.

verses.latin: Perfectus eris et absque macula cum Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: You shall be perfect and without blemish before the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Gentes istæ, quarum possidebis terram, hariolos et divinos audiunt: tu autem a Domino Deo tuo alteram doctrinam habes.
verses.english: These nations, whose land you are about to possess, listen to soothsayers and diviners; but you, however, have a different teaching from the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Prophetam de gente tua et de fratribus tuis sicut me, suscitabit tibi Dominus Deus tuus: ipsum audietis,
verses.english: The Lord your God will raise up for you a Prophet from among your own people, from your brothers, just like me—Moses is speaking here. You shall listen to Him.

verses.latin: ut petiisti a Domino Deo tuo in Horeb, quando concio congregata est, atque dixisti: Ultra non audiam vocem Domini Dei mei, et ignem hunc maximum ultra non videam, ne moriar.
verses.english: This is exactly what you requested from the Lord your God at Horeb, when the assembly was gathered, and you said: "Let me no longer hear the voice of the Lord my God, and let me not see this immense fire any longer, lest I die."

verses.latin: Et ait Dominus mihi: Bene omnia locuti sunt.
verses.english: And the Lord said to me, "They have spoken well in all they said."

verses.latin: Prophetam suscitabo eis de medio fratrum suorum similem tui, et ponam verba mea in ore ejus, loqueturque ad illos omnia quæ præcepero illi.
verses.english: "I will raise up a Prophet for them from among their brothers, just like you, and I will put My words in His mouth, and He will speak to them everything that I command Him."

verses.latin: Qui autem non audierit verba ejus quæ loquetur in nomine meo, ego ultor ero.
verses.english: "But whoever will not listen to the words that He speaks in My Name, I Myself will take vengeance upon him."

verses.latin: Prophetam autem qui, patescens superbia, voluerit loqui verba in nomine meo quæ ego non præcepi illi, et de nomine alienorum deorum, interficietur.
verses.english: "However, a prophet who, revealing pride, presumes to speak words in My Name that I have not commanded him to speak, or who speaks in the name of foreign gods, that prophet shall be put to death."

verses.latin: Si cogitaveris in corde tuo: Quomodo possum scire verbum quod non est locutus Dominus?
verses.english: If you think in your heart: "How can I know which word the Lord has not spoken?"

verses.latin: Hoc habebis signum: Quod si propheta, loquens in nomine Domini, prædixerit et non evenerit illud, hoc est verbum quod non est locutus Dominus, sed per superbiam animi sui protulit: et idcirco non timebis eum.
verses.english: This is the sign you will have: If a prophet, speaking in the Name of the Lord, predicts something and that thing does not happen, that is a word which the Lord has not spoken. Rather, the prophet uttered it out of his own proud spirit. Therefore, you shall not be afraid of him.

verses.latin: Cum delevisset Dominus Deus tuus nationes quarum tibi traditurus est terram et possederis eam atque habitaveris in urbibus ejus et in domibus
verses.english: When the Lord your God completely destroys the nations from the land He is giving to you, and when you have taken possession of their land and settled in their cities and homes,

verses.latin: tres civitates separabis tibi in medio terrae tuae quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi in possessionem
verses.english: then you are to designate three cities in the middle of your land—the land the Lord your God is giving you as your inheritance.

verses.latin: iter faciens ut tres partes possideas universae regionis
verses.english: You must make the roads to these cities clear and maintain them, and you shall divide the entire territory of your land, which the Lord your God gives you as an inheritance, into three districts. These three cities of refuge will be distributed among these districts.

verses.latin: haec erit lex interfectoris qui fugerit ad ea ut vivat qui percusserit proximum suum nescius et nullum odium habuerit adversus eum ante diem hesternum
verses.english: This is the law for a slayer who will flee to one of these cities and live: anyone who strikes his neighbor accidentally, without any prior malice or hatred towards him,

verses.latin: ut si quis cum proximo suo silvas cecidisset et absque animo nocendi ferrum securis in ligna dimisisset recidissetque lignum et ferrum secudis fugiens manum in proximum ejus inciderit interfecitque eum talis ad unam harum civitatum confugiet et vivet
verses.english: For example, if someone goes into the forest with his neighbor to cut wood, and as he swings the ax to fell a tree, the ax head accidentally flies off the handle, slips from his hand, and strikes his neighbor, killing him—such a person may flee to one of these cities of refuge and live.

verses.latin: ne forte proximus interfecti fervens animo persequatur et comprehendens eum in itinere percutiat animam ejus qui non est reus mortis quia nullum odium habuit adversus eum hesterno die
verses.english: Otherwise, the avenger of the slain, burning with rage, might pursue him and overtake him on the road, striking him dead. This would be a grave injustice, as the person is not deserving of death because he had no prior malice or hatred towards the one he accidentally killed.

verses.latin: idcirco praecipio tibi ut tres civitates facias in tuo numero
verses.english: Therefore, I command you to designate these three cities for yourselves.

verses.latin: cum autem dilataverit Dominus Deus tuus terminos tuos sicut juravit patribus tuis et dederit tibi omnem terram quam eis pollicitus est
verses.english: And when the Lord your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your ancestors, and gives you all the land He promised them,

verses.latin: (si tamen custodieris universa mandata haec et feceris quae ego hodie praecipio tibi ut diligas Dominum Deum tuum et ambules viis ejus omni tempore)
verses.english: (This will happen only if you are careful to obey all these commandments and do what I am instructing you today, which is to love the Lord your God and walk in His ways at all times.)

verses.latin: addes tibi alias tres civitates et supradictarum trium numerum duplicabis
verses.english: then you must add three more cities of refuge to these, making the total number six, to double the initial three cities.

verses.latin: ut non effundatur sanguis innoxius in medio terrae tuae quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi possidendam et sis sanguinis reus
verses.english: This is so that innocent blood will not be shed in the middle of your land, which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and thus make you guilty of bloodshed.

verses.latin: si quis autem odio habens proximum suum insidiatus fuerit ei surgensque percusserit animam ejus et ille mortuus fuerit fugeritque ad unam supradictarum urbium
verses.english: But if someone, driven by hatred for his neighbor, lies in wait, ambushes him, and strikes him dead, and then flees to one of these cities of refuge,

verses.latin: mittent majores natu civitatis illius et arripient eum de loco confugii et tradent in manum proximi cujus sanguis effusus est et morietur
verses.english: then the elders of his own city must send for him, seize him from the city of refuge, and hand him over to the avenger of blood, who will ensure he is put to death.

verses.latin: non auferes terminos proximi tui quos fixerunt priores in possessione tua quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi in terra quam sortiturus es
verses.english: You must not move your neighbor's boundary markers, which were set by your ancestors in the land you will possess—the land the Lord your God is giving you as your inheritance.

verses.latin: non stabit testis unus contra aliquem quicquid illud peccati et facinoris fuerit sed in ore duorum aut trium testium stabit omne verbum
verses.english: A single witness is not sufficient to condemn anyone for any crime or wrongdoing. Every charge must be confirmed by the testimony of two or three witnesses.

verses.latin: si steterit testis mendax contra hominem accusans eum praevaricationis
verses.english: If a malicious witness comes forward and testifies falsely against another person, accusing him of a transgression or a crime,

verses.latin: stabunt ambo quorum est negotium ante Dominum in conspectu sacerdotum et judicum qui fuerint in diebus illis
verses.english: then both individuals involved in the dispute must stand before the Lord, in the presence of the priests and judges who are serving at that time.

verses.latin: cumque diligentissime perscrutantes judices invenerint falsum esse testem et locutum esse contra fratrem suum mendacium
verses.english: The judges must investigate the matter thoroughly. If they find that the witness is indeed false and has lied against his fellow Israelite,

verses.latin: reddent ei sicut fratri suo facere cogitavit et auferes malum de medio tui
verses.english: then you shall do to him exactly what he intended to do to his brother. In this way, you will purge that evil from your midst.

verses.latin: ut audientes ceteri timorem habeant et non ultra addantur talia facinora in medio tui
verses.english: The others will hear of this judgment and be struck with fear, ensuring that such evil acts are not committed again in your midst.

verses.latin: non misereberis sed animam pro anima oculum pro oculo dentem pro dente manum pro manu pedem pro pede redde
verses.english: Show no pity. The rule shall be: a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, a hand for a hand, and a foot for a foot.

verses.latin: Si egressus fueris ad pugnam contra inimicos tuos, et videris equos et currus, et majorem hostium tuorum multitudinem quam tu habeas, non timebis eos: quia Dominus Deus tuus tecum est, qui eduxit te de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: When you go out to fight your enemies, and you see their large armies with many horses and chariots, don't be afraid of them. The Lord your God is with you, the very God who brought you out of the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Cumque jam ad prælium ventum est, stabit sacerdos juxta et loquetur ad populum,
verses.english: When you are about to go into battle, a priest will stand nearby and speak to the people.

verses.latin: et dicet eis: Audi, Israël: Vos hodie ingrediemini ad pugnam contra inimicos vestros: non pertimescat cor vestrum, nolite metuere, nolite fugere, nec formidetis eos:
verses.english: He will say to them: 'Listen, O Israel! Today you are going into battle against your enemies. Do not be faint of heart. Do not be afraid, do not panic, and do not be terrified by them.'

verses.latin: quia Dominus Deus vester vobiscum est, et pro vobis ipse pugnabit contra adversarios.
verses.english: Because the Lord your God is right there with you, and He Himself will fight on your behalf against your adversaries.

verses.latin: Præcones quoque, postquam siluerit sacerdos, loquentur ad populum, et dicent: Quis est homo, qui ædificavit domum novam, et non dedicavit eam? vadat, et revertatur in domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius dedicet illam.
verses.english: After the priest has finished speaking, the officers will then say to the people: 'Is there any man here who has built a new house and has not yet dedicated it? Let him return home now, so that he does not die in battle, and another man dedicates his house instead.'

verses.latin: Quis est homo, qui plantavit vineam, et necdum vindemiavit ex ea? redeat, et eat in domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius vindemiet ex ea.
verses.english: 'Is there any man here who has planted a vineyard and has not yet enjoyed its first harvest? Let him return home now, so that he does not die in battle and another man gets to enjoy his first harvest.'

verses.latin: Quis est homo, qui despondit uxorem, et non accepit eam? vadat, et revertatur in domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius accipiat illam.
verses.english: 'Is there any man here who has become engaged to a woman but has not yet married her? Let him return home now, so that he does not die in battle and another man marries her.'

verses.latin: Hæc quoque addent, et loquentur ad populum: Quis est homo timidus et corde pavido? vadat, et revertatur in domum suam, ne forte fratrum suorum corda paveant, sicut et illius.
verses.english: The officers will then add this instruction and speak to the people: 'Is there any man here who is afraid and faint-hearted? Let him return home now, so that his brothers' hearts do not also become afraid and tremble like his own.'

verses.latin: Cumque omnes audierint, et parati fuerint ad prælium, constituite tribunos, et centuriones, et duces exercitus.
verses.english: Once everyone has heard these instructions and is ready for battle, then you must appoint officers: commanders over thousands, commanders over hundreds, and other leaders for the army.

verses.latin: Si quando accesseris ad civitatem, ut expugnes eam, offeres ei primum pacem.
verses.english: When you approach a city to attack it, you must first offer it terms of peace.

verses.latin: Si voluerit suscipere, et aperire tibi portas, cunctus populus, qui in ea est, salvabitur, et serviet tibi sub tributo.
verses.english: If the city agrees to accept your terms and opens its gates to you, then all the people who live in it will be spared, and they will serve you as forced laborers, paying tribute.

verses.latin: Si autem noluerit pacisci tecum, et cœperit bellum facere, obsidione circumdabis eam.
verses.english: But if the city refuses to make peace with you and instead chooses to wage war, then you must lay siege to it.

verses.latin: Cumque tradiderit Dominus Deus tuus illam in manu tua, percuties omne masculinum ejus in ore gladii,
verses.english: And when the Lord your God delivers that city into your hand, you must strike down every male in it with the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: absque mulieribus, et parvulis, et jumentis, et omni eo quod in civitate est, universam prædam diripies: et comedes de spoliis hostium tuorum, quæ tibi Dominus Deus tuus dederit.
verses.english: However, you may take for yourselves the women, the young children, the livestock, and all other belongings found in the city as plunder. You are permitted to use these spoils of your enemies, which the Lord your God has given to you.

verses.latin: Sic facies cunctis civitatibus quæ a te procul valde sunt, et non sunt de his civitatibus, quas in possessionem accepturus es.
verses.english: This is how you must deal with all the cities that are located very far from you. These are the cities that are not among those you are destined to conquer and claim as your permanent land.

verses.latin: De his autem urbibus, quæ tibi dantur, non relinques omnem animam viventem:
verses.english: However, in the cities within the land that the Lord your God is giving to you as an inheritance, you must not allow anything that breathes to remain alive.

verses.latin: sed interficies eos, id est, Hethæum, et Amorrhæum, et Chananæum, et Pherezæum, et Hevæum, et Jebusæum, sicut præcepit Dominus Deus tuus,
verses.english: Instead, you must utterly destroy these peoples—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—just as the Lord your God has commanded you.

verses.latin: ne forte doceant vos facere omnes abominationes, quas ipsi fecerunt idolis suis, et peccetis in Dominum Deum vestrum.
verses.english: Otherwise, they will teach you to imitate all the abominable practices that they perform for their idols, and you will then sin against the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Quando obsederis civitatem multo tempore, et munitionibus circumdederis, ut expugnes eam, non succides arbores, de quibus potest comedi, nec secures mittes ad illas: quoniam arbor lignum est, et non homo, nec potest contra te militare.
verses.english: When you lay siege to a city for a long time, surrounding it with fortifications in order to capture it, do not cut down its fruit-bearing trees. You must not use an axe to destroy them, for a tree provides wood and food, and it is not a human being who can fight against you in battle.

verses.latin: Si qua autem est arbor, quæ non est ligni pomiferi, sed silvestris, et apta operi, succide, et ædifica ex ea machinas, donec capiatur civitas.
verses.english: However, if there is a tree that is not a fruit-bearing tree, but a wild tree that is suitable for building, you may cut it down. Use these trees to construct siege engines and other works until the city is captured.

verses.latin: Si egressus fueris ad pugnam contra inimicos tuos, et videris equos et currus et majorem multitudinem hostium quam tu habes, non timebis eos: quia Dominus Deus tuus tecum est, qui eduxit te de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: When you go out to battle against your enemies, and you see that they have many horses and chariots, and a greater army than you do, do not be afraid of them. For the Lord your God is with you—the same God who led you out from the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Cumque jam instare certamen cœperit, consistet sacerdos ante acies, et sic alloquetur populum:
verses.english: When the battle is about to begin, the priest shall step forward before the battle lines and speak to the people, saying:

verses.latin: Audi, Israël: Vos hodie ingredimini ad pugnandum contra inimicos vestros: non pertimescat cor vestrum, nolite metuere, nolite cedere, nec paveatis illos:
verses.english: Listen, O Israel! Today you are going out to fight against your enemies. Let your hearts not be afraid, do not fear, do not yield, and do not be terrified by them.

verses.latin: quia Dominus Deus vester in medio vestri est, et ipse pugnabit pro vobis contra adversarios.
verses.english: Because the Lord your God is in your midst, and He Himself will fight for you against your adversaries.

verses.latin: Præcones quoque in exercitu, audiente populo, clara voce dicent: Quis ædificavit domum novam, et non dedicavit eam? Vadat, et revertatur domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius dedicet illam.
verses.english: Then the officers in the army shall proclaim in a loud voice, so that the people can hear: "Has anyone built a new house but not yet dedicated it? Let him go and return to his home, lest he die in battle and another man dedicate it."

verses.latin: Quis plantavit vineam, et necdum vindemiavit ex ea? Vadat, et revertatur domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius vindemiet eam.
verses.english: "Has anyone planted a vineyard but not yet harvested its fruit? Let him go and return to his home, lest he die in battle and another man harvest it."

verses.latin: Quis despondit uxorem, et non accepit eam? Vadat, et revertatur domum suam, ne forte moriatur in bello, et alius accipiat eam.
verses.english: "Has anyone become engaged to a woman but not yet married her? Let him go and return to his home, lest he die in battle and another man marry her."

verses.latin: Addentque præcones, et hæc loquentes ad populum: Quis est vir timidus et corde pavido? Vadat, et revertatur in domum suam, ne forte fratrum ejus perterreat et pavefaciat animos.
verses.english: And the officers shall add, speaking further to the people: "Who is a man who is fearful and fainthearted? Let him go and return to his home, lest he fill the hearts of his brothers with terror and make them afraid too."

verses.latin: Cumque siluerint omnes et jussi fuerint ad pugnam, principes turmarum ducant exercitum.
verses.english: When all these announcements have been made and the people have been commanded to prepare for battle, then the leaders of the companies shall lead the army.

verses.latin: Si quando accesseris ad expugnandam civitatem, offeres ei primum pacem.
verses.english: When you approach a city to attack it, you shall first offer it terms of peace.

verses.latin: Si receperit et aperuerit tibi portas, cunctus populus qui in ea fuerit, serviet tibi sub tributo.
verses.english: If the city accepts your offer and opens its gates to you, then all the people who are in it shall become your servants and pay tribute to you.

verses.latin: Sin autem noluerit pacem fœdusque inire tecum, et cœperit adversus te bellum facere, oppugnabis eam.
verses.english: But if it refuses to make peace and a treaty with you, and begins to wage war against you, then you shall besiege it.

verses.latin: Cumque tradiderit Dominus Deus tuus illam in manu tua, percuties omne masculinum ejus in ore gladii,
verses.english: And when the Lord your God delivers it into your hand, you shall strike down every male within it with the edge of the sword.

verses.latin: absque mulieribus et parvulis, et jumentis et iis quæ in civitate sunt universis. Omnemque prædam illius diripies, et comedes de spoliis inimicorum tuorum, quæ tibi Dominus Deus tuus dederit.
verses.english: But the women, children, livestock, and everything else in the city—all its plunder—you shall take for yourselves. You may eat the spoils of your enemies, which the Lord your God has given to you.

verses.latin: Sic facies cunctis civitatibus quæ a te procul valde sunt, et non sunt de his urbibus quas in possessionem accepturus es.
verses.english: This is what you shall do to all the cities that are very far from you, and which are not among the cities you are about to receive as your own possession.

verses.latin: De his autem civitatibus quæ tibi dantur in possessionem, non dimittes quemquam vivere:
verses.english: However, concerning these cities that are given to you as a possession—the ones within the promised land—you shall not let anyone remain alive who breathes.

verses.latin: sed interficies in ore gladii, Cherythæum et Amorrhæum, et Chananæum, et Pherezæum, et Hevæum, et Jebusæum, sicut præcepit Dominus Deus tuus:
verses.english: Instead, you must utterly destroy them with the edge of the sword: the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, just as the Lord your God has commanded you.

verses.latin: ne forte discant ex eis opera idololatriæ, et peccent in Dominum Deum vestrum.
verses.english: Do this so that they may not teach you to imitate their idolatrous practices, and thereby cause you to sin against the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Quando obsederis civitatem multo tempore, et munitionibus circumdederis, ut expugnes eam, non succides arbores, nec falce vastabis regionem: quoniam arbor est lignum, et non homo, nec potest contra te militare.
verses.english: When you besiege a city for a long time, surrounding it with fortifications in order to capture it, you shall not cut down its fruit trees, nor lay waste to the region with an axe. For the tree is wood, not a man, and therefore it cannot fight against you.

verses.latin: Si qua est arbor quæ non sit ligni pomiferi, sed agrestis, et apta operi, succide, et fac machinas, donec capias civitatem quæ contra te pugnat.
verses.english: But if there is a tree that is not a fruit-bearing tree, but a wild tree suitable for work—meaning it produces timber—you may cut it down and use it to build siege works until you capture the city that is fighting against you.

verses.latin: Si inventus fuerit occisus homo in terra quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi ut possideas, et jaceat per agros, nesciturque quis eum percusserit:
verses.english: If a man is found murdered in the land that the Lord your God will give you to possess, lying dead in the open fields, and the identity of the one who struck him dead is unknown:

verses.latin: egredientur majores natu, et judices tui, et metientur a loco cadaveris usque ad proximum oppidum:
verses.english: Then your elders and judges must go out and measure the distance from where the corpse lies to the nearest surrounding towns.

verses.latin: et seniores civitatis illius, quae inventa fuerit cæteris propinquior, tollent vitulam de armento, quæ non traxit jugum, nec in opere fatigata est:
verses.english: And the elders of the city that is found to be the closest to the body must take a young heifer from the herd, one that has never been put under a yoke or used for any work.

verses.latin: et adducent eam ad asperam vallem, quæ nunquam arata est, nec sementem recepit: et cædent inibi cervicem ejus.
verses.english: They shall bring the heifer to a rugged valley that has never been plowed or sown with seed, and there they shall break its neck.

verses.latin: Accedentque sacerdotes Levitici generis (illos enim elegit Dominus Deus tuus ut ministrent ei, et benedicant in nomine ejus, et ad verbum eorum omne negotium, et quidquid mundum est sive immundum, judicetur):
verses.english: Then the priests of the Levitical lineage (for the Lord your God has chosen them to minister to Him, and to bless in His name, and by their word every dispute and every matter of clean or unclean is to be judged) shall come forward.

verses.latin: et majores natu civitatis illius, quæ cæteris propinquior fuerit ad occisum, lavabunt manus suas super vitulam quæ in valle percussa est,
verses.english: And the elders of that city which was found closest to the murdered man shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley.

verses.latin: et dicent: Manus nostræ non fuderunt sanguinem hunc, nec oculi nostri viderunt.
verses.english: And they shall declare: "Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes witness it.

verses.latin: Propitius esto, Domine, populo tuo Israël, quem redemisti: et ne statuas sanguinem innocentem in medio populi tui Israël. Eritque propitiabilis sanguis.
verses.english: Be merciful, O Lord, to Your people Israel, whom You have redeemed; and do not allow innocent blood to remain among Your people Israel." And so the guilt of the blood shall be atoned for.

verses.latin: Tu autem auferes innocentem sanguinem de medio tui, quando feceris quod præcepit Dominus.
verses.english: Thus you shall remove the guilt of innocent blood from among you, when you have done what the Lord commands.

verses.latin: Si egressus fueris ad pugnam contra inimicos tuos, et tradiderit eos Dominus Deus tuus in manu tua, captivosque duxeris:
verses.english: If you go out to fight against your enemies, and the Lord your God delivers them into your power, and you take them as captives of war:

verses.latin: et videris in numero captivorum mulierem pulchram, et concupieris eam, voluerisque habere uxorem:
verses.english: And if you see a beautiful woman among the captives, and you desire her, and wish to take her as your wife:

verses.latin: induces eam in domum tuam: radetque capillos, et circumcidet ungues suos,
verses.english: You must bring her into your house. She shall then shave all the hair from her head, and she must trim her nails (these actions are part of a purification ritual for a non-Israelite woman).

verses.latin: et deponet vestem, in qua capta est: sedensque in domo tua, flebit patrem et matrem suam uno mense: et post hæc intrabis ad eam, et dormies cum illa, erisque vir ejus, et ipsa uxor tua.
verses.english: And she shall remove the clothing in which she was captured. She must then sit in your house and mourn her father and mother for one full month. After this period, you may go in to her, and sleep with her; and you shall be her husband, and she shall be your wife.

verses.latin: Sin autem nolueris habere eam uxorem, dimittes liberam: nec vendes pecunia, nec affliges eam per potentiam, quia humiliasti illam.
verses.english: But if afterwards you no longer desire to have her as your wife, you must let her go free. You shall not sell her for money, nor shall you treat her as a slave, because you have humbled her (by taking her as a wife and then rejecting her).

verses.latin: Si habuerit homo uxores duas, unam dilectam, et alteram exosam, genueritque ex eis filios, et fuerit filius primogenitus odiosæ:
verses.english: If a man has two wives, one dearly loved and the other hated, and both have borne him children, and the firstborn son happens to be the son of the hated wife:

verses.latin: cum diviserit filiis suis hæreditatem, non poterit filium dilectæ facere primogenitum, et præferre filio odiosæ, qui primogenitus est:
verses.english: Then, when he divides his inheritance among his sons, he may not treat the son of the loved wife as the firstborn, preferring him over the son of the hated wife, who is indeed the true firstborn.

verses.latin: sed filium odiosæ primogenitum agnoscet, dabitque ei de omnibus quæ possidet, duplicem partem: iste est enim caput liberorum ejus, et illi debentur primogenita.
verses.english: Instead, he must acknowledge the son of the hated wife as the firstborn, and give him a double portion of all that he possesses. For that son is the first fruit of his strength, and the right of the firstborn belongs to him.

verses.latin: Si genuerit homo filium contumacem et protervum, qui non audit verba patris et matris, et correctus obedire contemnit:
verses.english: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not listen to the words of his father or his mother, and though corrected, stubbornly refuses to obey:

verses.latin: apprehendent eum ambo, et ducent ad seniores civitatis, et ad portam judicii loci illius:
verses.english: His father and mother shall both take hold of him and bring him before the elders of the city, at the city gate where judgments are made.

verses.latin: dicentque ad eos: Filius noster iste contumax est et protervus, hæc quæ præcipimus, audire contemnit, luxuriæ et voraginibus deditus.
verses.english: And they shall say to the elders: "This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he refuses to listen to our commands, and he is given over to gluttony and drunkenness."

verses.latin: Lapidibus eum universus populus civitatis illius obruet, et morietur: ut auferatis malum de medio vestri, et omnis Israël audiens timeat.
verses.english: Then all the people of that city shall stone him with stones, and he shall die. You must remove this evil from among you, so that all of Israel may hear and be filled with fear (and learn from his example).

verses.latin: Cum fuerit peccatum aliquod morte dignum, et occisus pependerit in ligno:
verses.english: When a man has committed a sin worthy of death, and he has been put to death and then hung on a tree (as a public display):

verses.latin: non permanebit cadaver ejus in ligno, sed in eadem die sepelietur: quia maledictus a Deo est qui pependerit in ligno: et ne polluas terram tuam, quam Dominus Deus tuus daturus est tibi in possessionem.
verses.english: His corpse shall not remain on the tree overnight. You must bury him on the same day, because anyone hung on a tree is cursed by God. Do not defile the land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.

verses.latin: Si inventus fuerit occisus homo in terra, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi possidendam, et jacens in agro, nec scietur quis eum percusserit:
verses.english: If a man is found slain in the land—the territory the Lord your God is giving you to possess—lying in a field, and it is not known who killed him,

verses.latin: maiores natu et judices tui egredientur, et metientur a loco cadaveris usque ad proximas civitates:
verses.english: then your elders and your judges must go out and measure the distance from the place where the body lies to the nearest towns.

verses.latin: et quam intra se civitatem esse perspexerint viciniorem, majores natu civitatis illius tollent vitulam de armento, quæ non traxit jugum, nec portavit aratrum:
verses.english: Whichever town they determine is the closest, the elders of that town must take a heifer from the herd—one that has never been used for work, neither pulling a yoke nor an plow.

verses.latin: et ducent eam ad asperam vallem, quæ nunquam arata est nec consita: et illic interficient in torrente vitulam.
verses.english: They must lead the heifer to a rugged valley that has never been tilled or sown with seeds, and there, in the dry riverbed, they must break the heifer’s neck.
