verses.latin: Accedentque sacerdotes Levitici generis (nam ipsos elegerat Dominus Deus tuus, ut ministrarent ei, et benedicerent in nomine Domini, et ad verbum eorum omne negotium et quidquid mundum est atque immundum judicetur):
verses.english: Then the priests, who are from the tribe of Levi, must approach—because the Lord your God chose them to minister to Him and to bless in the name of the Lord, and by their word, every matter, both clean and unclean, is to be judged.

verses.latin: et omnes majores natu civitatis illius, quæ proxima fuerit occiso, lavabunt manus suas super vitulam, quæ in valle percussa est,
verses.english: And all the elders of that town, which is nearest to the slain man, must wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley.

verses.latin: et dicent: Manus nostrae non fuderunt sanguinem hunc, nec oculi nostri viderunt.
verses.english: Then they must declare: 'Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes witness this crime.'

verses.latin: Propitius esto, Domine, populo tuo Israel, quem redemisti: et ne imputes innocenti sanguini in medio populi tui Israel. Et propitiabitur pro eis sanguinis reatus.
verses.english: They must pray: 'Be merciful, O Lord, to Your people Israel, whom You have redeemed. Do not hold the guilt of this innocent blood against Your people Israel.' And the guilt of that blood will be forgiven them—it will be expiated for them.

verses.latin: Tuque auferes innocentem sanguinem de medio tui, quando feceris quod præcepit Dominus.
verses.english: Thus, you will remove the guilt of innocent blood from among you, when you do what the Lord has commanded.

verses.latin: Si egressus fueris ad pugnam contra inimicos tuos, et tradiderit eos Dominus Deus tuus in manu tua, captivosque duxeris,
verses.english: When you go out to battle against your enemies, and the Lord your God delivers them into your hand, and you take captives—

verses.latin: et videris in numero captivorum mulierem pulchram, et concupieris eam, voluerisque habere uxorem:
verses.english: and you see among the captives a beautiful woman, and you desire her and want to take her as your wife—

verses.latin: introduces eam in domum tuam: et radet caput, ac circumcidet ungues suos,
verses.english: you must bring her into your house. She must shave her head and trim her nails.

verses.latin: et deponet vestem in qua capta est, sedensque in domo tua flebit patrem et matrem suam uno mense: et post hæc intrabis ad eam, et dormies cum illa, erisque vir ejus, et ipsa uxor tua.
verses.english: She must remove the clothes in which she was captured and remain in your house, mourning her father and mother for one full month. After that period, you may go in to her, lie with her, and she will be your wife, and you her husband.

verses.latin: Sin autem nolueris habere eam, dimittes liberam, nec vendes pecunia, nec afflixes per potentiam: quoniam humiliasti illam.
verses.english: But if you no longer desire her, you must let her go free. You are not to sell her for money, nor oppress her by force, because you have humbled her—taken away her former dignity.

verses.latin: Si habuerit homo uxores duas, unam dilectam et alteram odiosam, et genuerint ex eo filios, et fuerit filius dilectæ primogenitus, et odiosæ postea:
verses.english: If a man has two wives, one who is loved and another who is disliked, and both bear him sons, but the firstborn son is from the disliked wife, and the second son is from the loved wife—

verses.latin: cum diviserit filiis suis hæreditatem, non poterit filium dilectæ facere primogenitum, et præferre filio odiosæ ac legitimo primogenito:
verses.english: when he divides his inheritance among his sons, he cannot make the son of the loved wife the firstborn, preferring him over the son of the disliked wife, who is the true and legitimate firstborn.

verses.latin: sed primogenitum filium odiosæ agnoscet, dabitque ei de omnibus quæ habuerit, duplicem partem: iste enim caput liberorum ejus est, et huic debentur primogenita.
verses.english: Instead, he must acknowledge the firstborn son of the disliked wife by giving him a double portion of all he possesses. For that son is the first of his strength, and the rights of the firstborn belong to him.

verses.latin: Si genuerit homo filium contumacem et protervum, qui non audit verba patris et matris, et correptus obtemperare contemnit:
verses.english: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not listen to the words of his father or his mother, and even when corrected, he scorns to obey—

verses.latin: apprehendent eum ambo et ducent ad seniores civitatis et ad portam judicii loci illius,
verses.english: his father and mother must both take hold of him and bring him to the elders of his town, at the gate where judicial matters are heard.

verses.latin: dicentque ad eos: Filius noster hic contumax et protervus est: monita nostra audire contemnit, comessationibus vacat, et luxuriæ atque conviviis.
verses.english: They must say to the elders: 'This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he refuses to listen to our warnings. He is given to gluttony, drunkenness, and wild feasts.'

verses.latin: Omnis populus civitatis ejus lapidibus eum obruet, et morietur: ut auferatis malum de medio vestri, et omnis Israel audiens timeat.
verses.english: Then all the people of his town must stone him to death. You must remove this evil from among you, and all Israel, hearing of it, will be struck with fear.

verses.latin: Qui peccaverit nexu mortis, et fuerit occisus, ac suspensus in ligno:
verses.english: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death and is executed, and afterward his body is hanged on a tree—

verses.latin: non permanebit cadaver ejus in ligno, sed eadem die sepelietur: non enim maledictus Dei est qui suspensus est: et ne polluas terram tuam, quam Dominus Deus tuus dabit tibi in possessionem.
verses.english: his corpse must not remain on the tree overnight. You must bury him the same day. For a hanged man is cursed by God, and you must not defile your land, which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.

verses.latin: Non videbis bovem fratris tui, aut ovem errantem, et quasi non pertineat ad te, subterfugies: sed reduces eam fratri tuo.
verses.english: If you see your fellow Israelite’s ox or sheep wandering astray, you must not ignore it or walk away as if it does not concern you. Instead, you must make sure to bring it back to him.

verses.latin: Etiamsi non fuerit frater tuus prope, vel eum ignoras, pones in domum tuam, et erit apud te, donec requirat eam frater tuus, et reddas illi.
verses.english: Even if your fellow Israelite is not nearby, or you do not know him, you must bring the animal into your own house. It must stay with you until your fellow Israelite asks for it, and then you must return it to him.

verses.latin: Similiter facies de asino et de vestimento, et de omni re perdita fratris tui, quæcumque tibi perierit: non negliges.
verses.english: You must do the same for a donkey, a piece of clothing, and any lost thing belonging to your fellow Israelite that you find. You must not neglect any such thing.

verses.latin: Non videbis asinum fratris tui, aut bovem corruentem in via, et quasi non ad te pertineat, pertransibis: sed sublevabis eum.
verses.english: You must not see your fellow Israelite’s donkey or ox collapsed on the road and walk by as if it does not concern you. Instead, you must help the animal get back up.

verses.latin: Non induetur mulier veste virili, nec vir utetur veste feminea: abominabilis enim apud Deum est qui facit hæc.
verses.english: A woman must not wear men’s clothing, nor may a man wear women’s clothing. Whoever does such things is an abomination to God.

verses.latin: Si ambulans per viam, in arbore vel in terra nidum avis inveneris, et matrem pullis vel ovis desuper incubantem: non sumes matrem cum filiis,
verses.english: If, while walking along the road, you find a bird’s nest in a tree or on the ground with a mother bird sitting on her young or on her eggs, you must not take the mother along with the young.

verses.latin: sed abire patieris eam, et pullos tolles tibi: ut bene sit tibi, et longiori vivas tempore.
verses.english: Instead, you must let the mother bird fly away, and then you may take the young for yourself. This command ensures your well-being and a long life.

verses.latin: Quando ædificas domum novam, facies murum tecti per circuitum: ne si forte ceciderit aliquis, et macula sanguinis ejus sit in domo tua.
verses.english: When you build a new house, you must build a parapet wall around the edge of the roof. This is to prevent anyone from falling off the roof, so that you do not incur the guilt of bloodshed in your home.

verses.latin: Non seres vineam tuam diverso semine: ne et quod serueris, et ex vinea nasci poterit, sanctificetur.
verses.english: You must not plant your vineyard with two different kinds of seeds. If you do, both the crop you sow and the produce from the vines will be declared holy and therefore forbidden to you.

verses.latin: Non arabis simul in bove et asino.
verses.english: You must not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together.

verses.latin: Non indueris vestimento quod ex lana et lino textum est simul.
verses.english: You must not wear clothing made of wool and linen woven together.

verses.latin: Funiculos in fimbriis facies per quatuor angulos pallii tui, quo operiris.
verses.english: You must make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear.

verses.latin: Si acceperit homo uxorem, et post coitum odio habuerit eam,
verses.english: If a man takes a wife, and after having relations with her, he comes to hate her,

verses.latin: atque impegerit ei crimen pessimum, et famam detraxerit dicens: Uxorem hanc accepi, et ingressus ad eam, non inveni in ea virginitatis signa:
verses.english: and he accuses her of a terrible crime and slanders her, saying, 'I took this woman as my wife, and when I had relations with her, I found no evidence that she was a virgin!'

verses.latin: parentes puellæ, et testes ejus, assument signa virginitatis ejus, et afferent ad seniores urbis, qui sedent in porta:
verses.english: then the girl’s parents and her witnesses must gather the evidence of her virginity and bring it to the elders of the city, who are seated at the city gate.

verses.latin: et dicent eis: Hanc filiam nostram dedimus huic viro uxorem, et quod odio habet eam,
verses.english: And they must say to the elders, 'We gave our daughter to this man as his wife. Now he hates her,

verses.latin: imposuit ei crimen pessimum, ut diceret: Non inveni filiam tuam virginem: et hæc sunt signa virginitatis filiæ meæ. Expandentque vestimentum coram senioribus civitatis.
verses.english: and has accused her of a terrible crime, saying, 'I found your daughter was not a virgin.' But here is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity!—and they must spread the garment before the elders of the city.

verses.latin: Caudent igitur senes civitatis illius virum illum, et multabunt centum siclis argenti, quas dabunt patri puellæ,
verses.english: Therefore, the elders of that city must take the man and publicly beat him. They must also fine him one hundred silver shekels, which they must give to the girl’s father,

verses.latin: quia diffamavit nomen pessimum super virginem ex Israel. Et uxorem habere non poterit, omni tempore vitæ suæ.
verses.english: because he slandered an Israelite virgin. He will not be permitted to divorce her for the rest of his life.

verses.latin: Quod si verum est, quod objecit, et non sunt inventa virginitatis indicia in puella,
verses.english: However, if the accusation he made is true, and no evidence of virginity is found in the girl,

verses.latin: ejicient eam de foribus domus paternæ, et lapidibus opprimet eam populus civitatis illius, et morietur: quoniam fecerit nefas in Israel, ut fornicaretur in domo patris sui: et auferes malum de medio tui.
verses.english: then they must bring her out to the entrance of her father’s house, and the men of her city must stone her to death. She has committed an outrage in Israel by defiling herself through fornication while still in her father’s house. You must remove this evil from your midst.

verses.latin: Si dormierit homo cum uxore alterius, uterque morietur, id est, adulter, et adultera: et auferes malum de Israel.
verses.english: If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both of them—the adulterer and the adulteress—must be put to death. You must remove this evil from Israel.

verses.latin: Si puellam virginem desponsatam, vir aliquis in civitate repererit, et concubuerit cum ea:
verses.english: If a man finds a virgin girl who is betrothed to another man within a city, and he lies with her,

verses.latin: ambos ad portas civitatis illius duces, et lapidibus opprimes, atque morientur: puellam quidem, quia non clamavit cum esset in urbe: virum vero, quia humiliavit uxorem proximi sui: et auferes malum de medio tui.
verses.english: you must bring both of them to the city gate and stone them to death. The girl must die because she did not cry out for help, even though she was in the city. The man must die because he violated his neighbor’s betrothed wife. You must remove this evil from your midst.

verses.latin: Si autem in agro vir invenerit puellam desponsatam, et apprehendens concubuerit cum ea, ipse morietur solus:
verses.english: But if a man finds a betrothed girl in the open country and seizes her and lies with her, then only the man who lay with her must be put to death.

verses.latin: puella nihil patietur, nec est rea mortis: quoniam sicut latro insidiatur homini, et sic puella passa est.
verses.english: The girl is innocent and deserves no punishment of death, because this crime is like a man ambushing and murdering another man. That is how the girl suffered.

verses.latin: Sola cum esset in agro, clamavit, et nemo affuit qui liberaret.
verses.english: She was alone in the open country, she cried out, but there was no one to rescue her.

verses.latin: Si invenerit homo puellam virginem, quæ non est desponsata, et apprehendens concubuerit cum ea, et fuerit deprehensus:
verses.english: If a man finds a virgin girl who is not betrothed, and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,

verses.latin: dabit qui dormivit cum ea, patri puellæ, quinquaginta siclos argenti, et ipsam habebit uxorem, quia humiliavit illam: non poterit dimittere eam, omnibus diebus vitæ suæ.
verses.english: the man who lay with her must pay the girl’s father fifty silver shekels. He must also take the girl as his wife, because he violated her, and he will not be permitted to divorce her for the rest of his life.

verses.latin: Non accipiet homo uxorem patris sui, nec revelabit operimentum ejus.
verses.english: A man must not marry his father’s wife, nor may he have sexual relations with her.

verses.latin: Non videbis bovem fratris tui, aut ovem errantem, et quasi non pertineat ad te, parvum ne facias, sed reduc illud ad fratrem tuum.
verses.english: You must not see your kinsman's ox or sheep wandering away and ignore it as if it isn't your concern. Instead, you must bring it back to your kinsman.

verses.latin: Quod si non est frater tuus prope, nec nosti eum: in domum tuam introduc, et sit apud te, donec requirat eum frater tuus, et reddas illi.
verses.english: But if your kinsman isn't nearby, or if you don't know who the owner is, then you must bring the animal to your own house. Keep it with you there until your kinsman comes looking for it, and then you must return it to him.

verses.latin: Similiter facies de asino et de vestimento et de omni re fratris tui quae perierit: et inveneris, non negleges.
verses.english: You must do the same for your kinsman's donkey, or his garment, or any other lost property of your kinsman. If you find something, you must not neglect it or pretend you didn't see it.

verses.latin: Non videbis asinum aut bovem fratris tui cadere in via, et quasi nihil ad te pertineat, praeteribis: sed sublevabis eum.
verses.english: You must not see your kinsman's donkey or ox collapsed on the road and just walk by as if it's none of your business. Instead, you must help him lift it up.

verses.latin: Non induetur mulier veste virili, nec vir utetur veste feminea: abominabilis est enim apud Deum omnis qui facit haec.
verses.english: A woman must not wear men's clothing, nor must a man wear women's clothing. For all who do these things are utterly detestable in the sight of God.

verses.latin: Si inveneris in via, et in arbore, vel in terra nidum avis, et matrem super pullis, vel ovis, non accipies matrem cum filiis:
verses.english: If you find a bird's nest on the road, or in a tree, or on the ground, with the mother bird sitting on chicks or eggs, you must not take the mother with her young.

verses.latin: sed abire permitte matrem, et pullos tibi sume, ut bene sit tibi, et longiori vivas tempore.
verses.english: But you must allow the mother to fly away, and then you may take the young for yourself, so that it may go well with you and you may live a long time.

verses.latin: Cum aedificaveris domum novam, facies murum in tecto tuo, ne si forte ceciderit aliquis, et macula sanguinis maneat in domo tua.
verses.english: When you build a new house, you must build a parapet or railing around your roof. This is to ensure that if someone falls from it, the guilt of bloodshed will not rest upon your house.

verses.latin: Non seras vineam tuam diverso semine, ne et sementis quam serueris, et de vinea cuncta reddantur.
verses.english: You must not sow your vineyard with two different kinds of seed. If you do, the entire harvest—both the crop you planted and the fruit of the vineyard—will become consecrated for God, meaning it will be forfeited.

verses.latin: Non arabis in bove et asino simul.
verses.english: You must not plow with an ox and a donkey harnessed together.

verses.latin: Non indueris vestimento quod ex lana linoque contextum est.
verses.english: You must not wear clothing woven from wool and linen together.

verses.latin: Funiculos in fimbriis facies per quatuor angulos pallii tui, quo operiris.
verses.english: You must make cords or tassels on the four corners of the cloak with which you cover yourself.

verses.latin: Si acceperit homo uxorem, et postquam coierit cum ea, oderit eam,
verses.english: If a man takes a wife, and after having relations with her, he comes to hate her,

verses.latin: affingens ei causas turpitudinis, et dixerit: Uxorem hanc accepi, et ingressus ad eam, non inveni in ea signa virginitatis ejus:
verses.english: and then he invents disgraceful accusations against her, saying: "I took this woman as my wife, and when I went in to her, I did not find in her the signs of her virginity—meaning, proof that she was a virgin before our marriage."

verses.latin: tollent patrem et matrem puellae, et deferent secum signa virginitatis ejus ad seniores urbis, qui sedent in porta.
verses.english: Then the father and mother of the young woman must take the proof of her virginity and bring it with them to the elders of the city, who sit in the gate for judgment.

verses.latin: Et dicet pater: Filiam meam dedi huic viro uxorem, et quia odit eam,
verses.english: And the father will say: "I gave my daughter to this man as his wife, but now he hates her,"

verses.latin: imponit ei verba blasphemiae, dicens: Non inveni filiam tuam virginem. Et haec sunt signa virginitatis filiae meae. Expandent vestimentum coram senioribus civitatis:
verses.english: and he has falsely accused her, saying: "I did not find your daughter to be a virgin." But here is the proof of my daughter's virginity." And they will spread the garment before the elders of the city.

verses.latin: Assumentque senes urbis illius virum illum, et verberabunt.
verses.english: Then the elders of that city must take that man and punish him with lashes.

verses.latin: Mulctabunt insuper centum aureis, quos dabit patri puellae, eo quod diffamaverit nomen pessimum super virginem Israel: et uxorem habere perget, nec poterit eam dimittere omnibus diebus vitae suae.
verses.english: Moreover, they must fine him one hundred pieces of gold, which he must give to the young woman's father. This is because he defamed a virgin of Israel with a wicked accusation. He must also continue to have her as his wife and will not be permitted to divorce her for all the days of his life.

verses.latin: Quod si verum est, et non sunt inventa virginitatis indicia in puella:
verses.english: But if the accusation is true, and the proofs of virginity were not found in the young woman:

verses.latin: ejicient eam de foribus domus patris sui, et lapidibus oppriment viri civitatis ejus, et morietur: quoniam fecerit nefas in Israel, ut fornicaretur in domo patris sui: et auferes malum de medio tui.
verses.english: Then they must bring her out to the entrance of her father's house, and the men of her city must stone her to death. This is because she committed an outrageous act in Israel by committing fornication while in her father's house. Thus, you must remove such wickedness from among you.

verses.latin: Si dormierit homo cum uxore alterius viri, uterque morietur, id est, adulter et adultera: et auferes malum de Israel.
verses.english: If a man is caught sleeping with another man's wife, both of them must die—that is, both the adulterer and the adulteress. Thus, you must remove such wickedness from Israel.

verses.latin: Si puella virgo desponsata fuerit viro, et invenerit eam aliquis in civitate, et concubuerit cum ea:
verses.english: If a young woman, a virgin, is engaged to a man, and someone finds her in the city and has relations with her:

verses.latin: Ambo ad portas civitatis ejus ducentur, et lapidibus opprimentur: puella quidem, quia non clamavit cum esset in urbe: vir autem, quia humiliavit uxorem proximi sui: et auferes malum de medio tui.
verses.english: Both of them must be brought to the gate of that city, and they must be stoned to death. The young woman must die because she did not cry out for help, even though she was in the city. The man must die because he violated his kinsman's betrothed wife. Thus, you must remove such wickedness from among you.

verses.latin: Quod si in agro invenerit homo puellam desponsatam, et apprehendens concubuerit cum ea, ipse morietur solus:
verses.english: However, if a man finds an engaged young woman in the open country and seizes her and has relations with her, then only the man must die.

verses.latin: puella nihil patietur, nec est rea mortis: quoniam sicut latro insidiatur homini, et animum ejus violenter invadit, ita et puella passa est.
verses.english: The young woman will suffer no punishment and is not guilty of death. This is because she is like a man who is ambushed by a robber and violently attacked—just so, the young woman suffered this violence.

verses.latin: Clamavit, et non erat qui salveret.
verses.english: She cried out for help, but there was no one to rescue her.

verses.latin: Si invenerit homo puellam virginem, quae non est desponsata, et apprehendens concubuerit cum ea, et fuerit deprehensus:
verses.english: If a man finds a young virgin woman who is not engaged, and he seizes her and has relations with her, and he is caught in the act:

verses.latin: dabit qui dormivit cum ea, patri puellae quinquaginta siclos argenti, et habebit eam uxorem, quia humiliavit illam, non poterit dimittere eam omnibus diebus vitae suae.
verses.english: Then the man who had relations with her must give the young woman's father fifty pieces of silver. He must also take her as his wife, because he violated her, and he will not be permitted to divorce her for all the days of his life.

verses.latin: Non accipiet homo uxorem patris sui, nec revelabit operimentum ejus.
verses.english: A man must not take his father's wife as his own, nor uncover her father's nakedness. This means he must not have sexual relations with her.

verses.latin: Non intrabit eunuchus, attritis vel amputatis testiculis, et abscisso veretro, in Ecclesiam Domini.
verses.english: A man who has had his testicles crushed or cut off, or his penis cut off, shall not enter the assembly of the Lord’s people.

verses.latin: Non intrabit mamzer, id est de scorto natus, in Ecclesiam Domini, usque ad decimam generationem.
verses.english: A mamzer—that is, a child born from an unchaste woman or an illicit union—shall not enter the assembly of the Lord, not even to the tenth generation.

verses.latin: Ammonites et Moabitæ non intrabunt Ecclesiam Domini, usque in decimam generationem, et ultra in æternum:
verses.english: The Ammonites and the Moabites shall not enter the assembly of the Lord, not even to the tenth generation, and even beyond that, forever.

verses.latin: quia non occurrerunt vobis cum pane et aqua in via quando egrediebamini de Ægypto: et quia conduxerunt contra te Balaam filium Beor de Mesopotamia Syriæ, ut malediceret tibi:
verses.english: This is because they did not come out to meet you with bread and water on the road when you were coming out of Egypt. And also because they hired Balaam, the son of Beor, from Mesopotamia of Syria, to curse you.

verses.latin: et noluit Dominus Deus tuus audire Balaam, vertitque maledictionem ejus in benedictionem tuam, propterea quod diligeret te.
verses.english: However, the Lord your God would not listen to Balaam, and He turned Balaam’s curse into a blessing for you, because the Lord loved you.

verses.latin: Non facies cum eis pacem, nec fœdus unquam in sempiternum.
verses.english: You shall never make peace with them, nor any alliance, forever.

verses.latin: Non abominaberis Idumæum, quia frater tuus est: nec Ægyptium, quia advena fuisti in terra ejus.
verses.english: You shall not detest an Edomite, because he is your brother. Nor shall you detest an Egyptian, because you were once an immigrant in his land.

verses.latin: Filii qui eis nati fuerint, in tertia generatione intrabunt Ecclesiam Domini.
verses.english: The children who are born to them in the third generation may enter the assembly of the Lord.

verses.latin: Quando egressus fueris ad pugnam contra inimicos tuos, custodies te ab omni re mala.
verses.english: When you go out to battle against your enemies, you shall guard yourself from every wicked thing.

verses.latin: Si fuerit inter vos homo qui nocturno pollutus sit somno, egredietur extra castra, et non revertetur priusquam lavetur aqua:
verses.english: If there is any man among you who has become unclean from a nocturnal emission—a wet dream—he shall go outside the camp and shall not return until he has washed himself with water.

verses.latin: et post solis occasum, et ablutus omni spurcitia, ingredietur in castra.
verses.english: And after sunset, having washed away all impurity, he may re-enter the camp.

verses.latin: Locum habebis extra castra ad eas necessitates naturæ, quæ munditiæ sunt aptæ:
verses.english: You shall have a designated place outside the camp for the necessities of nature, a place suitable for cleanliness.

verses.latin: habebisque paxillum in balteo tuo, et cum sedebis foras, fodies in terra, et operies quidquid ejeceris:
verses.english: You shall also have a digging tool among your provisions, and when you sit outside the camp for defecation, you shall dig in the ground and cover whatever you have expelled.

verses.latin: quia Dominus Deus tuus ambulat in medio castrorum tuorum, ut liberet te, et tradat tibi inimicos tuos: et castra tua erunt sancta, et nihil apparebit in eis fœditatis, ne derelinquat te.
verses.english: For the Lord your God walks in the midst of your camp to deliver you and to hand over your enemies to you. Therefore, your camp must be holy, and nothing indecent or impure shall appear in it, lest God abandon you.

verses.latin: Si confugerit ad te servus, qui dominum suum fugerit, non trades eum domino suo:
verses.english: If a servant who has fled his master seeks refuge with you, you shall not hand him over to his master.

verses.latin: sed morabitur tecum in loco qui ei placuerit, et in una urbium tuarum, ubi voluerit: nec contristabis eum.
verses.english: Instead, he shall remain with you in the place that pleases him and in one of your cities, wherever he desires. You shall not oppress him.

verses.latin: Non erit meretrix de filiabus Israël, nec scortator de filiis Israël.
verses.english: There shall be no harlot among the daughters of Israel, nor any male prostitute among the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Non offeres mercedem prostibuli, nec pretium canis, in domum Domini Dei tui, quicquid illud est quod voveris: quia abominabile est utrumque apud Dominum Deum tuum.
verses.english: You shall not bring the wages of a prostitute, nor the price of a dog, into the house of the Lord your God, no matter what you have vowed. For both of these are detestable to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Non fœnerabis fratri tuo ad usuram pecuniam, nec fruges, nec quamlibet aliam rem:
verses.english: You shall not lend money to your brother at interest, nor grain, nor any other thing.

verses.latin: sed alieno. Fratri autem tuo absque usura quod indiget commodabis: ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere tuo, in terra ad quam ingredieris possidendam.
verses.english: But you may lend to a foreigner. To your brother, however, you shall lend without charging interest, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all your work in the land which you are entering to possess.

verses.latin: Cum voveris votum Domino Deo tuo, non tardabis reddere: quia requiret illud Dominus Deus tuus, et si moratus fueris, reputabitur tibi in peccatum.
verses.english: When you make a vow to the Lord your God, you shall not delay fulfilling it. For the Lord your God will surely require it of you, and if you delay, it will be counted as a sin for you.

verses.latin: Si nolueris polliceri, absque peccato eris.
verses.english: If you choose not to make a promise by vowing, you will be without sin.

verses.latin: Quod egressum est de labiis tuis, custodies, et facies sicut promisisti Domino Deo tuo, et propria voluntate et ore locutus es.
verses.english: Whatever has come out of your lips, you shall keep and perform, just as you promised to the Lord your God, for you spoke it of your own free will and with your own mouth.

verses.latin: Ingressus vineam proximi tui, comede uvas quantum tibi placuerit, non tamen asportes: nec uvas, nec ficus de ejus arboribus.
verses.english: When you enter your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat grapes as much as you like to satisfy yourself, but you shall not carry any away from the vineyard.

verses.latin: Si intraveris segetes amici tui, poteris vellere spicas, et confricare manu: falce autem non metes.
verses.english: If you enter your friend’s standing grain field, you may pluck heads of grain and rub them in your hand, but you shall not use a sickle to harvest his grain.

verses.latin: Si acceperit homo uxorem, et habuerit eam, et non invenerit gratiam ante oculos ejus propter aliquam fœditatem: scribet libellum repudii, et dabit in manu ejus, et dimittet eam de domo sua.
verses.english: If a man takes a wife and marries her, but she does not find favor in his eyes because he has found some indecency in her—a shameful act that makes her displeasing to him—then he must write a certificate of divorce for her, put it in her hand, and send her out of his house.

verses.latin: Cumque egressa fuerit, et recesserit ab eo, et acceperit virum alterum:
verses.english: And when she has left him and gone from him, and taken another husband,

verses.latin: et ille quoque oderit eam, et dederit ei libellum repudii, et dimiserit de domo sua, vel certe mortuus fuerit:
verses.english: and if that second husband also dislikes her and gives her a certificate of divorce, sending her out of his house—or if this second husband dies,

verses.latin: non poterit prior maritus recipere eam in uxorem: quia polluta est, et abominabilis facta est ante Dominum: ne peccato oneres terram tuam, quam Dominus Deus tuus traditurus est tibi possidendam.
verses.english: then her first husband cannot take her back as his wife, because she has been defiled and has become abominable before the Lord. You must not allow such a sin to pollute your land, which the Lord your God is about to give you as an inheritance.

verses.latin: Cum acceperit homo uxorem novam, non procedet ad bellum, nec ei quippiam necessitatis imponetur publicæ, sed vacabit absque culpa domi suæ uno anno, et lætificabit uxorem suam quam duxit.
verses.english: When a man takes a new wife, he shall not go out to war, nor shall any public duty be imposed upon him. He must be free from any obligation at home for one year, and he shall make his wife whom he has taken happy.

verses.latin: Non accipies in pignus inferiorem et superiorem molam, nec fullonem: quia animam suam oppignoravit.
verses.english: You shall not take the lower and upper millstones as a pledge—the grinding equipment necessary for daily bread—nor a fulling mill; for that would be taking a man's very livelihood as a pledge, which is like taking his soul.

verses.latin: Si deprehensus fuerit homo sollicitans fratrem suum de filiis Israël, et vendens illo, accepta pecunia: morietur, et auferes malum de medio vestri.
verses.english: If a man is found kidnapping one of his brothers from the children of Israel, and selling him, or if he is found exploiting him for profit, that kidnapper must die. You are to remove this evil from among you.

verses.latin: Observa diligenter ne incurras plagam lepræ, sed facies quæcumque docuerint te sacerdotes Levitici generis, juxta id quod præcepi eis, et implebis.
verses.english: Be very careful to observe the laws concerning leprosy. Do everything the Levitical priests instruct you, just as I commanded them, and fulfill their instructions fully.

verses.latin: Mementote quæ fecerit Dominus Deus vester Mariæ in via cum egrederemini de Ægypto.
verses.english: Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam—Moses' sister—on the way when you came out of Egypt.

verses.latin: Cum pecuniam mutuam dederis proximo tuo, non ingredieris domum ejus ut pignus auferas:
verses.english: When you lend money to your neighbor, you shall not enter his house to take a pledge from him.

verses.latin: sed stabis foris, et ille tibi proferet quod habuerit.
verses.english: Instead, you must stand outside, and he himself shall bring you what he has as a pledge.

verses.latin: Sin autem pauper est, non pernoctabit apud te pignus ejus,
verses.english: If, however, the borrower is a poor man, his pledge shall not remain with you overnight.

verses.latin: sed statim reddes ei vesperi, ut dormiens in vestimento suo benedicat tibi, et justitia reputetur tibi coram Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: You must return it to him at sunset, so that he may sleep in his garment and bless you. This act of justice will be counted to you before the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Non negabis mercedem mercenarii pauperis, et inopis, sive fratris tui, sive advenæ qui tecum moratur in terra tua:
verses.english: You shall not deny payment to a poor and needy hired servant, whether he is one of your own brothers or an alien residing with you in your land.

verses.latin: sed eadem die reddes ei pretium laboris sui, ante solis occubitum: quia pauper est, et in eo suspendit animam suam: ne clamet ad Dominum adversum te, et reputetur tibi in peccatum.
verses.english: But on the very same day, you must pay him his wages before the sun sets, for he is poor and depends on that money for his very life. If you do not pay him, he may cry out to the Lord against you, and it will be counted as a sin to you.

verses.latin: Non occidentur patres pro filiis, neque filii pro patribus suis, sed unusquisque pro peccato suo morietur.
verses.english: Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor shall children be put to death for their fathers. Each person shall die for his own sin.

verses.latin: Non pervertes judicium advenæ et pupilli, nec auferes pignus viduæ:
verses.english: You shall not pervert the justice due to an alien or an orphan, nor shall you take a widow's garment as a pledge.

verses.latin: sed memento quod servieris in Ægypto, et liberaverit te Dominus Deus tuus inde: idcirco præcipio tibi ut facias hanc rem.
verses.english: But remember that you were once slaves in Egypt, and the Lord your God delivered you from there. Therefore, I command you to do this thing—to show justice and mercy to the vulnerable.

verses.latin: Quando messueris segetem in agro tuo, et oblitus manipuli in agro, non revertaris ut tollas illud: sed advenam, et pupillum, et viduam relinques, ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere manuum tuarum.
verses.english: When you reap your harvest in your field and forget a sheaf of grain there, do not go back to get it. Leave it for the alien, the orphan, and the widow, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.

verses.latin: Si excutias olivas tuas, non revisites quidquid remansit in arboribus, sed capies advenam, et pupillum, et viduam.
verses.english: When you beat your olive trees to gather their fruit, do not go over the branches a second time. Leave whatever remains on the trees for the alien, the orphan, and the widow.

verses.latin: Si vindemiaveris vineam tuam, non colliges remaneates racemos, sed advenæ, et pupillo, ac viduæ cedere permittes.
verses.english: When you gather the grapes from your vineyard, do not collect the remaining clusters. You must allow them to go to the alien, the orphan, and the widow.

verses.latin: Mementote quod et vos servi fueritis in Ægypto, et idcirco præcipio tibi ut facias hanc rem.
verses.english: Remember that you also were slaves in Egypt, and for that reason, I command you to do this thing—to care for the needy as you were once cared for.

verses.latin: Si acceperit homo uxorem, et habuerit eam, et non invenerit gratiam ante oculos ejus propter aliquam fœditatem: scribet libellum repudii, et dabit in manu illius, et dimittet eam de domo sua.
verses.english:
If a man takes a woman as his wife and marries her,
and she does not find favor in his eyes because of some indecency or moral defect discovered in her,
then he is to write a bill of divorce.
He must give this document into her hand,
and then he is to send her out of his house.

verses.latin: Cumque egressa fuerit, et recesserit ab eo, et junxerit se viro alteri:
verses.english:
And when she has gone out from him and departed,
and then has joined herself in marriage to another man,

verses.latin: et ille quoque oderit eam, et scripserit ei libellum repudii, dederitque in manu illius, et dimiserit de domo sua, vel certe si mortuus fuerit:
verses.english:
and that man also comes to detest her,
and has written her a bill of divorce, and given it into her hand, and sent her out of his house—
or if that man has died certainly,

verses.latin: non poterit prior maritus recipere eam in uxorem: quia polluta est, et abominabilis facta est coram Domino, ne peccatum inducas super terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus tradet tibi possidendam.
verses.english:
then the former husband will not be able to take her back as his wife,
because she is now defiled, and has become an abomination before the Lord.
You must not bring such a sin upon the land
which the Lord your God is giving you to possess.

verses.latin: Si quis duxerit nuper uxorem, non procedet ad bellum, nec ei quippiam necessitatis imponetur, sed vacabit absque culpa domi suæ uno anno, ut delectet uxorem suam quam duxit.
verses.english:
If a man has recently married a wife,
he shall not go out to war, nor shall any compulsory service be imposed upon him.
Instead, he shall be free from all obligations at his home for one year,
so that he may bring joy to the wife whom he has taken.

verses.latin: Non accipies in pignus inferiorem et superiorem molam, neque fullonem: quia animam suam oppignoravit.
verses.english:
You shall not take as security the lower or upper millstone,
nor the implements of a fuller (which are essential for his work),
because by doing so, one pledges a person's very means of life itself.

verses.latin: Si deprehensus fuerit homo, sollicitans fratrem suum de filiis Israël, et vendens illo pretio, accepta pecunia: auferetur, et occidetur. Et auferes malum de medio tui.
verses.english:
If a man is caught kidnapping one of his brothers from among the children of Israel,
and then sells him for a price, having received money for him,
that man shall be taken away and put to death.
Thus, you shall remove this evil from your midst.

verses.latin: Observa diligenter ne incurras plagam lepræ, sed facies omnia quæ docuerunt te sacerdotes Levitici generis, juxta id quod præcepi eis, et implebis atque facies.
verses.english:
Take careful heed that you do not contract the plague of leprosy.
You must do everything that the priests of the Levitical lineage have taught you.
You shall diligently fulfill and carry out everything according to what I have commanded them.

verses.latin: Memento quid fecerit Dominus Deus tuus Mariæ in via cum egrederemini de Ægypto.
verses.english:
Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam (the sister of Moses) on the journey,
when you were coming out of Egypt.

verses.latin: Cum pecuniam mutuam dederis proximo tuo, non ingredieris domum ejus ut pignus auferas:
verses.english:
When you lend money to your neighbor,
you shall not enter his house to take a pledge (or collateral).

verses.latin: sed stabis foris, et ipse proferet ad te quod habuerit.
verses.english:
Instead, you shall stand outside,
and he himself shall bring out to you whatever he has for a pledge.

verses.latin: Si pauper est, non pernoctabit pignus apud te:
verses.english:
If he is a poor man,
the pledge (such as a garment needed for warmth) shall not remain with you overnight.

verses.latin: sed statim reddes ei vesperi, ut dormiens in vestimento suo, benedicat tibi, et sit tibi justitia coram Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english:
But you shall immediately return it to him in the evening,
so that when he sleeps in his own garment, he may bless you.
This act of mercy will be counted as righteousness for you before the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Non contristabis mercenarium pauperem et inopem, sive de fratribus tuis, sive de advenis, qui tecum morantur in terra tua:
verses.english:
You shall not oppress a poor and needy hired servant,
whether he is one of your own people,
or a foreigner who dwells with you in your land.

verses.latin: sed eadem die reddes ei mercedem laboris sui, ante solis occasum, quia pauper est, et in eo sustentat animam suam: ne clamet adversum te ad Dominum, et reputetur tibi in peccatum.
verses.english:
But on the very same day, you shall pay him his wages before the sun sets,
because he is poor and depends on it to sustain his very life.
Otherwise, he might cry out against you to the Lord,
and it will be counted as a sin for you.

verses.latin: Non occidetur pater pro filio, nec filius pro patre, sed unusquisque pro peccato suo morietur.
verses.english:
A father shall not be put to death for the sin of his son,
nor shall a son be put to death for the sin of his father.
Each person shall die for his own sin.

verses.latin: Non pervertes judicium advenæ et pupilli, nec auferes pignoris loco viduæ vestimentum.
verses.english:
You shall not pervert the justice due to a foreigner or an orphan,
nor shall you take a widow's garment as a pledge (for it is her only covering).

verses.latin: Memento quod servieris in Ægypto, et eruerit te Dominus Deus tuus inde: idcirco præcipio tibi ut facias hanc rem.
verses.english:
Remember that you yourselves were slaves in Egypt,
and the Lord your God delivered you from there (from your slavery).
Therefore, I command you to do this thing (to care for the vulnerable).

verses.latin: Quando messueris segetem in agro tuo, et oblitus spicam reliqueris, non revertes iterum ut tollas eam: sed advenam, et pupillum, et viduam, esse permittes, ut benedicat tibi Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere manuum tuarum.
verses.english:
When you reap your harvest in your field,
and have forgotten a sheaf of grain and left it behind,
you shall not return again to take it.
Instead, you shall leave it for the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow to gather,
so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.

verses.latin: Si excusseris olivas tuas, non revisites quid remanserit in arboribus: sed advenæ, pupillo, ac viduæ relinques.
verses.english:
When you beat down the fruit from your olive trees,
you shall not go back again to gather what remains on the branches.
Instead, you shall leave it for the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow.

verses.latin: Si vindemiaveris vineam tuam, non colliges remanentes racemos: sed inquilino, et pupillo, ac viduæ dimittes.
verses.english:
When you gather the grapes from your vineyard,
you shall not collect the remaining clusters of grapes.
Instead, you shall leave them for the resident foreigner, the orphan, and the widow.

verses.latin: Memento quod et tu servieris in Ægypto: et idcirco præcipio tibi ut facias hanc rem.
verses.english:
Remember that you yourselves were also slaves in Egypt,
and therefore I command you to do this thing (to care for the needy).

verses.latin: Si fuerit inter viros quaestio, et judicia inter eos, justumque judicaverint, et condemnaverint impium, innocentem vero absolverint:
verses.english: If a legal dispute arises between men, and a judgment is needed to resolve it, and the judges render a just verdict, declaring the guilty party condemned and the innocent party absolved:

verses.latin: si noxius fuerit verberibus dignus, prosternet judex eum, et fustibus caedi faciet coram se, pro mensura peccati, et modo caedendi.
verses.english: If the guilty party is deserving of physical punishment, the judge must have him laid down and beaten with rods in his presence, according to the severity of his sin and the manner of the beating.

verses.latin: Quadraginta vicibus percutiet, et non addet ultra: ne foedissime laceratus, ultra modum humanum plagarum, turpis apparere videatur frater tuus.
verses.english: The punishment must not exceed forty blows, so that your brother, the one receiving the punishment, is not too severely disgraced and disfigured beyond what is humanely bearable.

verses.latin: Non ligabis os bovis terentis in area fruges tuas.
verses.english: You must not muzzle an ox while it is threshing your grain in the threshing floor, for it deserves to eat from the fruits of its labor.

verses.latin: Quando habitaverint fratres simul, et unus ex eis absque liberis mortuus fuerit, uxor defuncti non nubet alteri: sed accipiet eam frater ejus, et suscitabit semen fratris sui, vocabitque nomen illius.
verses.english: When brothers live together and one of them dies without having children, his widow must not marry an outsider. Instead, her late husband’s brother must marry her to raise up an heir for his deceased brother's lineage, and the firstborn son they have together will be named after the deceased brother.

verses.latin: Si noluerit accipere uxorem fratris sui, quae ei lege debetur, vadet mulier ad portam civitatis, et interpellabit majores natu, et dicet: Noluit frater viri mei suscitare nomen fratris sui in Israel, nec vult me uxorem accipere.
verses.english: If the brother refuses to marry his deceased brother’s wife, as he is legally bound to do, the woman must go to the city gate and appeal to the elders, declaring: 'My husband’s brother refuses to perpetuate his brother’s name in Israel, and he will not take me as his wife.'

verses.latin: Et statim accersiri facient eum, interrogabuntque. Si responderit: Nolo eam accipere uxorem:
verses.english: The elders will immediately summon him and question him. If he replies: 'I do not wish to marry her as my wife:'

verses.latin: accedet mulier ad eum in conspectu seniorum, et tollet calceamentum de pede ejus, et conspuet in faciem illius, dicetque: Sic fiet homini qui non ædificat domum fratris sui.
verses.english: Then the woman must approach him in the presence of the elders, and she will remove his sandal from his foot, and spit in his face, saying: 'This is what happens to the man who refuses to build up his brother’s household and continue his legacy.'

verses.latin: Et vocabitur nomen illius in Israel, domus discalceati.
verses.english: And in Israel, his family name will forever be known as 'the house of the one who lost his sandal,' marking his failure to fulfill his duty.

verses.latin: Si rixati fuerint viri duo, et voluerit uxor unius eruere virum suum de manu fortioris, extenditque manum, et apprehendit pudenda ejus:
verses.english: If two men are fighting, and the wife of one of them tries to rescue her husband from the stronger man by reaching out her hand and grabbing his private parts:

verses.latin: abscides manum illius, nec parces ei.
verses.english: You must cut off her hand, showing her no pity for such an indecent and aggressive act.

verses.latin: Non habebis in sacculo tuo pondus diversum, majus et minus.
verses.english: You must not keep two different kinds of weights in your bag, a heavier one for buying and a lighter one for selling, for such dishonesty is an abomination.

verses.latin: Nec erit in domo tua modius major et minor.
verses.english: And you must not have two different kinds of measures in your house, a larger one for buying and a smaller one for selling.

verses.latin: Pondus justum et verum habebis, et modium æqualem et verum erit tibi, ut multo vivas tempore super terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi.
verses.english: You must always have honest and accurate weights and measures. This practice will ensure you live a long time in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.

verses.latin: Abominatur enim Dominus Deus tuus eum, qui facit hæc, et aversus est ab omni iniquitate.
verses.english: For the Lord your God detests anyone who commits such injustices, for He is fundamentally opposed to all wickedness and dishonesty.

verses.latin: Non habebis in sacculo tuo pondus diversum, majus et minus.
verses.english: You must not keep two different kinds of weights in your bag, a heavier one for buying and a lighter one for selling, for such dishonesty is an abomination.

verses.latin: Memento quid fecerit tibi Amalec in via, quando egrediebaris de Ægypto:
verses.english: Remember what the Amalekites did to you on your journey when you were coming out of Egypt.

verses.latin: quomodo occurrerit tibi, et omnes extremos agminis tui, qui lassitudine defecerant, conciderit, quando tu eras esuriens et sitiens, et absque ulla Dei timore.
verses.english: Remember how they attacked you along the way, striking down all the stragglers at the very rear of your column who were exhausted and faltering, while you were hungry and thirsty, and they did this without any fear of God.

verses.latin: Cum ergo Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi requiem, et subjugaverit omnes per circuitum nationes in terra quam tibi daturus est: delebis nomen ejus sub cælo. Cave ne obliviscaris.
verses.english: Therefore, when the Lord your God grants you rest from all your enemies surrounding you in the land He is giving you as an inheritance, you must completely wipe out the memory of the Amalekites from under the sky. Make sure you never forget this command.

verses.latin: Cum ingressus fueris terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus tibi daturus est possidendam, et occupaveris eam, atque habitaveris in ea:
verses.english: When you finally enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess, and you have taken it over and settled down there to live in it:

verses.latin: tolles de cunctis primitiis frugum terrae tuae, quas oblatus fueris de terra tua, quam Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi, et pones in corbe, ac perges ad locum, quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut in eo nomen ejus invocetur:
verses.english: you are to take some of the first fruits of all the produce of your land that you harvest from the land the Lord your God has given you. Put them in a basket, and go to the specific place that the Lord your God will choose for His Name to be praised and invoked there.

verses.latin: accedesque ad sacerdotem, qui fuerit in diebus illis, et dices ad eum: Profiteor hodie coram Domino Deo tuo, quod ingressus sim terram, pro qua juravit Dominus patribus nostris, ut daret eam nobis.
verses.english: And you shall go to the priest who is ministering in those days, and you shall say to him: "I declare today before the Lord your God that I have come into the land for which the Lord swore to our fathers that He would give it to us."

verses.latin: Susceptoque sacerdote corbe de manu tua, ponet eum ante altare Domini Dei tui:
verses.english: And the priest will take the basket from your hand and place it before the altar of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: et loqueris, ac dices in conspectu Domini Dei tui: Syrus persequebatur patrem meum, qui descendit in Ægyptum, et ibi peregrinatus est in paucissimo numero: crevitque in gentem magnam, et robustam, et infinitæ multitudinis.
verses.english: And you shall speak and say in the presence of the Lord your God: "A wandering Aramean was my father Jacob, who went down into Egypt and lived there as an alien with a very small number of people. He grew there into a great nation, powerful and of immense multitude."

verses.latin: Afflixeruntque nos Ægyptii, et persecuti sunt, imponentes onera gravia.
verses.english: "And the Egyptians afflicted us and persecuted us, imposing heavy burdens upon us."

verses.latin: Et clamavimus ad Dominum Deum patrum nostrorum: qui exaudivit nos, et respexisset afflictionem nostram, et laborem, atque angustias.
verses.english: "And we cried out to the Lord God of our fathers, and He heard us. He looked upon our affliction, our toil, and our distress."

verses.latin: Et eduxit nos de Ægypto in manu forti, et brachio extento, in signis, et prodigiis, et terrore magno.
verses.english: "And He led us out of Egypt with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, with signs, and with wonders, and with great terror."

verses.latin: Et introduxit in locum hunc, et tradidit nobis terram lacte et melle manantem.
verses.english: "And He brought us into this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey."

verses.latin: Et idcirco nunc offero primitias frugum terræ, quam dedit mihi Dominus. Et dimittes ea in conspectu Domini Dei tui, et adorabis Dominum Deum tuum.
verses.english: "And therefore, now I offer the first fruits of the produce of the land which the Lord has given me." And you shall place them down in the presence of the Lord your God, and you shall adore the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Et epulaberis in omnibus bonis, quæ Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi, et domui tuæ, tu et Levita, et advena, qui tecum est.
verses.english: And you shall rejoice in all the good things that the Lord your God has given to you and to your household—you, and the Levite, and the foreigner who lives among you.

verses.latin: Cum compleveris decimam cunctarum frugum tuarum, anno decimationis tertio, dabis Levitæ, et advenæ, et pupillo, et viduæ, ut comedant intra portas tuas, et saturentur:
verses.english: When you have finished setting aside the tenth part of all your produce, during the third year, which is the year for tithing, you shall give it to the Levite, and to the foreigner, and to the orphan, and to the widow, so that they may eat within your towns and be fully satisfied.

verses.latin: et loqueris in conspectu Domini Dei tui: Abstuli quod sanctificatum est de domo mea, et dedi illud Levitæ, et advenæ, et pupillo, ac viduæ, sicut jussisti mihi, non præteriens mandata tua, nec oblitus eorum.
verses.english: And you shall speak in the presence of the Lord your God: "I have taken the holy portion from my house and have given it to the Levite, and to the foreigner, and to the orphan, and to the widow, just as You commanded me, neither going beyond Your commands nor forgetting them."

verses.latin: Non comedi ex iis in luctu meo, neque separavi ex eis quidquam in sordibus meis, nec dedi de illis quidquam mortuo. Obedivi voci Domini Dei mei, et feci omnia sicut præcepisti mihi.
verses.english: "I have not eaten any of it while in mourning, nor have I set aside any of it for any unclean purpose, nor have I given any of it for the dead. I have obeyed the voice of the Lord my God, and I have done everything just as You commanded me."

verses.latin: Respice de sanctuario tuo, de excelso cælorum habitaculo, et benedic populo tuo Israël, et terræ, quam dedisti nobis, sicut jurasti patribus nostris, terræ lacte et melle mananti.
verses.english: "Look down from Your holy sanctuary, from Your exalted dwelling place in the heavens (the spiritual realm), and bless Your people Israel, and the land You have given us, just as You swore to our fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey."

verses.latin: Hodie Dominus Deus tuus præcepit tibi ut facias mandata hæc et judicia: et custodias et impleas ea in omni corde tuo, et in omni anima tua.
verses.english: Today the Lord your God has commanded you to perform these statutes and judgments. Therefore, you must carefully keep and fulfill them with all your heart and with all your soul.

verses.latin: Dominum elegisti hodie, ut sit tibi Deus, et ambules in viis ejus, et custodias cærimonias illius, et mandata atque judicia, et obedias voci ejus.
verses.english: You have chosen the Lord today to be your God, and to walk in His ways, and to keep His ceremonies, and His commands, and His judgments, and to obey His voice.

verses.latin: Et Dominus elegit te hodie, ut sis ei populus peculiaris, sicut locutus est tibi, et custodias universa mandata illius:
verses.english: And the Lord has chosen you today to be His own special people, just as He promised you, and to carefully keep all His commands.

verses.latin: et faciat te excelsiorem cunctis gentibus quas creavit in laudem, et nomen, et gloriam suam: ut sis populus sanctus Domini Dei tui, sicut locutus est.
verses.english: And He will make you higher than all the nations He has created, in praise, and in name, and in His glory, so that you may be a holy people to the Lord your God, just as He has promised.

verses.latin: Cum ingressus fueris terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus tibi daturus est possidendam, et tenueris eam, atque habitaveris in illa:
verses.english: When you enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance to possess, and you have taken hold of it and settled there,

verses.latin: tolles de cunctis primitiis frugum terrae tuae, quas collegeris de solo tuo, et pones in corbe, proficiscerisque ad locum quem elegerit Dominus Deus tuus, ut in eo nomen illius invocetur:
verses.english: you shall take some of the first of all the produce of your land that you harvest from your soil, and put it in a basket, and you shall go to the special place where the Lord your God has chosen for His Name to be invoked and worshiped.

verses.latin: et venies ad sacerdotem qui fuerit in diebus illis, et dices ad eum: Profiteor hodie coram Domino Deo tuo, quod ingressus sim terram, pro qua juravit Dominus patribus nostris ut daret eam nobis.
verses.english: and present yourself to the priest who is serving during that time, and declare to him: 'Today I openly declare before the Lord your God that I have entered the land concerning which the Lord swore an oath to our fathers that He would give it to us.'

verses.latin: Suscipiensque sacerdos corbem de manu tua, ponet illum ante altare Domini Dei tui:
verses.english: The priest shall then take the basket from your hand, and place it before the altar of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: et loqueris, et dices in conspectu Domini Dei tui: Syrus persequebatur patrem meum, qui descendit in Aegyptum, et peregrinatus est ibi in parvo numero, crevitque in gentem magnam ac robustam et infinitis refertam:
verses.english: Then you shall speak and say in the presence of the Lord your God: 'An Aramean (Laban) once afflicted my ancestor, Jacob, who was a wanderer about to perish. He went down into Egypt and lived there as an alien with only a small group. But there he grew into a great, strong, and countless nation.

verses.latin: et afflixerunt nos Aegyptii, et persecuti sunt, imponentes onera gravia.
verses.english: Then the Egyptians afflicted us and persecuted us by imposing heavy burdens upon us.

verses.latin: Et clamavimus ad Dominum Deum patrum nostrorum, qui exaudivit nos, et respexit humilitatem nostram, et laborem, atque angustias:
verses.english: So we cried out to the Lord, the God of our fathers, and He heard us and saw our humility, our suffering, and our oppression.

verses.latin: et eduxit nos de Aegypto in manu forti, et brachio extento, in terroribus magnis, et signis atque portentis.
verses.english: and He brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, amidst terrifying acts, and great signs and wonders.

verses.latin: Et introduxit nos ad locum istum, et tradidit nobis terram fluentem lacte et melle.
verses.english: He led us to this very place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey—a land of abundant blessings.

verses.latin: Idcirco nunc offero primitias frugum terrae, quam dedisti mihi, Domine. Et pones eas coram Domino Deo tuo, et adorato Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: Therefore, I now bring the firstfruits of the land that You, O Lord, have given me.' You shall then place them before the Lord your God, and you shall worship the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Et laetaberis in omnibus bonis quae Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi, et domui tuae, tu et Levites, et advena qui tecum est.
verses.english: And you shall rejoice in all the good things that the Lord your God has given to you and your household, together with the Levite and the foreign visitor who lives among you.

verses.latin: Cum compleveris decimam cunctarum frugum tuarum, anno decimationis, dabisque Levítae, et advenae, et pupillo, et viduae, ut comedant intra portas tuas, et saturentur:
verses.english: When you have finished setting aside the tithe of all your produce in the third year, the year of tithing, you shall give it to the Levite, the foreign visitor, the orphan, and the widow, so that they may eat within your towns and be satisfied.

verses.latin: dices in conspectu Domini Dei tui: Abstuli quod sanctificatum est de domo mea, et dedi illud Levítae, et advenae, et pupillo, ac viduae, sicut jussisti mihi, non praeterii mandata tua, nec oblitus sum praecepti tui.
verses.english: Then you shall say in the presence of the Lord your God: 'I have removed the sacred portion from my house and have given it to the Levite, the foreign visitor, the orphan, and the widow, just as You commanded me. I have not violated Your commandments, nor have I forgotten Your precepts.'

verses.latin: Non comedi ex eis in luctu meo, nec separavi ex eis quidquam in sordibus, nec expendi ex his mortuo. Obedivi voci Domini Dei mei, et feci omnia sicut praeceepisti mihi.
verses.english: I have not eaten any of it while I was in mourning, nor set aside any of it for an unclean purpose, nor offered any of it to the dead. I have obeyed the voice of the Lord my God and have done everything as You commanded me.

verses.latin: Respice de sanctuario tuo caelso, de excelso caeli habitaculo, et benedic populo tuo Israël, et terrae, quam dedisti nobis, sicut jurasti patribus nostris, terrae lacte et melle mananti.
verses.english: Look down from Your holy dwelling, from the exalted heavens—Your dwelling place—and bless Your people Israel, and the land You have given us, as You swore to our fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey.

verses.latin: Hodie Dominus Deus tuus praecepit tibi ut facias mandata haec, atque judicia: et custodias et impleas ea in omni corde tuo, et tota anima tua.
verses.english: Today, the Lord your God commands you to observe these statutes and ordinances. You are to keep and fulfill them with all your heart and with all your soul.

verses.latin: Dominum elegisti hodie ut sit tibi Deus, et ambules in viis ejus, et custodias caerimonias illius, et mandata, atque judicia, et obedias voci ejus.
verses.english: Today you have declared the Lord to be your God, that you may walk in His ways, keep His rituals, and observe His statutes and ordinances, and obey His voice.

verses.latin: Et Dominus elegit te hodie ut sis ei populus peculiaris, sicut locutus est tibi, et custodias universa mandata illius:
verses.english: And the Lord has declared you today to be His own treasured people, just as He promised you, so that you may keep all His commandments.

verses.latin: et faciat te excelsiorem cunctis gentibus quas creavit in laudem, et nomen, et gloriam suam: et sis populus sanctus Domini Dei tui, sicut locutus est.
verses.english: and that He may set you high above all the nations He has made, for His own praise, name, and glory, and that you may be a holy people to the Lord your God, just as He has declared.

verses.latin: Præcepitque Moyses et seniores Israël populo, dicentes: Custodite omne mandatum, quod ego præcipio vobis hodie.
verses.english: Moses and the elders of Israel gave this commandment to the people, saying, "Obey every command that I am giving to you today."

verses.latin: Cum transieritis Jordanem ad terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis, eriges tibi lapides magnos, et calce levigabis eos.
verses.english: When you cross the Jordan River to enter the land that the Lord your God is giving to you, you are to set up large stones for yourselves, and you are to coat them with plaster.

verses.latin: Et scribes super eos omnia verba legis hujus, ut ingressus terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dat tibi, terram lacte et melle manantem, sicut juravit patribus nostris.
verses.english: And upon these stones, you are to write down all the words of this law. Do this after you have entered the land that the Lord your God is giving to you—a land flowing with milk and honey, just as He swore to our ancestors.

verses.latin: Cum ergo transieritis Jordanem, erigite lapides, quos ego hodie præcipio vobis, in monte Hebal, et levigabitis eos calce:
verses.english: Therefore, when you have crossed the Jordan, set up these stones—which I am commanding you today—on Mount Ebal, and you are to coat them with plaster.

verses.latin: et ædificabis ibi altare Domino Deo tuo, de lapidibus inædificatis, quos ferrum non tetigit,
verses.english: And there, on Mount Ebal, you are to build an altar to the Lord your God from stones that have not been cut by any iron tool.

verses.latin: de saxis quoque imperfectis, et integris: et offeres super eo holocausta Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: Use stones that are naturally rough and whole. And on this altar, you are to offer burnt offerings to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Immolabisque pacificas hostias, et comedes ibi, et epulaberis coram Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: You are also to sacrifice peace offerings, and you will eat them there, celebrating in the presence of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Et scribes super lapides omnia verba legis hujus plane et lucide.
verses.english: And you are to write clearly and legibly upon these stones all the words of this law.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Moyses, et sacerdotes Levitici generis, ad omnem Israël, dicentes: Attende et audi, Israël: Hodie factus es populus Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: Then Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all of Israel, saying, "Listen closely and pay attention, O Israel. Today, you have become the people of the Lord your God."

verses.latin: Custodi ergo mandata et cærimonias ejus, quas ego præcipio tibi hodie.
verses.english: Therefore, you must keep His commandments and His sacred rituals, which I am giving to you today.

verses.latin: Præcepitque Moyses populo in die illo, dicens:
verses.english: Moses also commanded the people on that very day, saying:

verses.latin: Hi stabunt ad benedicendum populum super montem Garizim, postquam transieritis Jordanem: Simeon, Levi, Juda, Issachar, Joseph, et Benjamin.
verses.english: These tribes are to stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people once you have crossed the Jordan: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et hi contra ad maledicendum in monte Hebal: Ruben, Gad, Aser, Zabulon, Dan, et Nephthali.
verses.english: And these tribes, by contrast, are to stand on Mount Ebal to declare curses: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

verses.latin: Pronuntiabuntque Levitæ, et dicent omni viræ Israël clara voce:
verses.english: Then the Levites are to declare this and say in a loud voice to every man of Israel:

verses.latin: Maledictus homo qui facit sculptile et fusile, abominationem Domini, opus manuum artificum, et ponit illud in abscondito: et respondebit omnis populus, et dicet: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the man who makes an idol, whether carved or cast, an abomination to the Lord—something made by the hands of craftsmen—and then sets it up in a hidden place. And all the people are to answer and say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui affligit patrem suum et matrem: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who dishonors his father or his mother. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui transfert terminos proximi sui: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who moves his neighbor's boundary marker. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui errantem cæcum in via, seducit: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who misleads a blind person who is lost on the road. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui pervertit judicium advenæ, et pupilli, et viduæ: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who perverts justice for a foreigner, an orphan, or a widow. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum uxore patris sui, et revelat operculum patris sui: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who sleeps with his father's wife, thereby uncovering his father's nakedness. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum omni pecore: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who sleeps with any animal. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum sorore sua, filia patris sui, sive matris suæ: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who sleeps with his sister, whether she is his father's daughter or his mother's daughter. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum socru sua: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who sleeps with his mother-in-law. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui percutit proximum suum clam: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who secretly strikes down his neighbor. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui accipit munus ut occidat sanguinem innocentem: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui non permanet in sermonibus legis hujus, neque eos opere perficit: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: Cursed is the one who does not uphold the words of this law, nor fully carry them out through his actions. And all the people are to say, 'Amen!'

verses.latin: Præcepit quoque Moyses et seniores Israël populo, dicentes: Custodite omne mandatum, quod ego præcipio vobis hodie.
verses.english: Moses and the elders of Israel then gave instructions to the people, saying, 'Keep every command that I am giving to all of you today.'

verses.latin: Cum transieritis Jordanem ad terram, quam Dominus Deus vester daturus est vobis, eriges tibi lapides magnos, et calce levigabis eos:
verses.english: When you cross the Jordan River to enter the land that the Lord your God is about to give you, you must set up large stones for yourselves and cover them with a smooth coating of lime,

verses.latin: et scribes super eos omnia verba legis hujus, cum transieris: ut intres terram, quam Dominus Deus tuus dat tibi, terram lacte et melle manantem, sicut juravit Dominus patribus vestris.
verses.english: and on these stones, you are to write all the words of this law once you have crossed over, so that you may truly enter the land which the Lord your God is giving you—a land of abundance, flowing with milk and honey—just as the Lord swore to your ancestors.

verses.latin: Igitur cum transieritis Jordanem, erigite lapides quos ego hodie præcipio vobis in monte Hebal, et levigabis eos calce:
verses.english: Therefore, as soon as you have crossed the Jordan, you must set up these stones, which I command you today, on Mount Ebal. You shall also prepare them by covering them with lime,

verses.latin: et ædificabis ibi altare Domino Deo tuo de lapidibus, quos ferrum non tetigit, et non sectis.
verses.english: and there, on Mount Ebal, you are to build an altar to the Lord your God using stones that have not been touched by any iron tool or cut into shape.

verses.latin: De lapidibus quoque imperfectis ædificabis altare Domini Dei tui: et offeres super illud holocausta Domino Deo tuo,
verses.english: You shall build the altar of the Lord your God from these unworked, natural stones, and upon it, you will offer burnt sacrifices to the Lord your God.

verses.latin: immolabisque pacificas victimas, et comedes ibi, et lætaberis coram Domino Deo tuo.
verses.english: You will also offer peace offerings, which you will eat there, and rejoice in the presence of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Et scribes super lapides omnia verba legis hujus plane et lucide.
verses.english: And on these stones, you shall write all the words of this law clearly and distinctly, so that everyone can read them.

verses.latin: Locuti sunt autem Moyses et sacerdotes Levitici generis ad omnem Israël, dicentes: Attende et audi, Israël: Hodie factus es populus Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: Then Moses, along with the priests from the tribe of Levi, spoke to all of Israel, saying: 'Listen closely and pay attention, O Israel! For today, you have officially become the people of the Lord your God.'

verses.latin: Servabis igitur mandata et cæremonias ejus, quas ego præcipio tibi hodie.
verses.english: Therefore, you are to keep His commandments and His ceremonies, which I am giving to you today.

verses.latin: Præcepit quoque Moyses populo in die illo, dicens:
verses.english: Moses also commanded the people on that same day, saying:

verses.latin: Hi stabunt ad benedicendum populum super montem Garizim, transito Jordane: Simeon, Levi, Juda, Issachar, Joseph, et Benjamin.
verses.english: When you have crossed the Jordan, these tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et e contra stabunt ad maledicendum in monte Hebal: Ruben, Gad, Aser, Zabulon, Dan, et Nephthali.
verses.english: And in contrast, these tribes shall stand on Mount Ebal to declare curses: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

verses.latin: Levita quoque pronuntiabunt, et dicent omni viro Israël excelso voce:
verses.english: Then the Levites shall proclaim and declare in a loud voice to every man of Israel:

verses.latin: Maledictus homo qui facit sculptile et fusile, abominationem Domini, opus manuum artificum, et ponit illud in abscondito: et respondebit omnis populus, et dicet: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be the man who makes a graven or molten image—an abomination to the Lord, the work of artisans' hands—and sets it up in secret.' And all the people shall respond and say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui affligit patrem suum et matrem: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who treats his father or mother with contempt.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui transfert terminos proximi sui: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who moves his neighbor’s landmark or property boundary.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui errare facit cæcum in itinere: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who misleads a blind person on their journey.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui pervertit judicium advenæ, pupilli, et viduæ: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who perverts justice for the foreigner, the orphan, or the widow.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum uxore patris sui, et revelat operimentum patris sui: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who sleeps with his father’s wife, uncovering his father’s nakedness.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum omni pecore: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who has sexual relations with any animal.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum sorore sua, filia patris sui, sive matris suæ: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who sleeps with his sister, whether his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui dormit cum socru sua: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who sleeps with his mother-in-law.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui percutit proximum suum clam: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who strikes his neighbor in secret, intending harm.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui accipit munus ut interficiat sanguinem innocentem: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who accepts a bribe to shed innocent blood.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Maledictus qui non permanet in sermonibus legis hujus, neque eos opere perficit: et dicet omnis populus: Amen.
verses.english: 'Cursed be he who does not uphold the words of this law and fails to perform them completely.' And all the people shall say, 'Amen.'

verses.latin: Si audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, ut custodias et facias omnia mandata ejus, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, faciet te Dominus Deus tuus excelsiorem cunctis gentibus quæ in terra sunt.
verses.english: If you truly listen to the voice of the Lord your God, so that you keep and obey all of His commandments which I am giving to you today, then the Lord your God will raise you higher than all the nations that are on the earth.

verses.latin: Et venient super te omnes benedictiones istæ, et apprehendent te, si tamen præcepta ejus audieris.
verses.english: And all these blessings will come upon you and they will overtake you, if you actually listen to His commandments.

verses.latin: Benedictus tu in civitate, et benedictus in agro.
verses.english: You will be blessed in the city, and blessed in the field.

verses.latin: Benedictus fructus ventris tui, et fructus terræ tuæ, et fructus jumentorum tuorum, greges ovium tuarum, et armenta boum tuorum.
verses.english: Blessed will be the children born to you, and the produce of your land, and the offspring of your livestock: the flocks of your sheep and the herds of your cattle.

verses.latin: Benedictum horreum tuum, et reliquiæ tuæ.
verses.english: Blessed will be your storehouse and your provisions.

verses.latin: Benedictus eris ingrediens et egrediens.
