verses.english: You will be blessed when you come in and when you go out.

verses.latin: Tradet Dominus inimicos tuos, qui consurgunt adversum te, corruentes in conspectu tuo: per unam viam venient ad te, et per septem fugient a facie tua.
verses.english: The Lord will cause your enemies who rise up against you to be utterly defeated before your eyes. They will come against you on one path, but they will flee from you on seven paths, unable to stand against you.

verses.latin: Mittet Dominus benedictionem super horrea tua, et in omnibus operibus manuum tuarum: et benedicet te in terra quam Dominus Deus tuus dederit tibi.
verses.english: The Lord will send His blessing upon your storehouses and upon all the work of your hands. And He will bless you in the land that the Lord your God is giving to you.

verses.latin: Suscitabit te Dominus sibi in populum sanctum, sicut juravit tibi: si tamen custodieris mandata Domini Dei tui, et ambulaveris in viis ejus.
verses.english: The Lord will establish you for Himself as a holy people, just as He swore to you, if you truly keep the commandments of the Lord your God and walk in His ways.

verses.latin: Videbuntque omnes terræ populi, quod nomen Domini invocatum sit super te, et timebunt te.
verses.english: And all the peoples of the earth will see that the Name of the Lord is invoked over you—meaning you belong to Him and are under His divine protection—and they will fear you.

verses.latin: Abundare te faciet Dominus omnibus bonis, de fructu uteri tui, et de fructu jumentorum tuorum, et de fructu terræ tuæ, quam juravit Dominus patribus tuis ut daret tibi.
verses.english: The Lord will cause you to abound with every good thing: with children born to you, and with the offspring of your livestock, and with the produce of your land, which the Lord swore to your fathers to give to you.

verses.latin: Aperiet Dominus thesaurum suum optimum, cælum, ut tribuat pluviam terræ tuæ in tempore suo: et benedicet cunctis operibus manuum tuarum: et fœnerabis gentibus multis, et ipse a nemine fœneraberis.
verses.english: The Lord will open His good treasure house, the sky, to give rain to your land in its proper season. And He will bless all the work of your hands, and you will lend to many nations, and you yourself will not need to borrow from anyone.

verses.latin: Faciet te Dominus caput et non caudam: et semper eris sursum, et non deorsum: si tamen audieris mandata Domini Dei tui, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, et custodieris et feceris.
verses.english: The Lord will make you the head and not the tail; and you will always be above, and never below, if you actually listen to the commandments of the Lord your God, which I am commanding you today, and if you keep and obey them.

verses.latin: Nec declines a sermonibus quos ego præcipio tibi hodie, nec ad dexteram, nec ad sinistram, ut sequaris deos alienos, neque colas illos.
verses.english: And you must not turn away from the words that I am commanding you today, either to the right or to the left, so that you do not follow other gods or worship them.

verses.latin: Quod si audire nolueris vocem Domini Dei tui, ut custodias et facias omnia mandata ejus et cærimonias, quas ego præcipio tibi hodie, venient super te omnes maledictiones istæ, et apprehendent te.
verses.english: But if you refuse to listen to the voice of the Lord your God, so that you keep and obey all His commandments and statutes, which I am commanding you today, then all these curses will come upon you and they will overtake you.

verses.latin: Maledictus tu in civitate, et maledictus in agro.
verses.english: You will be cursed in the city, and cursed in the field.

verses.latin: Maledictum horreum tuum, et reliquiæ tuæ.
verses.english: Cursed will be your storehouse and your provisions.

verses.latin: Maledictus fructus ventris tui, et fructus terræ tuæ, greges ovium tuarum, et armenta boum tuorum.
verses.english: Cursed will be the children born to you, and the produce of your land, the flocks of your sheep and the herds of your cattle.

verses.latin: Maledictus eris ingrediens, et maledictus egrediens.
verses.english: You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.

verses.latin: Mittet Dominus super te famem, et sitim, et increpationem in omnibus operibus tuis, quæ facies: donec conterat te, atque disperdat velociter, propter malignitatem sermonum tuorum, qua reliquisti me.
verses.english: The Lord will send upon you famine and thirst, and frustration and defeat in all the work you undertake, until He crushes you and quickly destroys you because of the wickedness of your ways, by which you have abandoned Me.

verses.latin: Jungat tibi Dominus pestilentiam, donec consumat te de terra, ad quam ingredieris possidendam.
verses.english: The Lord will afflict you with a persistent plague until He consumes you from the land into which you are going to possess it.

verses.latin: Percutiet te Dominus egestate, febri, et frigore, ardore et æstu, et aere corrupto ac rubigine, et persequetur donec pereas.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with a wasting disease, with fever and chills, with burning fever and scorching heat, and with blight and mildew that destroy your crops; and these will pursue you until you perish.

verses.latin: Sitque cælum quod supra te est, æreum: et terra, quam calcas, ferrea.
verses.english: And the sky above you will be like bronze, meaning it will give no rain, and the earth that you walk on will be like iron, meaning it will be hard and barren.

verses.latin: Det Dominus de cælo tuæ terræ pluviam pulverem, et cinerem: de cælo et in te descendat, donec confringaris.
verses.english: The Lord will give as rain for your land from the sky, dust and ashes; from the sky these will descend upon you until you are destroyed.

verses.latin: Tradat te Dominus corruentem ante hostes tuos: per unam viam egrediaris contra eos, et per septem fugias, et sis in dispersionem universis regnis terræ.
verses.english: The Lord will cause you to be defeated before your enemies. You will go out against them on one path, but flee on seven paths, and you will be scattered among all the kingdoms of the earth.

verses.latin: Sitque cadaver tuum in escam cunctis volatilibus cæli, et bestiis terræ, et non sit qui sepeliat.
verses.english: And your dead body will be food for all the birds of the sky and for the beasts of the earth, and there will be no one to bury you.

verses.latin: Percutiat te Dominus ulcere Ægypti, et fistulis, et scabie, et prurigine, ita ut curari non possis.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with the boils of Egypt, and with festering sores, and with scabies and persistent itching, so that you cannot be cured.

verses.latin: Percutiat te Dominus amentia, et cæcitate, et stupore mentis.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with madness, and with blindness, and with confusion of mind.

verses.latin: Et palpes in meridie sicut palpare solet cæcus in tenebris, et non dirigas vias tuas: omnique tempore calumniam sustineas, et opprimaris violentia, nec sit qui liberet te.
verses.english: And you will grope around at noon, just as a blind person gropes in darkness, and you will not find your way. At all times you will suffer injustice and be oppressed by violence, and there will be no one to rescue you.

verses.latin: Uxorem accipias, et alter dormiat cum ea: domum ædifices, et non habites in ea: plantas vineam, et non vindemies ex ea.
verses.english: You will take a wife, but another man will lie with her. You will build a house, but not live in it. You will plant a vineyard, but not gather its grapes.

verses.latin: Bos tuus immoletur coram te, et non comedas ex eo: asinus tuus rapiatur in conspectu tuo, et non reddatur tibi: oves tuæ dentur inimicis tuis, et non sit qui te adjuvet.
verses.english: Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, and you will not eat its meat. Your donkey will be stolen right before your eyes and not be returned to you. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, and there will be no one to help you.

verses.latin: Filii tui et filiæ tuæ tradantur alteri populo, videntibus oculis tuis, et in conspectu eorum contabescant: nec sit fortitudo in manu tua.
verses.english: Your sons and your daughters will be given over to another people while your eyes see it happen, and your eyes will waste away longing for them with no hope, and there will be no strength in your hand to prevent it.

verses.latin: Fructus terræ tuæ, et omnes labores tuos, comedet populus quem ignoras: et sis semper calumniam sustinens, et oppressus omnibus diebus.
verses.english: The produce of your land and all your hard work, a people whom you do not know will eat. And you will always suffer injustice and be oppressed all your days.

verses.latin: Et contabescere facias oculis tuis, pro his quæ visurus es, et mirari ad omnia quæ conspicies.
verses.english: Your eyes will grow dim from longing for what you expect to see but never will, and you will be filled with horror at everything you witness.

verses.latin: Percutiat te Dominus ulcere pessimo in genibus, et in femoribus, sanarique non possis, a planta pedis usque ad verticem tuum.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with terrible boils on your knees and on your thighs, and you will not be able to be cured, from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.

verses.latin: Ducet te Dominus, et regem tuum, quem constitueris super te, in gentem quam ignoras tu et patres tui: et servies ibi diis alienis, ligno et lapidi.
verses.english: The Lord will lead you and your king, whom you set over yourselves, to a nation that neither you nor your fathers have known. And there you will serve other gods, made of wood and stone.

verses.latin: Et eris in prodigium, et in proverbium, ac fabulam omnibus populis, ad quos te induxerit Dominus.
verses.english: And you will become an object of astonishment, and a proverb, and a derisive tale among all the peoples to whom the Lord has brought you.

verses.latin: Sementem multam jacies in terram, et modicum colliges: quia locustæ devorabunt omnia.
verses.english: You will sow much seed in the ground, but gather little, because locusts will devour everything.

verses.latin: Vineam plantabis, et pones, et vinum non bibes: nec colliges ex ea quippiam, quoniam vastabitur a vermibus.
verses.english: You will plant vineyards and cultivate them, but you will not drink their wine, nor will you gather anything from them, because they will be devoured by pests.

verses.latin: Olivas habebis in omnibus finibus tuis, et non ungeris oleo: eo quod defluent et peribunt.
verses.english: You will have olive trees throughout all your territory, but you will not anoint yourselves with their oil, because their olives will fall off and perish before they can be harvested.

verses.latin: Si audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, ut custodias et facias omnia mandata ejus, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, faciet te Dominus Deus tuus excelsiorem cunctis gentibus quæ in terra sunt.
verses.english: If you truly listen to the voice of the Lord your God and carefully keep all His commandments, which I am giving you today, the Lord your God will raise you up above all the other nations on the earth.

verses.latin: Cunctique sermones isti venient super te, et apprehendent te, si tamen audieris mandata Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: And all these blessings will come upon you and find you, if you genuinely listen to the commandments of the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Benedictus tu in civitate, et benedictus in agro.
verses.english: You will be blessed in the city, and you will be blessed in the countryside.

verses.latin: Benedictus fructus ventris tui, et fructus terræ tuæ, et fructus jumentorum tuorum, greges ovium, et armenta boum.
verses.english: Blessed will be the children born to you, the produce from your land, and the offspring of your livestock—your flocks of sheep and herds of cattle.

verses.latin: Benedictæ reliquiæ tuæ, et horrea tua.
verses.english: Blessed will be your baskets and your storage bins.

verses.latin: Benedictus eris et ingrediens, et egrediens.
verses.english: You will be blessed when you come in, and blessed when you go out.

verses.latin: Tradet Dominus inimicos tuos, qui consurgunt adversum te, corruentes in conspectu tuo: per unam viam venient contra te, et per septem fugient a facie tua.
verses.english: The Lord will hand over your enemies, those who rise against you; they will be defeated right before your eyes. They will come against you by one road, but they will flee from you in seven different directions.

verses.latin: Benedictionem præcipiet Dominus tibi in horreis tuis, et in omnibus operibus manuum tuarum: et benedicet te in terra quam acceperis.
verses.english: The Lord will command blessings upon you in your storage bins and in everything you do with your hands. He will bless you in the land that the Lord gives to you.

verses.latin: Suscitabit te Dominus sibi in populum sanctum, sicut juravit tibi: si tamen custodieris mandata Domini Dei tui, et ambulaveris in viis ejus.
verses.english: The Lord will establish you as His holy people, just as He swore to you He would. This will happen if you keep the commandments of the Lord your God and walk in His ways.

verses.latin: Videbuntque omnes populi terræ, quod nomen Domini invocatum sit super te, et timebunt te.
verses.english: All the peoples of the earth will see that you are called by the name of the Lord, and they will be in awe of you.

verses.latin: Faciet te Dominus abundare omnibus bonis, fructu uteri tui, et fructu jumentorum tuorum, fructu terræ tuæ, quam juravit Dominus patribus tuis ut daret tibi.
verses.english: The Lord will grant you abundant prosperity in children, in the offspring of your livestock, and in the produce of your land, in the land that the Lord swore to your fathers He would give you.

verses.latin: Aperiet Dominus thesaurum suum optimum, cælum, ut tribuat pluviam terræ tuæ in tempore suo: et benedicat cunctis operibus manuum tuarum: et fœnerabis gentibus multis, et ipse a nemine fœneraberis.
verses.english: The Lord will open His rich storehouse, the sky, to send rain on your land in its proper season. He will bless all the work of your hands. You will lend to many nations, but you will not need to borrow from any.

verses.latin: Facietque te Dominus caput, et non caudam: et semper eris sursum, et non deorsum: si tamen audieris mandata Domini Dei tui, quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie, et custodieris et feceris.
verses.english: The Lord will make you the head and not the tail; you will always be at the top and never at the bottom. This will be true if you genuinely listen to the commandments of the Lord your God that I am giving you today, and are careful to keep and do them.

verses.latin: Nec declines ex sermonibus quos ego mando tibi hodie, nec ad dexteram, nec ad sinistram, ut sequaris deos alienos, neque colas illos.
verses.english: Do not turn away from any of the words I am commanding you today, either to the right or to the left, so that you do not go after other gods or worship them.

verses.latin: Quod si non audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, ut custodias et facias omnia mandata ejus et cærimonias, quas ego præcipio tibi hodie, venient super te omnes maledictiones istæ, et apprehendent te.
verses.english: But if you do not genuinely listen to the voice of the Lord your God and are not careful to keep all His commandments and statutes, which I am giving you today, then all these curses will come upon you and find you.

verses.latin: Maledictus eris in civitate, et maledictus in agro.
verses.english: You will be cursed in the city, and you will be cursed in the countryside.

verses.latin: Maledictæ reliquiæ tuæ, et horrea tua.
verses.english: Cursed will be your baskets and your storage bins.

verses.latin: Maledictus fructus ventris tui, et fructus terræ tuæ, armenta boum, et greges ovium.
verses.english: Cursed will be the children born to you, the produce from your land, and the offspring of your cattle and sheep.

verses.latin: Maledictus eris ingrediens, et maledictus egrediens.
verses.english: You will be cursed when you come in, and cursed when you go out.

verses.latin: Mittet Dominus super te famem, et sitim, et increpationem in omnibus operibus tuis, quæ facies, donec conterat te, atque perdat velociter propter inventionem malorum operum tuorum, eo quod me dereliqueris.
verses.english: The Lord will send upon you curses of famine, thirst, and frustration in everything you attempt to do, until He crushes you and swiftly destroys you because of the evil you have done in forsaking Him.

verses.latin: Adjungat Dominus pestem in te, donec consumat te de terra, ad quam ingredieris possidendam.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with plague until He completely removes you from the land you are entering to possess.

verses.latin: Percutiat te Dominus egestate, febri et frigore, ardore et æstu, et aere corrupto ac rubigine, et persequatur donec pereas.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with wasting disease, fever and inflammation, scorching heat, drought, blight, and mildew. These will pursue you until you perish.

verses.latin: Sitque cælum, quod supra te est, æreum: et terra, quam calcas, ferrea.
verses.english: The sky above your head will be like bronze, and the ground beneath your feet will be like iron.

verses.latin: Det Dominus pulverem et de cælo cinere pluet super te, donec conteraris.
verses.english: The Lord will send dust and ashes raining down from the sky upon your land instead of rain, until you are utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: Tradat te Dominus corruentem ante hostes tuos: per unam viam egrediaris contra eos, et per septem fugias, semperque sis dispersus per omnia regna terræ.
verses.english: The Lord will cause you to be defeated before your enemies. You will march out against them by one road, but you will flee from them in seven different directions. You will be scattered throughout all the kingdoms of the earth.

verses.latin: Sitque cadaver tuum in escam cunctis volatilibus cæli, et bestiis terræ, et non sit qui sepeliat.
verses.english: Your corpses will become food for all the birds of the sky and the wild animals of the earth, with no one to bury them.

verses.latin: Percutiat te Dominus ulcere Ægypti, et partem corporis, per quam stillicidia profluunt, scabie quoque et prurigine, ita ut curari non possis.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with the boils of Egypt, with tumors, with festering sores, and with an incurable itch and rash.

verses.latin: Percutiat te Dominus amentia, et cæcitate, et stupore mentis.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with madness, blindness, and confusion of mind.

verses.latin: Et palpes in meridie sicut cæcus palpare solet in tenebris, et non dirigas vias tuas: omnique tempore calumniam sustineas, et opprimaris violentia, nec sit qui te libere.
verses.english: At noon, you will grope around like a blind person fumbling in the darkness, unable to find your way. You will be constantly wronged and oppressed by violence, with no one to rescue you.

verses.latin: Uxorem accipias, et alter dormiat cum ea. Domum ædifices, et non habites in ea. Vinee plantes, et non vindemies eam.
verses.english: You will marry a woman, but another man will sleep with her. You will build a house, but you will not get to live in it. You will plant a vineyard, but you will not gather its grapes.

verses.latin: Bos tuus immoletur coram te, et non comedas ex eo. Asinus tuus rapiatur in conspectu tuo, et non reddatur tibi. Oves tuæ dentur inimicis tuis, et non sit qui auxilietur tibi.
verses.english: Your ox will be slaughtered before your very eyes, but you will not eat any of its meat. Your donkey will be stolen from you, right before your eyes, and it will not be returned to you. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, and there will be no one to help you.

verses.latin: Filii tui et filiæ tuæ tradantur alteri populo, videntibus oculis tuis, et deficientibus ad conspectum eorum omni die, et nulla sit in manu tua facultas.
verses.english: Your sons and daughters will be given over to another people, and you will watch it happen, your eyes failing with longing for them day after day. You will be powerless to do anything.

verses.latin: Fructus terræ tuæ, et omnes labores tuos comedat populus quem ignoras: et sis semper calumniam sustinens, et oppressus omnibus diebus.
verses.english: A people you do not know will eat the produce of your land and all the fruits of your labor. You will be constantly wronged and oppressed for the rest of your days.

verses.latin: Et furore opprimaris ad ea quæ videbis oculis tuis.
verses.english: You will be driven mad by what you see with your own eyes.

verses.latin: Percutiat te Dominus ulcere pessimo in genibus et in suris, sanarique non possis, a planta pedis usque ad verticem tuum.
verses.english: The Lord will strike you with painful, incurable boils on your knees and legs. These sores will cover you from the sole of your foot to the top of your head.

verses.latin: Ducet te Dominus, et regem tuum, quem constitueris super te, in gentem quam ignoras tu et patres tui: et servies ibi diis alienis, ligno et lapidi.
verses.english: The Lord will lead you and the king you set over you to a nation that neither you nor your ancestors have known. There you will serve other gods made of wood and stone.

verses.latin: Et eris perditus in proverbium ac fabulam omnibus populis, ad quos te induxerit Dominus.
verses.english: You will become an object of horror, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples to whom the Lord will scatter you.

verses.latin: Sementem multam jacies in terram, et parum colliges: quia locustis omnia devorabuntur.
verses.english: You will sow much seed in your fields, but you will harvest little, because locusts will devour it all.

verses.latin: Vineam plantabis, et coles, et vinum non bibes, nec colliges ex ea quippiam: quoniam vastabitur a vermibus.
verses.english: You will plant and cultivate vineyards, but you will not drink the wine or gather the grapes, because worms will eat them.

verses.latin: Olivas habebis in omnibus terminis tuis, et non ungeris ex oleo: confringentur enim et peribunt olivæ tuæ.
verses.english: You will have olive trees throughout your territory, but you will not anoint yourself with the oil from them. This is because your olives will drop off and perish before they ripen.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt verba pacti, quod præcepit Dominus Moysi ut feriret cum filiis Israël in terra Moab, præter illud pactum, quod cum eis pepigit in Horeb.
verses.english: These are the words of the sacred covenant that the Lord commanded Moses to establish with the children of Israel in the land of Moab. This covenant was made in addition to the earlier one He had already established with them on Mount Horeb.

verses.latin: Hæc sunt verba pacti, quod jussit Dominus Moysi ut feriret cum filiis Israël in terra Moab, præter id pactum quod pepigerat cum eis in Horeb.
verses.english: These are the terms of the covenant which the Lord commanded Moses to establish with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant He had already made with them at Mount Horeb.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Moyses omnem Israël, et dixit ad eos: Vos vidistis omnia quæ fecit Dominus in terra Ægypti Pharaoni, et universis servis ejus, cunctæque terræ illius,
verses.english: Then Moses called all of Israel together and said to them: “You yourselves saw everything the Lord did in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land,

verses.latin: tentationes magnas, quas viderunt oculi tui, signa quoque et prodigia ingentia,
verses.english: including the great trials your eyes witnessed—the signs and the immense wonders.

verses.latin: et non dedit vobis Dominus cor intelligens, et oculos videntes, et aures audientes, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: But the Lord did not give you a heart that could truly understand, nor eyes that could truly see, nor ears that could truly hear, until this very day.

verses.latin: Adduxique vos quadraginta annis per desertum: non sunt attrita vestimenta vestra, nec calceamenta pedum vestrorum vetustate consumpta sunt.
verses.english: I led you for forty years through the desert, and your clothes did not wear out, nor did your sandals become old and worn on your feet.

verses.latin: Panem non comedistis, et vinum et siceram non bibistis: ut sciretis quia ego sum Dominus Deus vester.
verses.english: You did not eat bread, nor did you drink wine or strong drink, so that you would know that I am the Lord your God.

verses.latin: Venistisque ad locum istum: egressusque est Sehon rex Hesebon, et Og rex Basan, obviam nobis ad pugnam, et percussimus eos.
verses.english: You came to this place, and Sihon, the king of Heshbon, and Og, the king of Bashan, came out to fight us, and we defeated them.

verses.latin: Tulimusque terram eorum, et tradidimus possidendam Ruben et Gad, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse.
verses.english: Then we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to Reuben, Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Custodite ergo verba pacti hujus, et facite illa: ut intelligatis universa quæ agitis.
verses.english: Therefore, keep the words of this covenant and do them, so that you may prosper in everything you undertake.

verses.latin: Omnes vos statis hodie coram Domino Deo vestro, principes vestri, et tribus, ac majores natu, et præfecti:
verses.english: All of you stand here today before the Lord your God: your leaders, your tribes, your elders, and your officials,

verses.latin: omnis populus Israël, simul et uxores vestræ, ac liberi, et advena qui tecum est in castris tuis, lignorum cæsorum ad aquarum haustores:
verses.english: all the people of Israel, together with your wives and children, and the foreigners living among you in your camps, from those who cut wood to those who draw water.

verses.latin: ut transires in fœdus Domini Dei tui, et in jusjurandum quod hodie Dominus Deus tuus ferit tecum:
verses.english: You are here to enter into the covenant of the Lord your God, and into the oath which the Lord your God is establishing with you today.

verses.latin: ut suscitet te sibi in populum, et sit ipse Deus tuus, sicut locutus est tibi, et sicut juravit patribus tuis, Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob.
verses.english: He is doing this so that He may establish you as His own people, and that He Himself may be your God, just as He promised you, and just as He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.latin: Nec vobis solis ego hoc pactum ferio, et his juramentis confirmo,
verses.english: I am not making this covenant with its oaths and confirmations only with you who are present today,

verses.latin: sed cunctis qui adfuere et absunt.
verses.english: but also with all who are present here with us and with those who are not present today, which refers to your future generations.

verses.latin: Vos enim scitis quomodo habitaverimus in terra Ægypti, et quomodo transierimus per medias gentes, quas iter fecistis:
verses.english: For you yourselves know how we lived in the land of Egypt, and how we passed through the midst of the nations during your journey here.

verses.latin: et vidistis abominationes et idola eorum, ligna scilicet et lapides, argentum et aurum, quæ colebant.
verses.english: And you saw their detestable things and their idols—their wooden and stone images, and their silver and gold, which they worshipped.

verses.latin: Ne forte sit inter vos vir, aut mulier, sive familia, aut tribus, cujus cor aversum sit hodie a Domino Deo nostro, ut vadat et serviat diis illarum gentium: ne forte sit inter vos radix germinans fel et amaritudinem.
verses.english: Beware lest there be among you a man or woman, or a family or tribe, whose heart turns away from the Lord our God today, to go and serve the gods of those nations. Beware lest there be among you a root that sprouts forth poison and bitterness.

verses.latin: Cumque audierit verba juramenti hujus, benedicat sibi in corde suo, dicens: Pax erit mihi, et ambulabo in pravitate cordis mei: et auferat ebriam ab sitiente,
verses.english: If anyone hears the words of this oath and then blesses himself in his own heart, saying, 'I will have peace, even though I walk according to the stubbornness of my heart'—thinking that this will allow him to remove the sin of the drunken from the thirsty, meaning, to cause others to stumble by his own sin—

verses.latin: et nolit Dominus propitiari illi: sed tunc quasi fumentes et irati super illum, furor Domini et zelus ejus, et omne maledictum, quod scriptum est in hoc volumine, requiescet super illum: delebitque nomen ejus sub cælo.
verses.english: then the Lord will not be willing to forgive him. Instead, the Lord's anger and jealousy will burn against that man, and all the curses written in this book will rest upon him. The Lord will utterly blot out his name from under the sky.

verses.latin: Et consumet eum in omnes tribus Israël, juxta maledictiones et juramenta quæ scripta sunt in libro legis hujus.
verses.english: The Lord will set him apart for destruction from all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses and oaths written in this book of the Law.

verses.latin: Dicetque generatio futura, et filii qui nascentur post vos, et peregrinus qui de longinquo terræ advenerit, videns plagas terræ illius, et languores quibus eam afflixerit Dominus,
verses.english: The generation to come, and the children born after you, and the foreigner who comes from a distant land, will see the plagues of that land and the diseases with which the Lord has afflicted it.

verses.latin: sulphur et sal, et ustionem ignis, ita ut ultra non seratur, nec quidquam germinet, neque ulla herba concrescat in ea, sicut subversa est Sodoma et Gomorrha, Adama et Seboim, quas subvertit Dominus in ira et furore suo:
verses.english: They will see that the whole land is sulfur and salt and burning fire, so that it cannot be sown, nor can anything sprout, nor can any plant grow in it—just like the overthrow of Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, which the Lord overthrew in His fierce anger and wrath.

verses.latin: et dicent omnes gentes: Quare fecit Dominus sic terræ huic? quæ est hæc ira, et indignatio furoris ejus immensa?
verses.english: And all the nations will ask: 'Why did the Lord do this to this land? What is the meaning of this immense wrath and indignation of His fury?'

verses.latin: Et respondebunt: Quia dereliquerunt pactum Domini, quod pepigit cum patribus eorum, quando eduxit illos de terra Ægypti:
verses.english: And they will answer: 'Because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord, which He made with their fathers when He brought them out of the land of Egypt;'

verses.latin: et servierunt diis alienis, et adoraverunt eos, quos nesciebant, et quibus non fuerant attributi.
verses.english: 'and they served other gods and worshipped them—gods they did not know, and gods the Lord had not assigned to them.'

verses.latin: Idcirco iratus est furor Domini contra terram hanc, ut induceret super eam omnes maledictiones quæ scriptæ sunt in hoc volumine:
verses.english: Therefore, the fierce anger of the Lord was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curses that are written in this book;

verses.latin: et ejecit eos de terra sua in ira, et in furore, et in indignatione maxima, projecitque in terram alienam, sicut hodie comprobatur.
verses.english: and He cast them out of their land in wrath, and in fierce anger, and in great indignation, and hurled them into another land, as is evident today.

verses.latin: Secreta Domino Deo nostro, quæ manifesta sunt, nobis et filiis nostris usque in æternum sunt, ut faciamus universa verba legis hujus.
verses.english: The secret things belong to the Lord our God; but the things that are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, so that we may carry out all the words of this Law.

verses.latin: Cum ergo omnia hæc verba quæ scripta sunt, et benedictio et maledictio, venerint super te, et cogitaveris in corde tuo inter omnes gentes in quas Dominus Deus tuus disperserit te,
verses.english: When all these words that are written—both the blessing and the curse—come upon you, and you reflect on them in your heart among all the nations where the Lord your God has scattered you,

verses.latin: et reversus fueris ad eum, et obedieris ejus imperiis, sicut ego hodie præcipio tibi, cum filiis tuis, in omni corde tuo, et in omni anima tua:
verses.english: and when you return to Him and obey His commands, just as I am commanding you today, you and your children, with all your heart and with all your soul:

verses.latin: remittet Dominus Deus tuus captivitatem tuam, et miserebitur tui, et rursum congregabit te de cunctis populis, in quos te ante dispersit.
verses.english: then the Lord your God will restore your fortunes and have compassion on you. He will gather you again from all the peoples among whom He had scattered you.

verses.latin: Si fueris usque ad solum cæli dispersus, inde te colliget Dominus Deus tuus, et assumet,
verses.english: Even if you have been dispersed to the farthest reaches under the sky, from there the Lord your God will gather you and bring you back.

verses.latin: et adducet in terram quam possederunt patres tui, et possidebis eam: et benedicens tibi, majoris numeri faciet te, quam fuerunt patres tui.
verses.english: He will bring you into the land that your fathers possessed, and you will possess it. And He will bless you and make you more numerous than your fathers were.

verses.latin: Circumcidet Dominus Deus tuus cor tuum, et cor seminis tui, ut diligas Dominum Deum tuum in toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua, ut vivas.
verses.english: The Lord your God will circumcise your heart and the heart of your descendants, so that you may love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul, that you may live.

verses.latin: Omnesque maledictiones istas convertet super inimicos tuos, et super eos qui oderunt te, et persequuntur.
verses.english: And the Lord will turn all these curses upon your enemies and upon those who hate you and persecute you.

verses.latin: Tu autem reverteris, et audies vocem Domini Dei tui, et facies universa mandata quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie:
verses.english: But you will return, and you will listen to the voice of the Lord your God, and you will do all the commands that I am giving you today.

verses.latin: et in omnibus operibus manuum tuarum, et in progenie uteri tui, et in fructu jumentorum tuorum, et in ubertate terræ tuæ, et in rerum omnium largitate, benedicet tibi Dominus: revertetur enim Dominus ut gaudeat super te in omnibus bonis, sicut gavisus est super patres tuos:
verses.english: And the Lord your God will make you abound in prosperity in all the work of your hands, and in the offspring of your body, and in the produce of your livestock, and in the fruitfulness of your land, and in the abundance of all your possessions. For the Lord will again delight in you for all good things, just as He delighted in your fathers.

verses.latin: si tamen audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, et custodieris mandata ejus et cæremonias ejus, quæ in hac lege conscriptæ sunt, et revertaris ad Dominum Deum tuum in toto corde tuo, et in tota anima tua.
verses.english: This will happen, however, only if you listen to the voice of the Lord your God, and keep His commands and His ceremonies which are written in this Law, and if you return to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.

verses.latin: Hoc mandatum, quod ego præcipio tibi hodie, non est super te, nec procul positum, nec impossibile.
verses.english: For this commandment which I am giving you today is not too difficult for you, nor is it far away, nor is it impossible.

verses.latin: Igitur cum venerint super te omnes sermones isti, benedictio sive maledictio, quos proposui in conspectu tuo: et pœnitueris in corde tuo, in cunctis gentibus, in quas disperserit te Dominus Deus tuus,
verses.english: Therefore, when all these words come upon you—all the blessings and all the curses which I have placed before you—and you then seriously consider them in your heart, while you are among all the nations where the Lord your God has scattered you,

verses.latin: et reversus fueris ad Dominum Deum tuum, et obedieris ejus imperio, sicut ego hodie præcipio tibi, tu et filii tui, in omni corde tuo et in omni anima tua:
verses.english: and when you have returned to the Lord your God, and have obeyed His commandment with your entire being, just as I am commanding you today—both you and your children—with all your heart and with all your soul,

verses.latin: reducet Dominus Deus tuus captivitatem tuam, et miserebitur tui, ac rursus congregabit te de cunctis populis, in quos te ante dispersit.
verses.english: then the Lord your God will restore your fortunes, and He will have compassion on you. He will gather you again from all the nations among whom He previously scattered you.

verses.latin: Si ad cardines cæli fueris dissipatus, inde te colliget Dominus Deus tuus, et assumet,
verses.english: Even if you have been scattered to the farthest ends of the world, from there the Lord your God will gather you and bring you back.

verses.latin: atque introducet in terram quam possederunt patres tui, et obtinebis eam: et felicior majorque eris quam fuerunt patres tui.
verses.english: He will bring you back into the land that your ancestors possessed, and you will own it once again. You will be more prosperous and more numerous than your ancestors ever were.

verses.latin: Circumcidet Dominus Deus tuus cor tuum, et cor seminis tui, ut diligas Dominum Deum tuum in toto corde tuo et in tota anima tua, ut vivas.
verses.english: The Lord your God will circumcise your heart, and the hearts of your descendants, so that you may love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul, in order that you may truly live.

verses.latin: Omnes autem maledictiones istæ convertentur super inimicos tuos, et super eos qui oderunt te, et persequuntur.
verses.english: Then all these curses will turn upon your enemies, and upon those who hate you and persecute you.

verses.latin: Tu vero reverteris, et audies vocem Domini Dei tui, faciesque universa mandata quæ ego præcipio tibi hodie.
verses.english: But you will return and listen to the voice of the Lord your God, and you will carry out all the commandments that I am giving you today.

verses.latin: Et uberiorem te faciet Dominus Deus tuus in omni opere manuum tuarum, in sobole uteri tui, et in fructu jumentorum tuorum, in ubertate terræ tuæ, et in rerum omnium largitate.
verses.english: And the Lord your God will make you abound in every work of your hands: in the children of your womb, in the offspring of your livestock, and in the abundance of your land, as well as in the generosity of all things.

verses.latin: Revertetur enim Dominus ut gaudeat super te in bonis, sicut gavisus est super patres tuos:
verses.english: For the Lord will delight again over you for your good, just as He delighted over your ancestors,

verses.latin: si tamen audieris vocem Domini Dei tui, et custodieris mandata ejus et cæremonias, quæ in hac lege conscriptæ sunt, et revertaris ad Dominum Deum tuum in toto corde tuo et in tota anima tua.
verses.english: if only you listen to the voice of the Lord your God and keep His commandments and His ceremonies, which are written in this law, and you return to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.

verses.latin: Non in cælo est, nec procul posita, ut possis dicere: Quis nostrum potest ascendere in cælum, et inde afferre illud nobis, et audire atque implere?
verses.english: For this commandment that I am giving you today is not too difficult for you, nor is it far away. It is not in the sky, so that you should have to say, "Who among us can ascend to the sky for us, and bring it down to us, so that we may hear it and do it?"

verses.latin: Neque trans mare sita, ut causeris et dicas: Quis nobis transfretare potest mare, et inde nobis illud afferre, ut audire et facere possimus?
verses.english: Nor is it beyond the sea, so that you should complain and say, "Who among us can cross the sea for us, and bring it to us, so that we may hear it and do it?"

verses.latin: Sed juxta te est sermo valde, in ore tuo, et in corde tuo, ut facias illum.
verses.english: Instead, the word is very near you, in your mouth and in your heart, so that you may do it.

verses.latin: Considera quod hodie proposuerim in conspectu tuo vitam et bonum, et e contrario mortem et malum:
verses.english: Consider that today I have set before you life and good, and conversely, death and evil.

verses.latin: ut diligas Dominum Deum tuum, et ambules in viis ejus, et custodias mandata illius et cæremonias atque judicia, et vivas, atque multipliceris: et benedicat tibi in terra ad quam ingredieris possidendam.
verses.english: This choice is so that you may love the Lord your God, and walk in His ways, and keep His commandments, ceremonies, and judgments, so that you may live and multiply. And He will bless you in the land that you are entering to possess.

verses.latin: Sin autem aversus fuerit cor tuum, et audire nolueris, sed errore deceptus adoraveris alienos deos, et servieris illis:
verses.english: But if your heart turns away, and you refuse to listen, but instead are deceived by error to worship foreign gods and serve them,

verses.latin: prædico tibi hodie quod pereas, et parvo tempore moreris in terra, ad quam Jordane transmisso ingredieris possidendam.
verses.english: then I declare to you today that you will surely perish. You will not remain for long in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.

verses.latin: Testes invoco hodie cælum et terram, quod proposuerim vobis vitam et mortem, benedictionem et maledictionem.
verses.english: I call the universe and the earth as witnesses against you today, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse.

verses.latin: Elige ergo vitam, ut et tu vivas, et semen tuum: et diligas Dominum Deum tuum, et obedias voci ejus, et illi adhæreas: ipse est enim vita tua, et longitudo dierum tuorum, ut habites in terra, pro qua juravit Dominus patribus tuis Abraham, Isaac et Jacob, ut daret eam illis.
verses.english: Therefore, choose life, so that both you and your descendants may live. And this means you must love the Lord your God, obey His voice, and cling to Him. For He Himself is your life and the length of your days, so that you may dwell in the land that the Lord swore to your ancestors—Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—to give to them.

verses.latin: Et abiit Moyses, et locutus est omnia verba haec ad omnem Israël,
verses.english: Moses went and spoke all these words to all of Israel.

verses.latin: et dixit ad eos: Centum viginti annorum sum hodie, non possum ultra ingredi et egredi, et Dominus dixit mihi: Non transibis Jordanem istum.
verses.english: And he said to them: "I am one hundred and twenty years old today. I cannot lead you anymore, and the Lord has told me, 'You will not cross this Jordan River.'"

verses.latin: Dominus Deus tuus transibit ante te: ipse delebit gentes istas in conspectu tuo, et possidebis eas: et Josue iste transibit ante te, sicut locutus est Dominus.
verses.english: "The Lord your God Himself will go before you. He will destroy these nations in your sight, and you will take possession of their land. And this Joshua will go before you, just as the Lord has commanded."

verses.latin: Et faciet Dominus eis sicut fecit Sehon et Og regibus Amorrhaeorum, et universis terris eorum, quos subvertit.
verses.english: "And the Lord will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to all their lands, which He utterly destroyed."

verses.latin: Cum ergo et hos deleverit, tradetque vobis, et facietis eis sicut praecepi vobis.
verses.english: "Therefore, when He has destroyed even these nations and delivered them over to you, you will do to them exactly as I have commanded you."

verses.latin: Confortamini, et estote robusti: nolite timere, nec paveatis ad conspectum eorum: quia Dominus Deus tuus ipse est ductor tuus, et non dimittet, nec derelinquet te.
verses.english: "Be strong and courageous. Do not fear them, nor be terrified by their presence, because the Lord your God Himself is your leader. He will not abandon you, nor will He ever forsake you."

verses.latin: Vocavitque Moyses Josue, et dixit ei coram omni Israël: Confortare, et esto robustus: tu enim introduces populum istum in terram, quam juravit Dominus patribus eorum ut daret illis, et tu eam sorte divides.
verses.english: Moses then called Joshua and said to him in front of all Israel: "Be strong and courageous, for you will lead this people into the land that the Lord swore to their fathers to give them. And you will divide it among them by lot."

verses.latin: Et Dominus qui ductor est tuus, ipse erit tecum: non dimittet, nec derelinquet te: noli timere, nec paveas.
verses.english: "And the Lord, who is your leader, He Himself will be with you. He will not abandon you, nor will He ever forsake you. Do not be afraid, nor be dismayed."

verses.latin: Scripsit itaque Moyses legem hanc, et tradidit eam sacerdotibus filiis Levi, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, et cunctis senioribus Israël.
verses.english: So Moses wrote down this entire law and delivered it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of Israel.

verses.latin: Praecepitque eis, dicens: Post septem annos, anno remissionis, in solemnitate tabernaculorum,
verses.english: He then commanded them, saying: "At the end of every seven years, in the year of release, during the Feast of Tabernacles—which is the time of the Sabbatical year—"

verses.latin: quando convenit omnis Israël ut appareat in conspectu Domini Dei tui in loco quem elegerit: leges verba legis hujus coram omni Israël, audientibus cunctis.
verses.english: "When all of Israel gathers to appear before the Lord your God in the holy place He chooses, you shall read the words of this entire law before all of Israel, with everyone listening intently."

verses.latin: Congrega populum, viros et mulieres, parvulos et advenas, qui sunt intra portas tuas: ut audientes discant, et timeant Dominum Deum vestrum, et custodiant universa verba legis hujus, et opere compleant:
verses.english: "Gather the people: men, women, children, and the foreigners living within your towns—so that they may listen, learn, and fear the Lord your God, and diligently observe all the words of this law, carrying them out in their actions."

verses.latin: et filii eorum qui ignorant, audiant, et discant timere Dominum Deum vestrum cunctis diebus quibus versamini in terra, ad quam Jordanem transgredimini ut habitetis in ea.
verses.english: "And their children, who do not yet know the Law, may hear it and learn to fear the Lord your God all the days you live in the land you are crossing the Jordan to inhabit."

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Moysen: Ecce juxta sunt dies mortis tuae. Voca Josue, et sta cum eo in tabernaculo testimonii, ut praecipiam ei. Abierunt ergo Moyses et Josue, et steterunt in tabernaculo testimonii.
verses.english: The Lord then said to Moses: "Look, the days of your death are near. Call Joshua, and stand with him in the Tent of Meeting—the Tabernacle of Testimony—so that I may give him his charge." So Moses and Joshua went and stood inside the Tent of Meeting.

verses.latin: Apparuitque Dominus ibi in columna nubis, quae stetit super ostium tabernaculi.
verses.english: And the Lord appeared there in a pillar of cloud, which stood directly over the entrance of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Ecce dormies cum patribus tuis: et populus iste consurgens fornicabitur post deos alienos in terra, ad quam ingreditur ut habitet in ea: ibique derelinquet me, et irritum faciet pactum, quod pepigi cum eo.
verses.english: The Lord then said to Moses: "Behold, you will soon lie down with your fathers in death. And this people, when they settle in the land they are about to enter, will rise up and commit spiritual adultery by pursuing foreign gods. They will abandon Me there and break the covenant I have made with them."

verses.latin: Et irascetur furor meus contra eum in die illo: et derelinquam eum, et abscondam faciem meam ab eo, et erit in devorationem: invenientque eum cuncta mala et afflictiones, ita ut dicat in illo die: Vere quoniam non est Deus mecum, invenerunt me haec mala.
verses.english: "And My wrath will burn fiercely against them on that day. I will abandon them and hide My face from them, and they will be utterly consumed. All sorts of evils and afflictions will find them, so that on that day, they will say: 'Surely, because God is not with me, these evils have come upon me.'"

verses.latin: Ego autem abscondam faciem meam in die illo propter universa mala eorum, quae fecerunt, quia secuti sunt deos alienos.
verses.english: "But I will certainly hide My face from them on that day because of all the evils they have committed, for they will have pursued foreign gods."

verses.latin: Nunc itaque scribite vobis canticum istud, et docete filios Israël: ut memoriter teneant, et psallant: et sit mihi canticum istud testimonium pro filiis Israël.
verses.english: "Now therefore, write down this song for yourselves, and teach it to the children of Israel. Have them memorize it and sing it, so that this song may serve as a perpetual witness for Me against the children of Israel."

verses.latin: Introducam enim eos in terram, pro qua juravi patribus eorum, lacte et melle manantem: et comedent, et saturabuntur, et impinguabuntur: et convertentur ad deos alienos, et servient eis: irritumque facient, et inridebunt pactum meum.
verses.english: "For I will bring them into the land which I swore to their fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey. They will eat, be satisfied, and grow prosperous. But then they will turn to foreign gods and serve them. They will invalidate My covenant and mock it."

verses.latin: Cumque invenerint eum mala multa et afflictiones, respondebit ei canticum istud pro testimonio, quod noverit cogitationem illius, et quid antequam fieret, versaretur in mente. Ego enim scio cogitationes ejus, quamvis nunc in terra deserta versetur.
verses.english: "And when many evils and afflictions find them, this song will stand as a witness against them, for it will reveal their inner thoughts and what they were planning even before it happened. For I know their intentions, even now, while they are still living in the desert land."

verses.latin: Scripsit ergo Moyses canticum illud in die illo, et docuit filios Israël.
verses.english: So Moses wrote that song on that very day and taught it to the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Et praecepit Josue filio Nun, et ait: Confortare, et esto robustus: tu enim introduces filios Israël in terram, quam jurejurando pollicitus sum, et ego ero tecum.
verses.english: And He—the Lord—gave a charge to Joshua, the son of Nun, saying: "Be strong and courageous, for you will lead the children of Israel into the land which I promised them by oath, and I will be with you."

verses.latin: Postquam ergo scripsit Moyses verba legis hujus in volumine atque complevit:
verses.english: Therefore, after Moses had finished writing all the words of this entire law in a scroll,

verses.latin: praecepit Levitis, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, dicens:
verses.english: He commanded the Levites, who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Tollite librum istum, et ponite eum in latere arcae foederis Domini Dei vestri: ut sit ibi contra te in testimonium.
verses.english: "Take this Book of the Law and place it beside the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord your God, so that it may remain there as a witness against you."

verses.latin: Ego enim scio contumaciam tuam, et cervicem tuam durissimam. Adhuc vivente me, et vobiscum gradiente, semper contentiosi fuistis contra Dominum: quanto magis cum mortuus fuero.
verses.english: "For I know your stubbornness and your hard-headed obstinacy. Even while I am still alive and walking among you, you have always been contentious against the Lord. How much more rebellious will you be after I am dead!"

verses.latin: Congregate ad me omnes majores natu per tribus vestras, et præfectos, ut loquar audientibus cunctis verba haec, et testificer contra eos caelum et terram.
verses.english: "Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and all your officials, so that I may speak these words in the hearing of everyone, and call the sky and the earth to witness against them."

verses.latin: Scio enim quod post mortem meam inique agetis, et declinabitis cito de via, quam praecepi vobis: et occurrent vobis mala in novissimis diebus, eo quod faciatis malum in conspectu Domini, ut irritetis eum per opera manuum vestrarum.
verses.english: "For I know that after my death, you will act wickedly and quickly turn aside from the path that I have commanded you. And evils will certainly befall you in the latter days, because you will do evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking Him to anger with the work of your own hands—your idols."

verses.latin: Locutus est ergo Moyses, audiente universo coetu Israël, verba cantici hujus, et ad finem usque complevit.
verses.english: So Moses spoke the words of this song in the hearing of the entire assembly of Israel, and he completed it fully.

verses.latin: Et abiit Moyses, et locutus est omnes sermones istos ad universum Israel,
verses.english: And Moses went, and he spoke all these words to the whole nation of Israel.

verses.latin: et dixit ad eos: Centum viginti annorum sum hodie; non ultra potero egredi et ingredi: praesertim cum et Dominus dixerit mihi: Non transibis Jordanem istum.
verses.english: He said to them, 'I am one hundred and twenty years old today, and I can no longer lead you out or bring you in, especially since the Lord has already told me that I will not cross this Jordan River.'

verses.latin: Dominus ergo Deus tuus ipse transibit ante te: ipse delebit omnes gentes has in conspectu tuo, et possidebis eas: et Josue iste transiet ante te, sicut locutus est Dominus.
verses.english: So the Lord your God Himself will go across before you, and He Himself will destroy all these nations in front of you so that you can take possession of their lands. And Joshua, here, will cross over ahead of you, just as the Lord has promised.

verses.latin: facietque Dominus eis sicut fecit Sehon et Og regibus Amorrhaeorum, et universae terrae eorum, quos subvertit.
verses.english: And the Lord will deal with these nations just as He dealt with Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, and with all of their land, whom He utterly destroyed.

verses.latin: cum ergo et hos tradiderit vobis, similiter facietis eis sicut praecepi vobis.
verses.english: Therefore, when He delivers even these nations to you, you shall do to them just as I have commanded you.

verses.latin: Confortamini, et estote robusti: nolite timere, nec paveatis a facie eorum: quia Dominus Deus tuus ipse est ductor tuus, et non dimittet te, nec derelinquet.
verses.english: Be strong and take courage! Do not be afraid, nor be terrified by their armies, because the Lord your God Himself is your leader. He will not leave you, nor will He ever abandon you.

verses.latin: Vocavitque Moyses Josue, et dixit ei coram omni Israel: Confortare, et esto robustus: tu enim introduces populum istum in terram, quam juravit Dominus patribus eorum ut daret eis: et tu eam sorte divides.
verses.english: Then Moses called Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel, 'Be strong and courageous, for you shall bring this people into the land that the Lord swore to their fathers that He would give them, and you shall divide it among them by lot.'

verses.latin: Et Dominus qui ductor est vester, ipse erit ante te: ipse complebit, et non dimittet, nec derelinquet te: noli timere, nec paveas.
verses.english: And the Lord, who is your leader, He Himself will go before you. He Himself will accomplish this task, and He will not leave you nor abandon you. Do not be afraid, nor be terrified.

verses.latin: Scripsit ergo Moyses legem hanc, et tradidit eam sacerdotibus filiis Levi, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, et cunctis senioribus Israel.
verses.english: So Moses wrote this entire Law and delivered it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of Israel.

verses.latin: Praecepitque eis, dicens: Post septem annos, anno remissionis, in solemnitate tabernaculorum,
verses.english: And he commanded them, saying, 'After every seven years, in the year of remission —the year of release from debts—, during the Feast of Tabernacles,'

verses.latin: quando omnis Israel venerit ut appareat in conspectu Domini Dei tui in loco quem elegerit Dominus, leges legem hanc coram omni Israel auribus eorum.
verses.english: 'When all of Israel comes to appear before the presence of the Lord your God in the specific place that the Lord will choose, you shall read this entire Law aloud for all of Israel to hear.'

verses.latin: Congrega populum, viros et mulieres, parvulos et advenas, qui sunt intra portas tuas: ut audientes discant, et timeant Dominum Deum vestrum, et custodiant omnia verba legis hujus:
verses.english: 'Gather the people—men, women, children, and the foreigners who live within your towns—so that they may hear and learn to fear the Lord your God, and carefully observe all the words of this Law.'

verses.latin: et filii eorum qui ignorant, audiant, et discant timere Dominum Deum vestrum cunctis diebus quibus versamini in terra, ad quam Jordanem transgredimini ut possideatis eam.
verses.english: 'And so that their children, who have not yet learned the Law, may hear it and learn to fear the Lord your God all the days you live in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Moysen: Ecce juxta sunt dies mortis tuae. Voca Josue, et state in tabernaculo testimonii, ut dem ei mandata.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Moses, 'Behold, the days of your death are near. Call Joshua, and both of you present yourselves in the Tent of Testimony so that I may give him commands.'

verses.latin: Abierunt igitur Moyses et Josue, et steterunt in tabernaculo testimonii.
verses.english: So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the Tent of Testimony.

verses.latin: Apparuitque Dominus ibi in columna nubis, quae stetit super ostium tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: And the Lord appeared there in a pillar of cloud, which stood over the entrance of the Tent of Testimony.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Moysen: Ecce tu dormies cum patribus tuis: et populus iste consurgens fornicabitur post deos alienos in terra, ad quam ingreditur ut habitet ibi: et derelinquet me, et irritum faciet pactum, quod pepigi cum eo.
verses.english: Then the Lord said to Moses, 'Behold, you are about to die and join your fathers. And this people will then rise up and commit spiritual fornication by chasing after foreign gods in the land they are entering to inhabit. They will abandon Me and break the covenant that I have made with them.'

verses.latin: Et irascetur furor meus contra eum in die illo: et derelinquam eum, et abscondam faciem meam ab eo, et erit in direptionem: invenientque eum mala multa et afflictiones, ita ut dicat in die illo: Vere quia non est Deus mecum, invenerunt me haec mala.
verses.english: And My furious anger will be kindled against them on that day. I will abandon them and hide My face from them, and they will become prey. Many evils and afflictions will befall them, so much so that they will say on that day, 'Surely these evils have befallen me because God is not with me.'

verses.latin: Nunc itaque scribite vobis canticum istud, et docete filios Israel: ut memoriter teneant, et psallant: et sit mihi carmen hoc pro testimonio contra filios Israel.
verses.english: Now therefore, write this song for yourselves and teach it to the children of Israel, so that they may remember it and sing it, and so that this song may serve as a witness for Me against the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Ingressus enim terram, pro qua juravi patribus eorum, lacte et melle manantem, et comederis, et saturatus fueris, et incrassatus, dereliquerit Dominum Deum suum, et irritum faciet pactum ejus:
verses.english: For when they enter the land that I swore to their fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey—and they eat, become full, and grow prosperous, they will then abandon the Lord their God and break His covenant.

verses.latin: et afflixerit eum tanta malorum et afflictionum multitudo, ut cantici hujus testimonium respondeat ei: pro scientia quippe habeo cogitationes eorum, quae et nunc in promptu sunt, antequam introducam eos in terram quam multis promisi juramento.
verses.english: And when such a multitude of evils and afflictions befalls them, then the testimony of this song will serve as a reminder to them. For I truly know their thoughts, which are even now present in their hearts, even before I bring them into the land which I promised to many with an oath.

verses.latin: Scripsit ergo Moyses canticum, et docuit filios Israel.
verses.english: So Moses wrote down the song and taught it to the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Et mandavit Josue filio Nun, et ait: Confortare, et esto robustus: tu enim introduces filios Israel in terram, quam juravi, et ego ero tecum.
verses.english: And He —God— commanded Joshua, the son of Nun, and said, 'Be strong and courageous, for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land that I swore to give them, and I will be with you.'

verses.latin: Postquam ergo scripsit Moyses omnia verba legis hujus in volumine, atque complevit:
verses.english: So after Moses finished writing all the words of this Law in a scroll,

verses.latin: praecepit Levitis, qui portabant arcam foederis Domini, dicens:
verses.english: he gave a command to the Levites, who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, saying:

verses.latin: Tollite librum legis hujus, et ponite eum in latere arcae foederis Domini Dei vestri: ut sit ibi in testimonio contra te.
verses.english: 'Take this book of the Law and place it beside the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord your God, so that it may remain there as a witness against you.'

verses.latin: Ego enim scio contumaciam tuam, et cervicem tuam durissimam. Adhuc vivente me hodie vobiscum, semper contentiose egistis contra Dominum: quanto magis cum mortuus fuero.
verses.english: 'For I know your obstinacy and your extreme stubbornness. Even while I am still alive with you today, you have always acted rebelliously against the Lord. How much more will you do so when I am dead?'

verses.latin: Congregate ad me omnes majores natu per tribus vestras, atque doctores, et loquar audientibus eis verba haec, et invocabo contra eos caelum et terram.
verses.english: 'Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and your officers, and I will speak these words in their hearing, and I will call the universe and the earth to witness against them.'

verses.latin: Scio enim quod post mortem meam inique agetis, et declinabitis cito de via, quam praecepi vobis: et occurrent vobis mala in novissimis diebus, eo quod faciatis malum in conspectu Domini, ut irritetis eum per opera manuum vestrarum.
verses.english: 'For I know that after my death you will act wickedly and quickly turn aside from the path that I commanded you. And evils will surely befall you in the latter days, because you will do evil in the sight of the Lord and provoke Him to anger through the idols that you have made with your own hands.'

verses.latin: Locutus est ergo Moyses, audiente universo coetu Israel, verba cantici hujus, et ad finem usque complevit.
verses.english: So Moses spoke the words of this song in the hearing of the entire assembly of Israel, and he completed it even to the end.

verses.latin: Audite, caeli, quae loquor; audiat terra verba oris mei.
verses.english: O you heavens, hear what I am about to say. Let the entire earth listen to the words from My mouth.

verses.latin: Concrescat ut pluvia doctrina mea; fluat ut ros eloquium meum.
verses.english: May My teaching pour down like the rain, refreshing and abundant. May My words flow gently like the dew. May it be like a heavy shower upon tender plants, and like drops upon the green grass.

verses.latin: Quia nomen Domini invocabo: date magnitudinem Deo nostro.
verses.english: For I will proclaim the Name of the Lord. Ascribe greatness to our God!

verses.latin: Dei perfecta sunt opera, et omnes viae ejus judicia: Deus fidelis, et absque ulla iniquitate, justus et rectus.
verses.english: God's works are perfect, and all His ways are just judgments. He is a faithful God, without any iniquity—He is righteous and upright.

verses.latin: Peccaverunt ei, et non filii ejus in sordibus: generatio prava atque perversa.
verses.english: They have sinned against Him, and they are not His pure children, but rather a wicked and perverse generation.

verses.latin: Hoccine reddis Domino, popule stulte atque insipiens? numquid non ipse est Pater tuus, qui possedit te, et fecit, et creavit te?
verses.english: Is this how you repay the Lord, you foolish and unwise people? Is He not your Father, who possesses you, who made you, and who formed you?

verses.latin: Memento dierum antiquorum, cogita generationes singulas: interroga patrem tuum, et annuntiabit tibi; majores tuos, et dicent tibi.
verses.english: Remember the ancient days, consider each past generation. Ask your father, and he will tell you; ask your elders, and they will explain it to you.

verses.latin: Quando dividebat Altissimus gentes: quando separabat filios Adam, constituit terminos populorum juxta numerum filiorum Israel.
verses.english: When the Most High divided the nations, when He separated the descendants of Adam, He set the boundaries for the peoples according to the number of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Pars enim Domini, populus ejus: Jacob funiculus haereditatis ejus.
verses.english: For the Lord's portion is His people: Jacob is the designated portion of His inheritance.

verses.latin: Invenit eum in terra deserta, in loco horroris et vastae solitudinis: circumduxit eum, et docuit, et custodivit quasi pupillam oculi sui.
verses.english: He found him in a deserted land, in a place of horror and vast wilderness. He led him around, and taught him, and guarded him like the pupil of His own eye.

verses.latin: Sicut aquila provocans ad volandum pullos suos, et super eos volitans, expandit alas suas, et assumpsit eum, atque portavit in humeris suis.
verses.english: Like an eagle that stirs its young to fly, hovering over them, it spreads its wings, takes them up, and carries them on its shoulders.

verses.latin: Dominus solus dux ejus fuit: et non erat cum eo deus alienus.
verses.english: The Lord alone was his guide; and there was no foreign god with him.

verses.latin: Constituit eum super excelsam terram: ut comederet fructus agrorum, ut sugeret mel de petra, oleumque de saxo durissimo.
verses.english: He established him on the high land, so that he might eat the fruits of the fields, so that he might draw honey from the rock, and oil from the hardest stone.

verses.latin: Butyrum de armento, et lac de ovibus cum adipe agnorum et arietum Sian: et hircos cum medulla tritici, et sanguinem uvae biberet meracissimum.
verses.english: He provided butter from the herd, and milk from the sheep, with the fat of lambs and rams of Bashan, and goats, with the finest wheat. And he drank the pure blood of the grape, the most unmixed wine.

verses.latin: Incrasatus est dilectus, et recalcitravit: incrasatus, impinguatus, dilatatus, dereliquit Deum factorem suum, et recessit a Deo salutari suo.
verses.english: But the Beloved grew fat and kicked back against Him. He grew fat, became plump, and became broad. He abandoned God, his Maker, and departed from God, his Savior.

verses.latin: Provocaverunt eum in diis alienis, et in abominationibus ad iracundiam concitaverunt.
verses.english: They provoked Him to jealousy with foreign gods, and they stirred Him to anger with their abominations.

verses.latin: Immolabant daemonibus, et non Deo, diis quos ignorabant: novi recentesque venerant, quos non coluerant patres eorum.
verses.english: They sacrificed to demons, and not to God—to gods they did not know. They were new, recently introduced gods, whom their fathers had not worshipped.

verses.latin: Deum qui genuit te dereliquisti, et oblitus es Domini creatoris tui.
verses.english: You have forsaken God who begot you, and you have forgotten the Lord, your Creator.

verses.latin: Vidit Dominus, et ad iracundiam concitatus est: quoniam provocaverunt eum filii sui et filiae.
verses.english: The Lord saw this, and He was provoked to anger, because His sons and His daughters provoked Him.

verses.latin: Et ait: Abscondam faciem meam ab eis, et considerabo novissima eorum: generatio enim perversa est, et infideles filii.
verses.english: And He said: 'I will hide My face from them, and I will see what their end will be. For they are a perverse generation, and children who are unfaithful.'

verses.latin: Ipsi me provocaverunt in eo qui non erat Deus, et excitaverunt in iracundiam in vanitatibus suis: et ego provocabo eos in eo qui non est populus, et in gente stulta irritabo illos.
verses.english: They provoked Me with what was not God, and they roused Me to anger with their worthless idols. So I will provoke them with what is not a people, and I will irritate them with a foolish nation.

verses.latin: Ignis succensus est in furore meo, et ardebit usque ad inferni novissima: devorabitque terram cum germine suo, et montium fundamenta comburet.
verses.english: For a fire has been kindled by My wrath, and it will burn to the lowest depths of hell itself. It will devour the earth with its harvest, and consume the very foundations of the mountains.

verses.latin: Congregabo super eos mala, et sagittas meas complebo in eis.
verses.english: I will heap evils upon them, and I will exhaust My arrows against them.

verses.latin: Consumentur fame, et devorabunt eos aves morsu amarissimo: dentes bestiarum immittam in eos, cum furore trahentium super terram.
verses.english: They will be consumed by hunger, and the birds of prey will devour them with the bitterest bite. I will send against them the teeth of wild beasts, with the fury of creeping things that crawl upon the earth.

verses.latin: Foris vastabit gladius, et intus pavor, juvenem simul ac virginem, lactentem cum homine sene.
verses.english: Outside, the sword will bring desolation, and inside, terror. Both young men and virgins, infants and old men alike, will perish.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Ubi est eorum progenies? cessare faciam ex hominibus memoriam eorum.
verses.english: And I said: 'Where is their offspring? I will cause their memory to cease from among men.'

verses.latin: Sed propter iram inimicorum distuli: ne forte superbirent hostes, et dicerent: Manus nostra excelsa, et non Dominus, fecit haec omnia.
verses.english: But I postponed it because of the wrath of their enemies, lest their foes become arrogant and say: 'Our hand is mighty, and it was not the Lord who did all these things.'

verses.latin: Gens absque consilio est, et sine prudentia.
verses.english: For they are a nation without counsel and without understanding.

verses.latin: Utinam saperent, et intelligerent, ac novissima providerent!
verses.english: Oh, that they were wise, that they understood, and that they would foresee their latter end!

verses.latin: Quomodo persequeretur unus mille, et duo fugarent decem millia, nisi Deus eorum vendidisset eos, et Dominus eos conclusisset?
verses.english: How could one man pursue a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, unless their God had sold them off, and the Lord had shut them up?

verses.latin: Non enim est Deus noster ut dii eorum: et inimici nostri sunt judices.
verses.english: For their god is not like our God—even our enemies judge this to be true.

verses.latin: De vinea Sodomorum, vinea eorum, et de suburbis Gomorrhae: uva eorum, uva fellis, et botri amarissimi.
verses.english: Their vine comes from the vine of Sodom and from the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are grapes of gall, and their clusters are most bitter.

verses.latin: Fel draconum vinum eorum, et venenum aspidum insanabile.
verses.english: Their wine is the venom of dragons, and the incurable poison of asps.

verses.latin: Numquid non haec condita sunt apud me, et signata in thesauris meis?
verses.english: Are not these things stored up with Me, and sealed in My treasuries?

verses.latin: Mea est ultio, et ego retribuam in tempore, ut labatur pes eorum: juxta est dies perditionis, et adesse festinant tempora.
verses.english: Vengeance belongs to Me, and I will repay them in due time, when their foot slips. The day of their destruction is near, and their appointed times hasten to come.

verses.latin: Judicabit Dominus populum suum, et in servis suis miserebitur: videbit quod infirmata sit manus, et clausi quoque defecerunt, et residui consumpti sunt.
verses.english: For the Lord will judge His people, and He will have compassion on His servants. He will see that their power is weakened, and that those who were imprisoned have failed, and that the remaining ones have been consumed.

verses.latin: Et dicet: Ubi sunt dii eorum, in quibus habebant fiduciam?
verses.english: And He will say: 'Where are their gods, in whom they placed their trust?'

verses.latin: de quorum victimis comedebant adipes, et bibebant vinum libaminum: surgant, et opitulentur vobis, et in necessitate vos protegant.
verses.english: 'Those who ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their libations, let them arise and help you! Let them protect you in your time of need!'

verses.latin: Videte quod ego sim solus, et extra me non sit alius Deus: ego occidam, et vivere faciam: percutiam, et ego sanabo, et non est qui de manu mea possit eruere.
verses.english: See now that I alone am He, and there is no other God besides Me. I kill, and I make alive. I strike, and I heal. There is no one who can deliver out of My hand.

verses.latin: Levabo ad caelum manum meam, et dicam: Vivo ego in aeternum.
verses.english: I will lift My hand to the heavens and declare: 'As I live forever!'

verses.latin: Audite, caeli, quae loquor: audiat terra verba oris mei.
verses.english: Listen, you created universe, to what I speak. Let the earth hear the words that come from My mouth.

verses.latin: Concrescat ut pluvia doctrina mea, fluat ut ros eloquium meum, quasi imber super herbam, et quasi stillae super gramina.
verses.english: Let My teaching be absorbed like gentle rain, and My words distill like dew, like showers upon the tender grass, and like drops upon the growing plants.

verses.latin: Quia nomen Domini invocabo. Date magnificentiam Deo nostro.
verses.english: For I will proclaim the name of the Lord God. Therefore, give all glory and majesty to our God!

verses.latin: Dei perfecta sunt opera, et omnes viae ejus judicia: Deus fidelis, et absque ulla iniquitate, justus et rectus.
verses.english: All of God’s works are perfect, and all of His ways are just. God is faithful and without any evil; He is righteous and upright.

verses.latin: Peccaverunt ei, et non filii ejus in sordibus: generatio prava atque perversa.
verses.english: They have sinned against Him, and are not truly His children, but instead are stained by their perversity: a generation that is crooked and twisted.

verses.latin: Hæccine reddis Domino, popule stulte et insipiens? Numquid non ipse est pater tuus, qui possedit te, et fecit, et creavit te?
verses.english: Is this how you repay the Lord, you foolish and unwise people? Is He not your Father, who possesses you, and made you, and created you into existence?

verses.latin: Mementio dierum antiquorum, cogitate generationes singulas: interroga patrem tuum, et annuntiabit tibi: majores tuos, et dicent tibi.
verses.english: Remember the days of old. Consider each generation, one after another. Ask your father, and he will tell you. Ask your elders, and they will explain it to you.

verses.latin: Quando dividebat Altissimus gentes: quando separabat filios Adam, constituit terminos populorum juxta numerum filiorum Israel.
verses.english: When the Most High God divided the nations, when He separated the children of Adam, He established the boundaries of the peoples according to the number of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Pars enim Domini, populus ejus: Jacob funiculus hæreditatis ejus.
verses.english: For the Lord’s portion is His people; Jacob is the measuring line of His inheritance.

verses.latin: Invenit eum in terra deserta, in loco horroris et vastæ solitudinis: circumdedit eum, et erudivit: et custodivit quasi pupillam oculi sui.
verses.english: He found them in a desert land, in a place of terrifying emptiness and vast desolation. He surrounded them and taught them, and He guarded them as the apple of His eye.

verses.latin: Sicut aquila provocans ad volandum pullos suos, et super eos volitans, expandit alas suas, et assumpsit eum, atque portavit in humeris suis.
verses.english: Like an eagle stirring up its nest, teaching its young to fly, hovering over them, it spreads its wings, takes them up, and carries them on its shoulders.

verses.latin: Dominus solus dux ejus fuit: et non erat cum eo deus alienus.
verses.english: The Lord alone was their leader, and there was no foreign god with them.

verses.latin: Constituit eum super excelsam terram: ut comederet fructus agrorum, ut sugeret mel de petra, oleumque de saxo durissimo.
verses.english: He set them on the high places of the earth so that they might eat the produce of the fields, and that they might suck honey from the rock, and oil from the hardest stone.

verses.latin: Butyrum de armento, et lac de ovibus cum adipe agnorum, et arietum Basan, et hircorum cum medulla tritici, et sanguinem uvæ biberet meracissimum.
verses.english: He gave them butter from the herd, and milk from the sheep, with the fat of lambs and rams from Bashan, and goats, with the finest wheat marrow. They drank the purest blood of the grape, which is wine.

verses.latin: Incrassatus est dilectus, et recalcitravit: incrassatus, impinguatus, dilatatus, dereliquit Deum factorem suum, et recessit a Deo salutari suo.
verses.english: But My beloved Israel grew fat and kicked against Me! Having grown fat, being well-fed, and expanding in prosperity, they abandoned God their Maker and turned away from God their Savior.

verses.latin: Provocaverunt eum in diis alienis, et in abominationibus ad iracundiam concitaverunt.
verses.english: They provoked Him to jealousy with foreign gods, and they stirred Him to anger with their abominations.

verses.latin: Immolaverunt dæmoniis, et non Deo, diis quos ignorabant: novi recentesque venerunt, quos non coluerunt patres eorum.
verses.english: They sacrificed to demons, not to God—to gods they did not know, newly arrived ones, recently come into being, whom their fathers had not worshipped.

verses.latin: Deum qui te genuit, oblitus es: et oblitus es Domini creatoris tui.
verses.english: You forgot God, who gave birth to you; you forgot the Lord, your Creator.

verses.latin: Vidit Dominus, et ad iracundiam concitatus est: quia provocaverunt eum filii sui et filiæ.
