verses.english: The Lord saw this, and He was moved to anger, because His sons and daughters provoked Him.

verses.latin: Et ait: Abscondam faciem meam ab illis, et considerabo novissima eorum: generatio enim perversa est, et infideles filii.
verses.english: And He said: 'I will hide My face from them, and I will see what their end will be. For they are a perverse generation, and they are unfaithful children.'

verses.latin: Ipsi me provocaverunt in eo qui non erat Deus, et irritaverunt in vanitatibus suis: et ego provocabo eos in eo qui non est populus, et in gente stulta irritabo illos.
verses.english: They provoked Me to jealousy with that which was not God, and they angered Me with their empty idols. So I will provoke them with a people who are not a people, and I will anger them with a foolish nation.

verses.latin: Ignis succensus est in furore meo, et ardebit usque ad inferni novissima: devorabitque terram cum germine suo, et montium fundamenta comburet.
verses.english: For a fire has been kindled in My wrath, and it will burn to the lowest depths of hell. It will devour the earth with its harvest, and it will consume the foundations of the mountains.

verses.latin: Congregabo super eos mala, et sagittas meas complere.
verses.english: I will heap evils upon them, and I will exhaust My arrows against them.

verses.latin: Consumentur fame, et devorabunt aves morsu amarissimo: dentes bestiarum immittam in eos, cum furore trahentium super terram, atque serpentium.
verses.english: They will be consumed by famine, and birds will devour them with the bitterest bite. I will send the teeth of wild beasts among them, with the furious venom of creeping things upon the earth, even serpents.

verses.latin: Foris vastabit eos gladius, et intus pavor, juvenem simul ac virginem, lactentem cum homine sene.
verses.english: Outside, the sword will destroy them, and inside, terror will consume them—both young men and virgins, infants with old men.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Ubi sunt? cessare faciam ex hominibus memoriam eorum.
verses.english: And I said: 'Where are they now? I will make their memory cease from among humanity.'

verses.latin: Sed propter iram inimicorum distuli: ne forte superbirent hostes, et dicerent: Manus nostra excelsa, et non Dominus fecit hæc omnia.
verses.english: But I held back My judgment because of the anger of their enemies, lest the adversaries become arrogant and say: 'Our own powerful hand did all this, and not the Lord.'

verses.latin: Gens absque consilio est, et sine prudentia.
verses.english: For they are a nation without counsel and without understanding.

verses.latin: Utinam saperent, et intelligerent, ac novissima providerent!
verses.english: If only they were wise, and understood, and would consider their latter end!

verses.latin: Quomodo persequatur unus mille, et duo fugent decem millia? Nonne ideo, quia Deus suus vendidit eos, et Dominus concluserit illos?
verses.english: How could one man pursue a thousand, and two men put ten thousand to flight? Is it not because their God has sold them, and the Lord has delivered them up?

verses.latin: Non enim est Deus noster ut dii eorum: et inimici nostri sunt judices.
verses.english: For their gods are not like our God; even our enemies themselves are witnesses of this.

verses.latin: De vinea Sodomorum, vinea eorum, et de suburbanis Gomorrhæ: uva eorum, uva fellis, et botrus amarissimus.
verses.english: For their vine is from the vine of Sodom and from the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are grapes of bitterness, and their clusters are most bitter.

verses.latin: Fel draconum vinum eorum, et venenum aspidum insanabile.
verses.english: Their wine is the venom of dragons, and the incurable poison of vipers.

verses.latin: Nonne hæc condita sunt apud me, et signata in thesauris meis?
verses.english: Are not these things stored up with Me, and sealed in My treasures?

verses.latin: Mea est ultio, et ego retribuam in tempore, ut labatur pes eorum: juxta est dies perditionis, et adesse festinant tempora.
verses.english: Vengeance belongs to Me, and I will repay them in due time, when their foot slips. For the day of their destruction is near, and the appointed times are hastening to come.

verses.latin: Judicabit Dominus populum suum, et in servis suis miserebitur: videbit quod infirmata sit manus, et clausi quoque defecerunt, et consumpti sunt.
verses.english: For the Lord will judge His people, and He will have compassion on His servants when He sees that their power is gone, and that both the imprisoned and the free have vanished and are consumed.

verses.latin: Et dicet: Ubi sunt dii eorum, in quibus habebant fiduciam?
verses.english: And He will say: 'Where are their gods, in whom they placed their trust?'

verses.latin: De quorum victimis comedebant adipes, et bibebant vinum libaminum: surgant, et opitulentur vobis, et in necessitate vos protegant.
verses.english: Those who ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their libations: 'Let them arise and help you, and protect you in your time of need!'

verses.latin: Videte quod ego sim solus, et non sit alius Deus præter me: ego occidam, et vivere faciam: percutiam, et sanabo: et non est qui de manu mea possit eruere.
verses.english: See now that I alone am God, and there is no other God besides Me. I kill, and I make alive. I wound, and I heal. And there is no one who can rescue from My hand.

verses.latin: Levabo ad caelum manum meam, et dicam: Vivo ego in æternum.
verses.english: For I will lift My hand to the created universe and declare: 'As I live forever!'

verses.latin: Hæc est benedictio, qua benedixit Moyses homo Dei filiis Israël ante mortem suam.
verses.english: This is the final blessing that Moses, the man of God, gave to the children of Israel just before his death.

verses.latin: Et ait: Dominus de Sina venit, et de Seir ortus est nobis: apparuit de monte Pharan, et cum eo sanctorum millia.
verses.english: And Moses said: "The Lord God came from Mount Sinai—the place of the Law—and dawned upon us from Mount Seir, and revealed Himself from Mount Paran, bringing with Him thousands of His holy angels.

verses.latin: Dilexit populos: omnes sancti in manu illius sunt: et qui appropinquant pedibus ejus, accipient de doctrina illius.
verses.english: Truly, He loved His people Israel. All of His holy ones are in His powerful hand, and those who approach Him and follow His ways will receive His divine teaching.

verses.latin: Legem præcepit nobis Moyses, hæreditatem multitudinis Jacob.
verses.english: Moses gave us the Law—His divine instruction—as a spiritual inheritance for all the descendants of Jacob.

verses.latin: Eritque apud rectissimum rex, congregatis principibus populorum cum tribubus Israël.
verses.english: And there will be a King among the upright people of Israel when the leaders of the tribes gather together.

verses.latin: Vive Ruben, et noli mori: et sit parvus numerus ejus.
verses.english: Moses blessed the tribe of Reuben: "May Reuben live and not perish, even if their numbers remain small among the other tribes."

verses.latin: Hæc est Juda benedictio: Audi Domine vocem Juda, et ad populum suum introduc eum: manus ejus pugnabunt pro eo, et adjutor illius contra adversarios ejus sis.
verses.english: And this is the blessing for Judah: "Hear, O Lord, the plea of Judah, and bring him back to his people after battle. Let his hands fight powerfully for him, and may You be his helper against all his enemies."

verses.latin: Levi quoque ait: Perfectio tua, et doctrina tua viro sancto tuo, quem probasti in tentatione, et judicasti ad aquas contradictionis.
verses.english: And to Levi, Moses said: "Your spiritual perfection and Your divine teaching belong to Your holy man—the high priest—whom You tested during trials and judged at the waters of Meribah, where the people contended against You."

verses.latin: Qui dixit patri suo, et matri suæ: Nescio vos: et fratribus suis: Ignoro illos: quoniam custodierunt eloquia tua, et pactum tuum servaverunt.
verses.english: "The Levites, for Your sake, were willing to disregard their own father and mother, and to disown their own brothers. They did this because they guarded Your holy words and diligently kept Your covenant."

verses.latin: Judicia tua, o Jacob, et legem tuam, o Israël, ponent: offerent incensum in furore tuo, et holocaustum super altare tuum.
verses.english: "They will teach Your judgments to Jacob and Your Law to Israel. They will offer incense as a pleasing aroma when Your presence is manifested, and they will offer burnt offerings on Your altar."

verses.latin: Benedic Domine fortitudinem ejus, et opera manuum illius suscipe: percute dorsa inimicorum ejus, et qui oderunt eum, non consurgant.
verses.english: "Bless, O Lord, the strength of the tribe of Levi, and accept the sacred works of their hands. Strike down their enemies so they may never rise against them again."

verses.latin: Et Benjamin ait: Amantissimus Domini habitabit confidenter in eo: quasi in thalamo totâ die morabitur, et inter humeros illius requiescet.
verses.english: And to Benjamin, Moses said: "The beloved of the Lord shall dwell securely in His presence. He will remain there as in a sacred chamber all the day, and the Lord will rest between his shoulders, protecting him."

verses.latin: Joseph quoque ait: De benedictione Domini terra ejus, de pomis cœli, et rore, atque abyssis subjacente.
verses.english: And to Joseph, Moses said: "May his land be blessed by the Lord, producing fruit from the heavens—from the rains and the dew—and from the deep waters that lie beneath the earth."

verses.latin: De pomis fructuum solis ac lunæ, de vertice antiquorum montium, de pomis æternorum collium.
verses.english: "May his land be blessed with the finest fruits ripened by the sun and the moon, with the choicest produce from the ancient mountains and the fruit of the everlasting hills."

verses.latin: Et de pomis terræ, et plenitudine ejus, benedictio illius qui apparuit in rubo veniat super caput Joseph, et super verticem Nazaræi inter fratres suos.
verses.english: "May the blessing of Him who appeared in the burning bush come upon the head of Joseph, and upon the crown of him who was set apart from his brothers—meaning Jacob's favored son."

verses.latin: Quasi primogeniti tauri pulchritudo ejus, cornua rinocerotis cornua illius: in ipsis populos ventilabit usque ad terminos terræ. Hæc sunt millia Ephraim, et hæc millia Manasse.
verses.english: "His glory is like the firstborn bull, his horns are like the horns of a wild ox. With them he shall push the nations to the ends of the earth. These are the thousands of Ephraim, and these are the thousands of Manasseh—Joseph's two tribes."

verses.latin: Et Zabulon ait: Lætare Zabulon in exitu tuo, et Issachar in tabernaculis tuis.
verses.english: And to Zebulun, Moses said: "Rejoice, Zebulun, as you go out for commerce, and rejoice, Issachar, in your settled dwelling places."

verses.latin: Populos vocabunt ad montem: ibi sacrificabunt victimas justitiæ. Qui inundationem maris quasi lac sugent, et thesauros absconditos arenarum.
verses.english: "They will summon peoples to the sacred mountain to offer sacrifices of righteousness there. For they will draw from the abundance of the seas as if it were milk, and discover the hidden treasures buried in the sand—resources from the coast."

verses.latin: Et Gad ait: Benedictus in latitudine Gad: quasi leo requievit, et cepit brachium et verticem.
verses.english: And to Gad, Moses said: "Blessed is he who enlarges Gad's territory! He lies down like a lion, ready to seize his prey—both arm and crown—from his enemies."

verses.latin: Et vidit principatum suum, et texit cum principibus populi. Fortissimus Israël fecit judicium, et justitiam suam cum eo, et cornua ejus cum millibus.
verses.english: "He chose his own best portion of land, for there a leader's share was reserved for him. He marched with the chiefs of the people. He executed the Lord God's justice for Israel and His righteous decrees with Him, joining his forces with the thousands of the other tribes."

verses.latin: Dan quoque ait: Dan leo juvenis, catulus leonis de Basan.
verses.english: And to Dan, Moses said: "Dan is a young lion, a lion's cub springing forth from Bashan."

verses.latin: Nephthalim quoque ait: Nephthalim ad voluntatem satietatis, et plenus benedictione Domini: mare et meridiem possidebit.
verses.english: And to Naphtali, Moses said: "Naphtali is abundantly satisfied with the Lord's favor and full of His blessing. He will possess the coastal region to the south."

verses.latin: Aser quoque ait: Benedictus Aser in filiis, placeat fratribus suis, et tingat in oleo pedem suum.
verses.english: And to Asher, Moses said: "Blessed be Asher above all sons! May he be favored by his brothers, and may he dip his foot in oil—symbolizing abundant olive oil from his land."

verses.latin: Ferrum et æs calceamentum ejus. Sicut dies juventutis tuæ, ita et senectus tua.
verses.english: "His shoes will be made of iron and bronze, providing strength. As your days of youth are, so shall your days of old age be—full of vigor and blessing."

verses.latin: Non est alius ut Deus Israelis: qui scandit super cœlum, adjutor tuus: magnitudine suâ et nubibus.
verses.english: There is no God like the God of Israel, who rides across the universe to come to your aid, majestic in His clouds.

verses.latin: Habitaculum ejus sursum, et subter brachia sempiterna: ejecit a facie tuâ inimicum, dixitque: Conterere.
verses.english: His dwelling is in the highest heavens, and His everlasting arms support you from beneath. He drove out your enemy before you and commanded, 'Destroy them!'

verses.latin: Habitavit Israël confidenter, et absque timore solus. Fons Jacob in terrâ frumenti et vini consistebat, cœlique irrigabunt eum rore.
verses.english: So Israel dwelt securely, alone and without fear. The fountain of Jacob—meaning his descendants—lived in a land of grain and new wine, and the skies above watered it with dew.

verses.latin: Beatus es tu Israël: quis similis tui populus, qui salvaris in Domino? Scutum auxilii tui, et gladius gloriæ tuæ: negabunt te inimici tui, et tu eorum colla calcabis.
verses.english: Blessed are you, O Israel! Who is like you, a people saved by the Lord God? He is the shield of your help and the sword of your glory. Your enemies will deny your power, but you will tread upon their necks.

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo Moyses de campestribus Moab super montem Nebo, in verticem Phasga, contra Jericho: ostenditque ei Dominus omnem terram Galaad usque Dan,
verses.english: Moses then went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho. The Lord showed him all the land of Gilead as far as Dan,

verses.latin: et universam Nephthali, et terram Ephraim et Manasse, et omnem terram Juda usque ad mare novissimum,
verses.english: all of Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, stretching as far as the western sea, which is the Mediterranean.

verses.latin: et australem partem, et latitudinem campi Jericho civitatis Palmarum usque Segor.
verses.english: and the southern region of the land, along with the whole plain of Jericho, known as the city of palm trees, stretching all the way to Zoar.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad eum: Haec est terra, pro qua juravi Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob, dicens: Semini tuo dabo eam: vidisti eam oculis tuis, et non transibis ad illam.
verses.english: The Lord then said to him: "This is the land that I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob that I would give to their descendants. You have seen it with your own eyes, but you will not cross over into it."

verses.latin: Mortuusque est ibi Moyses servus Domini, in terra Moab, jubente Domino:
verses.english: So Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there in the land of Moab, in obedience to the Lord's command.

verses.latin: et sepelivit eum in valle terrae Moab contra Phogor: et nemo scit sepulchrum ejus usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: And He buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, opposite Beth-peor. No one knows the exact location of his burial place to this very day.

verses.latin: Erat Moyses centum viginti annorum quando mortuus est: non caligavit oculus ejus, nec dentes illius moti sunt.
verses.english: Moses was one hundred and twenty years old when he died. His eyesight had not dimmed, nor had his physical strength diminished.

verses.latin: Fleveruntque eum filii Israel in campestribus Moab triginta diebus: et completi sunt dies luctus planctusque Moysi.
verses.english: The children of Israel mourned for him in the plains of Moab for thirty days, and the days of mourning and lamentation for Moses were thus completed.

verses.latin: Josue vero filius Nun repletus est spiritu sapientiæ, quia Moyses posuit manum suam super eum: et obedierunt ei filii Israel, feceruntque sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: Joshua, the son of Nun, was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands upon him. The children of Israel obeyed him, doing exactly as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Et non surrexit propheta ultra in Israel sicut Moyses, quem scivit Dominus facie ad faciem,
verses.english: And there has not arisen a prophet in Israel since like Moses, whom the Lord knew face to face—meaning, in intimate, direct communication.

verses.latin: in omnibus signis atque portentis, quæ misit per eum, ut faceret in terra Ægypti Pharaoni, et omnibus servis ejus, universæque terræ illius,
verses.english: This refers to all the miraculous signs and wonders which the Lord sent him to perform in the land of Egypt against Pharaoh, against all his servants, and against all his land.

verses.latin: et cuncta manu robusta, et magnis mirabilibus, quæ fecit Moyses coram universo Israel.
verses.english: It also refers to the entire display of God's strong hand and the great and terrible things that Moses performed in the sight of all Israel.
